to link Payment Configuration for a Business Service Provider](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#steps-to-link-payment-configuration-for-a-business-service-provider)\n\n[Steps to unlink Payment Configuration](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#steps-to-unlink-payment-configuration)\n\n[Integration Steps](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#integration-steps)\n\n[Step 1: Get UPI Intent from Payment Gateway](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#step-1)\n\n[Step 2: Assemble the Interactive Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#step-2--assemble-the-interactive-object)\n\n[Step 3: Add Common Message Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#step-3--add-common-message-parameters)\n\n[Step 4:Make a POST Call to Messages Endpoint](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#step-4-make-a-post-call-to-messages-endpoint)\n\n[Step 5: Consumer Pays for the Order](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#step-5--consumer-pays-for-the-order)\n\n[Step 6: Get Notified About Transaction Status Updates from payment gateway](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#step-6--get-notified-about-transaction-status-updates-from-payment-gateway)\n\n[Step 7: Update order status](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#step-7--update-order-status)\n\n[Step 8: Reconcile Payments](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#step-8--reconcile-payments)\n\n[Merchant Preferred UPI Payment Method](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#merchant-preferred-upi-payment-method)\n\n[Updates to Order Details Payload](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#updates-to-order-details-payload)\n\n[List of supported apps:](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#list-of-supported-apps-)\n\n[Checklist for Integrated Merchants](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#checklist-for-integrated-merchants)\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=595945097590761&version=1743728118)[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\>\nCloud API\n\n\n# Receive UPI Payments Through WhatsApp\n\nFor businesses working with Razorpay or PayU payment gateways, we have deeper integration with these PGs. Please refer to [Payment Gateway Integration Guide](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/pg)\n\nYour business can enable customers to pay for their orders using all the UPI Apps installed on their devices via WhatsApp. Businesses can send customers invoice( `order_details`) messages, then get notified about payment status updates via webhook notifications from Payment Gateway.\n\n## Overview\n\nCurrently, customers browse business catalogs, add products to cart, and send orders in with our set of commerce messaging solutions, which includes [Single Product Message, Multi Product Message, and Product Detail Page](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/guides/commerce-guides/share-products-with-customers).\n\nWith the WhatsApp Payments API, businesses can send customers a bill so the customer can complete their order with all the UPI Apps.\n\n## How It Works\n\nThe business must send an `order_details` message for the consumer to initiate payment. This type of message is a new type of interactive message, which always contains the same 4 main components: **header**, **body**, **footer**, and **action**. Inside the **action** component, the business includes all the information needed for the customer to complete their payment.\n\nEach `order_details` message contains a unique `reference_id` provided by the business, and that unique number is used throughout the flow to track the order. This `reference_id` is fetched from UPI intent link( **tr** value from the UPI payment intent) generated for a business order from Payment Gateway.\n\nOnce the message is sent, the business waits for a payment or transaction status updates directly from Payment Gateway. Upon receiving payment signal for an order, Business should relay this payment signal to consumer through interactive order status( `order_status`) message.\n\nUpdating user about the payment signal is important as this message updates the order details message and order details view for the consumer reflecting the order confirmation from merchant. This is shown with an example in subsequent sections.\n\n## Purchase Flow in App\n\nIn the WhatsApp customer app, the purchase flow has the following steps:\n\n1. Customer sends an order with selected products to the business or Business identifies the products that the customer has shown interest to purchase.\n\n2. After receiving the order/identifying the product, if a merchant accepts payment methods other than UPI, such as credit cards and payment wallets, then merchant will send a message to the user to get their preferred payment method for the order.\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=811339793994614&version=1731962796)\n\n3.\n    When consumers want to pay using UPI payment method, then merchants should retrieve the UPI payment intent by calling Payment Gateway. Merchant needs to use UPI intent to construct order details messages and send it to the consumer.\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=971923044172997&version=1731962796)![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=729609215519626&version=1731962796)\n\n4. When the consumer taps the Pay now/continue button, they will be given the option to choose UPI payment Apps - WhatsApp or any other UPI payments apps. Consumers may choose any UPI option to pay for the order.\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=946615243445984&version=1731962796)![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=184393104468587&version=1731962796)\n\n5. Consumer pays for the order and the payment method is saved for the future and automatically selected for the next payment transaction. Also, one quick note is the order details screen order-status will continue to show \"Order pending\" until merchant sends order status interactive message.\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=6103981082988885&version=1731962796)![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=462787186030936&version=1731962796)\n\n6. Once the payment is complete, the business receives a notification from Payment Gateway and the merchant needs to send order status updates to the consumer client notifying consumers about the progress to the order, this will update the order details message CTAs and order details screen - order status description.\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=917272609479700&version=1731962796)![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=619524793069670&version=1731962796)![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=766641921520501&version=1731962796)\n\n\n## Before You Start\n\nTo receive UPI payments on WhatsApp merchants have to set up their VPA on WhatsApp Business Manager using the direct payment methods option.\n\nEach configuration must have a unique name, merchant categorization code (mcc), purpose code, and VPA handles as shown below. A business can have multiple payment configurations, but for each order merchant must specify a specific configuration to be used for payment. See `payment_configuration` field in `order_details` message.\n\n```\n[\\\n  {\\\n    \"name\": \"unique name 1\",\\\n    \"merchantVpa\": \"handle_1@paytm\",\\\n    \"merchantMcc\": \"merchant categorization code\",\\\n    \"merchantPurposeCode\": \"purpose code\"\\\n  },\\\n  {\\\n    \"name\": \"unique name 2\",\\\n    \"merchantVpa\": \"handle_2@paytm\",\\\n    \"merchantMcc\": \"merchant categorization code\",\\\n    \"merchantPurposeCode\": \"purpose code\"\\\n  },\\\n]\n```\n\n`name` for each payment type must be unique. `name` will be used to reference the specific configurations for each payment type. If WA is unable to find a payment configuration name, the user will not be able to make the payment upon receiving the `order_details` message. `mcc` refers to a [merchant categorization code](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fen.wikipedia.org%2Fwiki%2FMerchant_category_code&h=AT2LyTLoM41KEnflm58dkCHSo23P7eLqX5CE2baq2piTe96XqO_nAn_ut2xV44zp0CCWvfoWLCEgk_9GMZsdo5Ush-sgMJxfBFXayF3YollEZiOn-e0cV83T2zzkFAaQgXktVTNc0ep5Vg) for the items in the order. `upi_pc` refers to the purpose of the transaction. Some sample codes are below:\n\n| Code | Title |\n| --- | --- |\n| 00 | Default |\n| 01 | SEMI |\n| 02 | AMC |\n| 03 | Travel |\n| 04 | Hospitality |\n| 05 | Hospital |\n| 06 | Telecom |\n| 07 | Insurance |\n| 08 | Education |\n| 09 | Gifting |\n| 10 | Others |\n\nIf merchant/partner is not sure of the MCC and purpose code, then they may contact Payment Gateway to get this information as Payment Gateway sets up these values based on the type of business while generating business VPAs.\n\n## Manage Your Payment Methods (Beta Feature)\n\nSelf-service Payment Configuration allows you to add multiple payment configurations to your WhatsApp Manager profile. Each payment configuration will have its own UPI handle(VPA), MCC, and purpose code (for physical goods) so that merchants can accept payments for different categories with different UPI accounts. After setup, merchant can send invoice( `order_details`) messages to users with the corresponding payment configuration to collect payments.\n\n### Pre-requisites\n\nManage Payment Methods feature is in Beta, so please contact Business Engineering team to allow merchants/partners access the page in WhatsApp Business Manager portal.\n\n### Steps to link Payment Configuration for a Business Service Provider\n\nYou can create a payment configuration for a WhatsApp Business Account using the 'Payment configurations' page and under 'India' in [WhatsApp Business Manager](https://business.facebook.com/wa/manage/home).\n\nPlay\n\n0:00\n\nMute\n\nAdditional Visual Settings\n\nEnter Fullscreen\n\nSharing and reporting options\n\n![](https://static.xx.fbcdn.net/rsrc.php/v4/y4/r/-PAXP-deijE.gif)\n\nSomething Went Wrong\n\nWe're having trouble playing this video.\n\n[Learn more](https://www.facebook.com/help/396404120401278/list)\n\nAfter linking your payment configuration, you must integrate with the Payments APIs below. This will allow you to send an `order_details` message to customers with the payment configuration to receive payments.\n\n### Steps to unlink Payment Configuration\n\nPlay\n\n0:00\n\nMute\n\nAdditional Visual Settings\n\nEnter Fullscreen\n\nSharing and reporting options\n\n![](https://static.xx.fbcdn.net/rsrc.php/v4/y4/r/-PAXP-deijE.gif)\n\nSomething Went Wrong\n\nWe're having trouble playing this video.\n\n[Learn more](https://www.facebook.com/help/396404120401278/list)\n\nNote: Make sure no new order messages requesting payment from consumer are sent with the payment config your are trying to remove before you perform the unlink action.\n\n## Integration Steps\n\nThe steps outlined below assume that the business is about to send order details message to consumer client.\n\nThe following sequence diagram demonstrates the typical integration flow for WA Payments API:\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=733142948537346&version=1731962796)\n\n### Step 1: Get UPI Intent from Payment Gateway\n\nOnce the consumer has expressed their interest to purchase an item using UPI payment method. Merchant needs to call payment gateway to create a UPI intent, the following is the sample UPI intent link:\n\n```\nupi://pay?pa=cfsukoonaa@yesbank&pn=Sukoon&tr=877376394&\n\tam=10.00&cu=INR&mode=00&purpose=00&mc=5399&tn=877376394\n```\n\nMerchant needs to parse the `tr` value from the above URI and use this as the reference id in invoice( `order_details`) interactive message.\n\n### Step 2: Assemble the Interactive Object\n\nTo send an `order_details` message, businesses must assemble an [interactive object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages#interactive-object) of type `order_details` with the following components:\n\n| Object | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `type`<br>object | **Required.**<br>Must be \"order\\_details\". |\n| `header`<br>object | **Optional.**<br>Header content displayed on top of a message. If a header is not provided, the API uses an image of the first available product as the header |\n| `body`<br>object | **Required.**<br>An object with the body of the message. The object contains the following field:<br>`text` string<br>- **Required** if `body` is present. The content of the message. Emojis and markdown are supported. Maximum length is 1024 characters |\n| `footer`<br>object | **Optional.**<br>An object with the footer of the message. The object contains the following fields:<br>`text` string<br>- **Required** if `footer` is present. The footer content. Emojis, markdown, and links are supported. Maximum length is 60 characters |\n| `action`<br>object | **Required.**<br>An action object you want the user to perform after reading the message. This action object contains the following fields:<br>`name` string<br>- **Required**. Must be \"review\\_and\\_pay\"<br>`parameters` object<br>- See [Parameters Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#paramobject) for information |\n\n#### Parameters Object\n\n| Object | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `reference_id`<br>string | **Required.**<br>Unique identifier for the order or invoice provided by the business. This cannot be an empty string and can only contain English letters, numbers, underscores, dashes, or dots, and should not exceed 35 characters.<br>The `reference_id` must be unique for each `order_details` message for the same business. If the partner would like to send multiple order\\_details messages for the same order, invoice, etc. it is recommended to include a sequence number in the `reference_id` (for example, -) to ensure `reference_id` uniqueness. |\n| `type`<br>object | **Required.**<br>The type of goods being paid for in this order. Current supported options are `digital-goods` and `physical-goods` |\n| `beneficiaries`<br>array | **Required for shipped physical-goods.**<br>An array of beneficiaries for this order. A beneficiary is an intended recipient for shipping the physical goods in the order. It contains the following fields:<br>Beneficiary information isn't shown to users but is needed for legal and compliance reasons.<br>`name` string<br>- **Required.** Name of the individual or business receiving the physical goods. Cannot exceed 200 characters<br>`address_line1` string<br>- **Required.** Shipping address (Door/Tower Number, Street Name etc.). Cannot exceed 100 characters<br>`address_line2` string<br>- **Optional.** Shipping address (Landmark, Area, etc.). Cannot exceed 100 characters<br>`city` string<br>- **Required.** Name of the city. <br>`state` string<br>- **Required.** Name of the state.<br>`country` string<br>- **Required.** Must be \"India\".<br>`postal_code` string<br>- **Required.** 6-digit zipcode of shipping address. |\n| `payment_type` | **Required.**<br>Must be \"upi\". |\n| `payment_configuration` | **Required.**<br>The name of the pre-configured payment configuration to use for this order and must not exceed 60 characters. |\n| `currency` | **Required.**<br>The currency for this order. Currently the only supported value is `INR`. |\n| `total_amount`<br>object | **Required.**<br>The `total_amount` object contains the following fields:<br>`offset` integer<br>- **Required.** Must be `100` for `INR`.<br>`value` integer<br>- **Required.** Positive integer representing the amount value multiplied by offset. For example, ₹12.34 has value 1234.<br>`total_amount.value` must be equal to `order.subtotal.value` \\+ `order.tax.value` \\+ `order.shipping.value` \\- `order.discount.value`. |\n| `order`<br>object | **Required.**<br>See [order object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#ordobject) for more information. |\n\n#### Order Object\n\n| Object | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `status`<br>string | **Required.**<br>Only supported value in the `order_details` message is `pending`.<br>In an `order_status` message, `status` can be: `pending`, `captured`, or `failed`. |\n| `type`<br>string | **Optional.**<br>Only supported value is `quick_pay`. When this field is passed in we hide the \"Review and Pay\" button and only show the \"Pay Now\" button in the order details bubble. |\n| `items`<br>object | **Required.**<br>An object with the list of items for this order, containing the following fields:<br>`retailer_id` string<br>- **Optional.** Content ID for an item in the order from your catalog.<br>`name` string<br>- **Required.** The item’s name to be displayed to the user. Cannot exceed 60 characters<br>`image` object<br>- **Optional.** Custom image for the item to be displayed to the user. See [item image object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#item_image_object) for information<br>Using this image field will limit the items array to a maximum of 10 items and this cannot be used with `retailer_id` or `catalog_id`.<br>`amount` amount object with value and offset -- refer total amount field above<br>- **Required.** The price per item<br>`sale_amount` amount object<br>- **Optional.** The discounted price per item. This should be less than the original amount. If included, this field is used to calculate the subtotal amount<br>`quantity` integer<br>- **Required.** The number of items in this order, this field cannot be decimal has to be integer. <br>`country_of_origin` string<br>- **Optional** if `catalog_id` is not present. The country of origin of the product<br>`importer_name` string<br>- **Optional** if `catalog_id` is not present. Name of the importer company<br>`importer_adress` string<br>- **Optional** if `catalog_id` is not present. Address of importer company |\n| `subtotal`<br>object | **Required.**<br>The value **must be equal** to sum of `order.amount.value` \\\\* `order.amount.quantity`. Refer to `total_amount` description for explanation of `offset` and `value` fields<br>The following fields are part of the `subtotal` object:<br>`offset` integer<br>- **Required.** Must be `100` for `INR`<br>`value` integer<br>- **Required.** Positive integer representing the amount value multiplied by offset. For example, ₹12.34 has value 1234 |\n| `tax`<br>object | **Required.**<br>The tax information for this order which contains the following fields:<br>`offset` integer<br>- **Required.** Must be `100` for `INR`<br>`value` integer<br>- **Required.** Positive integer representing the amount value multiplied by offset. For example, ₹12.34 has value 1234<br>`description` string<br>- **Optional.** Max character limit is 60 characters |\n| `shipping`<br>object | **Optional.**<br>The shipping cost of the order. The object contains the following fields:<br>`offset` integer<br>- **Required.** Must be `100` for `INR`<br>`value` integer<br>- **Required.** Positive integer representing the amount value multiplied by offset. For example, ₹12.34 has value 1234<br>`description` string<br>- **Optional.** Max character limit is 60 characters |\n| `discount`<br>object | **Optional.**<br>The discount for the order. The object contains the following fields:<br>`offset` integer<br>- **Required.** Must be `100` for `INR`<br>`value` integer<br>- **Required.** Positive integer representing the amount value multiplied by offset. For example, ₹12.34 has value 1234<br>`description` string<br>- **Optional.** Max character limit is 60 characters<br>`discount_program_name` string<br>- **Optional.** Text used for defining incentivised orders. If order is incentivised, the merchant needs to define this information. Max character limit is 60 characters |\n| `catalog_id`<br>object | **Optional.**<br>Unique identifier of the Facebook catalog being used by the business. |\n| `expiration`<br>object | **Optional.**<br>Expiration for that order. Business must define the following fields inside this object:<br>`timestamp` string – UTC timestamp in seconds of time when order should expire. Minimum threshold is 300 seconds<br>`description` string – Text explanation for expiration. Max character limit is 120 characters |\n\n#### Item Image Object\n\n| Object | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `link`<br>string | **Required.**<br>A link to the image that will be shown to the user. Must be an `image/jpeg` or `image/png` and 8-bit, RGB or RGBA. Follows same requirements as image in [media](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/media#supported-media-types) |\n\nBy the end, the interactive object should look something like this for a catalog-based integration:\n\n```\n{\n  \"interactive\": {\n    \"type\": \"order_details\",\n    \"header\": {\n      \"type\": \"image\",\n      \"image\": {\n        \"link\": \"http(s)://the-url\",\n        \"provider\": {\n          \"name\": \"provider-name\"\n        }\n      }\n    },\n    \"body\": {\n      \"text\": \"your-text-body-content\"\n    },\n    \"footer\": {\n      \"text\": \"your-text-footer-content\"\n    },\n    \"action\": {\n      \"name\": \"review_and_pay\",\n      \"parameters\": {\n        \"reference_id\": \"reference-id-value\",\n        \"type\": \"digital-goods\",\n        \"payment_type\": \"upi\",\n        \"payment_configuration\": \"unique-payment-config-id\",\n        \"currency\": \"INR\",\n        \"total_amount\": {\n          \"value\": 21000,\n          \"offset\": 100\n        },\n        \"order\": {\n          \"status\": \"pending\",\n          \"catalog_id\": \"the-catalog_id\",\n          \"expiration\": {\n            \"timestamp\": \"utc_timestamp_in_seconds\",\n            \"description\": \"cancellation-explanation\"\n          },\n          \"items\": [\\\n            {\\\n              \"retailer_id\": \"1234567\",\\\n              \"name\": \"Product name, for example bread\",\\\n              \"amount\": {\\\n                \"value\": 10000,\\\n                \"offset\": 100\\\n              },\\\n              \"quantity\": 1,\\\n              \"sale_amount\": {\\\n                \"value\": 100,\\\n                \"offset\": 100\\\n              }\\\n            }\\\n          ],\n          \"subtotal\": {\n            \"value\": 20000,\n            \"offset\": 100\n          },\n          \"tax\": {\n            \"value\": 1000,\n            \"offset\": 100,\n            \"description\": \"optional_text\"\n          },\n          \"shipping\": {\n            \"value\": 1000,\n            \"offset\": 100,\n            \"description\": \"optional_text\"\n          },\n          \"discount\": {\n            \"value\": 1000,\n            \"offset\": 100,\n            \"description\": \"optional_text\",\n            \"discount_program_name\": \"optional_text\"\n          }\n        }\n      }\n    }\n  }\n}\n```\n\nFor a non-catalog based integration i.e. when catalog-id is not present, an example payload looks as follows:\n\n```\n{\n  \"interactive\": {\n    \"type\": \"order_details\",\n    \"header\": {\n      \"type\": \"image\",\n      \"image\": {\n        \"id\": \"your-media-id\"\n      }\n    },\n    \"body\": {\n      \"text\": \"your-text-body-content\"\n    },\n    \"footer\": {\n      \"text\": \"your-text-footer-content\"\n    },\n    \"action\": {\n      \"name\": \"review_and_pay\",\n      \"parameters\": {\n        \"reference_id\": \"reference-id-value\",\n        \"type\": \"digital-goods\",\n        \"payment_type\": \"upi\",\n        \"payment_configuration\": \"unique-payment-config-id\",\n        \"currency\": \"INR\",\n        \"total_amount\": {\n          \"value\": 21000,\n          \"offset\": 100\n        },\n        \"order\": {\n          \"status\": \"pending\",\n          \"expiration\": {\n            \"timestamp\": \"utc_timestamp_in_seconds\",\n            \"description\": \"cancellation-explanation\"\n          },\n          \"items\": [\\\n            {\\\n              \"name\": \"Product name, for example bread\",\\\n              \"amount\": {\\\n                \"value\": 10000,\\\n                \"offset\": 100\\\n              },\\\n              \"quantity\": 1,\\\n              \"sale_amount\": {\\\n                \"value\": 100,\\\n                \"offset\": 100\\\n              },\\\n              \"country_of_origin\": \"country-of-origin\",\\\n              \"importer_name\": \"name-of-importer-business\",\\\n              \"importer_address\": {\\\n                \"address_line1\": \"B8/733 nand nagri\",\\\n                \"address_line2\": \"police station\",\\\n                \"city\": \"East Delhi\",\\\n                \"zone_code\": \"DL\",\\\n                \"postal_code\": \"110093\",\\\n                \"country_code\": \"IN\"\\\n              }\\\n            },\\\n            {\\\n              \"name\": \"Product name, for example bread\",\\\n              \"amount\": {\\\n                \"value\": 10000,\\\n                \"offset\": 100\\\n              },\\\n              \"quantity\": 1,\\\n              \"sale_amount\": {\\\n                \"value\": 100,\\\n                \"offset\": 100\\\n              },\\\n              \"country_of_origin\": \"country-of-origin\",\\\n              \"importer_name\": \"name-of-importer-business\",\\\n              \"importer_address\": {\\\n                \"address_line1\": \"B8/733 nand nagri\",\\\n                \"address_line2\": \"police station\",\\\n                \"city\": \"East Delhi\",\\\n                \"zone_code\": \"DL\",\\\n                \"postal_code\": \"110093\",\\\n                \"country_code\": \"IN\"\\\n              }\\\n            }\\\n          ],\n          \"subtotal\": {\n            \"value\": 20000,\n            \"offset\": 100\n          },\n          \"tax\": {\n            \"value\": 1000,\n            \"offset\": 100,\n            \"description\": \"optional_text\"\n          },\n          \"shipping\": {\n            \"value\": 1000,\n            \"offset\": 100,\n            \"description\": \"optional_text\"\n          },\n          \"discount\": {\n            \"value\": 1000,\n            \"offset\": 100,\n            \"description\": \"optional_text\",\n            \"discount_program_name\": \"optional_text\"\n          }\n        }\n      }\n    }\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### Step 3: Add Common Message Parameters\n\nOnce the interactive object is complete, append the other parameters that make a message: `recipient_type`, `to`, and `type`. Remember to set the `type` to `interactive`.\n\n```\n{\n   \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n   \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n   \"to\": \"PHONE_NUMBER\",\n   \"type\": \"interactive\",\n   \"interactive\": {\n     // interactive object here\n   }\n }\n\n```\n\nThese are [parameters common to all message types](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/api/messages#sending-messages).\n\n### Step 4:Make a POST Call to Messages Endpoint\n\nMake a POST call to the [`/[PHONE_NUMBER_ID]/messages`](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages) endpoint with the `JSON` object you have assembled. If your message is sent successfully, you get the following response:\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"contacts\": [ {\\\n      \"input\": \"[PHONE_NUMBER_ID]\",\\\n      \"wa_id\": \"[PHONE-NUMBER_ID]\"\\\n  } ],\n  \"messages\": [ {\\\n      \"id\": \"wamid.HBgLMTY1MDUwNzY1MjAVAgARGBI5QTNDQTVCM0Q0Q0Q2RTY3RTcA\"\\\n  } ]\n}\n\n```\n\nFor all errors that can be returned and guidance on how to handle them, see [WhatsApp Cloud API, Error Codes](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes).\n\n### Step 5: Consumer Pays for the Order\n\nConsumers can pay using WhatsApp payment method or using any UPI supported app that is installed on the device.\n\n### Step 6: Get Notified About Transaction Status Updates from payment gateway\n\nBusinesses receive updates to the invoice via payment gateway webhooks, when the status of the user-initiated transaction changes. The unique identifier tr(reference-id passed in `order_details` message) can be used to map the transaction to the consumer invoice or interactive order details message.\n\nPlease refer to our PG integration guide for the exact payment sigals. \\[PayU\\], \\[Cashfree\\], \\[RazorPay\\] and Billdesk\n\n### Step 7: Update order status\n\nUpon receiving transaction signals from payment gateway through webhook, the business must update the order status to keep the user up to date. Currently we support the following order status values:\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=634034961253028&version=1742854961)\n\n| Value | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `pending` | User has not successfully paid yet |\n| `processing` | User payment authorized, merchant/partner is fulfilling the order, performing service, etc. |\n| `partially-shipped` | A portion of the products in the order have been shipped by the merchant |\n| `shipped` | All the products in the order have been shipped by the merchant |\n| `completed` | The order is completed and no further action is expected from the user or the partner/merchant |\n| `canceled` | The partner/merchant would like to cancel the `order_details` message for the order/invoice. The status update will fail if there is already a `successful` or `pending` payment for this `order_details` message |\n\nTypically businesses update the `order_status` using either the WhatsApp payment status change notifications or their own internal processes. To update `order_status`, the partner sends an `order_status` message to the user.\n\n```\n{\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"whatsapp-id\",\n  \"type\": \"interactive\",\n  \"interactive\": {\n    \"type\": \"order_status\",\n    \"body\": {\n      \"text\": \"your-text-body-content\"\n    },\n    \"action\": {\n      \"name\": \"review_order\",\n      \"parameters\": {\n        \"reference_id\": \"reference-id-value\",\n        \"order\": {\n          \"status\": \"processing | partially_shipped | shipped | completed | canceled\",\n          \"description\": \"optional-text\"\n        }\n      }\n    }\n  }\n}\n```\n\nThe following table describes the returned values:\n\n| Value | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `reference_id` | The ID provided by the partner in the `order_details` message |\n| `status` | The new order `status` |\n| `description` | Optional text for sharing status related information in `order_details`. Could be useful while sending cancellation. Max character limit is 120 characters |\n\nFor all errors that can be returned and guidance on how to handle them, see [WhatsApp On-Premises API, Errors](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/on-premises/errors).\n\nMerchant should always post this order-status message to consumer after receiving transaction updates for an order. As the order\\_details message and order details screen experience is tied to to the order status updates.\n\n### Step 8: Reconcile Payments\n\nBusinesses should use their bank statements to reconcile the payments using the `reference_id` provided in the `order_details` messages.\n\n## Merchant Preferred UPI Payment Method\n\nNow merchants can specify upto `one` UPI Payment app to showup in checkout flow. Merchant preferred payment app will be shown on top of the list of available UPI apps in - \"Choose payment method\" screen. To enable this capability we require partners to specify the external app-id in the Order Details or order-invoice message.\n\nNote: This feature is available on consumer apps on and above version: 2.24.21.0\n\n### Updates to Order Details Payload\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"interactive\": {\n    \"action\": {\n      \"name\": \"review_and_pay\",\n      \"parameters\": {\n         \"preferred_payment_methods\": [\\\n             {\\\n                \"method\": \"Application-ID\"\\\n             }\\\n          ]\n          ....\n      }\n      \"order\": ..\n      }\n    }\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### List of supported apps:\n\n| UPI Application | Application ID to be passed in Order Details payload |\n| --- | --- |\n| Google Pay | gpay |\n| PhonePe | phonepe |\n| PayTm | paytm |\n| Amazon Pay | amazonpay |\n| CRED | cred |\n| Mobikwik | mobikwik |\n\n## Checklist for Integrated Merchants\n\n- Ensure that `order_status` message is send to consumer informing them about updates to an order after receiving transaction updates for an order.\n\n- Ensure the merchant is verified and WABA contact is marked with a verified check.\n\n- Verify the WABA is mapped to appropriate merchant initiated messaging tier(1k, 10k and 100k per day)\n\n- Merchant should list the customer support informatoin in the profile screen incase consumer wants to report any issues.\n\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Receive UPI Payments Through WhatsApp](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#receive-upi-payments-through-whatsapp)\n\n[Overview](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#overview)\n\n[How It Works](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#how-it-works)\n\n[Purchase Flow in App](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#purchase-flow-in-app)\n\n[Before You Start](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#before-you-start)\n\n[Manage Your Payment Methods (Beta Gateway](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#step-1)\n\n[Step 2: Assemble the Interactive Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#step-2--assemble-the-interactive-object)\n\n[Step 3: Add Common Message Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#step-3--add-common-message-parameters)\n\n[Step 4:Make a POST Call to Messages Endpoint](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#step-4-make-a-post-call-to-messages-endpoint)\n\n[Step 5: Consumer Pays for the Order](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#step-5--consumer-pays-for-the-order)\n\n[Step 6: Get Notified About Transaction Status Updates from payment gateway](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#step-6--get-notified-about-transaction-status-updates-from-payment-gateway)\n\n[Step 7: Update order status](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#step-7--update-order-status)\n\n[Step 8: Reconcile Payments](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#step-8--reconcile-payments)\n\n[Merchant Preferred UPI Payment Method](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#merchant-preferred-upi-payment-method)\n\n[Updates to Order Details Payload](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#updates-to-order-details-payload)\n\n[List of supported apps:](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent#list-of-supported-apps-)\n\n[Checklist for Integrated Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/)\n\nWe are making changes to the WhatsApp Business Platform pricing model.\n\n**Effective July 1, 2025 for all businesses on our platform:**\n\n- The conversation-based pricing model will be deprecated\n- We will charge [per-message for template messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing/updates-to-pricing#per-message-pricing) instead of per-conversation\n- Utility templates sent within an open customer service window [will be free](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing/updates-to-pricing#free-utility-templates-in-the-customer-service-window)\n\nSee [Pricing Updates on the WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing/updates-to-pricing) for additional details.\n\n# Sending Product Card Carousel Templates\n\nThis document describes how to send approved [product card carousel templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/message-templates/product-card-carousel-templates) to WhatsApp users.\n\n## Request Syntax\n\nUse the [**POST /<WHATSAPP\\_BUSINESS\\_PHONE\\_NUMBER\\_ID>/messages**](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages) endpoint to send an approved product card carousel template to a WhatsApp user.\n\n```\nPOST /<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>/messages\n```\n\n## Post Body\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\n  \"type\": \"template\",\n  \"template\": {\n    \"name\": \"<TEMPLATE_NAME>\",\n    \"language\": {\n      \"code\": \"<TEMPLATE_LANGUAGE>\"\n    },\n    \"components\": [\\\n      {\\\n        \"type\": \"body\",\\\n        \"parameters\": [\\\n          <MESSAGE_BODY_TEXT_VARIABLE>,\\\n          <MESSAGE_BODY_TEXT_VARIABLE>\\\n        ]\\\n      },\\\n      {\\\n        \"type\": \"carousel\",\\\n        \"cards\": [\\\n          {\\\n            \"card_index\": <CARD_INDEX>,\\\n            \"components\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"type\": \"header\",\\\n                \"parameters\": [\\\n                  {\\\n                    \"type\": \"product\",\\\n                    \"product\": {\\\n                      \"product_retailer_id\": \"<PRODUCT_ID>\",\\\n                      \"catalog_id\": \"<CATALOG_ID>\"\\\n                    }\\\n                  }\\\n                ]\\\n              }\\\n            ]\\\n          }\\\n\\\n          /* Addt'l cards would follow. */\\\n\\\n        ]\\\n      }\\\n    ]\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## Post Body Parameters\n\n| Placeholder | Description | Example Value |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| `<CARD_INDEX>`<br>_Integer_ | **Required.**<br>Zero-indexed order in which card should appear within the card carousel. `0` indicates first card, `1` indicates second card, etc. | `0` |\n| `<CATALOG_ID>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>ID of [connected ecommerce catalog](https://www.facebook.com/business/help/158662536425974) containing the product. | `194836987003835` |\n| `<MESSAGE_BODY_TEXT_VARIABLE>`<br>_Object_ | **Required if template message body text uses variables, otherwise omit.**<br>Object describing a message variable. If the template uses multiple variables, you must define an object for each variable.<br>Supports `text`, `currency`, and `date_time` types. See [Messages Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages#parameter-object).<br>There is no maximum character limit on this value, but it does count against the message body text limit of 1024 characters. | ```<br>{<br>  \"type\":\"text\",<br>  \"text\": \"Pablo\"<br>}<br>``` |\n| `<PRODUCT_ID>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>Product ID. | `vrpj01fvwp` |\n| `<TEMPLATE_LANGUAGE>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>Template [language and locale code](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/message-templates/supported-languages). | `en_US` |\n| `<TEMPLATE_NAME>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>Template name.<br>Maximum 512 characters. | `carousel_template_media_cards_v1` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>WhatsApp user phone number. | `+16505551234` |\n\n## Example Request\n\nThis example request sends an approved template named \"carousel\\_template\\_product\\_cards\\_v1\". It supplies a single body text variable value (which the template requires) and three product cards. Each card identifies where it should appear in the carousel (card\\_index), as well as the product ID and catalog ID where the card's product details (title, description, price, etc.) can be found.\n\n```\ncurl 'https://graph.facebook.com/v22.0/179776755229976/messages' \\\n-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...' \\\n-d '\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"+16505551234\",\n  \"type\": \"template\",\n  \"template\": {\n    \"name\": \"carousel_template_product_cards_v1\",\n    \"language\": {\n      \"code\": \"en_US\"\n    },\n    \"components\": [\\\n      {\\\n        \"type\": \"body\",\\\n        \"parameters\": [\\\n          {\\\n            \"type\": \"text\",\\\n            \"text\": \"Pablo\"\\\n          }\\\n        ]\\\n      },\\\n      {\\\n        \"type\": \"carousel\",\\\n        \"cards\": [\\\n          {\\\n            \"card_index\": 0,\\\n            \"components\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"type\": \"header\",\\\n                \"parameters\": [\\\n                  {\\\n                    \"type\": \"product\",\\\n                    \"product\": {\\\n                      \"product_retailer_id\": \"vrpj01fvwp\",\\\n                      \"catalog_id\": \"194836987003835\"\\\n                    }\\\n                  }\\\n                ]\\\n              }\\\n            ]\\\n          },\\\n          {\\\n            \"card_index\": 1,\\\n            \"components\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"type\": \"header\",\\\n                \"parameters\": [\\\n                  {\\\n                    \"type\": \"product\",\\\n                    \"product\": {\\\n                      \"product_retailer_id\": \"va2l5ioeat\",\\\n                      \"catalog_id\": \"194836987003835\"\\\n                    }\\\n                  }\\\n                ]\\\n              }\\\n            ]\\\n          },\\\n          {\\\n            \"card_index\": 2,\\\n            \"components\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"type\": \"header\",\\\n                \"parameters\": [\\\n                  {\\\n                    \"type\": \"product\",\\\n                    \"product\": {\\\n                      \"product_retailer_id\": \"sqpjv0mgde\",\\\n                      \"catalog_id\": \"194836987003835\"\\\n                    }\\\n                  }\\\n                ]\\\n              }\\\n            ]\\\n          }\\\n        ]\\\n      }\\\n    ]\n  }\n}'\n```\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Sending Product Card Carousel Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/product-card-carousel-templates#sending-product-card-carousel-templates)\n\n[Request Syntax](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/product-card-carousel-templates#request-syntax)\n\n[Post Body](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/product-card-carousel-templates#post-body)\n\n[Post Body Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/product-card-carousel-templates#post-body-parameters)\n\n[Example Request](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/product-card-carousel-templates#example-request)\n\n* * List](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/interactive-list-messages)\n- [Interactive Reply Buttons](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/interactive-reply-buttons-messages)\n- [Location](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/location-messages)\n- [Location Request](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages/location-request-messages)\n- [Reaction](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/reaction-messages)\n- [Sticker](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/sticker-messages)\n- [Template](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates)\n- [Text](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/text-messages)\n- [Video](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/video-messages)\n- [Read Receipts](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/mark-message-as-read)\n\n- [Block Users](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/block-users)\n- [Phone Numbers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/phone-numbers)\n- [Webhooks](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/set-up-webhooks)\n- [Sell Products & Services](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services)\n- [Payments API - India](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in)\n- [Payments API - Brazil](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br)\n- [Reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference)\n- [Support](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Audio Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/audio-messages#audio-messages)\n\n[Sending Audio Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/audio-messages#sending-audio-messages)\n\n[Request Syntax](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/audio-messages#request-syntax)\n\n[Post Body](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/audio-messages#post-body)\n\n[Post Body Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/audio-messages#post-body-parameters)\n\n[Supported Audio Formats](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/audio-messages#supported-audio-formats)\n\n[Example Request](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/audio-messages#example-request)\n\n[Example Response](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/audio-messages#example-response)\n\n# Audio Messages\n\nAudio messages display an audio icon and a link to an audio file. When the WhatsApp user taps the icon, the WhatsApp client loads and plays the audio file.\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/441324305_778596817585365_5782798363047115764_n.png?_nc_cat=107&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=X94I8LP40XwQ7kNvwHD2AEs&_nc_oc=AdmOrPmYqMM8HtjFTZPPkxcOSLGn4opQmZ3eIY3F-Vjep_ZYfLU_sY7wwHk9s2apFwo&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=IjRIa48U918V23yT2NDecA&oh=00_AYGC_CezVcRY1dFqX8_N_UEdpZJvGlxUnyQzaBaFQ7AVzw&oe=680AED68)\n\n## Sending Audio Messages\n\nUse the **[POST /<WHATSAPP\\_BUSINESS\\_PHONE\\_NUMBER\\_ID>/messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages)** endpoint to send an audio message to a WhatsApp user.\n\n### Request Syntax\n\n```\nPOST /<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>/messages\n```\n\n### Post Body\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\n  \"type\": \"audio\",\n  \"audio\": {\n    \"id\" : \"<MEDIA_ID>\"\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### Post Body Parameters\n\n| Placeholder | Description | Example Value |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| `<MEDIA_ID>`<br>_String_ | **Required if using an uploaded media asset (recommended)**.<br>[Uploaded media](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/media#upload-media) asset ID. | `3674626312780147` |\n| `<MEDIA_URL>`<br>_String_ | **Required if linking to your media asset (not recommended)**<br>URL of audio asset on your public server. For better performance, we recommend that you [upload your media asset](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/media#upload-media) instead. | `https://www.luckyshrub.com/assets/lucky-track.aac` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>WhatsApp user phone number. | `+16505551234` |\n\n## Supported Audio Formats\n\n| Audio Type | Extension | MIME Type | Max Size |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| AAC | .aac | audio/aac | 16 MB |\n| AMR | .amr | audio/amr | 16 MB |\n| MP3 | .mp3 | audio/mpeg | 16 MB |\n| MP4 Audio | .m4a | audio/mp4 | 16 MB |\n| OGG Audio | .ogg | audio/ogg (OPUS codecs only; base audio/ogg not supported.) | 16 MB |\n\n## Example Request\n\nExample request to send an image message using an uploaded media ID and a caption.\n\n```\ncurl 'https://graph.facebook.com/v22.0/106540352242922/messages' \\\n-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...' \\\n-d '{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"+16505551234\",\n  \"type\": \"audio\",\n  \"audio\": {\n    \"id\" : \"3674626312780147\"\n  }\n}'\n```\n\n## Example Response\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"contacts\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"input\": \"+16505551234\",\\\n      \"wa_id\": \"16505551234\"\\\n    }\\\n  ],\n  \"messages\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"wamid.HBgLMTY0NjcwNDM1OTUVAgARGBI1RjQyNUE3NEYxMzAzMzQ5MkEA\"\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Audio Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/audio-messages#audio-messages)\n\n[Sending Audio Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/audio-messages#sending-audio-messages)\n\n[Request Syntax](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/audio-messages#request-syntax)\n\n[Post Body](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/audio-messages#post-body)\n\n[Post Body Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/audio-messages#post-body-parameters)\n\n[Supported Audio Formats](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/audio-messages#supported-audio-formats)\n\n[Example Request](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/audio-messages#example-request)\n\n[Example Response](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/audio-messages#example-response)\n\n* * Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\n- [About the Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/overview)\n- [On-Premises API Sunset](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/on-premises/sunset)\n- [Cloud vs On-Prem](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-vs-onprem)\n- [Phone Numbers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/phone-numbers)\n- [Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/conversation-types)\n- [Pricing](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing)\n- [Quality Rating and Messaging Limits](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/messaging-limits)\n- [Webhooks](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/webhooks)\n\n\n- [Sample App Endpoints](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/sample-app-endpoints)\n\n- [Solution Providers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/solution-providers)\n- [Embedded Signup](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/embedded-signup)\n- [Link Previews](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/link-previews)\n- [Policy Enforcement](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/overview/policy-enforcement)\n- [Changelog](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-platform/changelog)\n- [Support](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/support)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Sample Callback URL for Webhooks Testing](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/sample-app-endpoints#sample-callback-url-for-webhooks-testing)\n\n[WhatsApp Business Platform On-Premises API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/sample-app-endpoints#whatsapp-business-platform-on-premises-api)\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=595945097590761&version=1743728118)[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\>\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\\>\n[Guides](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides)\n\n# Sample Callback URL for Webhooks Testing\n\nYou can clone our sample callback app using Glitch to create a public callback URL on Glitch's servers that you can use to test Webhooks. The purpose of creating the Glitch project is that it writes webhook payloads to a log file that you can view in real-time as webhooks are triggered.\n\n### Before you set up an endpoint for webhook testing for Cloud API\n\nThis guide is part of a multiple step process and you must have completed a number of these steps before you start configuring your sample app endpoint using Glitch. You must have completed the following:\n\n1. [Set up Developer Assets and Platform Access](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started#set-up-developer-assets)\n2. [Send a Test Message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started#sent-test-message)\n3. [Configure a Webhook](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started#configure-webhooks)\n\nFull instructions for getting started with WhatsApp Business Cloud API so you can send your first test message is located at [Get Started With the WhatsApp Business Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started).\n\n### Set up and Configure Glitch\n\n1. Head over to [glitch.com](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fglitch.com%2F&h=AT19AgbFbDiXjgFgEWzcl8bG3urMKq8fxWbSei3CkdGrZdR3iSGD5MrLqu3b9GBRMl5HBrLeAm5OtVFEaECP9FHMGfyCtOjQYTLiXrQtAuDHeld3ocBOYWdwpNEzQjLzzE10eK8n_AoXkQ) and create an account. This allows you to use all the features that we discuss in this guide and ensures that the UI we discuss and the UI you see are consistent. If you don't create an account, most of the UI features will be missing and will look different.\n\n\n2. After you have set up your Glitch account, open our starter Glitch project template using the following link: [WhatsApp Platform Webhook project template](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fglitch.com%2Fedit%2F%23%21%2Fwhatsapp-cloud-api-echo-bot&h=AT3yg01jz0mf6vr-hq8c_JUYnAfCDlbJUxxTKKJ2Z2-orJ0-Tq78JP_nBdHixE7JO6v865q5R3Y5z0TXr52fiv894DcXCYW3VEpdlE6WSMz4CqACXI7YvcCAT1zgr9YgNxhToF1xbEIGLQ).\n\n\n3. Click the **Remix to Edit** button at the top right corner of the Glitch webpage to clone our sample app.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/319077103_745533740322109_6185264739019898390_n.png?_nc_cat=101&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=43d5ZCIEcwkQ7kNvwGRADJ_&_nc_oc=Adma0DgJZ8bp5QRymMreuljlFsmTIjfVyfS5WltoijlLT8TphVePM6HmiEor60wmkvg&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=uZuSbcyN9Nc_yayJc9HXLQ&oh=00_AYHUwqNwGo1eWp0SYOE6YfoD6gl-7QMr00vVE5ratrlObQ&oe=680B04BC)\n\n\n\nClick Remix to Edit to create your own Gitch project\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n    A copy of the project will be created for your account.\n\n\n4. In the `.env` file, update the value of the `WEBHOOK_VERIFY_TOKEN` to a random string of your choosing. Then, you can optionally, copy the value of your temporary/permanent access token from **WhatsApp > API Setup** in your App Dashboard and paste that value for `GRAPH_API_TOKEN`.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/438031987_429864762960170_701313834828901418_n.png?_nc_cat=110&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=Hm2zodA-tp0Q7kNvwEaSYr6&_nc_oc=Adk9wik2VpLYlEoBpaN5bW64J0ObsblB6CeGus0LVMSx4yHuw51njQDSBsHD5YRQb0s&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=uZuSbcyN9Nc_yayJc9HXLQ&oh=00_AYFnmAFDBA7l6GynG2mbx4OObh00_dDAhK9cY1MMyqlpOA&oe=680AF731)\n\n\n\nUpdate Glitch environment variables for your project\n\n5. Click **Share** at the top right to get the **Live site** URL. Add `/webhook` at the end of the URL to get your complete callback URL. It will look something like ` https://<project-name>.glitch.me/webhook`.\n\nNow that your endpoint is ready, you need to return to your App Dashboard.\n\n### Configure App Dashboard with Glitch endpoint and verification token\n\n1. In your App Dashboard, find the WhatsApp product and click **Configuration**.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/320551751_5819501858128177_737000812008113994_n.png?_nc_cat=102&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=8-RF58sleYIQ7kNvwEixJ3C&_nc_oc=AdkG5G2FNTqo0OmaufCln4gBZ2_3oHmv9ETns-2FZWszxYeVo4xFlRmZAy6HBqjWn0E&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=uZuSbcyN9Nc_yayJc9HXLQ&oh=00_AYEGtYR6IUX4oG49jaTKVYOrLOvQ8rtAY3tdMJlwcL1_AA&oe=680AEC2E)\n\n2. Then, find the webhooks section and click **Edit**. After the click, a dialog appears on your screen and asks you for the **Callback URL** and **Verify Token**.\n\n    You need to use the values you used to configure your Glitch project in section [Set up and Configure Glitch](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/sample-app-endpoints#config-glitch). For instance, ( `https://<project-name>.glitch.me/webhook`) for **Callback URL** and (\"HAPPY\") for **Verify token**.\n\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/320000797_682400273266261_5220928916977728200_n.png?_nc_cat=108&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=h5X1976c090Q7kNvwF1tWl9&_nc_oc=Adlik2jGYCc4hVPUOUfyWgZYeLcZnGvkWHoyBTZ1ip4IUcIypTuhyoeNORNnf7vVBxM&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=uZuSbcyN9Nc_yayJc9HXLQ&oh=00_AYFdhsvsbAjePd1ncPBQPnekdOUOTyzI9-l63Ut0c2ksiA&oe=680AFF6E)\n\n3. Back in the Configuration page, click **Manage** to launch the App Dashboard Webhook Fields dialog.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/322227484_570973017700499_2459083230700003241_n.png?_nc_cat=103&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=nK5lHPF5IwMQ7kNvwEle2Yx&_nc_oc=Adl1Ag5TuXMabb17M6Q4SuL0KWh24y8TJ56w63FQr_X7EiWh8H3Xyazsm91RVbUu6_c&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=uZuSbcyN9Nc_yayJc9HXLQ&oh=00_AYE0rHXYQ1H6pL6PXnzWjP_5D4Zyq5_ncOT3kZTn-oxWHg&oe=680AEC51)\n\n\n\nManage Webhook Fields Dialog\n\n4. In the field table, click **Subscribe** to all the Webhook events you want to subscribe to (we recommend that you subscribe to all of them) at the far right column of the table.\n5. Then in the **messages** row, click **Test** to send a notification to your endpoint.\n\n\n    To confirm that a Webhook notification was triggered, go back to Glitch and select **LOGS** and the output should look like the following image.\n\n\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/322017022_675702840700565_8280391546939504635_n.png?_nc_cat=102&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=YtuRXc6Z3X0Q7kNvwHAG_rT&_nc_oc=AdleDbMFrya5Wwquf9jN-tqbVCon_gCKCPoji1yc8N43PpT_eFUcUy_Q7V4H7_sgfeo&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=uZuSbcyN9Nc_yayJc9HXLQ&oh=00_AYGXuGiZFGXOwiwIRacRXN1S8jsIBzYd7wpNLuIInuM3Dg&oe=680AEECA)\n\n    The complete Webhook notification payload should look like the following:\n\n\n\n```\n{\n     \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n     \"entry\": [\\\n       {\\\n         \"id\": \"0\",\\\n         \"changes\": [\\\n           {\\\n             \"field\": \"messages\",\\\n             \"value\": {\\\n               \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n               \"metadata\": {\\\n                 \"display_phone_number\": \"16505551111\",\\\n                 \"phone_number_id\": \"123456123\"\\\n               },\\\n               \"contacts\": [\\\n                 {\\\n                   \"profile\": {\\\n                     \"name\": \"test user name\"\\\n                   },\\\n                   \"wa_id\": \"16315551181\"\\\n                 }\\\n               ],\\\n               \"messages\": [\\\n                 {\\\n                   \"from\": \"16315551181\",\\\n                   \"id\": \"ABGGFlA5Fpa\",\\\n                   \"timestamp\": \"1504902988\",\\\n                   \"type\": \"text\",\\\n                   \"text\": {\\\n                     \"body\": \"this is a text message\"\\\n                   }\\\n                 }\\\n               ]\\\n             }\\\n           }\\\n         ]\\\n       }\\\n     ]\n}\n```\n\n\n## WhatsApp Business Platform On-Premises API\n\n1. Go to our starter webhook project on Glitch:\n    [Remix on Glitch![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/21624459_135531593756336_210820161941274624_n.png?_nc_cat=107&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=PctJncKmbpwQ7kNvwFt46J5&_nc_oc=AdmJF7Mm0zajwQ9wPc0wNX5dFI4kmJjEQaWczboj0REQ59FkW1KWFSda52PBwuk0M2Q&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=uZuSbcyN9Nc_yayJc9HXLQ&oh=00_AYHpcKJlvjiPceGDkFXLXa6EfoZy-W0VPtPHmeoUtHlr1g&oe=680B1100)](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fglitch.com%2Fedit%2F%23%21%2Fremix%2Fwhatsapp-biz-api-webhook-tester&h=AT3gaeeMASyrXJjwexJK2ZGDxS4sHZynKjvwf9Xjs5gaipb7Ei7toOYgOx5Cl09_FVc5aoYZ6AEWx65TU3GM0hcdpipUVeylzuMpWCNL4yZjNln-VWXcUwCMqg6haoFSdu8ArbWPZaBxvA)\n2. Click **`server.js`** in the left navigation to for the Webhook endpoint implementation.\n\n3. Click **Share** at the top right to get the **live site** URL. This will be your callback URL. It will look something like ` https://<project-name.glitch.me/webhook`.\n\n4. Click on the **Status** button in the left navigation pane. You will see that your app is listening on a specific port.\n5. Send a message or send yourself a test message to see the notification. The following example of the log shows a received text message with a body of \"Hi\" and a sent message with updated status of sent, then delivered, then read.\n\n\n\n```\nIncoming webhook: {\"messages\":[{\"from\":\"1234567890\",\"id\":\"ABGGhSkIc2B_Ago-sDy5BNm-1gI5\",\"text\":{\"body\":\"Hi\"},\"timestamp\":\"1529381066\",\"type\":\"text\"}]}\nIncoming webhook: {\"statuses\":[{\"id\":\"gBGGhSkIc2B_AgkXDygfSDwgG5s\",\"recipient_id\":\"1234567890\",\"status\":\"sent\",\"timestamp\":\"1529381072\"}]}\nIncoming webhook: {\"statuses\":[{\"id\":\"gBGGhSkIc2B_AgkXDygfSDwgG5s\",\"recipient_id\":\"1234567890\",\"status\":\"delivered\",\"timestamp\":\"1529381072\"}]}\nIncoming webhook: {\"statuses\":[{\"id\":\"gBGGhSkIc2B_AgkXDygfSDwgG5s\",\"recipient_id\":\"1234567890\",\"status\":\"read\",\"timestamp\":\"1529381076\"}]}\n```\n\n\n[WhatsApp Business Formats](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/image-messages#supported-image-formats)\n\n[Example Request](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/image-messages#example-request)\n\n[Example Response](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/image-messages#example-response)\n\n# Image Messages\n\nImage messages are messages that display a single image and an optional caption.\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/440788911_1344094656981591_356280964045551612_n.png?_nc_cat=110&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=HPejhhRwfzcQ7kNvwEp3T3Z&_nc_oc=Adk6-Xsw9bEhWrkD1kSaKYk6RUQ9HgCaUTUrcZaSB_cE6D40J9MrGs5ZpwzbgHhTp-o&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=TLhnHYxhzDnuGuIWRGCLZg&oh=00_AYF-5NN9w5t5pWPZ9zm3vYNaSoQmE4GSfYrSf5jBADZGUA&oe=680B0409)\n\n## Sending Image Messages\n\nUse the **[POST /<WHATSAPP\\_BUSINESS\\_PHONE\\_NUMBER\\_ID>/messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages)** endpoint to send an image message to a WhatsApp user.\n\n### Request Syntax\n\n```\nPOST /<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>/messages\n```\n\n### Post Body\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\n  \"type\": \"image\",\n  \"image\": {\n    \"id\" : \"<MEDIA_ID>\", /* Only if using uploaded media */\n    \"link\": \"<MEDIA_URL>\", /* Only if linking to your media */\n    \"caption\": \"<IMAGE_CAPTION_TEXT>\"\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### Post Body Parameters\n\n| Placeholder | Description | Example Value |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| `<IMAGE_CAPTION_TEXT>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Image caption text.<br>Maximum 1024 characters. | `The best succulent ever?` |\n| `<MEDIA_ID>`<br>_String_ | **Required if using an uploaded media asset (recommended)**.<br>[Uploaded media](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/media#upload-media) asset ID. | `1479537139650973` |\n| `<MEDIA_URL>`<br>_String_ | **Required if linking to your media asset (not recommended)**<br>URL of image asset on your public server. For better performance, we recommend that you [upload your media asset](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/media#upload-media) instead. | `https://www.luckyshrub.com/assets/succulents/aloe.png` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>WhatsApp user phone number. | `+16505551234` |\n\n## Supported Image Formats\n\nImages must be 8-bit, RGB or RGBA.\n\n\n\n| Image Type | Extension | MIME Type | Max Size |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| JPEG | .jpeg | image/jpeg | 5 MB |\n| PNG | .png | image/png | 5 MB |\n\n## Example Request\n\nExample request to send an image message with a caption to a WhatsApp user.\n\n```\ncurl 'https://graph.facebook.com/v22.0/106540352242922/messages' \\\n-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...' \\\n-d '\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"+16505551234\",\n  \"type\": \"image\",\n  \"image\": {\n    \"id\" : \"1479537139650973\",\n    \"caption\": \"The best succulent ever?\"\n  }\n}'\n```\n\n## Example Response\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"contacts\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"input\": \"+16505551234\",\\\n      \"wa_id\": \"16505551234\"\\\n    }\\\n  ],\n  \"messages\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"wamid.HBgLMTY0NjcwNDM1OTUVAgARGBI1RjQyNUE3NEYxMzAzMzQ5MkEA\"\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Image Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/image-messages#image-messages)\n\n[Sending Image Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/image-messages#sending-image-messages)\n\n[Request Syntax](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/image-messages#request-syntax)\n\n[Post Body](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/image-messages#post-body)\n\n[Post Body Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/image-messages#post-body-parameters)\n\n[Supported Image Formats](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/image-messages#supported-image-formats)\n\n[Example Request](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/image-messages#example-request)\n\n[Example Response](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/image-messages#example-response)\n\n* * In](https://business.facebook.com/business/loginpage/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fdevelopers.facebook.com%2Fdocs%2Fwhatsapp%2Fcloud-api%2Fmessages%2Finteractive-flow-messages%3Fnav_ref%3Dbiz_unified_f3_login_page_to_dfc&app=436761779744620&login_options%5B0%5D=FB&login_options%5B1%5D=SSO&is_work_accounts=1&config_ref=biz_login_tool_flavor_dfc)\n\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\n- [Overview](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview)\n- [Get Partners](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started-for-solution-partners)\n- [Get Started for Tech [Video](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/video-messages)\n- [Read Receipts](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/mark-message-as-read)\n\n- India](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in)\n- [Payments API - Brazil](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br)\n- [Reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference)\n- [Support](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Flow Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/interactive-flow-messages#flow-messages)\n\n[Example Request](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/interactive-flow-messages#example-request)\n\n[Example Response](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/interactive-flow-messages#example-response)\n\n# Flow Messages\n\nAfter you create a [WhatsApp Flow](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/flows), you can send it. To send a message with a flow, we have introduced a new type of the Interactive Object called `flow`. These are the following properties of the Interactive Object specific to flows:\n\n| Property | Type | Description |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| `interactive.type` | String | Value must be `flow` |\n| `interactive.action.name` | String | Value must be `flow` |\n| `interactive.action.parameters.flow_message_version` | String | Value must be `3`. |\n| `interactive.action.parameters.flow_id` | String | Unique ID of the Flow provided by WhatsApp.<br>Cannot be used with the `flow_name` parameter. Only one of these parameters is required. |\n| `interactive.action.parameters.flow_name` | String | The name of the Flow that you created. Changing the Flow name will require updating this parameter to match the new name.<br>Cannot be used with the `flow_id` parameter. Only one of these parameters is required. |\n| `interactive.action.parameters.flow_cta` | String | Text on the CTA button. For example: \"Signup\"<br>CTA text length is advised to be 30 characters or less (no emoji). |\n| `interactive.action.parameters.mode` | String | The Flow can be in either `draft` or `published` mode. `published` is the default value for this field. |\n| `interactive.action.parameters.flow_token` | String | Flow token that is generated by the business to serve as an identifier.<br>Default value is `unused`. |\n| `interactive.action.parameters.flow_action` | String | `navigate` or `data_exchange`. Default value is `navigate` |\n| `interactive.action.parameters.flow_action_payload` | String | Optional if `flow_action` is `navigate`. Should be omitted otherwise. |\n| `interactive.action.parameters.flow_action_payload.screen` | String | The `id` of the first screen.<br>Default is `FRIST_ENTRY_SCREEN` |\n| `interactive.action.parameters.flow_action_payload.data` | String | Optional. The input data for the first screen of the Flow. Must be a non-empty object. |\n\n## Example Request\n\n```\ncurl -X  POST \\\n 'https://graph.facebook.com/v19.0/FROM_PHONE_NUMBER_ID/messages' \\\n -H 'Authorization: Bearer ACCESS_TOKEN' \\\n -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n -d '{\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"to\": \"PHONE_NUMBER\",\n  \"type\": \"interactive\",\n  \"interactive\": {\n    \"type\": \"flow\",\n    \"header\": {\n      \"type\": \"text\",\n      \"text\": \"Flow message header\"\n    },\n    \"body\": {\n      \"text\": \"Flow message body\"\n    },\n    \"footer\": {\n      \"text\": \"Flow message footer\"\n    },\n    \"action\": {\n      \"name\": \"flow\",\n      \"parameters\": {\n        \"flow_message_version\": \"3\",\n        \"flow_token\": \"AQAAAAACS5FpgQ_cAAAAAD0QI3s.\",\n        \"flow_id\": \"1\",\n        \"flow_cta\": \"Book!\",\n        \"flow_action\": \"navigate\",\n        \"flow_action_payload\": {\n          \"screen\": \"<SCREEN_NAME>\",\n          \"data\": {\n            \"product_name\": \"name\",\n            \"product_description\": \"description\",\n            \"product_price\": 100\n          }\n        }\n      }\n    }\n  }\n}'\n```\n\n## Example Response\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"contacts\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"Input\": \"PHONE_NUMBER\",\\\n      \"wa_id\": \"WHATSAPP_ID\"\\\n    }\\\n  ],\n  \"messages\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"wamid.ID\"\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Flow Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/interactive-flow-messages#flow-messages)\n\n[Example Request](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/interactive-flow-messages#example-request)\n\n[Example Response](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/interactive-flow-messages#example-response)\n\n* *
