Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/migrating-from-cloud-to-onprem#step-5--start-sending-messages)\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=595945097590761&version=1743728118)[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\>\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\\>\n[Guides](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides)\n\n# Migrating from Cloud API to On-Premises API\n\nWe are sunsetting On-Premises API. Refer to our [On-Premises API Sunset](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/on-premises/sunset) document for details, and to learn how to migrate to our next-generation Cloud API.\n\nThis document explains how to migrate business phone numbers from Cloud API to On-Premises API. To migrate from On-Premises API to Cloud API, see [Migrating from On-Premises API to Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/migrating-from-onprem-to-cloud).\n\nNote that migrating a business phone number from one API to another is not the same as [migrating a number from one WhatsApp Business Account (WABA) to another](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/guides/migrate-phone-to-different-waba/).\n\nMigration does NOT affect:\n\n- the business phone number's display name, verification status, or quality rating\n- templates used by the business phone number, or their statuses\n- the owning WABA, its Official Business Account status, or its messaging limit\n\nIn order to support migration, however, you must be aware of any [API differences](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/migrating-from-cloud-to-onprem#api-differences) and take appropriate action to address them before performing the migration steps described in this document.\n\n## Best Practices\n\nAfter making sure that your app can handle all API differences, we recommend that you first migrate a low-volume business phone number and verify that all functionality that you intend to offer with On-Premises API works correctly. After verifying that everything is working properly, migrate additional numbers.\n\nWe also recommend that you perform migration when traffic to your On-Premises API deployment is low.\n\n## API Differences\n\nMake sure your app is able to handle these differences before starting the migration process.\n\n### Webhooks\n\nCloud API and Business Management API webhooks payload structures are different from On-Premises API payload structures. We recommend that you create a new webhook endpoint that can handle On-Premises API webhooks exclusively.\n\nRefer to the following documents to help you understand payload differences:\n\n- Configuration: [Webhooks for WhatsApp](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/webhooks/getting-started/webhooks-for-whatsapp)\n- Cloud API webhook payloads: [Webhooks Notification Payload Reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/components)\n- Business Management API webhook payloads: [Webhooks Setup](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/guides/set-up-webhooks)\n\nOnce migration to On-Premises API is complete, the business phone number's Cloud API webhooks will no longer be delivered and On-Premises API webhooks delivery will begin.\n\n### Media\n\nMedia IDs for any media uploaded to Cloud API cannot be used when sending messages with On-Premises API, so you must either [reupload media using On-Premises API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/on-premises/reference/media) to generate new media IDs, or use media URLs if the media is hosted on a public server. See [Sending Media Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/api/messages/media).\n\n### Error Codes\n\nCloud API and Business Management API error codes are different from On-Premises API error codes. See the following documents:\n\n- [Cloud API Error Codes](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes)\n- [Business Management API Error Codes](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/error-codes)\n\n### Push-To-Talk Messages\n\nOn-Premises identifies push-to-talk (PTT) messages in webhooks by setting `messages.type` to `voice`, but Cloud API identifies PTT messages by setting `messages.audio.voice` to `true`.\n\n## Downtime\n\nDowntime begins as soon as you perform registration step (step 3) and should only last a few seconds. During this time, messages sent to the number from WhatsApp users will be silently dropped.\n\nWe highly encourage you to schedule migration during a time when the number experiences low activity, to minimize any downtime impact.\n\n## Step 1: Integrate On-Premises API\n\nSince you are migrating a business phone number to On-Premises API, make sure that your app can successfully use your On-Premises API client and that the WhatsApp Business Account associated with the business phone number has webhooks configured correctly.\n\n## Step 2: Prepare for Migration\n\nWe suggest that you stop sending messages while you complete the migration.\n\nThe WhatsApp Business API On-Premises client has certain network requirements for connecting to the WhatsApp servers. To make sure you are ready, check [Set Up and Debug Your Network](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/guides/network-requirements).\n\n## Step 3: Register API Client\n\nRegister the business phone number on your On-Premises API client. To do that, call the [`/account` endpoint](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/api/account):\n\n```\nPOST /v1/account\n\n{\n    \"cc\": \"COUNTRY_CODE\",\n    \"phone_number\": \"PHONE_NUMBER_WITHOUT_COUNTRY_CODE\",\n    \"method\": \"sms\" or \"voice\",\n    \"cert\": \"VERIFIED_NAME_CERT_IN_BASE64\",\n    \"pin\": \"EXISTING_6_DIGIT_PIN\" # required if two-step verification is enabled\n}\n```\n\nDepending on the response received, the registration procedure can be considered complete or require another step to complete. If successful, you receive one of the following HTTP status codes. Follow the instructions that match the response you received:\n\n- `201 Created` — The account already exists. You are already registered, so you do not need to do anything else.\n- `202 Accepted` — The account does not exist. Depending on the method selected in the request, check your SMS or voice number for the registration code. This response will include a returned payload that contains the `vname` decoded from the `cert` parameter for you to confirm the right display name is being set. If correct, proceed to [Completing Your Account Registration](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/api/account/verify) to complete registration.\n\nSee all available fields for this endpoint [here](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/api/account#parameters).\n\nOnce the registration is complete, the On-Premises API client will be the one receiving messages.\n\n## Step 4: Set Shards\n\nOnce your client is registered, you can [set shards](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/multiconnect_mc), if needed.\n\n## Step 5: Start Sending Messages\n\nYou are ready to send messages to your customers. See the [Send Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/guides/messages) guides for guidance.\n\n[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\|\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\\|\n\n[Business Management API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Migrating Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/migrating-from-cloud-to-onprem#step-5--start-sending-messages)\n\n* * Request](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/auth-otp-template-messages#example-request)\n\n[Example Response](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/auth-otp-template-messages#example-response)\n\n![](https://scontent-lax3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/467179990_582893330879738_1534232517322631641_n.png?_nc_cat=102&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=UiIZ9_pPw1AQ7kNvwEwuj00&_nc_oc=Adm2CwelXPZx1FA-yGzhLSgh1250HuduABY4_wjp-Vb0U0j4rMotKw4fdkSzNc0Z9SQ&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-1.xx&_nc_gid=Bf7f7VNlzfKAAZeC3RRYHw&oh=00_AYETvXUF7H93nQFn76ghy2LovDBzvYmHfUTmkb4a9_I-7Q&oe=680AE45A)\n[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/)\n\nWe are making changes to the WhatsApp Business Platform pricing model.\n\n**Effective July 1, 2025 for all businesses on our platform:**\n\n- The conversation-based pricing model will be deprecated\n- We will charge [per-message for template messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing/updates-to-pricing#per-message-pricing) instead of per-conversation\n- Utility templates sent within an open customer service window [will be free](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing/updates-to-pricing#free-utility-templates-in-the-customer-service-window)\n\nSee [Pricing Updates on the WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing/updates-to-pricing) for additional details.\n\n# Sending Authentication Templates\n\nThis document explains how to send approved [authentication templates with one-time password buttons](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/authentication-templates).\n\n## Request\n\nUse the [WhatsApp Business Phone Number > Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages) endpoint to send an [authentication template message with a one-time password button](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/authentication-templates).\n\n### Request Syntax\n\n```\nPOST /<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>/messages\n```\n\n### Post Body\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"<CUSTOMER_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\n  \"type\": \"template\",\n  \"template\": {\n    \"name\": \"<TEMPLATE_NAME>\",\n    \"language\": {\n      \"code\": \"<TEMPLATE_LANGUAGE_CODE>\"\n    },\n    \"components\": [\\\n      {\\\n        \"type\": \"body\",\\\n        \"parameters\": [\\\n          {\\\n            \"type\": \"text\",\\\n            \"text\": \"<ONE-TIME PASSWORD>\"\\\n          }\\\n        ]\\\n      },\\\n      {\\\n        \"type\": \"button\",\\\n        \"sub_type\": \"url\",\\\n        \"index\": \"0\",\\\n        \"parameters\": [\\\n          {\\\n            \"type\": \"text\",\\\n            \"text\": \"<ONE-TIME PASSWORD>\"\\\n          }\\\n        ]\\\n      }\\\n    ]\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### Body Properties\n\n| Placeholder | Description | Sample Value |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| `<CUSTOMER_PHONE_NUMBER>` | The customer's WhatsApp phone number. | `12015553931` |\n| `<ONE-TIME PASSWORD>` | The one-time password or verification code to be delivered to the customer.<br>Note that this value must appear twice in the payload.<br>Maximum 15 characters. | `J$FpnYnP` |\n| `<TEMPLATE_LANGUAGE_CODE>` | The template's [language and locale code](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/message-templates/supported-languages). | `en_US` |\n| `<TEMPLATE_NAME>` | The template's name. | `verification_code` |\n\n## Response\n\nUpon success, the API will respond with:\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"contacts\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"input\": \"<INPUT>\",\\\n      \"wa_id\": \"<WA_ID>\"\\\n    }\\\n  ],\n  \"messages\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"<ID>\"\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\n### Response Contents\n\n| Placeholder | Description | Sample Value |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| `<INPUT>`<br>_String_ | The customer phone number that the message was sent to. This may not match `wa_id`. | `+16315551234` |\n| `<WA_ID>`<br>_String_ | WhatsApp ID of the customer who the message was sent to. This may not match `input`. | `+16315551234` |\n| `<ID>`<br>_String_ | WhatsApp message ID. You can use the ID listed after \"wamid.\" to track your message status. | `wamid.HBgLMTY1MDM4Nzk0MzkVAgARGBI3N0EyQUJDMjFEQzZCQUMzODMA` |\n\n## Example\n\n### Example Request\n\n```\ncurl -L 'https://graph.facebook.com/v22.0/105954558954427/messages' \\\n-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...' \\\n-d '{\n      \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n      \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n      \"to\": \"12015553931\",\n      \"type\": \"template\",\n      \"template\": {\n        \"name\": \"verification_code\",\n        \"language\": {\n          \"code\": \"en_US\"\n      },\n      \"components\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"type\": \"body\",\\\n          \"parameters\": [\\\n            {\\\n              \"type\": \"text\",\\\n              \"text\": \"J$FpnYnP\"\\\n            }\\\n          ]\\\n        },\\\n        {\\\n          \"type\": \"button\",\\\n          \"sub_type\": \"url\",\\\n          \"index\": \"0\",\\\n          \"parameters\": [\\\n            {\\\n              \"type\": \"text\",\\\n              \"text\": \"J$FpnYnP\"\\\n            }\\\n          ]\\\n        }\\\n      ]\n    }\n  }'\n```\n\n### Example Response\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"contacts\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"input\": \"12015553931\",\\\n      \"wa_id\": \"12015553931\"\\\n    }\\\n  ],\n  \"messages\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"wamid.HBgLMTY1MDM4Nzk0MzkVAgARGBI4Qzc5QkNGNTc5NTMyMDU5QzEA\"\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Sending Authentication Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/auth-otp-template-messages#sending-authentication-templates)\n\n[Request](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/auth-otp-template-messages#request)\n\n[Request Syntax](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/auth-otp-template-messages#request-syntax)\n\n[Post Body](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/auth-otp-template-messages#post-body)\n\n[Body Properties](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/auth-otp-template-messages#body-properties)\n\n[Response](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/auth-otp-template-messages#response)\n\n[Response Contents](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/auth-otp-template-messages#response-contents)\n\n[Example](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/auth-otp-template-messages#example)\n\n[Example Request](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/auth-otp-template-messages#example-request)\n\n[Example Response](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/auth-otp-template-messages#example-response)\n\n* * *\n\n![](https://scontent-lax3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/459257729_1010347667767763_3581566724399163588_n.svg?_nc_cat=111&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=SQN4xkEmOWYQ7kNvwHkGiJU&_nc_oc=AdnoRzSjABs829Jfrw2pQsujP70dqN9r4mTiLmYktEUdrYADlW552RTNqEVEmZy762s&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-2.xx&_nc_gid=Bf7f7VNlzfKAAZeC3RRYHw&oh=00_AYHteYin_gwu4mi9SSjv0loKJLTrIqhxRq-blt6T5MrYJA&oe=680B032C)\n\n- [![Follow us on Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/)\n\nWe are making changes to the WhatsApp Business Platform pricing model.\n\n**Effective July 1, 2025 for all businesses on our platform:**\n\n- The conversation-based pricing model will be deprecated\n- We will charge [per-message for template messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing/updates-to-pricing#per-message-pricing) instead of per-conversation\n- Utility templates sent within an open customer service window [will be free](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing/updates-to-pricing#free-utility-templates-in-the-customer-service-window)\n\nSee [Pricing Updates on the WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing/updates-to-pricing) for additional details.\n\nStarting April 1, 2025, we are temporarily pausing delivery of marketing template messages to WhatsApp users who have a United States phone number. See [Per-User Marketing Template Message Limits](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates#per-user-marketing-template-message-limits) for additional information.\n\n# Sending Messages\n\nThis document describes how to use the API to send messages to WhatsApp users.\n\n## Message Types\n\nYou can use the API to send the following types of messages.\n\n|     |     |\n| --- | --- |\n| [Address messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/address-messages) allow you to easily request a delivery address from WhatsApp users. | ![](https://scontent-lax3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/441384197_454102407352120_3773045747928009795_n.png?_nc_cat=110&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=5LmukRzc0ucQ7kNvwFEjOXU&_nc_oc=Adnm8FUCwtXIptjTGrhS3rDyHNWMvQvGXt_zc7T0QrIVtOgZc2NMLximNwXkkPA4qxI&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-1.xx&_nc_gid=RCJ6qBJsvNf7cs3dFaMl_Q&oh=00_AYGdFtdrR7BynXP2Kq_67TZphOhCOxDMmFo7hsHVrp4duQ&oe=680B0022) |\n|  |  |\n| [Audio messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/audio-messages) display an audio icon and a link to an audio file. When the WhatsApp user taps the icon, the WhatsApp client loads and plays the audio file. | ![](https://scontent-lax3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/441333612_1102926104368016_6233568143947105840_n.png?_nc_cat=106&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=8jpglCut2ogQ7kNvwE31F7L&_nc_oc=Adll6yiq6ijFLL6oWPJU9bL4j1bkfVkwqedwVf5UDGN8CSI7vmt7wAjQlQ32caisiU4&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-2.xx&_nc_gid=RCJ6qBJsvNf7cs3dFaMl_Q&oh=00_AYFjVIf7E0hgB5UgznTQzn4iIBY8ATKHKpOIxpBQut2sBw&oe=680B042A) |\n|  |  |\n| [Contacts messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/contacts-messages) allow you to send rich contact information directly to WhatsApp users, such as names, phone numbers, physical addresses, and email addresses. | ![](https://scontent-lax3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/440790666_990559829136435_3259503667945350761_n.png?_nc_cat=104&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=w-QULEpxnjYQ7kNvwG9ZvjZ&_nc_oc=Adm7y2ogSpcE9lKeGn1g3yD9riPTe1iMASfiW3GbFTBQlfU5ZjVmw1PMIrm4prYgtBM&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-1.xx&_nc_gid=RCJ6qBJsvNf7cs3dFaMl_Q&oh=00_AYERQ6i5bl0W9Q7VJ_sPj00c1xB4x_1vN6O3PbBmsDQU2g&oe=680AEFCE) |\n|  |  |\n| [Document messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/document-messages) display a document icon, linked to a document that a WhatsApp user can tap to download. | ![](https://scontent-lax3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/440797712_455258680228442_8760882695056096687_n.png?_nc_cat=109&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=2PkJR-CnY0gQ7kNvwFORm7b&_nc_oc=AdkiFYeZbkFly7mr362aPvL8rqQ09Ll7BtAGeGeRs6VxZpwfohyX7yFgTBzOC_9dNtQ&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-1.xx&_nc_gid=RCJ6qBJsvNf7cs3dFaMl_Q&oh=00_AYHTc8yQwKTSRpWO9liGZ2HwrLIrvMyZB4n4Sx7VPf9aRQ&oe=680AF7CE) |\n|  |  |\n| [Image messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/image-messages) display a single image and an optional caption. | ![](https://scontent-lax3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/439831684_1373893986606126_2007013942518250478_n.png?_nc_cat=108&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=0M6WKJBkKnQQ7kNvwFUGP6w&_nc_oc=AdmSg_GJRPbUiXBvCIheai8XSPGjQIAZ01Ma8mZt5qXJ9Ajco0besBwFYbM1ld8bnJU&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-1.xx&_nc_gid=RCJ6qBJsvNf7cs3dFaMl_Q&oh=00_AYH5KrptIBIX-Bgby8p9mpVpBrehCqTenD-EZe8iYOtwoQ&oe=680ADB8C) |\n|  |  |\n| [Interactive CTA URL button messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/interactive-cta-url-messages) allow you to map any URL to a button, so you don't have to include lengthy or obscure raw URLs in the message body. | When a WhatsApp user taps the button, a location sharing screen appears which the user can use to share their location. | for users to choose from. | |\n|  |  |\n| [Location messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/location-messages) allow you to send a location's latitude and longitude coordinates to a WhatsApp user. | ![](https://scontent-lax3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/440739359_451301924241746_5496230692221042707_n.png?_nc_cat=102&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=jpMnnPd4Ne0Q7kNvwHq263s&_nc_oc=Adlqa_KcJHIrwELlREKO_RHDs_S1cbbg9gYryWLLb2w_lVl0nycRRIlm-4pUtkPtxwg&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-1.xx&_nc_gid=RCJ6qBJsvNf7cs3dFaMl_Q&oh=00_AYEdQjaTkpxaBtc1aRx_kHhesbop_FaQ9qFYUrTT65vl0g&oe=680AE654) |\n|  |  |\n| [Sticker messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/sticker-messages) display animated or static sticker images in a WhatsApp message. | ![](https://scontent-lax3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/440786426_1111584576559135_6735562667160992382_n.png?_nc_cat=100&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=583fLRZ5B6MQ7kNvwFjXPvY&_nc_oc=AdkIgI-n4yEUWQK5v0o-tUrAW5ycFNkzFUHLNkhHTdklvDzA0yBOBbdGx9lIfzyRwYM&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-2.xx&_nc_gid=RCJ6qBJsvNf7cs3dFaMl_Q&oh=00_AYE__Bm84bZps4EVReKMQJ_IRkNdhrP1UsWMx46wiXeh5g&oe=680B082F) |\n|  |  |\n| [Text messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/text-messages) are messages containing only a text body and an optional link preview. | ![](https://scontent-lax3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/440778097_900237625125034_93345957848876145_n.png?_nc_cat=111&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=eCr2XiMkpBQQ7kNvwFqwr-E&_nc_oc=Adnyqs1EvM6QQVVP1tOPt7fKMQQX0MsMxtfAIyVEzmW-9-IWdjCYSpOKpUDuCUfPU-4&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-2.xx&_nc_gid=RCJ6qBJsvNf7cs3dFaMl_Q&oh=00_AYEdD8f7JJuLZnwcPktRO4yXb7575XA7xAQb0TSe6RCpYQ&oe=680B0F4F) |\n|  |  |\n| [Template messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates) allow you to send marketing, utility, and authentication templates to WhatsApp users. Unlike all other message types, template messages do not require a 24-hour customer service window to be open between you and the message recipient before the message can be sent. | ![](https://scontent-lax3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/442491229_25340041602306457_3685379301469303506_n.png?_nc_cat=101&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=Y00xxenfszAQ7kNvwFpuMIp&_nc_oc=AdmrxfCiG8K8N7rBgKWMI36QINfjG0KVSRyNTtfynINH9XfZs2E_K4H0RQtJPfPE8mk&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-2.xx&_nc_gid=RCJ6qBJsvNf7cs3dFaMl_Q&oh=00_AYHfhaDB7X7pPXN2mTpxIS8jRo-zlqem6-uGyWMO9lGFBg&oe=680B12D9) |\n|  |  |\n| [Video messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/video-messages) display a thumbnail preview of a video image with an optional caption. When the WhatsApp user taps the preview, it loads the video and displays it to the user. | ![](https://scontent-lax3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/441312822_455518227141854_5770420105763186824_n.png?_nc_cat=110&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=njvOfAhuWoEQ7kNvwF16j0M&_nc_oc=AdlqIpNpk2nynTMPBk68OW1v1y5CxmHwbVQhLJEgSOPFmTD5veYq4MfYAZEzhA5yOIM&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-1.xx&_nc_gid=RCJ6qBJsvNf7cs3dFaMl_Q&oh=00_AYGfUKNBXFkjzdesjoPMygfKp2TlIrQLK9-F2kBxNstg-g&oe=680AEFE7) |\n|  |  |\n| [Reaction messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/reaction-messages) are emoji-reactions that you can apply to a previous WhatsApp user message that you have received. | ![](https://scontent-lax3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/440758814_464628532577869_3703934471348865877_n.png?_nc_cat=111&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=uh7dBRl1k1EQ7kNvwGhwfi0&_nc_oc=AdlL_obiJiIP5hULWHJJeGQESAN6WofXpNdRAnBMTPh3jAdvQaOSy4UiTFj5DtcYNsw&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-2.xx&_nc_gid=RCJ6qBJsvNf7cs3dFaMl_Q&oh=00_AYEDLXUnqSn-u9ESg6Ba0zrLgMzENXVSPVIaZ6gwjeBpGQ&oe=680B0912) |\n\n## Customer Service Windows\n\nWhenever a WhatsApp user messages you, a 24-hour timer called a customer service window starts (or refreshes if one has already been started).\n\nWhen a customer service window is open between you and a user, you can send **any type of message** to the user. If a window is not open between you and the user, you can only send template messages to the user, as template messages are the only type that can be sent outside of a customer service window.\n\nAs a reminder, you can only send messages to users who have [opted-in](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/overview/getting-opt-in) to receiving messages from you.\n\n## Requests\n\nAll send message requests use the [**POST /<WHATSAPP\\_BUSINESS\\_PHONE\\_NUMBER\\_ID/messages**](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages) endpoint:\n\n```\nPOST /<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>/messages\n```\n\nThe post body varies depending on the [type of message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages#message-types) you want to send, but the payload uses the following common syntax:\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\n  \"type\": \"<MESSAGE_TYPE>\",\n  \"<MESSAGE_TYPE>\": {<MESSAGE_CONTENTS>}\n}\n```\n\nThe `type` property value in the post body payload indicates the [type of message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages#message-types) to send, and a property matching that type must be included that describes the message's contents.\n\nFor example, this is a request to send a [text message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/text-messages) to a WhatsApp user. Note that `type` is set to `text`, and a `text` object follows, which describes the message's contents:\n\n```\ncurl 'https://graph.facebook.com/v22.0/106540352242922/messages' \\\n-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...' \\\n-d '\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"+16505551234\",\n  \"type\": \"text\",\n  \"text\": {\n    \"preview_url\": true,\n    \"body\": \"As requested, here'\\''s the link to our latest product: https://www.meta.com/quest/quest-3/\"\n  }\n}'\n```\n\nHere's what the message would look like in the WhatsApp client if the text message was successfully delivered to the WhatsApp user:\n\n![](https://scontent-lax3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/440778097_900237625125034_93345957848876145_n.png?_nc_cat=111&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=eCr2XiMkpBQQ7kNvwFqwr-E&_nc_oc=Adnyqs1EvM6QQVVP1tOPt7fKMQQX0MsMxtfAIyVEzmW-9-IWdjCYSpOKpUDuCUfPU-4&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-2.xx&_nc_gid=RCJ6qBJsvNf7cs3dFaMl_Q&oh=00_AYEdD8f7JJuLZnwcPktRO4yXb7575XA7xAQb0TSe6RCpYQ&oe=680B0F4F)\n\n## Responses\n\nThe API will return the following JSON response if it successfully accepts your send message request without encountering any errors in the request itself. Note that this response only indicates that the API successfully **accepted your request**, it does not indicate successful delivery of your message. Message delivery status is communicated via **messages** webhooks instead.\n\n### Response Syntax\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"contacts\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"input\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\\\n      \"wa_id\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_ID>\"\\\n    }\\\n  ],\n  \"messages\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"<WHATSAPP_MESSAGE_ID>\",\\\n      \"message_status\": \"<PACING_STATUS>\"\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\n### Response Contents\n\n| Placeholder | Description | Sample Value |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| `<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>`<br>_String_ | WhatsApp user's WhatsApp phone number. May not match `wa_id` value. | `+16505551234` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_USER_ID>`<br>_String_ | WhatsApp user's WhatsApp ID. May not match `input` value. | `16505551234` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_MESSAGE_ID>`<br>_String_ | WhatsApp Message ID. This ID appears in associated **messages** webhooks, such as sent, read, and delivered webhooks. | `wamid.HBgLMTY0NjcwNDM1OTUVAgARGBI4MjZGRDA0OUE2OTQ3RkEyMzcA` |\n| `<PACING_STATUS>`<br>_String_ | Indicates [template pacing](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/message-templates/guidelines#template-pacing) status. The `message_status` property is only included in responses when sending a [template message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates) that uses a template that is being paced. | `wamid.HBgLMTY0NjcwNDM1OTUVAgARGBI4MjZGRDA0OUE2OTQ3RkEyMzcA` |\n\n## Webhooks\n\nMessages sent to WhatsApp users trigger **messages** webhooks, so be sure to subscribe to this topic to receive message status notifications.\n\n## Commerce Messages\n\nCommerce messages are interactive messages used in conjunction with a product catalog. See [Share Products With Customers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services/share-products) to see how to use these types of messages.\n\n## Contextual Replies\n\nContextual replies are a special way of responding to a WhatsApp user message. Sending a message as a contextual reply makes it clearer to the user which message you are replying to by quoting the previous message in a contextual bubble:\n\n![](https://scontent-lax3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/441349069_1363509007609494_6528221959622289637_n.png?_nc_cat=103&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=0WMwWdEbQfwQ7kNvwHszJpq&_nc_oc=AdkTSmU6NALY21krXxuw3dJbfbVYCAqNpHqQ4rN6ysTsqKZvTNvds5BPAryxQlpNgVo&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-2.xx&_nc_gid=RCJ6qBJsvNf7cs3dFaMl_Q&oh=00_AYH_HjlZWf6IWhql-_ZpzrqAWb-us64avc9JAemOPU0p5Q&oe=680B106B)\n\nYou can send any type of message, except for a reaction message, as a contextual reply.\n\n### Limitations\n\nThe contextual bubble will not appear at the top of the delivered message if:\n\n- The previous message has been deleted or moved to long term storage (messages are typically moved to long term storage after 30 days, unless you have enabled [local storage](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/local-storage/)).\n- You reply with an [audio](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/audio-messages), [image](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/image-messages), or [video message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/video-messages) and the WhatsApp user is running KaiOS.\n- You use the WhatsApp client to reply with a [push-to-talk](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Ffaq.whatsapp.com%2F657157755756612%2F%3Fcms_platform%3Dweb&h=AT0e_QPBbeQAqhkeA56PNs5yWbCrwQF0lrlVBPBXI83aVHUHQK7XLk_4eLocskZoydjK0TZejAOrW9Bk29xVeG7ftedffJfNyC6IY6nTKLpl82FYIloFXBN9slOF4A8BXZK_6Kj5-IBwaw) message and the WhatsApp user is running KaiOS.\n- You reply with a [template message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates).\n\n### Request Syntax\n\n```\nPOST /<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>/messages\n```\n\n### Post Body\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\n  \"context\": {\n    \"message_id\": \"WAMID_TO_REPLY_TO\"\n  },\n\n  /* Message type and type contents goes here */\n\n}\n```\n\n### Post Body Parameters\n\n| Placeholder | Description | Example Value |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| `<WAMID_TO_REPLY_TO>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>WhatsApp message ID (wamid) of the previous message you want to reply to. | `wamid.HBgLMTY0NjcwNDM1OTUVAgASGBQzQTdCNTg5RjY1MEMyRjlGMjRGNgA=` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>WhatsApp user phone number. | `+16505551234` |\n\n### Example Request\n\nExample of a text message sent as a reply to a previous message.\n\n```\ncurl 'https://graph.facebook.com/v19.0/106540352242922/messages' \\\n-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...' \\\n-d '\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"+16505551234\",\n  \"context\": {\n    \"message_id\": \"wamid.HBgLMTY0NjcwNDM1OTUVAgASGBQzQTdCNTg5RjY1MEMyRjlGMjRGNgA=\"\n  },\n  \"type\": \"text\",\n  \"text\": {\n    \"body\": \"You'\\''re welcome, Pablo!\"\n  }\n}'\n```\n\n## WhatsApp User Phone Number Formats\n\nPlus signs ( `+`), hyphens ( `-`), parenthesis ( `(`, `)`), and spaces are supported in send message requests.\n\nWe highly recommend that you include both the plus sign and country calling code when sending a message to a customer. If the plus sign is omitted, your business phone number's country calling code is prepended to the customer's phone number. This can result in undelivered or misdelivered messages.\n\nFor example, if your business is in India (country calling code `91`) and you send a message to the following customer phone number in various formats:\n\n| Number In Send Message Request | Number Message Delivered To | Outcome |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| `+16315551234` | `+16315551234` | Correct number |\n| `+1 (631) 555-1234` | `+16315551234` | Correct number |\n| `(631) 555-1234` | `+916315551234` | Potentially wrong number |\n| `1 (631) 555-1234` | `+9116315551234` | Potentially wrong number |\n\n## Media Caching\n\nIf you are using a link ( `link`) to a media asset on your server (as opposed to the ID ( `id`) of an asset you have uploaded to our servers), WhatsApp Cloud API internally caches the asset for a static time period of 10 minutes. We will use the cached asset in subsequent send message requests if the link in subsequent message send payloads is the same as the link in the initial message send payload.\n\nIf you don't want us to reuse the cached asset in a subsequent message within the 10 minute time period, append a random query string to the asset link in the new send message request payload. We will treat this as a new asset, fetch it from your server, and cache it for 10 minutes.\n\nFor example:\n\n- Asset link in 1st send message request: `https://link.to.media/sample.jpg` — asset fetched, cached for 10 minutes\n- Asset link in 2d send message request: `https://link.to.media/sample.jpg` \\- use cached asset\n- Asset link in 3rd send message request: `https://link.to.media/sample.jpg?abc123` \\- asset fetched, cached for 10 minutes\n\n## Delivery Sequence of Multiple Messages\n\nWhen sending a series of messages, the order in which messages are delivered is not guaranteed to match the order of your API requests. If you need to ensure the sequence of message delivery, confirm receipt of a `delivered` status in a [messages webhook](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/components#statuses-object) before sending the next message in your message sequence.\n\n## Message Time-To-Live (TTL)\n\nIf we are unable to deliver a message to a WhatsApp user, we will retry the delivery for a period of time known as a time-to-live, TTL, or the message validity period.\n\n### Default TTL\n\n- All messages except authentication templates: **30 days**.\n- Authentication templates: **10 minutes**\n\n### Customizing TTL for Authentication, Utility, and Marketing Templates\n\nYou can customize the default TTL for authentication and utility templates, and for marketing templates sent using the MM Lite API.\n\nTo learn more, see [Time-To-Live (TTL): Customization, Defaults, Min/Max Values, and Compatibility](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/message-templates#customizing-time-to-live).\n\n### When TTL is Exceeded: Dropped messages\n\nMessages that are unable to be delivered within the default or customized TTL are dropped.\n\nIf you do not receive a [delivered message webhook](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#status--message-delivered) before the TTL is exceeded, assume the message was dropped.\n\nIf you send a message that [fails to deliver](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#status--message-failed), there could be a minor delay before you receive the webhook, so you may wish to build in a small buffer before assuming the message was dropped.\n\n## Troubleshooting\n\nIf you are experiencing problems with message delivery, see [Message Not Delivered](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#message-not-delivered).\n\n[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\|\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\\|\n\n[Business Management API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Sending business](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/solution-providers/get-started-for-tech-providers#step-6--verify-your-business)\n\n[Step 7: Create or Choose a Multi-Partner Review](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/solution-providers/get-started-for-tech-providers#step-8--submit-for-app-review)\n\n[Step 9: Complete Access Verification](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/solution-providers/get-started-for-tech-providers#step-9--complete-access-verification)\n\n[Step 10: Confirm status](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/solution-providers/get-started-for-tech-providers#step-10--confirm-status)\n\n[Next Steps](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/solution-providers/get-started-for-tech-providers#next-steps)\n\n[Onboarding Business Customers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/solution-providers/get-started-for-tech-providers#onboarding-business-customers)\n\n[Webooks](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/solution-providers/get-started-for-tech-providers#webooks)\n\n[Billing](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/solution-providers/get-started-for-tech-providers#billing)\n\n[Support](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/solution-providers/get-started-for-tech-providers#support)\n\n# Become a Tech Provider\n\nThis document describes the steps you must take to become a [Tech Provider](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/solution-providers/#tech-providers). Once you complete these steps, you can begin onboarding business customers onto the WhatsApp Business Platform, and access their WhatsApp data using our various APIs.\n\nAs a Tech Provider, you can independently provide all WhatsApp messaging services to business customers who you have onboarded, or you can work with a [Solution Partner](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/solution-providers/#solution-partners) to jointly offer these services. If you are partnering with a Solution Partner, ask them for their app ID, as you will need it to complete these steps.\n\n## Step 1: Create a business portfolio\n\n_If you already have a business portfolio, you can skip this step._\n\nGo to [business.facebook.com](https://business.facebook.com/) and create a Meta Business Suite account using your Facebook credentials. This will generate a business portfolio, which will serve as a container for any WhatsApp related assets you will be creating later.\n\n## Step 2: Register as a Meta developer\n\n_If you are already registered as a Meta developer, you can skip this step._\n\nGo to [developers.facebook.com](https://developers.facebook.com/) and click **Get Started** (upper-right corner) and complete the registration flow. This will convert your Facebook account to a Meta developer account, which is necessary for app creation.\n\n## Step 3: Create an app\n\nGo to [developers.facebook.com/apps](https://developers.facebook.com/apps) and create a new **Business** app, which will generate your Meta app ID. If you are signed into your Meta Business Suite account, the app creation flow will present you with a list of existing business portfolios you have already created, or have been added to:\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/461426183_1029437118964133_4468893588257182398_n.png?_nc_cat=106&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=f5E7hFdDCuIQ7kNvwGovGLD&_nc_oc=AdnskRGtXAzz_U_eS93V5gCub25SEVgMEVM5WoRhM-bhRctpE4vTpCCw48W4O68ofL4&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ZvN50DwOEhLj-0A0WCBqBA&oh=00_AYENORhLqMEJQ2hbDUJYCT--lvt2hCx-d7yXZozM0T6pew&oe=680AE33C)\n\nIf you are not presented with a list of businesses, go to [business.facebook.com](https://business.facebook.com/) and sign into your Meta Business Suite account, then reload [developers.facebook.com/apps](https://developers.facebook.com/apps).\n\nSelect your business portfolio and continue. In the next screen, select **Other**, then **Business** app, and add an app name and your email address. Be sure to select your business portfolio in the **Business portfolio** dropdown menu before creating your app.\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/461196825_1039719914468731_5143064655690014954_n.png?_nc_cat=101&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=hvbTt4KBBBUQ7kNvwFf-jae&_nc_oc=AdnIq2T3_GjGgIVsFO-IDs9D1iYXiEGIlYB1-8-uuQniBIV9SkOAILbR4Kx-wkVDbr8&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ZvN50DwOEhLj-0A0WCBqBA&oh=00_AYECBDBKYwYQ-yVKwsMBfF75fUJTvPWugEsTzlUq_mqdpg&oe=680AF79F)\n\n## Step 4: Add basic data about your app\n\nIn the **App Dashboard**, navigate to **App settings** \\> **Basic** and add the following information:\n\n- App icon\n- Privacy Policy URL\n- Category\n- Platform\n\nBe sure to save your changes. You can add additional information if you wish, but the information above is the only information required to complete the remaining steps.\n\n## Step 5: Add the WhatsApp product\n\nIn the **App Dashboard** panel, scroll down to **Add products to your app**, locate the **WhatsApp** product, and click its **Set Up** button.\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/461107229_526336946652682_4957551454394139880_n.png?_nc_cat=103&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=1Tm8gvxud1EQ7kNvwGWJkK8&_nc_oc=AdlPqnTWOabTtUhxOV6eVxtHgzFXA4bE3zbDgHcAu1y-OUIxYyTY97PWWVh1nq-J04Y&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ZvN50DwOEhLj-0A0WCBqBA&oh=00_AYGWkPpUzPwMasH68EURUzO3pI4EiAyExaWRZYSTHsgOgw&oe=680AE6C4)\n\nComplete the flow until you are presented with the **Quickstart** panel:\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/461134480_1487934358755825_1118193011459680182_n.png?_nc_cat=105&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=lK_aFcJfnRMQ7kNvwH9T_3K&_nc_oc=AdnrUS9XzX3wLLys7JeRD8My1Whs9h38x26VJavrjv-C-jObFrJhi4fROqGb1RDMrXk&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ZvN50DwOEhLj-0A0WCBqBA&oh=00_AYHIYoNz_T_zpCcNxUhWlYm74TjCSBpqA6s6MUxpYICGNQ&oe=680ADE4F)\n\n## Step 6: Indicate how you will work with customers\n\nIn the **Quickstart** panel, locate the **Become a Tech Provide** r section and click the **Start onboarding** button:\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/461323934_3915179218753230_7687060599449064641_n.png?_nc_cat=109&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=sriC-0VJrTgQ7kNvwG_nXSz&_nc_oc=AdmaKEN0rH01tHUDCt1A_LOQTCB0kN_e9FyrsKPf1Kp-D4-x8WtzmRJFVrRSaNeTFpw&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ZvN50DwOEhLj-0A0WCBqBA&oh=00_AYGn3m96WJjvD-I8qCFQSfqboa_Aadr8yZKGdRzaSAQLig&oe=680AED0A)\n\nWork through the flow until you are asked to choose between **Independent Tech Provider**\nand **Working with a Solution Partner**:\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/461319411_3261023787364699_8516285214771642761_n.png?_nc_cat=108&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=dksKDNA25PIQ7kNvwEbjq__&_nc_oc=AdngaIEUfoyQx-QryXvW2iUNPVUtAuLSeh9ctye4MMRU2NqzBCBfIIzI-42FsEhSwGw&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ZvN50DwOEhLj-0A0WCBqBA&oh=00_AYGvia_CRUPFEb9R2ygQBAZe-8r8iNgPcPbkG2nYd1SlvA&oe=680B07F5)\n\nChoose the option (described below) that best matches how you will be working with your onboarded business customers. After making your choice and continuing, you will be taken to the **Quickstart** \\> **Onboarding** panel.\n\nNote that by clicking the Start onboarding button, you are agreeing to our [Tech Provider Terms](https://www.facebook.com/legal/BM-tech-provider-terms).\n\n### Independent Tech Provider\n\nChoose this option if you will be [onboarding business customers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/solution-providers/get-started-for-tech-providers#onboarding-business-customers) onto the WhatsApp Business Platform and providing them with WhatsApp messaging services entirely on your own (i.e., without the help of another solution provider).\n\nNote that choosing this option does not prevent you from partnering with other Solution Partners in the future, it just skips part of the setup process; you can always partner with a Solution Partner at a later date.\n\n### Working with a Solution Partner\n\nChoose this option if you are partnering with a [Solution Partner](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/solution-providers/#solution-partners) in order to provide WhatsApp messaging services to business customers, who can be onboarded by you or the Solution Partner. You must know your Solution Partner's app ID if you choose this option, as you will need it in a later step.\n\nNote that choosing this option does not prevent you from terminating your partnership with the Solution Partner in the future; you can always switch Solution Partners or operate independently at a later date.\n\n## Step 6: Verify your business\n\n_If your business is already verified, (the **Verify your business** row has a green checkmark and a green **Approved** dropdown menu label) you can skip this step._\n\nBefore you can complete the remaining steps, your business must be verified and approved. In the **Quickstart** \\> **Onboarding** panel, click the **Start verification** button.\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/461115641_820800519935727_5568051377015700149_n.png?_nc_cat=106&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=hg4N3Zmdx1YQ7kNvwH2HjgE&_nc_oc=AdmcwDck0iklC4Pxs2ilwVsN2-rAGVB73SQcwxa4JCVIshe8XB6W4_lfy1pyb1yn7Gw&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ZvN50DwOEhLj-0A0WCBqBA&oh=00_AYHiw365AxIRoZexuKAeuthIBPxam6epqDx_I5kWSISzFA&oe=680AEE32)\n\nComplete the flow and submit your business for verification. As part of the verification process, you will be asked to provide information about your business. See our [How to verify your business on Meta](https://www.facebook.com/business/help/2058515294227817) help center article, which lists all of the information you may be asked to provide.\n\nThe verification process can take several days. The article linked above describes the process in more detail, as well as how outcomes are communicated.\n\nThe **Business Verification** section of the **Quickstart** \\> **Onboarding** panel will also be updated once you submit for verification, indicating if the submission is still in progress or if your business has been verified.\n\nYou can also see your business's verification status in the **Meta Business Suite** \\> **Business information** panel:\n\n[https://business.facebook.com/settings/info](https://business.facebook.com/settings/info)\n\n## Step 7: Create or Choose a Multi-Partner solution\n\n_Skip this step if you chose Independent Tech Provider in step 5._\n\nIn the **Quickstart** \\> **Onboarding** panel, locate the **App Review** section and the **Create a partner solution** row:\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/461281803_819534203398038_7139306853046520777_n.png?_nc_cat=108&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=eh4XuNhhQ80Q7kNvwFgbxPd&_nc_oc=AdnqTBMwA64lF5hyGrKMzRzEIN3HIqN-mkJK32jZlPmwkiApO5Wlh-oQmo4Q_crTpC0&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ZvN50DwOEhLj-0A0WCBqBA&oh=00_AYH0RetELs7tIDtvb3-s6MC5fDROLQh2SMVajcdqAPkHMQ&oe=680B0F90)\n\nNote that if you already have a solution associated with this app, you will see a **Choose solution** button instead. Click the button and select an existing solution to complete this step.\n\nIf you see the **Create a partner solution** button, click it to display the solution creation window:\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/461272794_907091094597220_1727887144679269378_n.png?_nc_cat=104&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=kOciZa-x5X0Q7kNvwFrxGuB&_nc_oc=AdlVqrNhxpVf27GJiKEXX988FvVRn5AfGZdb_0c6Em8O_Bdmt5Ra4XBC_ZZs0OPm2M0&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ZvN50DwOEhLj-0A0WCBqBA&oh=00_AYG1U3jrdKoVI_g4h_VJl5xJS5VbrWTTcIeFrABH1f4BOg&oe=680ADC27)\n\nEnter a name for the partner solution and add the Solution Partner's app ID. Use a name that will help you distinguish the solution from other solutions you may create in the future. Note that only Solution Partner app IDs will be accepted; Tech Provider app IDs will be rejected.\n\nOnce your solution has been created it will appear in the **Create a partner solution** row with a **Pending Acceptance** status. You can proceed to the next steps while it is in a pending state.\n\n## Step 7: Review app settings\n\nIn the **Quickstart** \\> **Onboarding** panel, locate the **Review your app settings** row and click the **Review app settings** button:\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/461253641_1063537384766248_6312819233849241585_n.png?_nc_cat=101&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=ZsiXQ0q0Z6EQ7kNvwGcI9t4&_nc_oc=Adl3hJgS-4NaiOlyzVXYrGSk-qmjdoG7wENoRSCNjyu4tKnqSrk83FqYSsJZF69xNG4&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ZvN50DwOEhLj-0A0WCBqBA&oh=00_AYEd2R7NNyS0uBTJ_6AsYwCc_oB8dwYUnVGf_AayUKuo0A&oe=680B0245)\n\nIn the interface that appears, confirm that the information you supplied in step 4 is still accurate, and update if necessary.\n\n## Step 8: Capture videos for App Review\n\nIn the **Quickstart** \\> **Onboarding** panel, locate the **Record video documentation** row.\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/461279760_531240739508757_1771370276126761804_n.png?_nc_cat=110&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=hQZ-wnEjih4Q7kNvwFgo6JH&_nc_oc=Adlmo6iZUdd97yIDKVbYmt0yfZjsNHOTWdghxpm-Bjdu-g2Hr3R9GddlZ0HQQBoES40&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ZvN50DwOEhLj-0A0WCBqBA&oh=00_AYG9VZguMC4jZaR5ZMcTk7nF5kFBVLR0kySBtlJCV7FReg&oe=680B05CC)\n\nAs part of the App Review process you will be asked to provide two video recordings:\n\n- The first video must show a message created and sent from your app and received in the WhatsApp client (mobile app or web app).\n- The second video must show your app being used to create a message template.\n\nIf you are partnering with a Solution Partner, you can use your current integration with them to show these actions.\n\nClicking the **Record video** buttons in the panel will display helpful information for creating these videos (the buttons don't actually capture any video, you must do this on your own).\n\nAs an alternative, you can capture a screen recording of the **API Setup** cURL script being used by you to send a message to a WhatsApp user number you have added as a test recipient number, in lieu of sending a message using your or your partner's app. Similarly, you can capture a screen recording of the **WhatsApp Manager** being used by you to create a template message, instead of your or your partner's app.\n\nWhichever method you decide upon to generate your videos or screen recordings, save the recordings for the next step.\n\n## Step 8: Submit for App Review\n\nIn the **Quickstart** \\> **Onboarding** panel, locate the **Submit documentation for App Review** row and click the Begin App Review button. This flow will load the **App Review** \\> **Requests** panel, where you should see an app review request ready for you to edit:\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/461186267_1216789669534885_7600969123214529793_n.png?_nc_cat=100&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=sco74XrQt4gQ7kNvwE34_sC&_nc_oc=AdmpyteSaz-T6qXVbkqxJ5J3JkKdLp7FN1EpIKqQ-6h0zEnZY3aSqrOgJEP_tdGeO24&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ZvN50DwOEhLj-0A0WCBqBA&oh=00_AYG2hwL7O7xeKHbnyDsmit_v73Ei7Yj6YkEAGRPpw9sKqg&oe=680B10F5)\n\nClick the **Edit** button to access the App Review flow. As part of this process, you will be asked to explain how your, or your Solution Partner's app, uses your business customer's data, and why your app needs advanced access for the **whatsapp\\_business\\_messaging** and **whatsapp\\_business\\_management** permissions.\n\nWhen describing how your app uses each of these permissions, attach the appropriate screen recording or video you created in the previous step:\n\n- For **whatsapp\\_business\\_messaging**, attach the screen recording or video showing a message being sent with your or your Solution Partner's app and appearing in the WhatsApp client, or the screen recording of the API Setup cURL script being used by you.\n- For **whatsapp\\_business\\_management**, attach the screen recording or video showing your or your Solution Partner's app being used to create a message template, or the screen recording of the WhatsApp Manager being used by you to create a message template.\n\n**Important**: For the App verification details dialog, when your app review submission only involves **whatsapp\\_business\\_messaging** and/or **whatsapp\\_business\\_management** you do not need to provide the testing instructions. For e.g:\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/464807846_1084095626693161_1654600531082494200_n.png?_nc_cat=111&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=1OiBbH6mTNQQ7kNvwGd3hUR&_nc_oc=AdnEzv30b3FU8Sj4AkOlvaO6bBPha9COaCMS4Ikg6uy35Dle34s5bZBKBDTJ18hKu1g&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ZvN50DwOEhLj-0A0WCBqBA&oh=00_AYHJ-4nLJo77mKd0DZPF6nL7NYSdqPxUo18QUejUm7vX3Q&oe=680ADF31)\n\nComplete the flow and submit your request. Outcomes will be communicated via email, developer alert, and its status will be updated in the **App Review** \\> **Requests** panel.\n\n## Step 9: Complete Access Verification\n\nIn the **Quickstart** \\> **Onboarding** panel, locate the **Complete access verification** row and click the **Start verification** button.\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/461281976_431699419456511_203032831679080240_n.png?_nc_cat=103&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=OtfADI5KLAkQ7kNvwFpwvQu&_nc_oc=AdnjT5dZtL5yc2JfVA6ndVvh6QHgBRD3YCdQlbofkw3Bk75w6_757TIUav9Yj1-JI_U&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ZvN50DwOEhLj-0A0WCBqBA&oh=00_AYFhbyyMrjMM4Lgu8VF-V0H8kDccbFfE-8oNDQXNzc1Aug&oe=680B00C0)\n\nThis flow gathers basic information about your business in order to verify that it qualifies as a Tech Provider.\n\nComplete the flow and submit for verification.\n\n## Step 10: Confirm status\n\nAfter you have completed the steps above, the **Quickstart** \\> **Onboarding** panel should indicate that all steps are complete (with a green checkmark) and and congratulate you on your status as a Tech Provider:\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/461165630_1024046862803184_1435753393620019123_n.png?_nc_cat=100&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=nw3Q6Jl25-QQ7kNvwEnr_dB&_nc_oc=AdnZ3j_XiPPFfZeeht1Xc9wOl6j2iTH8DV1NrY2rf5CPjpANYgQDzfs9vwOWa1sKpfI&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ZvN50DwOEhLj-0A0WCBqBA&oh=00_AYE8EHobC63CKu80kIZ4Z1wBAMoTV_0gxoLW9-mJ0Fg4fA&oe=680AF5E0)\n\n## Next Steps\n\n### Onboarding Business Customers\n\nOnce you have confirmed your status as a Tech Provider, you can begin onboarding business customers via Embedded Signup.\n\nIf you are working as an [independent tech provider](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/solution-providers/get-started-for-tech-providers#independent-tech-provider), **you must implement Embedded Signup and surface it to potential customers** on your own. See our [Embedded Signup](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/embedded-signup) document to learn how to implement and test with a sandbox account, and how to use the data that Embedded Signup generates to onboard business customers.\n\nIf you are working with a Solution Partner, your partner can implement Embedded Singup to onboard business customers for you. However, if you also want to surface Embedded Signup somewhere on your website or customer portal and onboard business customers, you can do so, but it will require a [Multi-Partner Solution](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/solution-providers/multi-partner-solutions). Work with your Solution Partner if you are choosing this option.\n\n### Webooks\n\nIf you are working as an [independent tech provider](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/solution-providers/get-started-for-tech-providers#independent-tech-provider), before your app users can use your app to send and receive messages or manage templates, you must set up [Webhooks](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/set-up-webhooks).\n\nIf you are working with a solution partner who has already set up webhooks, work with your partner to determine if you need to set up webhooks as well.\n\n### Billing\n\nIf you are partnering with a Solution Partner, your partner will share their line of credit with onboarded business customers.\n\nIf you are working independently, your onboarded business customers must add a payment method to their WhatsApp Business Account. They can do this by following the steps described in our [Add a credit card to your WhatsApp Business Platform account](https://www.facebook.com/business/help/488291839463771) help center article.\n\n### Support\n\nConfirmed Tech Providers have access to all support channels. See [Support](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/support).\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Become a Tech [Support](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Billdesk Payment Gateway Integration Webhook](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-billdesk#status-webhook)\n\n[Parsing the Response](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-billdesk#parsing-the-response)\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=595945097590761&version=1743728118)[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\>\nCloud API\n\n\n# Billdesk Payment Gateway Integration Guide\n\n## Purpose\n\nThe purpose of this document is to lay down the payment integration with Billdesk that is required for a merchant, or a Solution Partner, that has implemented a chatbot using WhatsApp Business APIs and needs to accept payments from WhatsApp users.\n\nThis document outlines the necessary APIs that must be integrated and how the integration works in conjunction with the WhatsApp Business API integration. While not a comprehensive guide, it serves as a general overview to assist in understanding the payment gateway integration process. Any specific or unique details related to the payment gateway must be determined by the merchant or Solution Partner.\n\nIn terms of integrating with the WA P2M product, this document covers the requests and responses highlighted in red in the flow diagram.\n\n![](https://scontent-lax3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.8562-6/352811047_834235934303944_7808310108296808218_n.png?_nc_cat=106&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=f537c7&_nc_ohc=XotwJeZyGHMQ7kNvwHR3aPg&_nc_oc=AdnZuSuk2Q_X6BlwqfcRdTPv_9jgzGO-XIt8Q8BsKp1U6JhPfPMqVwT2Ye9n8Tls1No&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-2.xx&_nc_gid=M0OYtxfcsVE_ucKAQSXP6A&oh=00_AYE0K0wSX5mJ8ATbinAkm8whHsrKbOTtENunsP-Fs9Sdqg&oe=67F6903C)\n\n## Billdesk Payment Integration\n\n### Setup\n\nTo authenticate with Billdesk’s API, a client must be created and an authentication method must be selected between HMAC and Javascript Object Signing and Encryption (JOSE) with JOSE being the preferred method. These methods are used to encrypt/decrypt the request/response from Billdesk’s APIs.\n\nTo simplify the explanation, the following examples will only address the body of final payload that will ultimately be included in the final object required for successful authentication with their API. It is important to consult Billdesk's documentation for guidance on how this final object must be structured.\n\nYou must have the following details before you can proceed:\n\n1. Client ID and secret key from Billdesk\n\n2. Details from the payment configuration you already configured on the Whatsapp Business Account\n\na. Merchant category code\n\nb. Merchant’s VPA\n\n3. Merchant Name\n\n\n### Initiate Payment API\n\n#### Sample Request to `POST` to https://pguat.billdesk.io/payments/ve1\\_2/transactions/create\n\n```\n{\n  \"mercid\": \"BDMERCHANTID\",\n  \"orderid\": \"UPIODR00000004\",\n  \"amount\": \"2.00\",\n  \"currency\": \"356\",\n  \"bankid\": \"ICW\",\n  \"txn_process_type\": \"intent\",\n  \"itemcode\": \"DIRECT\",\n  \"payment_method_type\": \"upi\",\n  \"wa_mc\": \"0743\",\n  \"wa_vpa\": \"billdesk@hdfcbank\",\n  \"wa_txnid\": \"H477676443\",\n  \"wa_mercname\": \"SIDDHIVINK\",\n  \"additional_info\": {\n    \"additional_info1\": \"Details1\",\n    \"additional_info2\": \"Details2\"\n  },\n  \"device\": {\n    \"init_channel\": \"app\",\n    \"ip\": \"124.124.1.1\",\n    \"user_agent\": \"App/22.6.74 Platform/19.5.0\"\n  }\n}\n```\n\n| Parameters | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| order id (Mandatory) | string<br>Unique order id generated by the merchant to identify the transaction |\n| mercid (Mandatory) | string<br>Unique identifier as defined by BillDesk for each merchant |\n| amount (Mandatory) | string<br>Transaction amount in two decimals |\n| currency (Mandatory) | string<br>ISO currency of the transaction amount |\n| txn\\_process\\_type (Optional) | string<br>Value must be set to `intent` |\n| bankid (Optional) | string<br>BillDesk defined unique identifier for bank or acquirer |\n| ru (Optional) | string<br>Merchant return url |\n| itemcode (Mandatory) | string<br>Itemcode value as provided by BillDesk, with a default value `DIRECT` |\n| devic (Mandatory) | object<br>Device object. Refer to BillDesk doc for more details. |\n| payment\\_method\\_ type (Mandatory) | string<br>This must be set to `upi` |\n| wa\\_mc (Mandatory) | string<br>Merchant category |\n| wa\\_vpa (Mandatory) | string<br>Payee VPA |\n| wa\\_txnid (Mandatory) | string<br>Unique txnid generated by the bank for the transaction |\n| wa\\_mercname (Mandatory) | string<br>Merchant Name |\n\n#### Sample Response\n\n```\n{\n  \"objectid\": \"transaction\",\n  \"transactionid\": \"X7890477676443\",\n  \"orderid\": \"UPIODR00000004\",\n  \"mercid\": \"BDMERCID\",\n  \"transaction_date\": \"2022-03-18T11:50:27+05:30\",\n  \"amount\": \"2.00\",\n  \"surcharge\": \"0.00\",\n  \"discount\": \"0.00\",\n  \"charge_amount\": \"2.00\",\n  \"currency\": \"356\",\n  \"additional_info\": {\n    \"additional_info1\": \"Details1\",\n    \"additional_info2\": \"Details2\"\n  },\n  \"txn_process_type\": \"intent\",\n  \"bankid\": \"ICW\",\n  \"itemcode\": \"DIRECT\",\n  \"auth_status\": \"0002\",\n  \"transaction_error_code\": \"TRP0000\",\n  \"transaction_error_desc\": \"Transaction Pending \",\n  \"transaction_error_type\": \"pending\",\n  \"payment_method_type\": \"upi\",\n  \"wa_mc\": \"7399\",\n  \"wa_vpa\": \"billdesk@hdfcbank\",\n  \"wa_txnid\": \"H477676443\",\n  \"wa_mercname\": \"SIDDHIVINK\",\n  \"intent\": \"dXBpOi8vcGF5P3BhPWJpbGxkZXNrQGhkZmNiYW5rJnBuPVNJRERISVZJTksmbWM9NjMwMCZ0cj1YSEQ1MDQ3NzY3NjQ0MyZ0bj1QYXkmYW09Mi4wMCZtYWwMCZjdT1JTlI=\"\n}\n```\n\n### Parse the Response\n\nUse the value of “wa\\_txnid” on the response and pass it as the “reference\\_id” while setting up the “parameters” object to send for the [order details message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/upi#paramobject) using the Whastapp API.\n\nMake sure to verify the values in the intent you receive:\n\n- The `intent` key has the base64 encoded value of the intent\n- Decoding the `intent` should give a value that should be similar to this:\nupi://pay?pa=billdesk@hdfcbank&pn=SIDDHIVINKamp;mc=6300&tr=XHD50477676443&tn=Pay&am=2.00&malORS\n- The value of `pa` is the merchant `VPA`. This value must match the VPA on the `payment_configuration` you send in the `parameters` object\n\n### Status Webhook\n\nBilldesk will post a transaction object to the return URL ( `ru`) you specified in the initiate payment API.\n\n| Key | Data type | Description |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| objectid (Mandatory) | string | String representing the object's type. This value will be fixed as transaction |\n| transactionid | string | Unique transactionid generation by BillDesk for the transaction |\n| orderid | string | Unique orderid generated by merchant to for the transaction |\n| mercid | string | Unique identifier as defined by BillDesk for each merchant |\n| transaction\\_date | timestamp | BillDesk transaction date and time in YYYY-MM DDThh:mm:ssTZD format |\n| amount | string | Transaction amount in two decimals |\n| surcharge | string | Customer surcharge in two decimals applied to the transaction amount, if any |\n| discount | string | Customer discount in two decimals applied to the transaction amount, if any |\n| charge\\_amount | string | Total charge to the customer |\n| currency | integer | ISO currency of the transaction amount |\n| txn\\_process\\_type | string | Indicates transaction processing type.<br>Intent for payment\\_method\\_type is upi and the method of payment is UPI intent |\n| bankid | string | BillDesk defined unique identifier for bank or acquirer |\n| txn\\_process\\_type | string | Indicates transaction processing type. <br>Intent for payment\\_method\\_type is upi and the method of payment is UPI intent. |\n| ru | string | Merchant return url |\n| additional\\_info | object | Array of 10 `additional_info` values that can be attached to the transaction. Note: Merchant is advised to not pass customer PII information in additional info fields. |\n| itemcode | string | Itemcode value provided by BillDesk, with a default value of `DIRECT` |\n| bank\\_ref\\_no | string | Transaction reference number generated by bank or acquirer |\n| auth\\_status | string | Represents the authorization status of the transaction with the possible values:<br>∙ 0300 - transaction is successful<br>∙ 0002 - transaction is pending for authorization<br>∙ 0399 - transaction failed |\n| settlement\\_lob | string | Settlement line of business preconfigured by BillDesk for funds settlement to merchant account |\n| customer | object | Customer object |\n| device | object | Device object |\n| transaction\\_error\\_code | string | Represents the error code for a transaction with `0399` status |\n| transaction\\_error\\_type | string | Represents the standard error category for a transaction with `0399` status |\n| transaction\\_error\\_desc | string | Represents the description of the error code for a transaction with `0399` status |\n| authcode | string | Authorization code received from the acquirer for a successfully authorized card transaction |\n| eci | string | eci value for the authentication taken for the card transaction |\n| payment\\_method\\_type | string | Represents the method of payment e.g. upi |\n| card | Object | Payment method object (applicable when payment method is card) |\n| customer\\_refid | string | Unique customer identifier as per merchant |\n| links | object | Associated links with the object |\n\n### Parsing the Response\n\nUse the `auth_status` retrieved from the response above and transmit the corresponding [status message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/upi#step-7--update-order-status) via the WhatsApp API.\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Billdesk Payment Gateway Integration Guide](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-billdesk#billdesk-payment-gateway-integration-guide)\n\n[Purpose](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-billdesk#purpose)\n\n[Billdesk Payment Integration](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-billdesk#billdesk-payment-integration)\n\n[Setup](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-billdesk#setup)\n\n[Initiate Payment API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-billdesk#initiate-payment-api)\n\n[Parse the Response](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-billdesk#parse-the-response)\n\n[Status Webhook](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-billdesk#status-webhook)\n\n[Parsing the Response](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-billdesk#parsing-the-response)\n\n* *     "markdown": "[iframe](/common/referer_frame.php?cb=1)\n\n[iframe](/common/referer_frame.php?cb=1)\n\n[iframe](/common/referer_frame.php?cb=1)\n\n[iframe](/common/referer_frame.php?cb=1)\n\n![](https://facebook.com/security/hsts-pixel.gif)\n\n[![](https://developers.facebook.com/images/developer/m4d_logo_july_2024.svg)](https://developers.facebook.com/?no_redirect=1)\n\n[Docs](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/) [Tools](https://developers.facebook.com/tools/) [Support](https://developers.facebook.com/support/)\n\n[Log In](https://business.facebook.com/business/loginpage/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fdevelopers.facebook.com%2Fdocs%2Fwhatsapp%2Fcloud-api%2Fpayments-api%2Fpayments-br%2Foffsite-pix%3Fnav_ref%3Dbiz_unified_f3_login_page_to_dfc&app=436761779744620&login_options%5B0%5D=FB&login_options%5B1%5D=SSO&is_work_accounts=1&config_ref=biz_login_tool_flavor_dfc)\n\n[Pix](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/offsite-pix)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Offsite Pix Payments](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/offsite-pix#offsite-pix-payments)\n\n[Before You Start](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/offsite-pix#before-you-start)\n\n[Integration steps](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/offsite-pix#integration-steps)\n\n[1\\. Send an Order Details message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/offsite-pix#1--send-an-order-details-message)\n\n[2\\. Send an Order Status Update](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/offsite-pix#2--send-an-order-status-update)\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=595945097590761&version=1743728118)[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\>\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\\>\n[Payments API - Brazil](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br)\n\n# Offsite Pix Payments\n\nThis feature is not publicly available yet and is only available for businesses based in Brazil and their Brazillian customers. To enable payments for your businesses, please contact your Solution Partner.\n\nPayments API also enables businesses to collect payments from their customers via WhatsApp using dynamic Pix codes.\n\nWhen using this integration, WhatsApp only facilitates the communication between merchants and buyers. Merchants are responsible for integrating with a bank or PSP in order to generate dynamic Pix codes, and confirm their payment.\n\n## Before You Start\n\n1. Familiarize yourself with the [Orders API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders). Orders are the entrypoint for collecting payments in WhatsApp.\n2. You will need an existing integration with a bank or PSP to generate dynamic Pix codes and do automatic reconciliation when a payment is made. You must be able to update the order status as soon as a payment is made.\n\n## Integration steps\n\nThe following sequence diagram shows the typical integration with Pix.\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=1123185008974858&version=1729200999)\n\n### 1\\. Send an Order Details message\n\nFollow the full integration guide in the [Orders API page](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders).\n\nIf Pix is available on this order, you will need to provide a `pix_dynamic_code` to the `payment_settings` attribute.\n\n#### Pararmeters Object\n\n| Field Name | Optional? | Type | Description |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| `payment_settings` | Optional | [Payment Settings Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/offsite-pix#paymentsettingsobject) | List of payment related configuration objects. |\n\n#### Payment Settings\n\n| Field Name | Optional? | Type | Description |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| `type` | Required | String | Must be `pix_dynamic_code`. |\n| `pix_dynamic_code` | Required | [Dynamic Pix Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/offsite-pix#dynamicpixobject) | Dynamic Pix Code object that will be used to render the option to buyers during the checkout flow. |\n\n#### Dynamic Pix Code Object\n\n| **Field Name** | **Optional?** | **Type** | **Description** |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| `code` | Required | String | The dynamic Pix code which will be copied by the buyer. |\n| `merchant_name` | Required | String | Account holder name. Displayed in-app for the buyer for informational purposes. |\n| `key` | Required | String | Pix key. Displayed in-app for the buyer for informational purposes. |\n| `key_type` | Required | String | Pix key type. One of `CPF`, `CNPJ`, `EMAIL`, `PHONE` or `EVP`. |\n\n#### Payload example\n\n```\nPOST: /v1/messages\n{\n \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n \"to\": \"[recipient-wa-id]\",\n \"type\": \"interactive\",\n \"interactive\": {\n   \"type\": \"order_details\",\n   \"body\": {\n     \"text\": \"Your message content\"\n   },\n   \"action\": {\n     \"name\": \"review_and_pay\",\n     \"parameters\": {\n       \"reference_id\": \"unique-reference-id\",\n       \"type\": \"digital-goods\",\n       \"payment_type\": \"br\",\n       \"payment_settings\": [\\\n         {\\\n           \"type\": \"pix_dynamic_code\",\\\n           \"pix_dynamic_code\": {\\\n             \"code\": \"00020101021226700014br.gov.bcb.pix2548pix.example.com...\",\\\n             \"merchant_name\": \"Account holder name\",\\\n             \"key\": \"39580525000189\",\\\n             \"key_type\": \"CNPJ\"\\\n           }\\\n         }\\\n       ],\n       \"currency\": \"BRL\",\n       \"total_amount\": {\n         \"value\": 50000,\n         \"offset\": 100\n       },\n       \"order\": {\n         \"status\": \"pending\",\n         \"tax\": {\n           \"value\": 0,\n           \"offset\": 100,\n           \"description\": \"optional text\"\n           },\n         \"items\": [\\\n           {\\\n             \"retailer_id\": \"1234567\",\\\n             \"name\": \"Cake\",\\\n             \"amount\": {\\\n               \"value\": 50000,\\\n               \"offset\": 100\\\n             },\\\n             \"quantity\": 1\\\n           }\\\n         ],\n         \"subtotal\": {\n           \"value\": 50000,\n           \"offset\": 100\n         }\n       }\n     }\n   }\n }\n}\n```\n\n### 2\\. Send an Order Status Update\n\nOnce the payment is confirmed, you must send an order status update. Follow the integration guide in the [Orders API page](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders).\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Offsite Pix Payments](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/offsite-pix#offsite-pix-payments)\n\n[Before You Start](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/offsite-pix#before-you-start)\n\n[Integration steps](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/offsite-pix#integration-steps)\n\n[1\\. Send an Order Details message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/offsite-pix#1--send-an-order-details-message)\n\n[2\\. Send an Order Status Update](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/offsite-pix#2--send-an-order-status-update)\n\n* * Facebook](https://scontent-lax3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/89126182_222315695571651_4936319991919149056_n.svg?_nc_cat=1&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=OcG-3KgtZEgQ7kNvwGJrYsh&_nc_oc=AdkXzXgHftjiWjTAwZ8Kisw9QUfswu8_ji-fZjvrW-2vhni4bXGY1ieUMhCKgX5nQCI&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-2.xx&_nc_gid=fRiHiHb2FKZ2SDgNDtoseA&oh=00_AYETcDwYbiW2-pe_YUOAUX9RKGXgIHu8hKT1GnsqASzQYQ&oe=680AE2EF)](https://www.facebook.com/MetaforDevelopers)[![Follow In](https://business.facebook.com/business/loginpage/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fdevelopers.facebook.com%2Fdocs%2Fwhatsapp%2Fcloud-api%2Fphone-numbers%2Fconversational-components%3Fnav_ref%3Dbiz_unified_f3_login_page_to_dfc&app=436761779744620&login_options%5B0%5D=FB&login_options%5B1%5D=SSO&is_work_accounts=1&config_ref=biz_login_tool_flavor_dfc)\n\n[Cloud [Reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference)\n- [Support](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Conversational Components](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/phone-numbers/conversational-components#conversational-components)\n\n[Limitations](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/phone-numbers/conversational-components#limitations)\n\n[Configure
