Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages/location-request-messages#post-body-parameters)\n\n[Response](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages/location-request-messages#response)\n\n[Response Contents](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages/location-request-messages#response-contents)\n\n[Webhook](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages/location-request-messages#webhook)\n\n[Webhook Contents](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages/location-request-messages#webhook-contents)\n\n[Example Request](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages/location-request-messages#example-request)\n\n[Example Response](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages/location-request-messages#example-response)\n\n[Example Webhook](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages/location-request-messages#example-webhook)\n\n# Location Request Messages\n\nLocation request messages display **body text** and a **send location button**. When a WhatsApp user taps the button, a location sharing screen appears which the user can then use to share their location.\n\n![](https://scontent-lax3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/411712787_1346691626211128_4092487602815472288_n.png?_nc_cat=105&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=X8OotMZuQgcQ7kNvwGagUht&_nc_oc=AdkP7A1c2jNh4pJLEnHh2qRhGm-Nqo0rNJIc9eRnRsIFaAvIfpqjBb7_NWuUeG8Dj0M&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-1.xx&_nc_gid=I508QBcNZKWFRYDC3xDjyA&oh=00_AYESJkXnGmR4ZV6SaKNl8V7-it1bxtGyoy_A3eT1teQlgA&oe=680B056A)\n\nOnce the user shares their location, a **messages** webhook is triggered, containing the user's location details.\n\n## Sending Location Request Messages\n\nUse the **[POST /<WHATSAPP\\_BUSINESS\\_PHONE\\_NUMBER\\_ID>/messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages)** endpoint to send a location request message to a WhatsApp user.\n\n### Request Syntax\n\n```\nPOST /<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>/messages\n```\n\n### Post Body\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"type\": \"interactive\",\n  \"to\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\n  \"interactive\": {\n    \"type\": \"location_request_message\",\n    \"body\": {\n      \"text\": \"<BODY_TEXT>\"\n    },\n    \"action\": {\n      \"name\": \"send_location\"\n    }\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### Post Body Parameters\n\n| Placeholder | Description | Example Value |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| `<BODY_TEXT>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>Message body text. Supports URLs.<br>Maximum 1024 characters. | `Let's start with your pickup. You can either manually *enter an address* or *share your current location*.` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>WhatsApp user phone number. | `+16505551234` |\n\n## Response\n\nUpon success:\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"contacts\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"input\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\\\n      \"wa_id\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_ID>\"\\\n    }\\\n  ],\n  \"messages\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"<WHATSAPP_MESSAGE_ID>\",\\\n      \"message_status\": \"<PACING_STATUS>\"\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\n### Response Contents\n\n| Placeholder | Description | Sample Value |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| `<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>`<br>_String_ | WhatsApp user's WhatsApp phone number. May not match `wa_id` value. | `+16505551234` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_USER_ID>`<br>_String_ | WhatsApp user's WhatsApp ID. May not match `input` value. | `16505551234` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_MESSAGE_ID>`<br>_String_ | WhatsApp Message ID. This ID appears in associated **messages** webhooks, such as sent, read, and delivered webhooks. | `wamid.HBgLMTY0NjcwNDM1OTUVAgARGBI4MjZGRDA0OUE2OTQ3RkEyMzcA` |\n| `<PACING_STATUS>`<br>_String_ | Indicates [template pacing](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/message-templates/guidelines#template-pacing) status. The `message_status` property is only included in responses when sending a [template message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates) that uses a template that is being paced. | `wamid.HBgLMTY0NjcwNDM1OTUVAgARGBI4MjZGRDA0OUE2OTQ3RkEyMzcA` |\n\n## Webhook\n\nWhen a WhatsApp user shares their location in response to your message, a **messages** webhook is triggered containing the user's location details.\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_ACCOUNT_ID>\",\\\n      \"changes\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"value\": {\\\n            \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n            \"metadata\": {\\\n              \"display_phone_number\": \"<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_DISPLAY_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\\\n              \"phone_number_id\": \"<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>\"\\\n            },\\\n            \"contacts\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"profile\": {\\\n                  \"name\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_NAME>\"\\\n                },\\\n                \"wa_id\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_ID>\"\\\n              }\\\n            ],\\\n            \"messages\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"context\": {\\\n                  \"from\": \"<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\\\n                  \"id\": \"<WHATSAPP_CONTEXT_MESSAGE_ID>\"\\\n                },\\\n                \"from\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_ID>\",\\\n                \"id\": \"<WHATSAPP_MESSAGE_ID>\",\\\n                \"timestamp\": \"<TIMESTAMP>\",\\\n                \"location\": {\\\n                  \"address\": \"<LOCATION_ADDRESS>\",\\\n                  \"latitude\": <LOCATION_LATITUDE>,\\\n                  \"longitude\": <LOCATION_LONGITUDE>,\\\n                  \"name\": \"<LOCATION_NAME>\"\\\n                },\\\n                \"type\": \"location\"\\\n              }\\\n            ]\\\n          },\\\n          \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n        }\\\n      ]\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\n### Webhook Contents\n\n| Placeholder | Description | Example Value |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| `<LOCATION_ADDRESS>`<br>_String_ | Location address.<br>This parameter will only appear if the WhatsApp user chooses to share it. | `1071 5th Ave, New York, NY 10128` |\n| `<LOCATION_LATITUDE>`<br>_Number_ | Location latitude in decimal degrees. | `40.782910059774` |\n| `<LOCATION_LONGITUDE>`<br>_Number_ | Location longitude in decimal degrees. | `-73.959075808525` |\n| `<LOCATION_NAME>`<br>_String_ | Location name.<br>This parameter will only appear if the WhatsApp user chooses to share it. | `Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum` |\n| `<TIMESTAMP>`<br>_String_ | UNIX timestamp indicating when our servers processed the WhatsApp user's message. | `1702920965` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_ACCOUNT_ID>`<br>_String_ | WhatsApp Business Account ID. | `102290129340398` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_DISPLAY_PHONE_NUMBER>`<br>_String_ | WhatsApp business phone number's display number. | `15550783881` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER>`<br>_String_ | WhatsApp business phone number. | `15550783881` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>`<br>_String_ | WhatsApp business phone number ID. | `106540352242922` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_CONTEXT_MESSAGE_ID>`<br>_String_ | WhatsApp message ID of message that the user is responding to. | `wamid.HBgLMTY0NjcwNDM1OTUVAgARGBI1QjJGRjI1RDY0RkE4Nzg4QzcA` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_MESSAGE_ID>`<br>_String_ | WhatsApp message ID of the user's message. | `wamid.HBgLMTY0NjcwNDM1OTUVAgASGBQzQTRCRDcwNzgzMTRDNTAwRTgwRQA=` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_USER_ID>`<br>_String_ | WhatsApp user's WhatsApp ID. | `16505551234` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_USER_NAME>`<br>_String_ | WhatsApp user's name. | `Pablo Morales` |\n\n## Example Request\n\n```\ncurl 'https://graph.facebook.com/v22.0/106540352242922/messages' \\\n-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...' \\\n-d '\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"type\": \"interactive\",\n  \"to\": \"+16505551234\",\n  \"interactive\": {\n    \"type\": \"location_request_message\",\n    \"body\": {\n      \"text\": \"Let us start with your pickup. You can either manually *enter an address* or *share your current location*.\"\n    },\n    \"action\": {\n      \"name\": \"send_location\"\n    }\n  }\n}'\n```\n\n## Example Response\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"contacts\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"input\": \"+16505551234\",\\\n      \"wa_id\": \"16505551234\"\\\n    }\\\n  ],\n  \"messages\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"wamid.HBgLMTY0NjcwNDM1OTUVAgARGBJCNUQ5RUNBNTk3OEQ2M0ZEQzgA\"\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\n## Example Webhook\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"102290129340398\",\\\n      \"changes\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"value\": {\\\n            \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n            \"metadata\": {\\\n              \"display_phone_number\": \"15550783881\",\\\n              \"phone_number_id\": \"106540352242922\"\\\n            },\\\n            \"contacts\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"profile\": {\\\n                  \"name\": \"Pablo Morales\"\\\n                },\\\n                \"wa_id\": \"16505551234\"\\\n              }\\\n            ],\\\n            \"messages\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"context\": {\\\n                  \"from\": \"15550783881\",\\\n                  \"id\": \"wamid.HBgLMTY0NjcwNDM1OTUVAgARGBI1QjJGRjI1RDY0RkE4Nzg4QzcA\"\\\n                },\\\n                \"from\": \"16505551234\",\\\n                \"id\": \"wamid.HBgLMTY0NjcwNDM1OTUVAgASGBQzQTRCRDcwNzgzMTRDNTAwRTgwRQA=\",\\\n                \"timestamp\": \"1702920965\",\\\n                \"location\": {\\\n                  \"address\": \"1071 5th Ave, New York, NY 10128\",\\\n                  \"latitude\": 40.782910059774,\\\n                  \"longitude\": -73.959075808525,\\\n                  \"name\": \"Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum\"\\\n                },\\\n                \"type\": \"location\"\\\n              }\\\n            ]\\\n          },\\\n          \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n        }\\\n      ]\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Location Request Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages/location-request-messages#location-request-messages)\n\n[Sending Location Request     "markdown": "[iframe](/common/referer_frame.php?cb=1)\n\n[iframe](/common/referer_frame.php?cb=1)\n\n[iframe](/common/referer_frame.php?cb=1)\n\n[iframe](/common/referer_frame.php?cb=1)\n\n![](https://facebook.com/security/hsts-pixel.gif)\n\n[![](https://developers.facebook.com/images/developer/m4d_logo_july_2024.svg)](https://developers.facebook.com/?no_redirect=1)\n\n[Docs](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/) [Tools](https://developers.facebook.com/tools/) [Support](https://developers.facebook.com/support/)\n\n[Log In](https://business.facebook.com/business/loginpage/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fdevelopers.facebook.com%2Fdocs%2Fwhatsapp%2Fcloud-api%2Fpayments-api%2Fpayments-in%2Forderstatustemplate%3Fnav_ref%3Dbiz_unified_f3_login_page_to_dfc&app=436761779744620&login_options%5B0%5D=FB&login_options%5B1%5D=SSO&is_work_accounts=1&config_ref=biz_login_tool_flavor_dfc)\n\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\n- [Overview](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview)\n- [Get Started](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started)\n- [Get Started for Solution Partners](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started-for-solution-partners)\n- [Get Started for Tech Providers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started-for-tech-providers)\n- [Multi-Partner Solutions](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/multi-partner-solutions)\n- [Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages)\n- [Block Users](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/block-users)\n- [Phone Numbers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/phone-numbers)\n- [Webhooks](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/set-up-webhooks)\n- [Sell Products & Services](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services)\n- [Payments API - India](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in)\n\n\n- [Onboarding APIs](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/onboarding-apis)\n- [UPI Intent](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent)\n- [Payment Links](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links)\n- [Payment Gateway](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/pg)\n- [Order Details Template](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/orderdetailstemplate)\n- [Order Status Template](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/orderstatustemplate)\n- [Checkout Button Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/checkout-button-templates)\n\n- [Payments API - Brazil](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br)\n- [Reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference)\n- [Support](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Send order status template message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/orderstatustemplate#send-order-status-template-message)\n\n[Overview](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/orderstatustemplate#overview)\n\n[Creating an order status template](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/orderstatustemplate#creating-an-order-status-template)\n\n[Creating an order status template using template creation APIs](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/orderstatustemplate#creating-an-order-status-template-using-template-creation-apis)\n\n[Sending order status template message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/orderstatustemplate#sending-order-status-template-message)\n\n[Canceling an Order](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/orderstatustemplate#canceling-an-order)\n\nMeta Business Account, sometimes referred to as Business Manager account or simply Business account, is being renamed to **business portfolio**. This change will appear gradually across Meta technologies. The change is cosmetic only and does not affect Meta Business Account IDs (business portfolio IDs).\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=595945097590761&version=1743728118)[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\>\nCloud API\n\n\n# Send order status template message\n\n## Overview\n\nOrder status template is one of the [interactive message templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates#interactive) that extends the call-to-action button to support updating order status through a template. It allows the businesses to update the order status outside of the [customer session window](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing%20/#customer-service-windows) in use cases such as charging the card for past order and updating about a shipment on order placed in the past.\n\nUpon receiving the payment signals, the businesses must update the order status to keep the user up to date. Currently we support the following order status values\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=634034961253028&version=1742854961)\n\n| Value | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `pending` | User has not successfully paid yet |\n| `processing` | User payment authorized, merchant/partner is fulfilling the order, performing service, etc. |\n| `partially-shipped` | A portion of the products in the order have been shipped by the merchant |\n| `shipped` | All the products in the order have been shipped by the merchant |\n| `completed` | The order is completed and no further action is expected from the user or the partner/merchant |\n| `canceled` | The partner/merchant would like to cancel the `order_details` message for the order/invoice. The status update will fail if there is already a `successful` or `pending` payment for this `order_details` message |\n\n## Creating an order status template\n\nTo create an order status template, the business needs a business portfolio with a WhatsApp Business Account, and access to the WhatsApp Manager.\n\nIn **WhatsApp Manager** \\> **Account tools**:\n\n1. Click on `create template`\n2. Select `Utility` category to expand `Order details message` option\n3. Enter the desired `template name` and supported `locale`\n   - Depending on the number of `locales` selected there will be an equal number of template variants and businesses need to fill in the template details in respective locale.\n4. Please fill in template components such as `Body` and optional `footer` text and submit.\n5. Once submitted, templates will be [categorized as per the guidelines](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/updates-to-pricing/new-template-guidelines#template-category-guidelines) and undergo the [approval process](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/message-templates/guidelines#approval-process) refrain from having [marketing content](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/updates-to-pricing/new-template-guidelines#marketing-templates) as part of template components.\n6. The template will be approved or rejected after the template components are verified by the system.\n\n   - If business believe the category determined is not consistent with our template category guidelines, please confirm there are no [common issues](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/message-templates/guidelines#common-rejection-reasons) that leads to rejections and if you are looking for further clarification you may [request a review](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/updates-to-pricing/new-template-guidelines#requesting-review) of the template via [Business Support](https://business.facebook.com/business-support-home/)\n7. Once approved template [status](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/message-templates/guidelines#statuses) will be changed to `ACTIVE`\n   - Please be informed that template's status can change automatically from `ACTIVE` to `PAUSED` or `DISABLED` based on customer feedback and engagement. We recommend that you [monitor status changes](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/message-templates/guidelines#monitoring-status-changes) and take appropriate actions whenever such change occurs.\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.8562-6/403627249_359993013173066_1110732811755759684_n.gif?_nc_cat=105&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=f537c7&_nc_ohc=7c3F4BquVQAQ7kNvwFwW1d7&_nc_oc=Adl_iKfumgbcXIz6Cbt_K6fhVFh_4hDBWSgdzh8qQDEyetQMzcc7V6ss8oRGFiHV9QY&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=C6a88ls0uv5K6V9poJ2Knw&oh=00_AYEO-mRhFx_LeTRqKtoLKPSTW7mbT77LaI5YuDyyuNzkKw&oe=67F6774F)\n\n## Creating an order status template using template creation APIs\n\nTo create a template through API and understand the general syntax, required categories and\ncomponents please refer to [templates API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/message-templates/#creating-templates). All the guidelines outlined above in creating templates apply through API as well.\n\nOrder status template is categorized as “Utility” template and apart from ‘name’ and ‘language’ of\nchoice, it has general template components such as BODY, FOOTER and additionally sub category as “ORDER\\_STATUS”.\n\n```\nPOST https://graph.facebook.com/v16.0/WABA_ID/message_templates\n{\n  \"name\": \"{templateName}\",\n  \"language\": \"en_US\",\n  \"category\": \"UTILITY\",\n  \"sub_category\": \"ORDER_STATUS\",\n  \"components\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"type\": \"BODY\",\\\n      \"text\": \"Template Body text\"\\\n    },\\\n    {\\\n      \"type\": \"FOOTER\",\\\n      \"text\": \"Footer text\"\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\n## Sending order status template message\n\nOrder status template message allows the businesses to send update on the status of the\norder as template component parameters.\n\nTo send an order status template message, make a `POST` call to `/PHONE_NUMBER_ID/messages`\nendpoint and attach a message object with `type=template`. Then, add a [template object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages#template-object) with a\n`order_status` component and parameters with latest status on order with order `reference-id`.\n\nFor example, the following sample describes how to send `shipped` status on the placed order.\n\n```\n  curl -X  POST \\\n 'https://graph.facebook.com/v18.0/FROM_PHONE_NUMBER_ID/messages' \\\n -H 'Authorization: Bearer ACCESS_TOKEN' \\\n -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n -d '{\n    \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n    \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n    \"to\": \"PHONE_NUMBER\",\n    \"type\": \"template\",\n    \"template\":\n    {\n        \"name\": \"TEMPLATE_NAME\",\n        \"language\":\n        {\n            \"policy\": \"deterministic\",\n            \"code\": \"LANGUAGE_AND_LOCALE_CODE\"\n        },\n        \"components\":\n        [\\\n            {\\\n                \"type\": \"order_status\",\\\n                \"parameters\":\\\n                [{\\\n                    \"type\": \"order_status\",\\\n                    \"order_status\":\\\n                    {\\\n                        \"reference_id\": \"reference_id_value\",\\\n                        \"order\":\\\n                        {\\\n                            \"status\": \"processing | partially_shipped | shipped | completed | canceled\",\\\n                            \"description\": \"OPTINAL_DESCRIPTION\"\\\n                        }\\\n                    }\\\n                }]\\\n            }\\\n        ]\n    }\n}\n```\n\nUpon sending an `order_status` message with an invalid transition, you will receive an error webhook with the error code `2046` and message `New order status was not correctly transitioned`.\n\n## Canceling an Order\n\nAn order can be canceled by sending an `order_status` message with the status `canceled`. The customer cannot pay for an order that is canceled. The customer receives an `order_status` message and the order details page is updated to show that the order is canceled and the `Continue` button removed. The optional text shown below `Order canceled` on the order details page can be specified using the description field in the `order_status` message.\n\nAn order can be canceled only if the user has not already paid for the order. If the user has paid and the business sends a order\\_status message with canceled status will receive an error webhook with error code `2047` and message `Could not change order status to 'canceled'`.\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Send order status template message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/orderstatustemplate#send-order-status-template-message)\n\n[Overview](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/orderstatustemplate#overview)\n\n[Creating an order status template](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/orderstatustemplate#creating-an-order-status-template)\n\n[Creating an order status template using template creation APIs](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/orderstatustemplate#creating-an-order-status-template-using-template-creation-apis)\n\n[Sending order status template message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/orderstatustemplate#sending-order-status-template-message)\n\n[Canceling an Order](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/orderstatustemplate#canceling-an-order)\n\n* * LinkedIn](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/458754681_1046279956748647_3773356972584952025_n.png?_nc_cat=103&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=o3cQqCT-ypsQ7kNvwFGXswu&_nc_oc=AdnYuxLx5pTSZuxofK6THjkIRrQE3csuZs5E6Y9S7Pj06as8aebztcz2WXh1N3RyW_o&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=C6a88ls0uv5K6V9poJ2Knw&oh=00_AYE7PXtvrPBV6XlIGadvHLDGjBKwKQjqQWtClBdS9jNhnA&oe=680AE8AC)](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Fshowcase%2Fmeta-for-developers%2F&h=AT1m1kYNiX-W6G2kbv9Lmm9A6di1ErCqJcB22rCjVvoWJT5SGG5OPRHjq6M53VccBJJtWdq9My5sX_-MyUGCDgbQl0PKzkUsb12p8O0ysiUhIo5pzF6MMza1mwF0J7AdRlD7zAjPtOHI8w)[![Follow [Tools](https://developers.facebook.com/tools/) [Support](https://developers.facebook.com/support/)\n\n[Log In](https://business.facebook.com/business/loginpage/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fdevelopers.facebook.com%2Fdocs%2Fwhatsapp%2Fcloud-api%2Fwebhooks%2Fcomponents%3Fnav_ref%3Dbiz_unified_f3_login_page_to_dfc&app=436761779744620&login_options%5B0%5D=FB&login_options%5B1%5D=SSO&is_work_accounts=1&config_ref=biz_login_tool_flavor_dfc)\n\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\n- [Overview](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview)\n- [Get Started](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started)\n- [Get Started for Solution Partners](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started-for-solution-partners)\n- [Get Started for Tech Providers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started-for-tech-providers)\n- [Multi-Partner Solutions](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/multi-partner-solutions)\n- [Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages)\n- [Block Users](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/block-users)\n- [Phone Numbers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/phone-numbers)\n- India](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in)\n- [Payments API - Brazil](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br)\n- [Reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference)\n\n\n- [Account Migration](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/account-migration)\n- [Business Compliance](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/business-compliance)\n- [Business Profiles](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/business-profiles)\n- [Media](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/media)\n- [Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages)\n- [Phone Numbers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/phone-numbers)\n- [Registration](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration)\n- [Two-Step Verification](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/two-step-verification)\n- [WhatsApp Business Accounts](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/whatsapp-business-accounts)\n- [Flows Encryption](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/whatsapp-business-encryption)\n- [Webhooks](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/components)\n\n- [Support](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Webhooks Notification Payload Reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/components#webhooks-notification-payload-reference)\n\n[Notification Payload Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/components#notification-payload-object)\n\n[Value Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/components#value-object)\n\n[Messages Objects](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/components#messages-object)\n\n[Statuses Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/components#statuses-object)\n\n[Learn more](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/components#learn-more)\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=595945097590761&version=1743728118)[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\>\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\\>\n[Reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference)\n\n# Webhooks Notification Payload Reference\n\nWebhooks are triggered when a customer performs an action or the status for a message a business sends a customer changes. You get a webhooks notification:\n\n**When a customer performs an action**\n\n|     |     |\n| --- | --- |\n| - Sends a text message to the business<br>- Sends an image, video, audio, document, or sticker to the business<br>- Sends contact information to the business<br>- Sends location information to the business<br>- Clicks a reply button set up by the business | - Clicks a call-to-actions button on an Ad that Clicks to WhatsApp<br>- Clicks an item on a business' list<br>- Updates their profile information such as their phone number<br>- Asks for information about a specific product<br>- Orders products being sold by the business |\n\n**When the status for a message received by a business changes** (includes pricing information)\n\n|     |     |     |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| - `delivered` | - `read` | - `sent` |\n\n## Notification Payload Object\n\nThe notification payload is a combination of nested objects of JSON arrays and objects that contain information about a change.\n\n|     |     |\n| --- | --- |\n| Example Notification Payload<br>```<br>{<br>  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",<br>  \"entry\": [{<br>    \"id\": \"WHATSAPP-BUSINESS-ACCOUNT-ID\",<br>    \"changes\": [{<br>      \"value\": {<br>         \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",<br>         \"metadata\": {<br>           \"display_phone_number\": \"PHONE-NUMBER\",<br>           \"phone_number_id\": \"PHONE-NUMBER-ID\"<br>         },<br>      # Additional arrays and objects<br>         \"contacts\": [{...}]<br>         \"errors\": [{...}]<br>         \"messages\": [{...}]<br>         \"statuses\": [{...}]<br>      },<br>      \"field\": \"messages\"<br>    }]<br>  }]<br>}<br>``` | The Nested Structure of the Notification Payload<br>![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=734660034194247&version=1699984140) |\n\n| Name | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `object`<br> _string_ | The specific webhook a business is subscribed to. The webhook is `whatsapp_business_account`. |\n| `entry`<br> _array of objects_ | An array of entry objects. Entry objects have the following properties:<br>- `id` — _String_. The WhatsApp Business Account ID for the business that is subscribed to the webhook.<br>- `changes` — _Array of objects_. An array of change objects. Change objects have the following properties:<br>  <br>  <br>  - `value` — _Object_. A value object. See [Value Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/components#value-object).<br>  - `field` — _String_. Notification type. Value will be `messages`. |\n\n## Value Object\n\nThe `value` object contains details for the change that triggered the webhook. This object is nested within the `changes` array of the `entry` array.\n\n| Name | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `contacts`<br> _array of objects_ | Array of contact objects with information for the customer who sent a message to the business. Contact objects have the following properties:<br>- `wa_id` — _String_. The customer's WhatsApp ID. A business can respond to a customer using this ID. This ID may not match the customer's phone number, which is returned by the API as `input` when sending a message to the customer.<br>- `user_id` — _String_. Additional unique, alphanumeric identifier for a WhatsApp user.<br>- `profile` — _Object_. A customer profile object. Profile objects have the following properties:<br>  <br>  <br>  - `name` — _String_. The customer's name. |\n| `errors`<br> _array of objects_ | An array of error objects describing the error. Error objects have the following properties, which map to their equivalent properties in [API error response payloads](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes).<br>Webhooks triggered by v15.0 and older requests:<br>- `code` — _Integer_. Example: `130429`.<br>- `title` — _String_. Error code title. Example: `Rate limit hit`.<br>Webhooks triggered by v16.0 and newer requests:<br>- `code` — _Integer_. Error code. Example: `130429`.<br>- `title` — _String_. Error code title. Example: `Rate limit hit`.<br>- `message` — _String_. Error code message. This value is the same as the `title` value. For example: `Rate limit hit`. Note that the message property in API error response payloads pre-pends this value with the a `#` symbol and the error code in parenthesis. For example: `(#130429) Rate limit hit`.<br>- `error_data` — _Object_. An error data object with the following properties:<br>  <br>  <br>  - `details` — _String_. Describes the error. Example: `Message failed to send because there were too many messages sent from this phone number in a short period of time`. |\n| `messaging_product`<br> _string_ | Product used to send the message. Value is always `whatsapp`. |\n| `messages`<br> _array of objects_ | Information about a message received by the business that is subscribed to the webhook. See [Messages Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/components#messages-object). |\n| `metadata`<br> _object_ | A metadata object describing the business subscribed to the webhook. Metadata objects have the following properties:<br>- `display_phone_number` — _String._ The phone number that is displayed for a business.<br>- `phone_number_id` — _String._ ID for the phone number. A business can respond to a message using this ID. |\n| `statuses`<br> _array of objects_ | Status object for a message that was sent by the business that is subscribed to the webhook. See [Statuses Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/components#statuses-object). |\n\n### Messages Objects\n\nThe `messages` array of objects is nested within the `value` object and is triggered when a customer updates their profile information or a customer sends a message to the business that is subscribed to the webhook.\n\n| Name | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `audio`<br> _object_ | When the `messages` `type` is set to `audio`, including voice messages, this object is included in the `messages` object:<br>- `id` — _String._ ID for the audio file.<br>- `mime_type` — _String._ Mime type of the audio file. |\n| `button`<br> _object_ | When the `messages` `type` field is set to `button`, this object is included in the `messages` object:<br>- `payload` – _String._ The payload for a button set up by the business that a customer clicked as part of an interactive message.<br>- `text` — _String._ Button text. |\n| `context`<br> _object_ | Context object. Only included when a user replies or interacts with one of your messages. Context objects can have the following properties:<br>- `forwarded` — _Boolean_. Set to `true` if the message received by the business has been forwarded.<br>- `frequently_forwarded` — _Boolean_. Set to `true` if the message received by the business has been forwarded more than 5 times.<br>- `from` — _String._ The WhatsApp ID for the customer who replied to an inbound message.<br>- `id` — _String._ The message ID for the sent message for an inbound reply.<br>- `referred_product` — _Object._ Referred product object describing the product the user is requesting information about. **You must parse this value if you support Product Enquiry Messages**. See [Receive Response From Customers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services/receive-responses). Referred product objects have the following properties:<br>  <br>  <br>  - `catalog_id` — _String._ Unique identifier of the Meta catalog linked to the WhatsApp Business Account.<br>  - `product_retailer_id` — _String._ Unique identifier of the product in a catalog. |\n| `document`<br> _object_ | A document object. When `messages type` is set to `document`, this object is included in the `messages` object. Document objects can have the following properties:<br>- `caption` — _String._ Caption for the document, if provided.<br>- `filename` — _String._ Name for the file on the sender's device.<br>- `sha256` — _String._ SHA 256 hash.<br>- `mime_type` — \\_String. \\_ Mime type of the document file.<br>- `id` — _String._ ID for the document. |\n| `errors`<br> _array of objects_ | An array of error objects describing the error. Error objects have the following properties, which map to their equivalent properties in [API error response payloads](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes).<br>Webhooks triggered by v15.0 and older requests:<br>- `code` — _Integer_. Example: `130429`.<br>- `title` — _String_. Error code title. Example: `Rate limit hit`.<br>Webhooks triggered by v16.0 and newer requests:<br>- `code` — _Integer_. Error code. Example: `130429`.<br>- `title` — _String_. Error code title. Example: `Rate limit hit`.<br>- `message` — _String_. Error code message. This value is the same as the `title` value. For example: `Rate limit hit`. Note that the message property in API error response payloads pre-pends this value with the a `#` symbol and the error code in parenthesis. For example: `(#130429) Rate limit hit`.<br>- `error_data` — _Object_. An error data object with the following properties:<br>  <br>  <br>  - `details` — _String_. Describes the error. Example: `Message failed to send because there were too many messages sent from this phone number in a short period of time`. |\n| `from`<br> _string_ | The customer's WhatsApp ID. A business can respond to a customer using this ID. This ID may not match the customer's phone number, which is returned by the API as `input` when sending a message to the customer. |\n| `id`<br> _string_ | The ID for the message that was received by the business. You could use [messages endpoint](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages) to mark this specific message as read. |\n| `identity`<br> _object_ | An identity object. See `messages system identity`. Identity objects can have the following properties:<br>- `acknowledged` — State of acknowledgment for the `messages system customer_identity_changed`.<br>- `created_timestamp` — _String._ The time when the WhatsApp Business Management API detected the customer may have changed their profile information.<br>- `hash` — _String._ The ID for the `messages system customer_identity_changed` |\n| `image`<br> _object_ | When `messages type` is set to `image`, this object is included in the `messages` object.<br>- `caption` — _String_. Caption for the image, if provided.<br>- `sha256` — _String_. Image hash.<br>- `id` — _String_. ID for the image.<br>- `mime_type` — _String_. Mime type for the image. |\n| `interactive`<br> _object_ | When a customer has interacted with your message, this object is included in the `messages` object. Interactive objects have the following properties:<br>- `type` — Object with the following properties:<br>  <br>  <br>  - `button_reply` – Sent when a customer clicks a button. Object with the following properties:<br>    <br>    <br>    - `id` — _String_. Unique ID of a button.<br>    - `title` — _String_. Title of a button.<br>  - `list_reply` — Sent when a customer selects an item from a list. Object with the following properties:<br>    <br>    <br>    - `id` — _String_. Unique ID of the selected list item.<br>    - `title` — _String_. Title of the selected list item.<br>    - `description` — _String_. Description of the selected row. |\n| `order`<br> _object_ | Included in the `messages` object when a customer has placed an order. Order objects have the following properties:<br>- `catalog_id` — _String_. ID for the catalog the ordered item belongs to.<br>- `text` — _String_. Text message from the user sent along with the order.<br>- `product_items` — Array of product item objects containing the following fields:<br>  <br>  <br>  - `product_retailer_id` — _String_. Unique identifier of the product in a catalog.<br>  - `quantity` — _String_. Number of items.<br>  - `item_price` — _String_. Price of each item.<br>  - `currency` — _String_. Price currency. |\n| `referral`<br> _object_ | Referral object. When a customer clicks an ad that redirects to WhatsApp, this object is included in the `messages` object. Referral objects have the following properties:<br>- `source_url` – _String_. The Meta URL that leads to the ad or post clicked by the customer. Opening this url takes you to the ad viewed by your customer.<br>- `source_type` – _String_. The type of the ad’s source; `ad` or `post`.<br>- `source_id` – _String_. Meta ID for an ad or a post.<br>- `headline` – _String_. Headline used in the ad or post.<br>- `body` – _String_. Body for the ad or post.<br>- `media_type` – _String_. Media present in the ad or post; `image` or `video`.<br>- `image_url` – _String_. URL of the image, when `media_type` is an image.<br>- `video_url` – _String_. URL of the video, when `media_type` is a video.<br>- `thumbnail_url` – _String_. URL for the thumbnail, when `media_type` is a video.<br>- `ctwa_clid` – _String_. Click ID generated by Meta for ads that click to WhatsApp.<br>The referral object can be included in the following types of message: text, location, contact, image, video, document, voice, and sticker.<br>Click-to-WhatsApp ads are only supported in the Android and iOS apps. If the customer is using the Web browser or their computer to click on an ad, then the resulting webhook will contain a `referral` object without some of the above properties. |\n| `sticker`<br> _object_ | When `messages type` is set to `sticker`, this object is included in the `messages` object. Sticker objects have the following properties:<br>- `mime_type` – _String_. image/webp.<br>- `sha256` – _String_. Hash for the sticker.<br>- `id` – _String_. ID for the sticker.<br>- `animated` – _Boolean_. Set to `true` if the sticker is animated; `false` otherwise. |\n| `system`<br> _object_ | When `messages type` is set to `system`, a customer has updated their phone number or profile information, this object is included in the `messages` object. System objects have the following properties:<br>- `body` – _String_. Describes the change to the customer's identity or phone number.<br>- `identity` – _String_. Hash for the identity fetched from server.<br>- `new_wa_id` – _String_. New WhatsApp ID for the customer when their phone number is updated. Available on webhook versions v11.0 and earlier.<br>- `wa_id` – _String_. New WhatsApp ID for the customer when their phone number is updated. Available on webhook versions v12.0 and later.<br>- `type` – _String_. Type of system update. Will be one of the following:.<br>  <br>  <br>  - `customer_changed_number` – A customer changed their phone number.<br>  - `customer_identity_changed` – A customer changed their profile information.<br>- `customer` – _String_. The WhatsApp ID for the customer prior to the update. |\n| `text`<br> _object_ | When `messages type` is set to `text`, this object is included. Text objects have the following properties:<br>- `body` — _String_. The text of the message. |\n| `timestamp`<br> _string_ | Unix timestamp indicating when the WhatsApp server received the message from the customer. |\n| `type`<br> _string_ | The type of message that has been received by the business that has subscribed to Webhooks. Possible value can be one of the following:\n\n|     |     |\n| --- | --- |\n| - `audio`<br>- `button`<br>- `document`<br>- `text`<br>- `image` | - `interactive`<br>- `order`<br>- `sticker`<br>- `system` – for customer number change messages<br>- `unknown`<br>- `video` | |\n| `video`<br> _object_ | When `messages type` is set to `video`, this object is included in `messages` object. Video objects have the following properties:<br>- `caption` – _String_. The caption for the video, if provided.<br>- `sha256` – _String_. The hash for the video.<br>- `id` – _String_. The ID for the video.<br>- `mime_type` – _String_. The mime type for the video file. |\n\n### Statuses Object\n\nThe `statuses` object is nested within the `value` object and is triggered when a message is sent or delivered to a customer or the customer reads the delivered message sent by a business that is subscribed to the Webhooks.\n\n| Name | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `biz_opaque_callback_data`<br>_string_ | Arbitrary string included in sent message. See [Message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages#message-object) object. |\n| `conversation`<br>_object_ | Information about the conversation.<br>`id` –<br>Represents the ID of the conversation the given status notification belongs to.<br>`origin` _object_ – Describes conversation category<br>`type` – Indicates conversation category. This can also be referred to as a conversation entry point<br>`authentication` – Indicates the conversation was opened by a business sending template categorized as `AUTHENTICATION` to the customer. This applies any time it has been more than 24 hours since the last customer message.<br>`marketing` – Indicates the conversation was opened by a business sending template categorized as `MARKETING` to the customer. This applies any time it has been more than 24 hours since the last customer message.<br>`utility` – Indicates the conversation was opened by a business sending template categorized as `UTILITY` to the customer. This applies any time it has been more than 24 hours since the last customer message.<br>`service` – Indicates that the conversation opened by a business replying to a customer within a customer service window.<br>`referral_conversion` – Indicates a [free entry point conversation](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing#free-entry-point-conversations).<br>`expiration_timestamp` – Date when the conversation expires. This field is only present for messages with a \\`status\\` set to \\`sent\\`.<br>See [Conversations](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing#conversations) for more information about conversations and conversation categories. |\n| `errors`<br> _array of objects_ | An array of error objects describing the error. Error objects have the following properties, which map to their equivalent properties in [API error response payloads](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes).<br>Webhooks triggered by v15.0 and older requests:<br>- `code` — _Integer_. Example: `130429`.<br>- `title` — _String_. Error code title. Example: `Rate limit hit`.<br>Webhooks triggered by v16.0 and newer requests:<br>- `code` — _Integer_. Error code. Example: `130429`.<br>- `title` — _String_. Error code title. Example: `Rate limit hit`.<br>- `message` — _String_. Error code message. This value is the same as the `title` value. For example: `Rate limit hit`. Note that the message property in API error response payloads pre-pends this value with the a `#` symbol and the error code in parenthesis. For example: `(#130429) Rate limit hit`.<br>- `error_data` — _Object_. An error data object with the following properties:<br>- `details` — _String_. Describes the error. Example: `Message failed to send because there were too many messages sent from this phone number in a short period of time`. |\n| `id` _string_ | The ID for the message that the business that is subscribed to the webhooks sent to a customer |\n| `pricing` _object_ | An object containing pricing information.<br>~~`billable` – Indicates if the given message or conversation is billable. Default is `true` for all conversations, including those inside your free tier limit, except those initiated from free entry points. Free entry point conversatsion are not billable, `false`.<br>You will not be charged for free tier limit conversations, but they are considered billable and will be reflected on your invoice.~~ **Deprecated.** Visit the [WhatsApp Changelog](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-platform/changelog) for more information. <br> <br>`category` – Indicates the conversation category:<br>`authentication` – Indicates an authentication conversation.<br>`authentication-international` – Indicates an [authentication-international](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing/authentication-international-rates#authentication-international-rates) conversation.<br>`marketing` – Indicates an marketing conversation.<br>`utility` – Indicates a utility conversation.<br>`service` – Indicates an service conversation.<br>`referral_conversion` – Indicates a [free entry point conversation](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing#free-entry-point-conversations).<br>`pricing_model` – Type of pricing model used by the business. Current supported value is `CBP`<br>See [Conversations](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing#conversations) for more information about conversations and conversation categories. |\n| `recipient_id` _string_ | The customer's WhatsApp ID. A business can respond to a customer using this ID. This ID may not match the customer's phone number, which is returned by the API as `input` when sending a message to the customer. |\n| `status` _string_ | `delivered` – A webhook is triggered when a message sent by a business has been delivered<br>`read` – A webhook is triggered when a message sent by a business has been read<br>`sent` – A webhook is triggered when a business sends a message to a customer |\n| `timestamp` _Unix timestamp_ | Date for the status message |\n\nFor a status to be `read`, it must have been `delivered`. In some scenarios, such as when a user is in the chat screen and a message arrives, the message is `delivered` and `read` almost simultaneously. In this or other similar scenarios, the `delivered` notification will not be sent back, as it is implied that a message has been delivered if it has been read. The reason for this behavior is internal optimization.\n\n## Learn more\n\n- Check out our [Webhook Notification Payload Examples](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples).\n\n- Visit the [WhatsApp Business Management API Webhooks documentation](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/webhooks/reference/whatsapp-business-account/) to set up webhooks for updates about your WhatsApp Business Account and its assets.\n\n\n[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\|\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\\|\n\n[Business Management API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Webhooks Notification Payload Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/components#value-object)\n\n[Messages Objects](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/components#messages-object)\n\n[Statuses Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/components#statuses-object)\n\n[Learn more](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/components#learn-more)\n\n* *     "markdown": "[iframe](/common/referer_frame.php?cb=1)\n\n[iframe](/common/referer_frame.php?cb=1)\n\n[iframe](/common/referer_frame.php?cb=1)\n\n[iframe](/common/referer_frame.php?cb=1)\n\n![](https://facebook.com/security/hsts-pixel.gif)\n\n[![](https://developers.facebook.com/images/developer/m4d_logo_july_2024.svg)](https://developers.facebook.com/?no_redirect=1)\n\n[Docs](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/) [Tools](https://developers.facebook.com/tools/) [Support](https://developers.facebook.com/support/)\n\n[Log In](https://business.facebook.com/business/loginpage/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fdevelopers.facebook.com%2Fdocs%2Fwhatsapp%2Fcloud-api%2Fpayments-api%2Fpayments-br%2Fpayment-links%3Fnav_ref%3Dbiz_unified_f3_login_page_to_dfc&app=436761779744620&login_options%5B0%5D=FB&login_options%5B1%5D=SSO&is_work_accounts=1&config_ref=biz_login_tool_flavor_dfc)\n\n[Payment Links](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/payment-links)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Payment Links](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/payment-links#payment-links)\n\n[Before You Start](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/payment-links#before-you-start)\n\n[Integration steps](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/payment-links#integration-steps)\n\n[1\\. Send an Order Details message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/payment-links#1--send-an-order-details-message)\n\n[2\\. Send an Order Status Update](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/payment-links#2--send-an-order-status-update)\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=595945097590761&version=1743728118)[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\>\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\\>\n[Payments API - Brazil](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br)\n\n# Payment Links\n\nThis feature is not publicly available yet and is only available for businesses based in Brazil and their Brazillian customers. To enable payments for your businesses, please contact your Solution Partner.\n\nPayments API also enables businesses to collect payments from their customers via WhatsApp using Payment Links.\n\nWhen using this integration, WhatsApp only facilitates the communication between merchants and buyers. Merchants are responsible for integrating with a PSP from which they can generate Payment Links, and confirm their payment.\n\n## Before You Start\n\n1. Familiarize yourself with the [Orders API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders). Orders are the entrypoint for collecting payments in WhatsApp.\n2. You will need an existing integration with a PSP to generate Payment Links and do automatic reconciliation when a payment is made.\n3. You must update the order status as soon as a payment is made.\n\n## Integration steps\n\nThe following sequence diagram shows the typical integration with Payment Links.\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=915761436977610&version=1722361997)\n\n### 1\\. Send an Order Details message\n\nFollow the full integration guide in the [Orders API page](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders).\n\nIf Payment Link payment is available on this order, you will need to provide a `payment_link` to the `payment_settings` attribute.\n\n#### Pararmeters Object\n\n| Field Name | Optional? | Type | Description |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| `payment_settings` | Optional | [Payment Settings Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/payment-links#paymentsettingsobject) | List of payment related configuration objects. |\n\n#### Payment Settings\n\n| Field Name | Optional? | Type | Description |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| `type` | Required | String | Must be `payment_link`. |\n| `payment_link` | Required | [Payment Link Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/payment-links#paymentlinkobject) | Payment Link object that will be used to render the option to buyers during the checkout flow. |\n\n#### Payment Link Object\n\n| **Field Name** | **Optional?** | **Type** | **Description** |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| `uri` | Required | String | The Payment Link's uri which will be opened in the web browser, when user taps on the Payment Link CTA button. |\n\n#### Payload example\n\n```\nPOST: /v1/messages\n{\n \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n \"to\": \"[recipient-wa-id]\",\n \"type\": \"interactive\",\n \"interactive\": {\n   \"type\": \"order_details\",\n   \"body\": {\n     \"text\": \"Your message content\"\n   },\n   \"action\": {\n     \"name\": \"review_and_pay\",\n     \"parameters\": {\n       \"reference_id\": \"unique-reference-id\",\n       \"type\": \"digital-goods\",\n       \"payment_type\": \"br\",\n       \"payment_settings\": [\\\n         {\\\n           \"type\": \"payment_link\",\\\n           \"payment_link\": {\\\n             \"uri\": \"https://my-payment-link-url\",\\\n           }\\\n         }\\\n       ],\n       \"currency\": \"BRL\",\n       \"total_amount\": {\n         \"value\": 50000,\n         \"offset\": 100\n       },\n       \"order\": {\n         \"status\": \"pending\",\n         \"tax\": {\n           \"value\": 0,\n           \"offset\": 100,\n           \"description\": \"optional text\"\n           },\n         \"items\": [\\\n           {\\\n             \"retailer_id\": \"1234567\",\\\n             \"name\": \"Cake\",\\\n             \"amount\": {\\\n               \"value\": 50000,\\\n               \"offset\": 100\\\n             },\\\n             \"quantity\": 1\\\n           }\\\n         ],\n         \"subtotal\": {\n           \"value\": 50000,\n           \"offset\": 100\n         }\n       }\n     }\n   }\n }\n}\n```\n\n### 2\\. Send an Order Status Update\n\nOnce the payment is confirmed, you must send an order status update. Follow the integration guide in the [Orders API page](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders).\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Payment Links](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/payment-links#payment-links)\n\n[Before You Start](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/payment-links#before-you-start)\n\n[Integration steps](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/payment-links#integration-steps)\n\n[1\\. Send an Order Details message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/payment-links#1--send-an-order-details-message)\n\n[2\\. Send an Order Status Update](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/payment-links#2--send-an-order-status-update)\n\n* * [Tools](https://developers.facebook.com/tools/) [Support](https://developers.facebook.com/support/)\n\n[Log In](https://business.facebook.com/business/loginpage/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fdevelopers.facebook.com%2Fdocs%2Fwhatsapp%2Fcloud-api%2Freference%2Fregistration%3Fnav_ref%3Dbiz_unified_f3_login_page_to_dfc&app=436761779744620&login_options%5B0%5D=FB&login_options%5B1%5D=SSO&is_work_accounts=1&config_ref=biz_login_tool_flavor_dfc)\n\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\n- [Overview](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview)\n- [Get Started](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started)\n- [Get Started for Solution Partners](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started-for-solution-partners)\n- [Get Started for Tech Providers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started-for-tech-providers)\n- [Multi-Partner Solutions](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/multi-partner-solutions)\n- [Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages)\n- [Block Users](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/block-users)\n- [Phone Numbers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/phone-numbers)\n- [Webhooks](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/set-up-webhooks)\n- [Sell Products & Services](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services)\n- [Payments API - India](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in)\n- [Payments API - Brazil](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br)\n- [Reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference)\n\n\n- [Account Migration](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/account-migration)\n- [Business Compliance](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/business-compliance)\n- [Business Profiles](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/business-profiles)\n- [Media](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/media)\n- [Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages)\n- [Phone Numbers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/phone-numbers)\n- [Registration](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration)\n- [Two-Step Verification](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/two-step-verification)\n- [WhatsApp Business Accounts](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/whatsapp-business-accounts)\n- [Flows Encryption](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/whatsapp-business-encryption)\n- [Webhooks](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/components)\n\n- [Support](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Registration](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#registration)\n\n[Register a Business Phone Number](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#register)\n\n[Limitations](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#limitations)\n\n[Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#parameters)\n\n[Example Request without Local Storage](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#example-request-without-local-storage)\n\n[Example Request with Local Storage](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#example-request-with-local-storage)\n\n[Deregister a Business Phone Number](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#deregister)\n\n[Limitations](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#limitations-2)\n\n[Example](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#example)\n\n[See Also](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#see-also)\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=595945097590761&version=1743728118)[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\>\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\\>\n[Reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference)\n\n# Registration\n\nTo use your business phone number with Cloud API you must register it. Register your business phone number in the following scenarios:\n\n- Account Creation: When you implement this API, you need to register the business phone number you want to use to send messages. We enforce setting two-step verification during account creation to add an extra layer of security to your accounts.\n- Name Change: In this case, your phone is already registered and you want to change your display name. To do that, you must [first file for a name change on WhatsApp Manager](https://www.facebook.com/business/help/378834799515077). Once the name is approved, you need to register your phone again under the new name.\n- Migrating your number from On-Premises API to Cloud API. See [Migration Exception](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#migration-exception).\n\nBefore you can register your business phone number you must first [verify its ownership](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/phone-numbers#verify).\n\n### Migration Exception\n\nIf you are migrating a phone number from the On-Premises API to the Cloud API, there are extra steps you need to perform before registering a phone number with the Cloud API. See [Migrate From On-Premises API to Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/migrating-from-onprem-to-cloud) for the full process.\n\n## Register a Business Phone Number\n\nTo register your verified business phone number, make a `POST` call to `PHONE_NUMBER_ID/register`. Include the parameters listed below.\n\n| Endpoint | Authentication |\n| --- | --- |\n| `PHONE_NUMBER_ID/register`<br>(See [Get Phone Number ID](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/manage-phone-numbers#get-all-phone-numbers)) | Solution Partners must authenticate themselves with an access token with the `whatsapp_business_management` permission. |\n\n### Limitations\n\nRequests to the registration endpoint are limited to 10 requests per business number in a 72 hour moving window.\n\nWhen you make a registration request, we will check how many registration requests you have made to register that number in the last 72 hours. If you have already made 10 requests, the API will return error code `133016`, and the number will be prevented from being registered for the next 72 hours.\n\n### Parameters\n\n| Name | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `messaging_product` | **Required.**<br>Messaging service used. Set this to `\"whatsapp\"`. |\n| `pin` | **Required.**<br>If your verified business phone number already has two-step verification enabled, set this value to your number's 6-digit two-step verification PIN. If you cannot recall your PIN, you can [update it](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/two-step-verification#updating-verification-code).<br>If your verified business phone number does not have two-step verification enabled, set this value to a 6-digit number. This will be the newly verified business phone number's two-step verification PIN. |\n| `data_localization_region` | **Optional.**<br>If included, enables [local storage](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/local-storage/) on the business phone number. Value must be a 2-letter ISO 3166 country code (e.g. `IN`) indicating the country where you want data-at-rest to be stored.<br>Supported values:<br>**APAC**<br>- Australia: `AU`<br>- Indonesia: `ID`<br>- India: `IN`<br>- Japan: `JP`<br>- Singapore: `SG`<br>- South Korea: `KR`<br>**Europe**<br>- EU (Germany): `DE`<br>- Switzerland: `CH`<br>- United Kingdom: `GB`<br>**LATAM**<br>- Brazil: `BR`<br>**MEA**<br>- Bahrain: `BH`<br>- South Africa: `ZA`<br>- United Arab Emirates: `AE`<br>**NORAM**<br>- Canada: `CA`<br>Once enabled, cannot be disabled or changed directly. Instead, you must [deregister](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#deregister) the number and register it again without this parameter (to disable), or include the parameter with the new country code (to change).<br>To enable local storage on a number that has already been registered, you must deregister the number, then register it again and include this parameter. |\n\n### Example Request without Local Storage\n\n```\ncurl 'https://graph.facebook.com/v22.0/106540352242922/register ' \\\n-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...' \\\n-d '\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"pin\": \"212834\"\n}\n```\n\n### Example Request with Local Storage\n\n```\ncurl 'https://graph.facebook.com/v22.0/106540352242922/register ' \\\n-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...' \\\n-d '\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"pin\": \"212834\",\n  \"data_localization_region\": \"CH\"\n}\n```\n\nAll API calls require authentication with access tokens.\n\nDevelopers can authenticate their API calls with the access token generated in the **App Dashboard** \\> **WhatsApp** \\> **API Setup**.\n\nSolution Partners must authenticate themselves with an access token with the `whatsapp_business_messaging` and `whatsapp_business_management` permissions. See [System User Access Tokens](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/get-started#system-user-access-tokens) for information.\n\n## Deregister a Business Phone Number\n\nDeregistering a business phone number makes it no longer usable with Cloud API and disables [local storage](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/local-storage/) on the number, if it had been enabled.\n\nTo deregister a business phone number, make a `POST` call to `PHONE_NUMBER_ID/deregister`:\n\n| Endpoint | Authentication |\n| --- | --- |\n| `PHONE_NUMBER_ID/deregister`<br>(See [Get Phone Number ID](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/manage-phone-numbers#get-all-phone-numbers)) | Solution Partners must authenticate themselves with an access token with the `whatsapp_business_management` permission. |\n\n### Limitations\n\n- This endpoint cannot be used to deregister a business phone number that is in use with [both Cloud API and the WhatsApp Business app](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/embedded-signup/custom-flows/onboarding-business-app-users).\n- Deregistration does not delete a number or its message history. To delete a number and its history, see [Delete Phone Number from a WABA](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/phone-numbers#delete-phone-number-from-a-waba).\n- Requests to the deregistration endpoint are limited to 10 requests per business number in a 72-hour moving window. If you exceed this amount, the API will return error code `133016`, and the business phone number will be prevented from being deregistered for the next 72 hours.\n\n### Example\n\nSample Request:\n\n```\ncurl -X POST \\\n 'https://graph.facebook.com/v22.0/FROM_PHONE_NUMBER_ID/deregister' \\\n -H 'Authorization: Bearer ACCESS_TOKEN'\n```\n\nA successful response looks like:\n\n```\n{\n  \"success\": true\n}\n```\n\n## See Also\n\n- [Resetting Your Verification Code](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/phone-number#resetting-verification-code-in-whatsapp-manager)\n- [Cloud API Local Storage](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/local-storage/)\n\n[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\|\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\\|\n\n[Business Management API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Registration](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#registration)\n\n[Register a Business Phone Number](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#register)\n\n[Limitations](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#limitations)\n\n[Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#parameters)\n\n[Example Request without Local Storage](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#example-request-without-local-storage)\n\n[Example Request with Local Storage](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#example-request-with-local-storage)\n\n[Deregister a Business Phone Number](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#deregister)\n\n[Limitations](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#limitations-2)\n\n[Example](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#example)\n\n[See Also](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#see-also)\n\n* * [Success stories](https://developers.facebook.com/success-stories/)\n\n#### Support\n\n- [Developer support](https://developers.facebook.com/support/)\n- [Bug tool](https://developers.facebook.com/support/bugs/)\n- [Platform initiatives](https://developers.facebook.com/products/responsible-platform-initiatives/)\n- [Platform terms](https://developers.facebook.com/terms/)\n- [Developer policies](https://developers.facebook.com/devpolicy/)\n\nFollow Us\n\n- [![Follow us on
