Button](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#reply-button)\n\n[Received Message Triggered by Click to WhatsApp Ads](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#received-message-triggered-by-click-to-whatsapp-ads)\n\n[Product Inquiry Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#product-inquiry-messages)\n\n[Order Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#order-messages)\n\n[User Changed Number Notification](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#user-changed-number-notification)\n\n[Message Status Updates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#message-status-updates)\n\n[Status: Message Sent](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#status--message-sent)\n\n[Status: Message Delivered](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#status--message-delivered)\n\n[Status: Message Read](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#status--message-read)\n\n[Status: Message Deleted](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#status--message-deleted)\n\n[Status failed](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#status-failed)\n\n[Status failed due to stopped marketing messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#status-failed-due-to-stopped-marketing-messages)\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=595945097590761&version=1743728118)[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\>\nCloud API\n\n\n# Webhook Notification Payload Examples\n\n## Received Messages\n\n### Text Messages\n\nThe following is an example of a text message you received from a customer:\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_ACCOUNT_ID>\",\\\n      \"changes\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"value\": {\\\n            \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n            \"metadata\": {\\\n              \"display_phone_number\": \"<BUSINESS_DISPLAY_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\\\n              \"phone_number_id\": \"<BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>\"\\\n            },\\\n            \"contacts\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"profile\": {\\\n                  \"name\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_NAME>\"\\\n                },\\\n                \"wa_id\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_ID>\"\\\n              }\\\n            ],\\\n            \"messages\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"from\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\\\n                \"id\": \"<WHATSAPP_MESSAGE_ID>\",\\\n                \"timestamp\": \"<WEBHOOK_SENT_TIMESTAMP>\",\\\n                \"text\": {\\\n                  \"body\": \"<MESSAGE_BODY_TEXT>\"\\\n                },\\\n                \"type\": \"text\"\\\n              }\\\n            ]\\\n          },\\\n          \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n        }\\\n      ]\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\n### Reaction Messages\n\nThe following is an example of a reaction message you received from a customer. You will not receive this webbook if the message the customer is reacting to is more than 30 days old.\n\n```\n{\n\"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n\"entry\": [{\\\n    \"id\": \"WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_ACCOUNT_ID\",\\\n    \"changes\": [{\\\n        \"value\": {\\\n            \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n            \"metadata\": {\\\n                \"display_phone_number\": PHONE_NUMBER,\\\n                \"phone_number_id\": PHONE_NUMBER_ID\\\n            },\\\n            \"contacts\": [{\\\n                \"profile\": {\\\n                  \"name\": \"NAME\"\\\n                },\\\n                \"wa_id\": PHONE_NUMBER\\\n              }],\\\n            \"messages\": [{\\\n                \"from\": PHONE_NUMBER,\\\n                \"id\": \"wamid.ID\",\\\n                \"timestamp\": TIMESTAMP,\\\n                \"reaction\": {\\\n                  \"message_id\": \"MESSAGE_ID\",\\\n                  \"emoji\": \"EMOJI\"\\\n                },\\\n                \"type\": \"reaction\"\\\n              }]\\\n        },\\\n        \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n      }]\\\n}]\n}\n```\n\nNote that for reactions, the `timestamp` value indicates when the customer sent the reaction, not when the webhook was generated.\n\n### Media Messages\n\nWhen a message with media is received, the WhatsApp Business Platform downloads the media. A notification is sent to your Webhook once the media is downloaded.\n\nThe Webhook notification contains information that identifies the media object and enables you to find and retrieve the object. [Use the media endpoints to retrieve the media](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/media).\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [{\\\n      \"id\": \"WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_ACCOUNT_ID\",\\\n      \"changes\": [{\\\n          \"value\": {\\\n              \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n              \"metadata\": {\\\n                  \"display_phone_number\": PHONE_NUMBER,\\\n                  \"phone_number_id\": PHONE_NUMBER_ID\\\n              },\\\n              \"contacts\": [{\\\n                  \"profile\": {\\\n                    \"name\": \"NAME\"\\\n                  },\\\n                  \"wa_id\": \"WHATSAPP_ID\"\\\n                }],\\\n              \"messages\": [{\\\n                  \"from\": PHONE_NUMBER,\\\n                  \"id\": \"wamid.ID\",\\\n                  \"timestamp\": TIMESTAMP,\\\n                  \"type\": \"image\",\\\n                  \"image\": {\\\n                    \"caption\": \"CAPTION\",\\\n                    \"mime_type\": \"image/jpeg\",\\\n                    \"sha256\": \"IMAGE_HASH\",\\\n                    \"id\": \"ID\"\\\n                  }\\\n                }]\\\n          },\\\n          \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n        }]\\\n    }]\n}\n```\n\nWhen you receive a sticker, you will get the following notification:\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"ID\",\\\n      \"changes\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"value\": {\\\n            \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n            \"metadata\": {\\\n              \"display_phone_number\": \"PHONE_NUMBER\",\\\n              \"phone_number_id\": \"PHONE_NUMBER_ID\"\\\n            },\\\n            \"contacts\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"profile\": {\\\n                  \"name\": \"NAME\"\\\n                },\\\n                \"wa_id\": \"ID\"\\\n              }\\\n            ],\\\n            \"messages\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"from\": \"SENDER_PHONE_NUMBER\",\\\n                \"id\": \"wamid.ID\",\\\n                \"timestamp\": \"TIMESTAMP\",\\\n                \"type\": \"sticker\",\\\n                \"sticker\": {\\\n                  \"mime_type\": \"image/webp\",\\\n                  \"sha256\": \"HASH\",\\\n                  \"id\": \"ID\"\\\n                }\\\n              }\\\n            ]\\\n          },\\\n          \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n        }\\\n      ]\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\n### Unknown Messages\n\nIt's possible to receive an unknown message callback notification. For example, a customer could send you a message that's not supported, such as a disappearing message (in which case we'd notify the customer that the message type is not supported), or a business is using the API to send a template message to another business.\n\nThe following is an example of a message you received from a customer that is not supported.\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [{\\\n      \"id\": \"WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_ACCOUNT_ID\",\\\n      \"changes\": [{\\\n          \"value\": {\\\n              \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n              \"metadata\": {\\\n                \"display_phone_number\": \"PHONE_NUMBER\",\\\n                \"phone_number_id\": \"PHONE_NUMBER_ID\"\\\n              },\\\n              \"contacts\": [{\\\n                  \"profile\": {\\\n                    \"name\": \"NAME\"\\\n                  },\\\n                  \"wa_id\": \"WHATSAPP_ID\"\\\n                }],\\\n              \"messages\": [{\\\n                  \"from\": \"PHONE_NUMBER\",\\\n                  \"id\": \"wamid.ID\",\\\n                  \"timestamp\": \"TIMESTAMP\",\\\n                  \"errors\": [\\\n                    {\\\n                      \"code\": 131051,\\\n                      \"details\": \"Message type is not currently supported\",\\\n                      \"title\": \"Unsupported message type\"\\\n                    }],\\\n                   \"type\": \"unknown\"\\\n                   }]\\\n            }\\\n            \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n        }],\\\n    }]\n}\n```\n\n### Location Messages\n\nThe following is an example of a location message you received from a customer:\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [{\\\n      \"id\": \"WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_ACCOUNT_ID\",\\\n      \"changes\": [{\\\n          \"value\": {\\\n              \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n              \"metadata\": {\\\n                  \"display_phone_number\": \"PHONE_NUMBER\",\\\n                  \"phone_number_id\": \"PHONE_NUMBER_ID\"\\\n              },\\\n              \"contacts\": [{\\\n                  \"profile\": {\\\n                    \"name\": \"NAME\"\\\n                  },\\\n                  \"wa_id\": \"WHATSAPP_ID\"\\\n                }],\\\n              \"messages\": [{\\\n                  \"from\": \"PHONE_NUMBER\",\\\n                  \"id\": \"wamid.ID\",\\\n                  \"timestamp\": \"TIMESTAMP\",\\\n                 \"location\": {\\\n                    \"latitude\": LOCATION_LATITUDE,\\\n                    \"longitude\": LOCATION_LONGITUDE,\\\n                    \"name\": LOCATION_NAME,\\\n                    \"address\": LOCATION_ADDRESS,\\\n                 }\\\n                }]\\\n          },\\\n          \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n        }]\\\n    }]\n}\n```\n\n### Contacts Messages\n\nThe following is an example of a contact message you received from a customer:\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\":\"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\":[{\\\n    \"id\":\"WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_ACCOUNT_ID\",\\\n    \"changes\":[{\\\n      \"value\":{\\\n        \"messaging_product\":\"whatsapp\",\\\n        \"metadata\": {\\\n          \"display_phone_number\":\"PHONE_NUMBER\",\\\n          \"phone_number_id\":\"PHONE_NUMBER_ID\"\\\n          },\\\n        \"contacts\": [{\\\n          \"profile\":{\\\n            \"name\":\"NAME\"\\\n            },\\\n          \"wa_id\":\"WHATSAPP_ID\"\\\n          }],\\\n        \"messages\":[{\\\n          \"from\":\"PHONE_NUMBER\",\\\n          \"id\":\"wamid.ID\",\\\n          \"timestamp\":\"TIMESTAMP\",\\\n          \"contacts\":[{\\\n            \"addresses\":[{\\\n              \"city\":\"CONTACT_CITY\",\\\n              \"country\":\"CONTACT_COUNTRY\",\\\n              \"country_code\":\"CONTACT_COUNTRY_CODE\",\\\n              \"state\":\"CONTACT_STATE\",\\\n              \"street\":\"CONTACT_STREET\",\\\n              \"type\":\"HOME or WORK\",\\\n              \"zip\":\"CONTACT_ZIP\"\\\n            }],\\\n            \"birthday\":\"CONTACT_BIRTHDAY\",\\\n            \"emails\":[{\\\n              \"email\":\"CONTACT_EMAIL\",\\\n              \"type\":\"WORK or HOME\"\\\n              }],\\\n            \"name\":{\\\n              \"formatted_name\":\"CONTACT_FORMATTED_NAME\",\\\n              \"first_name\":\"CONTACT_FIRST_NAME\",\\\n              \"last_name\":\"CONTACT_LAST_NAME\",\\\n              \"middle_name\":\"CONTACT_MIDDLE_NAME\",\\\n              \"suffix\":\"CONTACT_SUFFIX\",\\\n              \"prefix\":\"CONTACT_PREFIX\"\\\n              },\\\n            \"org\":{\\\n              \"company\":\"CONTACT_ORG_COMPANY\",\\\n              \"department\":\"CONTACT_ORG_DEPARTMENT\",\\\n              \"title\":\"CONTACT_ORG_TITLE\"\\\n              },\\\n            \"phones\":[{\\\n              \"phone\":\"CONTACT_PHONE\",\\\n              \"wa_id\":\"CONTACT_WA_ID\",\\\n              \"type\":\"HOME or WORK>\"\\\n              }],\\\n            \"urls\":[{\\\n              \"url\":\"CONTACT_URL\",\\\n              \"type\":\"HOME or WORK\"\\\n              }]\\\n            }]\\\n          }]\\\n        },\\\n      \"field\":\"messages\"\\\n    }]\\\n  }]\n}\n```\n\n### Received Callback from a Quick Reply Button\n\nWhen your customer clicks on a quick reply button in an [interactive message template](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages#interactive-message-templates), a response is sent. Below is an example of the callback format.\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [{\\\n      \"id\": \"WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_ACCOUNT_ID\",\\\n      \"changes\": [{\\\n          \"value\": {\\\n              \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n              \"metadata\": {\\\n                  \"display_phone_number\": PHONE_NUMBER,\\\n                  \"phone_number_id\": PHONE_NUMBER_ID\\\n              },\\\n              \"contacts\": [{\\\n                  \"profile\": {\\\n                    \"name\": \"NAME\"\\\n                  },\\\n                  \"wa_id\": \"WHATSAPP_ID\"\\\n                }],\\\n              \"messages\": [{\\\n                  \"context\": {\\\n                    \"from\": PHONE_NUMBER,\\\n                    \"id\": \"wamid.ID\"\\\n                  },\\\n                  \"from\": \"16315551234\",\\\n                  \"id\": \"wamid.ID\",\\\n                  \"timestamp\": TIMESTAMP,\\\n                  \"type\": \"button\",\\\n                  \"button\": {\\\n                    \"text\": \"No\",\\\n                    \"payload\": \"No-Button-Payload\"\\\n                  }\\\n                }]\\\n          },\\\n          \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n        }]\\\n    }]\n}\n```\n\n### Received Answer From List Message\n\nThe following webhook notification is received when a user clicks on an item from a list message you sent:\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_ACCOUNT_ID\",\\\n      \"changes\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"value\": {\\\n              \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n              \"metadata\": {\\\n                   \"display_phone_number\": \"PHONE_NUMBER\",\\\n                   \"phone_number_id\": \"PHONE_NUMBER_ID\",\\\n              },\\\n              \"contacts\": [\\\n                {\\\n                  \"profile\": {\\\n                    \"name\": \"NAME\"\\\n                  },\\\n                  \"wa_id\": \"PHONE_NUMBER_ID\"\\\n                }\\\n              ],\\\n              \"messages\": [\\\n                {\\\n                  \"from\": PHONE_NUMBER_ID,\\\n                  \"id\": \"wamid.ID\",\\\n                  \"timestamp\": TIMESTAMP,\\\n                  \"interactive\": {\\\n                    \"list_reply\": {\\\n                      \"id\": \"list_reply_id\",\\\n                      \"title\": \"list_reply_title\",\\\n                      \"description\": \"list_reply_description\"\\\n                    },\\\n                    \"type\": \"list_reply\"\\\n                  },\\\n                  \"type\": \"interactive\"\\\n                }\\\n              ]\\\n          },\\\n          \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n        }\\\n      ]\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\n### Received Answer to Reply Button\n\nThe following webhook notification is received when a user clicks on a reply button you sent:\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_ACCOUNT_ID\",\\\n      \"changes\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"value\": {\\\n              \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n              \"metadata\": {\\\n                   \"display_phone_number\": \"PHONE_NUMBER\",\\\n                   \"phone_number_id\": PHONE_NUMBER_ID,\\\n              },\\\n              \"contacts\": [\\\n                {\\\n                  \"profile\": {\\\n                    \"name\": \"NAME\"\\\n                  },\\\n                  \"wa_id\": \"PHONE_NUMBER_ID\"\\\n                }\\\n              ],\\\n              \"messages\": [\\\n                {\\\n                  \"from\": PHONE_NUMBER_ID,\\\n                  \"id\": \"wamid.ID\",\\\n                  \"timestamp\": TIMESTAMP,\\\n                  \"interactive\": {\\\n                    \"button_reply\": {\\\n                      \"id\": \"unique-button-identifier-here\",\\\n                      \"title\": \"button-text\",\\\n                    },\\\n                    \"type\": \"button_reply\"\\\n                  },\\\n                  \"type\": \"interactive\"\\\n                }\\\n              ]\\\n          },\\\n          \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n        }\\\n      ]\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\n### Received Message Triggered by Click to WhatsApp Ads\n\nYou get the following webhook when a conversation is started after a user clicks an ad with a Click to WhatsApp’s call-to-action:\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"ID\",\\\n      \"changes\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"value\": {\\\n            \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n            \"metadata\": {\\\n              \"display_phone_number\": \"PHONE_NUMBER\",\\\n              \"phone_number_id\": \"PHONE_NUMBER_ID\"\\\n            },\\\n            \"contacts\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"profile\": {\\\n                  \"name\": \"NAME\"\\\n                },\\\n                \"wa_id\": \"ID\"\\\n              }\\\n            ],\\\n            \"messages\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"referral\": {\\\n                  \"source_url\": \"AD_OR_POST_FB_URL\",\\\n                  \"source_id\": \"ADID\",\\\n                  \"source_type\": \"ad or post\",\\\n                  \"headline\": \"AD_TITLE\",\\\n                  \"body\": \"AD_DESCRIPTION\",\\\n                  \"media_type\": \"image or video\",\\\n                  \"image_url\": \"RAW_IMAGE_URL\",\\\n                  \"video_url\": \"RAW_VIDEO_URL\",\\\n                  \"thumbnail_url\": \"RAW_THUMBNAIL_URL\",\\\n                  \"ctwa_clid\": \"CTWA_CLID\"\\\n                },\\\n                \"from\": \"SENDER_PHONE_NUMBERID\",\\\n                \"id\": \"wamid.ID\",\\\n                \"timestamp\": \"TIMESTAMP\",\\\n                \"type\": \"text\",\\\n                \"text\": {\\\n                  \"body\": \"BODY\"\\\n                }\\\n              }\\\n            ]\\\n          },\\\n          \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n        }\\\n      ]\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\n## Product Inquiry Messages\n\nA Product Inquiry Message is received when a customer asks for more information about a product. These can happen when:\n\n- a customer replies to [Single or Multi-Product Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services/share-products), or\n- a customer accesses a business's catalog via another entry point, navigates to a **Product Details** page, and clicks **Message Business about this Product**.\n\nA webhooks notification for a Product Inquiry Message looks like this:\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"ID\",\\\n      \"changes\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"value\": {\\\n              \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n              \"metadata\": {\\\n                   \"display_phone_number\": \"PHONE_NUMBER\",\\\n                   \"phone_number_id\": \"PHONE_NUMBER_ID\",\\\n              },\\\n              \"contacts\": [\\\n                {\\\n                  \"profile\": {\\\n                    \"name\": \"NAME\"\\\n                  },\\\n                  \"wa_id\": \"PHONE_NUMBER_ID\"\\\n                }\\\n              ],\\\n              \"messages\": [\\\n                {\\\n                  \"from\": \"PHONE_NUMBER\",\\\n                  \"id\": \"wamid.ID\",\\\n                  \"text\": {\\\n                    \"body\": \"MESSAGE_TEXT\"\\\n                  },\\\n                  \"context\": {\\\n                    \"from\": \"PHONE_NUMBER\",\\\n                    \"id\": \"wamid.ID\",\\\n                    \"referred_product\": {\\\n                      \"catalog_id\": \"CATALOG_ID\",\\\n                      \"product_retailer_id\": \"PRODUCT_ID\"\\\n                    }\\\n                  },\\\n                  \"timestamp\": \"TIMESTAMP\",\\\n                  \"type\": \"text\"\\\n                }\\\n              ]\\\n          },\\\n          \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n        }\\\n      ]\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\n## Order Messages\n\nA webhooks notification for when a customer places an order looks like this:\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"8856996819413533\",\\\n      \"changes\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"value\": {\\\n              \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n              \"metadata\": {\\\n                   \"display_phone_number\": \"16505553333\",\\\n                   \"phone_number_id\": \"phone-number-id\",\\\n              },\\\n              \"contacts\": [\\\n                {\\\n                  \"profile\": {\\\n                    \"name\": \"Kerry Fisher\"\\\n                  },\\\n                  \"wa_id\": \"16315551234\"\\\n                }\\\n              ],\\\n              \"messages\": [\\\n                {\\\n                  \"from\": \"16315551234\",\\\n                  \"id\": \"wamid.ABGGFlCGg0cvAgo6cHbBhfK5760V\",\\\n                  \"order\": {\\\n                    \"catalog_id\": \"the-catalog_id\",\\\n                    \"product_items\": [\\\n                      {\\\n                        \"product_retailer_id\":\"the-product-SKU-identifier\",\\\n                        \"quantity\":\"number-of-item\",\\\n                        \"item_price\":\"unitary-price-of-item\",\\\n                        \"currency\":\"price-currency\"\\\n                      },\\\n                      ...\\\n                    ],\\\n                    \"text\":\"text-message-sent-along-with-the-order\"\\\n                  },\\\n                  \"context\": {\\\n                    \"from\": \"16315551234\",\\\n                    \"id\": \"wamid.gBGGFlaCGg0xcvAdgmZ9plHrf2Mh-o\"\\\n                  },\\\n                  \"timestamp\": \"1603069091\",\\\n                  \"type\": \"order\"\\\n                }\\\n              ]\\\n          },\\\n          \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n        }\\\n      ]\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\n## User Changed Number Notification\n\nWhen a user changes their phone number on WhatsApp, you receive a system message notification:\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [{\\\n      \"id\": \"WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_ACCOUNT_ID\",\\\n      \"changes\": [{\\\n          \"value\": {\\\n              \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n              \"metadata\": {\\\n                  \"display_phone_number\": PHONE_NUMBER,\\\n                  \"phone_number_id\": PHONE_NUMBER_ID\\\n              },\\\n              \"messages\": [{\\\n                  \"from\": PHONE_NUMBER,\\\n                  \"id\": \"wamid.ID\",\\\n                  \"system\": {\\\n                    \"body\": \"NAME changed from PHONE_NUMBER to PHONE_NUMBER\",\\\n                    \"new_wa_id\": NEW_PHONE_NUMBER,\\\n                    \"type\": \"user_changed_number\"\\\n                  },\\\n                  \"timestamp\": TIMESTAMP,\\\n                  \"type\": \"system\"\\\n                }]\\\n          },\\\n          \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n        }]\\\n    }]\n}\n```\n\n## Message Status Updates\n\nThe WhatsApp Business Platform sends notifications to inform you of the status of the messages between you and users. When a message is sent successfully, you receive a notification when the message is sent, delivered, and read. The order of these notifications in your app may not reflect the actual timing of the message status. View the timestamp to determine the timing, if necessary.\n\n### Status: Message Sent\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_ACCOUNT_ID>\",\\\n      \"changes\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"value\": {\\\n            \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n            \"metadata\": {\\\n              \"display_phone_number\": \"<BUSINESS_DISPLAY_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\\\n              \"phone_number_id\": \"<BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>\"\\\n            },\\\n            \"statuses\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"id\": \"<WHATSAPP_MESSAGE_ID>\",\\\n                \"status\": \"sent\",\\\n                \"timestamp\": \"<WEBHOOK_SENT_TIMESTAMP>\",\\\n                \"recipient_id\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_ID>\",\\\n                \"conversation\": {\\\n                  \"id\": \"<CONVERSATION_ID>\",\\\n                  \"expiration_timestamp\": \"<CONVERSATION_EXPIRATION_TIMESTAMP>\",\\\n                  \"origin\": {\\\n                    \"type\": \"<CONVERSATION_CATEGORY>\"\\\n                  }\\\n                },\\\n                \"pricing\": {\\\n                  \"billable\": <IS_BILLABLE?>,\\\n                  \"pricing_model\": \"CBP\",\\\n                  \"category\": \"<CONVERSATION_CATEGORY>\"\\\n                }\\\n              }\\\n            ]\\\n          },\\\n          \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n        }\\\n      ]\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\nFor [free entry point conversations](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing#free-entry-point-conversations), `origin.type` and `pricing.category` are both set to `referral_conversion`, and `pricing.billable` is set to `false`.\n\n### Status: Message Delivered\n\nThe following notification is received when a business’ message is delivered and that message is part of a [user-initiated conversation](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing/conversationpricing#how-it-works) (if that conversation did not originate in a [free entry point](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing/conversationpricing#free-entry-points)):\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_ACCOUNT_ID>\",\\\n      \"changes\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"value\": {\\\n            \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n            \"metadata\": {\\\n              \"display_phone_number\": \"<BUSINESS_DISPLAY_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\\\n              \"phone_number_id\": \"<BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>\"\\\n            },\\\n            \"statuses\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"id\": \"<WHATSAPP_MESSAGE_ID>\",\\\n                \"status\": \"sent\",\\\n                \"timestamp\": \"<WEBHOOK_SENT_TIMESTAMP>\",\\\n                \"recipient_id\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_ID>\",\\\n                \"conversation\": {\\\n                  \"id\": \"<CONVERSATION_ID>\",\\\n                  \"origin\": {\\\n                    \"type\": \"<CONVERSATION_CATEGORY>\"\\\n                  }\\\n                },\\\n                \"pricing\": {\\\n                  \"billable\": <IS_BILLABLE?>,\\\n                  \"pricing_model\": \"CBP\",\\\n                  \"category\": \"<CONVERSATION_CATEGORY>\"\\\n                }\\\n              }\\\n            ]\\\n          },\\\n          \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n        }\\\n      ]\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\nFor [free entry point conversations](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing#free-entry-point-conversations), `origin.type` and `pricing.category` are both set to `referral_conversion`, and `pricing.billable` is set to `false`.\n\n### Status: Message Read\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_ACCOUNT_ID>\",\\\n      \"changes\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"value\": {\\\n            \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n            \"metadata\": {\\\n              \"display_phone_number\": \"<BUSINESS_DISPLAY_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\\\n              \"phone_number_id\": \"<BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>\"\\\n            },\\\n            \"statuses\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"id\": \"<WHATSAPP_MESSAGE_ID>\",\\\n                \"status\": \"read\",\\\n                \"timestamp\": \"<WEBHOOK_SENT_TIMESTAMP>\",\\\n                \"recipient_id\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_ID>\"\\\n              }\\\n            ]\\\n          },\\\n          \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n        }\\\n      ]\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\n### Status: Message Deleted\n\nCurrently, the Cloud API does not support webhook status updates for deleted messages. If a user deletes a message, you will receive a webhook with an error code for an unsupported message type:\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [{\\\n    \"id\": \"WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_ACCOUNT_ID\",\\\n    \"changes\": [{\\\n      \"value\": {\\\n      \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n      \"metadata\": {\\\n        \"display_phone_number\": PHONE_NUMBER,\\\n        \"phone_number_id\": PHONE_NUMBER\\\n      },\\\n      \"contacts\": [{\\\n        \"profile\": {\\\n          \"name\": \"NAME\"\\\n          },\\\n        \"wa_id\": PHONE_NUMBER\\\n        }],\\\n    \"messages\": [{\\\n      \"from\": PHONE_NUMBER,\\\n      \"id\": \"wamid.ID\",\\\n      \"timestamp\": TIMESTAMP,\\\n      \"errors\": [{\\\n        \"code\": 131051,\\\n        \"details\": \"Message type is not currently supported\",\\\n        \"title\": \"Unsupported message type\"\\\n        }],\\\n      \"type\": \"unsupported\"\\\n      }]\\\n    },\\\n    \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n    }]\\\n  }]\n}\n```\n\nNote that there are other user behaviors that can trigger this same error message.\n\n### Status failed\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_ACCOUNT_ID>\",\\\n      \"changes\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"value\": {\\\n            \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n            \"metadata\": {\\\n              \"display_phone_number\": \"<BUSINESS_DISPLAY_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\\\n              \"phone_number_id\": \"<BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>\"\\\n            },\\\n            \"statuses\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"id\": \"<WHATSAPP_MESSAGE_ID>\",\\\n                \"status\": \"failed\",\\\n                \"timestamp\": \"<WEBHOOK_SENT_TIMESTAMP>\",\\\n                \"recipient_id\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_ID>\",\\\n                \"errors\": [\\\n                  {\\\n                    \"code\": <ERROR_CODE>,\\\n                    \"title\": \"<ERROR_TITLE>\",\\\n                    \"message\": \"<ERROR_MESSAGE>\",\\\n                    \"error_data\": {\\\n                      \"details\": \"<ERROR_DETAILS>\"\\\n                    },\\\n                    \"href\": \"https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes/\"\\\n                  }\\\n                ]\\\n              }\\\n            ]\\\n          },\\\n          \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n        }\\\n      ]\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\n### Status failed due to stopped marketing messages\n\nSyntax for a webhook indicating that the message was not sent ( `status` of `failed`) because the WhatsApp user has [stopped marketing template messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates#stop-resume-controls) from the business: (error) `code` of `131050`.\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_ACCOUNT_ID>\",\\\n      \"changes\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"value\": {\\\n            \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n            \"metadata\": {\\\n              \"display_phone_number\": \"<BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\\\n              \"phone_number_id\": \"<BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>\"\\\n            },\\\n            \"statuses\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"id\": \"<WHATSAPP_MESSAGE_ID>\",\\\n                \"status\": \"failed\",\\\n                \"timestamp\": <WEBHOOK_SENT_TIMESTAMP>,\\\n                \"recipient_id\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\\\n                \"errors\": [\\\n                  {\\\n                    \"code\": 131050,\\\n                    \"title\": \"Unable to deliver the message. This recipient has chosen to stop receiving marketing messages on WhatsApp from your business\"\\\n                  }\\\n                ]\\\n              }\\\n            ]\\\n          },\\\n          \"field\": \"messages\"\\\n        }\\\n      ]\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\n[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\|\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\\|\n\n[Business Management API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Webhook Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#unknown-messages)\n\n[Location Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#location-messages)\n\n[Contacts Delivered](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#status--message-delivered)\n\n[Status: Message Read](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#status--message-read)\n\n[Status: Message Deleted](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#status--message-deleted)\n\n[Status failed](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#status-failed)\n\n[Status failed due to stopped marketing messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#status-failed-due-to-stopped-marketing-messages)\n\n* * Solution Partners](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started-for-solution-partners)\n- [Get Started for Tech [Reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference)\n- [Support](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Data Privacy & Security](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security#data-privacy---security)\n\n[Message Flows](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security#message-flows)\n\n[Stored and Collected Data](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security#store-collected-data)\n\n[FAQs](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security#faqs)\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=595945097590761&version=1743728118)[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\>\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\\>\n[Overview](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview)\n\n# Data Privacy & Security\n\nThis page describes how Meta provides Cloud API as a standalone service for businesses to message users at scale via WhatsApp. Meta also offers additional optional services that businesses can choose to use with Cloud API. For example, a business can leverage Meta's AI capabilities to converse with customers via Cloud API. When a business chooses to use these services, different terms could apply. Please consult the applicable documentation for additional details on how Meta processes data for these services.\n\n## Message Flows\n\nWhen a user sends a message to a business that uses Cloud API, the message travels encrypted via WhatsApp between the user and Cloud API. Once the message is received by Cloud API, Cloud API decrypts the message and forwards it to the business. When a business uses Cloud API to send a message to a user, the reverse applies. Upon receiving a message from a business, Cloud API will encrypt the message using the Signal protocol before sending it to the user via WhatsApp. Per the Signal protocol, the user and Cloud API, acting on behalf of the business, negotiate encryption keys and establish a secure communication channel.\n\nWhatsApp acts as the transport channel. WhatsApp protects users by detecting unusual messaging patterns (like a business trying to message all users) and collecting spam reports from users. Cloud API, operated by Meta, acts as the intermediary between WhatsApp and businesses using Cloud API. In other words, those businesses have designated Cloud API to operate on their behalf.\n\nTo the extent any data protection or privacy law applicable to you recognizes the concepts of \"data processor\" or \"service provider\" as defined within those laws, Meta, in providing Cloud API service, acts as a data processor/service provider on behalf of the business. Cloud API will only use the messages it processes on behalf of and at the instruction of the business, unless otherwise directed. Cloud API will not automatically use WhatsApp messages to inform the ads that a person sees.\n\nFor further detail on message flows and encryption, see the [WhatsApp Encryption Overview technical whitepaper](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.whatsapp.com%2Fsecurity%2FWhatsApp-Security-Whitepaper.pdf&h=AT2KpQhHaAaXbKAn5fA9TJL4C9N7KWMElxmtckenPLcvy41Axl98ENkE91nGz-DcT2RcmbqTrnTLou628GKSvPZK1A04k3d30iLqgOZWOstCWmRWRFlLK_JmYUb2dbbMueLNvu-01fmo4Q).\n\n## Stored and Collected Data\n\nAll data collected, stored, and accessed by Cloud API is controlled and monitored to ensure proper usage and to maintain a high level of privacy.\n\n**Business Data.** Information about the businesses, including their business phone numbers, business address, etc. is maintained by Meta and the Meta Business Suite or Business Manager product, and is subject to the terms of service provided by Meta.\n\n**Message Data.** Messages have a maximum retention period of 30 days in order to provide the base features and functionality of the Cloud API service; for example, retransmissions.\n\n**User Data.** Identifiers are used as sources or destinations of individual messages; as such they are deleted within 30 days of the last status update (sent, delivered, read) of a message, unless otherwise directed.\n\nFor a more detailed resource on Cloud API's storage and processing of data, see the [Meta Business Messaging Compliance Center](https://www.facebook.com/business/business-messaging/compliance/), which includes Cloud API's certifications and compliance documentation.\n\n## FAQs\n\n[Does Meta use the WhatsApp messages that are shared with it by a business for advertising?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security#faq_361977692267623)\n\nCloud API will not automatically use WhatsApp messages to inform the ads that a person sees. However, as is always the case, businesses can use messages they receive for their own marketing purposes, which may include advertising on Facebook or other channels, like email or TV.\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security#faq_361977692267623)\n\n[Where are the servers for Cloud API?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security#faq_294098639145450)\n\nCloud API processes messages on servers in Meta data centers, which are located [here](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fdatacenters.atmeta.com%2Fall-locations%2F&h=AT2gKU4TKeUvS4m0TXViAIJWT0OBavF9FSpXGM2JP7zE9kwJVjGaUT-6EI-ke-sMnnrzc_uzRdYPU24MQEkTlVzOIEif3cKw5t4z0TcAoN6CYbUkh_Q8a_Pu9VSUvn6_TWdzGKiuGMhfAg). If a business opts to use Cloud API Local Storage, message data is stored in data centers located in another designated country. A list of the Local Storage supported locations are listed [here](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration/#limitations).\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security#faq_294098639145450)\n\n[Is the Cloud API end-to-end encrypted? What is the encryption model?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security#faq_369532614841018)\n\nSee [Cloud API Overview, Encryption](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#encryption).\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security#faq_369532614841018)\n\n[What happens to message data at rest? How long is it stored?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security#faq_251420620318210)\n\nCloud API messages at rest are encrypted. Messages have a maximum retention period of 30 days in order to provide the base features and functionality of the Cloud API service; for example, retransmissions.\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security#faq_251420620318210)\n\n[Does Meta have access to encryption keys?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security#faq_542883550349148)\n\nIn order to send and receive messages through Cloud API, Cloud API manages the encryption/decryption keys on behalf of the business. For more detail, see the [WhatsApp Encryption Overview technical whitepaper](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.whatsapp.com%2Fsecurity%2FWhatsApp-Security-Whitepaper.pdf&h=AT0khrk8pXs5tHWNogww85biXtWKN4ktPHxQwoxmXFmSU57a_NdkluKVHTUAj_GrPt4JAoCeyzd5Hfdsiht32hU0Zu2nEXaQIK4fYwxX5JrJObkG-9ipYeKxBwYK8FRDFra9n5YH2-CEQg).\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security#faq_542883550349148)\n\n[What is the security model? Which certifications does the Cloud API have?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security#faq_356015479602013)\n\nWe have obtained SOC 2 Type II and ISO 27001 reports. Please visit our [Meta Business Messaging Compliance Center](https://www.facebook.com/business/business-messaging/compliance) to learn more.\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security#faq_356015479602013)\n\n[How does Cloud API comply with regional data protection laws (such as GDPR, LGPD, and PDPB)?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security#faq_1529419660724679)\n\nMeta takes data protection and people's privacy very seriously and we comply with applicable legal, industry, and regulatory requirements governing data protection, as well as industry best practices. Cloud API customers must meet their own obligations under data protection laws, such as the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Please visit our [Meta Business Messaging Compliance Center](https://www.facebook.com/business/business-messaging/compliance) to learn more.\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security#faq_1529419660724679)\n\n[What does Meta and WhatsApp do to make sure the transfer of data from the E.U. and/or the UK to the US is compliant?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security#faq_563143525100111)\n\nMeta and WhatsApp rely on appropriate GDPR-compliant transfer mechanisms when it transfers data from the E.U. and/or the UK to the US.\n\nSee the following legal terms for additional information:\n\n- For all customers, see the [Meta Hosting Terms for Cloud API](https://www.facebook.com/legal/Meta-Hosting-Terms-Cloud-API).\n- For customers in the European Region, see the [WhatsApp Business Data Transfer Addendum](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.whatsapp.com%2Flegal%2Fbusiness-data-transfer-addendum&h=AT0elefS78tr9Wb9CP9ywMspzZh2sq1Xr1iugwDVCs7K1UuCkeUgcBJ89w0JaZ7M8JkLJDWNw_x6Qc4KMpBg_s0EeK9BDFhaVvDu2zBKmX8mI5o2Ul6fLMdg9sTAT6iC1qYotK_I1bM-AQ).\n- For customers in the UK, see the [WhatsApp Business UK Data Transfer Addendum](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.whatsapp.com%2Flegal%2Fbusiness-data-transfer-addendum-uk&h=AT29y1K3lanrikFtTKds0lxv5sDphgoRweOGAD5pb0n2P3r-MDYPOjtHuNkt5J2lEIhbq_dAbcakV27Kr4gsgubHk3nI-kAe1Oso7aiOMytyyiCgD5NxCM_YjXA7XU4NEzUmM7CN78az-g).\n\nSee the applicable [WhatsApp Business Data Processing Terms](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.whatsapp.com%2Flegal%2Fbusiness-data-processing-terms&h=AT2p1JxG3o6CiyRLgwERMAeX1dXHze5rBCnbWj10LNI-Ou34dtekwSji1dbxX99niEy1aDu2nascieYcKLwZECfyDOvEqvjZFstEwODyBfLzCmBrzccST9sF9f_Dg_w5BA00NGhC0IlBMg) or [Meta Hosting Terms for Cloud API](https://www.facebook.com/legal/Meta-Hosting-Terms-Cloud-API) for an applicable list of sub-processors.\n\nWe will ensure that our businesses and partners can continue to enjoy business solutions while keeping their data safe and secure.\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security#faq_563143525100111)\n\n[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\|\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\\|\n\n[Business Management API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Data Privacy & Metrics](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#available-metrics)\n\n[Scaling](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#scaling)\n\n[Data Privacy & Security](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#data-privacy---security)\n\n[Encryption](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#encryption)\n\n[Pair Rate Limits](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#pair-rate-limits)\n\n[Tools](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#tools)\n\n[WhatsApp Manager](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#whatsapp-manager)\n\n[Third-party SDKs](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#third-party-sdks)\n\n[Postman](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#postman)\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=595945097590761&version=1743728118)[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\>\nCloud API\n\n\n# Overview\n\nCloud API, hosted by Meta, allows medium and large businesses to communicate with customers at scale. Using the API, businesses can build systems that connect thousands of customers with agents or bots, enabling both programmatic and manual communication. Additionally, businesses can integrate the API with numerous backend systems, such as CRM and marketing platforms.\n\n## HTTP Protocol\n\nCloud API is built on Graph API, so requests are expressed using the HTTP protocol and combinations of URL parameters, headers, and request bodies. For example, a common call to Cloud API from UNIX-based command line looks like this:\n\n```\ncurl 'https://graph.facebook.com/v17.0/106540352242922/messages' \\\n-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...' \\\n-d '\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"+16505555555\",\n  \"type\": \"text\",\n  \"text\": {\n    \"preview_url\": true,\n    \"body\": \"Here'\\''s the info you requested! https://www.meta.com/quest/quest-3/\"\n  }\n}'\n```\n\nIf you are unfamiliar with Graph API, refer to our [Graph API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/) documentation to learn the basics. The main differences between Graph API and Cloud API are which access token types you will commonly be using, resource permissions, request syntax, and webhooks syntax. These differences are described in further detail in appropriate sections of the Cloud API documentation set.\n\n## Resources\n\nThese are the primary resources you will be interacting with when using the API.\n\n### Business Portfolio\n\nTo use the API, you must have a [business portfolio](https://business.facebook.com/). If you do not have a portfolio, you will be prompted to create one as part of our [Get Started](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started) process. Business portfolios serve as a container for your WhatsApp Business Account (WABA) and business phone numbers.\n\nTo learn more about business portfolios, see our [About business portfolios in Meta Business Suite](https://www.facebook.com/business/help/486932075688253) help center article.\n\n### WhatsApp Business Accounts\n\nA WhatsApp Business Account represents a business on the WhatsApp Business Platform and is composed primarily of metadata about a specific business. Most other WhatsApp resources, such as [WhatsApp Business Phone Numbers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#whatsapp-business-phone-numbers) and [WhatsApp Message Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#whatsapp-message-templates) are associated with a WABA.\n\nYou can create a WABA by following the steps in our [Get Started](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started) document. To learn more about WABAs and their limitations, see [WhatsApp Business Accounts](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/overview/business-accounts).\n\n### WhatsApp Business Phone Numbers\n\nA WhatsApp Business Phone Number (business phone number) represents a real phone number, which, once registered for use with Cloud API, can be used to send and receive messages to and from WhatsApp users via the API.\n\nBusiness phone numbers are composed mostly of metadata about the number itself and your business, and this metadata can be surfaced in the WhatsApp client when users interact with your business phone number.\n\nYou can create a business phone number by following the steps in our [Get Started](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started) document. Note that there are restrictions and limitations on business phone numbers and their uses, which are described in detail in our [Business Phone Numbers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/phone-numbers) document.\n\n### WhatsApp Message Templates\n\nWhatsApp Message Templates (template) are customizable templates that you can construct via the API using various template components. Once created, they are automatically reviewed, and if approved, can be used in template messages.\n\nThere are two basic types of messages that you can send via the API: free-form messages and template messages. Of the two, template messages are the most restrictive, since they require the use of an approved WhatsApp Message Template. However, since templates must undergo review and be approved before they can be used, template messages are less likely to receive negative feedback from recipients, which can jeopardize your ability to message customers entirely.\n\nTo learn more about templates, refer to our [Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/message-templates) document.\n\n### Webhooks\n\nWebooks are simply JSON payloads sent using the HTTP protocol to a public endpoint on your server. Cloud API relies heavily on webhooks, as the contents of any messages sent from a WhatsApp user to your business phone number will be sent as a webhook, and all outgoing message delivery status updates are reported via webhook.\n\nNote that we do offer a [sample webhook app](https://developers.facebook.com/sample-app-endpoints) that you can clone on Glitch and use for testing. The app just dumps webhooks payloads directly to a console so you can see their contents. Keep in mind that you eventually need to build your own endpoint on your own server at some point which digests webhooks according to your own business logic.\n\nSee [Meta Webhooks](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/h/docs/graph-api/webhooks) to learn more about webhooks and how to digest them, and our [Webhooks for WhatsApp Business Accounts](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/webhooks/getting-started/webhooks-for-whatsapp) document.\n\n### Test Resources\n\nWhen you first complete the steps in our [Get Started](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started) document, a test WABA and test business phone number are automatically created for you.\n\nTest WABAs and test phone numbers are useful for testing purposes, as they bypass most messaging limits and don't require a payment method on file in order to send template messages.\n\nYou can delete your business portfolio and its test resources if:\n\n- you are an admin on the business portfolio associated with the app\n- no other apps are associated with the business portfolio\n- the business portfolio is not associated with any other WABAs\n- the WABA is not associated with any other business phone numbers.\n\nTo delete your business portfolio and its test resources:\n\n1. Go to the **App Dashboard** \\> **WhatsApp** \\> **Configuration** panel.\n2. Locate the **Test Account** section.\n3. Click the **Delete** button.\n\n## Authentication and Authorization\n\n### Access Tokens\n\nThe API supports three types of tokens:\n\n- System User Access Tokens\n- Business Integration System User Access Tokens\n- User Access Tokens\n\nSee our [Access Tokens](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/get-started#access-tokens) to determine which type of token you should use. Note that **tokens should be [passed via request headers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/get-started#using-tokens-in-requests)**, not as a query string parameter.\n\n### Permissions\n\nThe API relies on the following Graph API permissions. The exact combination of permissions your app needs depends on which endpoints your app will be accessing.\n\n- **business\\_management** — needed if interacting with a business portfolio.\n- **whatsapp\\_business\\_management** — needed if interacting with a WABA and its analytics, or any of its templates or business phone numbers.\n- **whatsapp\\_business\\_messaging** — needed to send and receive messages to and from WhatsApp users.\n\nThese permissions are typically granted when generating access tokens in the Meta Business Suite. See the token generation sections in our [Access Tokens](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/get-started#access-tokens) document.\n\n## Versioning\n\nVersioning uses Graph API's [versioning protocol](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/guides/versioning). This means that all endpoint requests can include a version number, and each version will be available for roughly 2 years before it will be retired and can no longer be called.\n\n## Throughput\n\nFor each registered business phone number, Cloud API supports up to 80 messages per second (mps) by default, and up to [1,000 mps](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#higher-throughput) by automatic upgrade.\n\nThroughput is inclusive of inbound and outbound messages and all message types. Note that business phone numbers, regardless of throughput, are still subject to their WhatsApp Business Account's [business use case rate limit](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#rate-limits) and [template messaging limits](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/messaging-limits).\n\nIf you attempt to send more messages than your current throughput level allows, the API will return error code `130429` until you are within your allowed level again. Also, throughput levels are intended for messaging campaigns involving different WhatsApp user phone numbers. If you attempt to send too many messages to the same WhatsApp user number, you may encounter a [pair rate limit](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#pair-rate-limits) error.\n\n### Higher Throughput\n\nIf you meet our [eligibility requirements](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#eligibility-requirements), we will automatically upgrade your business phone number to 1,000 mps at no cost to you. Higher throughput does not incur additional charges or affect pricing.\n\nThe upgrade process itself can take up to 1 minute. During this time the number will not be usable on our platform. If used in an API request, the API will return error code `131057`. Once a business phone number has been upgraded, it will automatically be upgraded for any future throughput increases with no downtime.\n\n### Eligibility Requirements\n\n- The business phone number must be able to initiate conversations with an [unlimited number of unique customers in a rolling 24-hour period](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/messaging-limits).\n- The business phone number must be registered for use with Cloud API. If the number is registered for use with On-Premises API, it must be [migrated to Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/migrate-between-on-premises-and-cloud-api#on-premises-to-cloud) first.\n- The business phone number must have a **Medium** [quality rating](https://www.facebook.com/business/help/896873687365001) or higher.\n\n### Webhooks\n\nYour webhook servers should be able to withstand 3x the capacity of outgoing message traffic and 1x the capacity of expected incoming message traffic. For example, if sending 1,000 mps with a 30% expected response rate, your servers should be able to process up to 3000 message status webhooks plus an additional 300 incoming message webhooks.\n\nWe attempt to deliver webhooks concurrently, so we recommend you configure and load test your webhook server to handle concurrent requests with the following latency standard:\n\n- Median latency not to exceed 250ms.\n- Less than 1% latency exceeds 1s.\n\nWe will attempt to re-deliver failed webhooks for up to 7 days, with exponential backoff.\n\n### Media Messages\n\nTo take full advantage of higher throughput, we recommend that you [upload your media assets](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/media#upload-media) to our servers and use the returned media IDs in [media messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages#media-messages) instead of hosting the assets on your own servers and using media asset URLs. If you prefer (or must) host the assets on your own servers, we recommend that you use [media caching](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages#media-http-caching).\n\n### Getting Throughput Level\n\nUse the [WhatsApp Business Phone Number](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/whats-app-business-account-to-number-current-status/) endpoint to get a phone number's current throughput level:\n\n```\nGET /<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>?fields=throughput\n```\n\n### Migration\n\nIf you [migrate a business phone number](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/migrate-between-on-premises-and-cloud-api) that has multiconnect running 2 or more shards from On-Premises API to Cloud API, it will automatically be upgraded to higher throughput.\n\n## Rate Limits\n\nSee [WhatsApp Business Management API rate limits](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/overview/rate-limiting/#wa-biz-api).\n\nIn addition to these rate limits, we have more granular limits on individual resources such as template messages and test business phone numbers:\n\n- [Test message rate limit](https://www.facebook.com/business/help/2640149499569241): Applies to unverified WABAs.\n- [Quality rating and messaging limits](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/api/rate-limits#quality-rating-and-messaging-limits): Applies to verified WABAs.\n- [Capacity rate limit](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/api/rate-limits#capacity): Applies to all accounts.\n- [Business phone rate limit](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/api/rate-limits#capacity): Applies to all accounts and limits the throughput per business phone number.\n\n### Available Metrics\n\nAs a Cloud API user, you can see the number of messages sent and delivered, as well as other metrics. See [Get Account Metrics](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/analytics) for information.\n\n### Scaling\n\nWithin Meta's infrastructure, the Cloud API automatically scales and adjusts to handle your workload, within your rate limit (messaging volume and number of WABAs).\n\n### Data Privacy & Security\n\nSee our [Privacy & Security Overview](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/data-privacy-and-security) for information.\n\n### Encryption\n\nWith the Cloud API, every WhatsApp message continues to be protected by Signal protocol encryption that secures messages before they leave the device. This means messages with a WABA are securely delivered to the destination chosen by each business.\n\nThe Cloud API uses industry standard encryption techniques to protect data in transit and at rest. The API uses Graph API for sending messages and Webhooks for receiving events, and both operate over industry standard HTTPS, protected by TLS. See our Encryption Overview whitepaper for additional details.\n\nSee our [Encryption Overview whitepaper](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.whatsapp.com%2Fsecurity%2FWhatsApp-Security-Whitepaper.pdf&h=AT3YT3jIQmP0NroJCKFkZx4rGpSP6gFNGz6Gxen8XeYUcenHwBTn6SrIb7fE3npb7zAVJ1ciR45IuWuHNlW095LbdaauLiThDOupkTjOC5NGObKg605J7viOhbdz_7ZjA6d91tEaEYv62g) for additional details.\n\n### Pair Rate Limits\n\nBusiness phone numbers are limited to sending 1 message every 6 seconds **to the same WhatsApp user phone number** (0.17 messages/second). This is roughly equivalent to 10 messages per minute, or 600 messages per hour. If you exceed this limit, the API will return error code `131056` until you are within your limit again.\n\nIf necessary, you can send up to 45 messages within 6 seconds as a burst. If you send a burst, you are essentially borrowing against your pair rate limit, so you will be prevented from sending subsequent messages to the same user until the amount of time it would normally take to send that many \"non-burst\" messages to the user has passed. For example, it takes ~2 minutes to send 20 \"non-burst\" messages to a user, so if you send a burst of 20, you will have to wait ~2 minutes before you can send another message to the user.\n\nTo avoid having to calculate post-burst message wait times, we recommend that if a message send request fails after sending a burst, you try again 4^X seconds later, where X = 0, and increases by 1 after each failed attempt, until the request succeeds.\n\n## Tools\n\n### WhatsApp Manager\n\nThe WhatsApp Manager is our web app that allows you to manually manage WhatsApp resources, such as WABAs, business phone numbers, and templates, and provides an easy way to see insights and quality ratings or limits on these resources. Most functionality offered by the WhatsApp Manager is also available via the API, with a few minor exceptions.\n\nThere are several ways to access the WhatsApp Manager. Each path assumes you have already completed all steps in our [Get Started](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started) document.\n\n#### Via the Meta Business Suite\n\n1. Log into the [Meta Business Suite](https://business.facebook.com/).\n2. If you have multiple business portfolios, use the dropdown menu on the left to select the account that owns, or has access to, the WABA you wish to load in the WhatsApp Manager.\n3. In the menu on the left, navigate to **Accounts** \\> **WhatsApp Accounts**.\n4. Select the WABA.\n5. In the **Summary** tab, click the **WhatsApp Manager** button.\n\n#### Via the App Dashboard\n\n1. Go to [My Apps](https://developers.facebook.com/apps/).\n2. Select the app that is associated with the WABA you want to load in the WhatsApp Manager.\n3. In the menu on the left, navigate to **WhatsApp** \\> **Quickstart**.\n4. Click the **Account information** tile in the **WhatsApp Business** section.\n\n#### Via URL\n\nYou can go directly to the **WhatsApp Manager Overview**, which displays all of the WABAs owned by, or shared with, a given business portfolio, by visiting:\n\n> [https://business.facebook.com/wa/manage/home/](https://business.facebook.com/wa/manage/home/)\n\nBy default, the overview loads the most recent WABA you created or were granted access to, but you can use the dropdown menu on the left to select the business portfolio that contains the WABA you are trying to access . This will take you out of the overview, however, and you must then use the menu on the left and navigate to **Accounts** \\> **WhatsApp Accounts** \\> (select the desired WABA) > **Settings** \\> **WhatsApp Manager** (button).\n\nAlternatively, if you have multiple business portfolios, you can append an account's ID to the end of the URL and bookmark it for easier access:\n\n> [https://business.facebook.com/wa/manage/home/?business\\_id=<META\\_BUSINESS\\_ACCOUNT\\_ID>](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#)\n\n### Third-party SDKs\n\nThe following third-party SDKs are not affiliated with, nor maintained by, Meta.\n\n- [PyWa — a Python wrapper for WhatsApp Cloud API](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fdavid-lev%2Fpywa%2F&h=AT0dVLcstDQnCfHHJSYGyLKKOTNcfDXCGFnBBWIluRtKZ_kkt-10bw-fD6UZREV4l5s7W9LNa9TbKE5ci2hKqipjuslFSx3VyO_cRrgziE87hgAQtEFcUqAhNQCHukidcsVTdeBOIy5E3g)\n\n### Postman\n\nWe have a Cloud API Postman collection containing common queries in our [WhatsApp Business Platform](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.postman.com%2Fmeta%2Fworkspace%2Fwhatsapp-business-platform&h=AT0mvb_kCPCM54l7qLRBDb5uGh907M99HhkY-QTGq89xo_36ZIFjgSlzmr8BFa3byvk8cLQA83EHBO1XmtZJ1tk12txpE_1B-GmMNGrb4EMcIp6T3kTuOmGdXzLW_uUB5UqA2_8QlFMfsw) workspace.\n\n[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\|\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\\|\n\n[Business Management API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Overview](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#overview)\n\n[HTTP Protocol](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#http-protocol)\n\n[Resources](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#resources)\n\n[Business Portfolio](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#business-portfolio)\n\n[WhatsApp Business Accounts](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#whatsapp-business-accounts)\n\n[WhatsApp Business Phone Numbers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#whatsapp-business-phone-numbers)\n\n[WhatsApp Message Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#whatsapp-message-templates)\n\n[Webhooks](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#webhooks)\n\n[Test Resources](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#test-resources)\n\n[Authentication and Authorization](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#authentication-and-authorization)\n\n[Access Tokens](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#access-tokens)\n\n[Permissions](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#permissions)\n\n[Versioning](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#versioning)\n\n[Throughput](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#throughput)\n\n[Higher Response](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/contacts-messages#example-response)\n\n# Contacts Messages\n\nContacts messages allow you to send rich contact information directly to WhatsApp users, such as names, phone numbers, physical addresses, and email addresses.\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/441381765_2668119610015051_1596469393832242771_n.png?_nc_cat=104&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=CWe8yjojblwQ7kNvwHJDbDY&_nc_oc=Adk8zfvzbyT2QKFuFqANMoZif3aRo556TvWvQYa0uxwrLdscrQl4ZefW1S1m_hl2gjk&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=Y9PRmPNYnhd7vqx82eU56w&oh=00_AYE73luuCh2C_fQdcnr7vATbF7ajPU2KQmttldsYdZnLcg&oe=680AEFF2)\n\nWhen a WhatsApp users taps the message's profile arrow, it displays the contact's information in a profile view:\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/441391825_1516000578987481_5920245070887074504_n.png?_nc_cat=100&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=vUuEwqhTEU8Q7kNvwGTtEGw&_nc_oc=AdmPEmtb3knMiZeC88978oEEcm3GmTZQXA37ohvcSCpITGTH1kSEQI2TZDh-K_9Ke7U&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=Y9PRmPNYnhd7vqx82eU56w&oh=00_AYGXJiHZKsTna2hIcLnSHMxFT1DbelHPn5_OZu3KgEpQPQ&oe=680AECA7)\n\nEach message can include information for up to 257 contacts, although it is recommended to send fewer for usability and negative feedback reasons.\n\n## Sending Contacts Messages\n\nUse the **[POST /<WHATSAPP\\_BUSINESS\\_PHONE\\_NUMBER\\_ID>/messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages)** endpoint to send a contacts message to a WhatsApp user.\n\n### Request Syntax\n\n```\nPOST /<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>/messages\n```\n\n### Post Body\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"to\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\n  \"type\": \"contacts\",\n  \"contacts\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"addresses\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"street\": \"<STREET_NUMBER_AND_NAME>\",\\\n          \"city\": \"<CITY>\",\\\n          \"state\": \"<STATE_CODE>\",\\\n          \"zip\": \"<ZIP_CODE>\",\\\n          \"country\": \"<COUNTRY_NAME>\",\\\n          \"country_code\": \"<COUNTRY_CODE>\",\\\n          \"type\": \"<ADDRESS_TYPE>\"\\\n        }\\\n        /* Additional addresses objects go here, if using */\\\n      ],\\\n      \"birthday\": \"<BIRTHDAY>\",\\\n      \"emails\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"email\": \"<EMAIL_ADDRESS>\",\\\n          \"type\": \"<EMAIL_TYPE>\"\\\n        }\\\n        */ Additional emails objects go here, if using */\\\n      ],\\\n      \"name\": {\\\n        \"formatted_name\": \"<FULL_NAME>\",\\\n        \"first_name\": \"<FIRST_NAME>\",\\\n        \"last_name\": \"<LAST_NAME>\",\\\n        \"middle_name\": \"<MIDDLE_NAME>\",\\\n        \"suffix\": \"<SUFFIX>\",\\\n        \"prefix\": \"<PREFIX>\"\\\n      },\\\n      \"org\": {\\\n        \"company\": \"<COMPANY_OR_ORG_NAME>\",\\\n        \"department\": \"<DEPARTMENT_NAME>\",\\\n        \"title\": \"<JOB_TITLE>\"\\\n      },\\\n      \"phones\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"phone\": \"<PHONE_NUMBER>\",\\\n          \"type\": \"<PHONE_NUMBER_TYPE>\",\\\n          \"wa_id\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_ID>\"\\\n        }\\\n        /* Additional phones objects go here, if using */\\\n      ],\\\n      \"urls\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"url\": \"<WEBSITE_URL>\",\\\n          \"type\": \"<WEBSITE_TYPE>\"\\\n        },\\\n        /* Additional URLs go here, if using */\\\n      ]\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\n### Post Body Parameters\n\n| Placeholder | Description | Example Value |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| `<ADDRESS_TYPE>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Type of address, such as home or work. | `Home` |\n| `<BIRTHDAY>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Contact's birthday in YYYY-MM-DD format. | `1999-01-23` |\n| `<CITY>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>City where the contact resides. | `Menlo Park` |\n| `<COMPANY_OR_ORG_NAME>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Name of the company where the contact works. | `Lucky Shrub` |\n| `<COUNTRY_CODE>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>ISO two-letter country code. | `US` |\n| `<COUNTRY_NAME>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Country name. | `United States` |\n| `<DEPARTMENT_NAME>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Department within the company. | `Legal` |\n| `<EMAIL_ADDRESS>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Email address of the contact. | `bjohnson@luckyshrub.com` |\n| `<EMAIL_TYPE>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Type of email, such as personal or work. | `Work` |\n| `<FIRST_NAME>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Contact's first name. | `Barbara` |\n| `<FORMATTED_NAME>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>Contact's formatted name. This will appear in the message alongside the profile arrow button. | `Barbara J. Johnson` |\n| `<JOB_TITLE>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Contact's job title. | `Lead Counsel` |\n| `<LAST_NAME>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Contact's last name. | `Johnson` |\n| `<MIDDLE_NAME>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Contact's middle name. | `Joana` |\n| `<PHONE_NUMBER>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>WhatsApp user phone number. | `+16505559999` |\n| `<PHONE_NUMBER_TYPE>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Type of phone number. For example, cell, mobile, main, iPhone, home, work, etc. | `Home` |\n| `<PREFIX>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Prefix for the contact's name, such as Mr., Ms., Dr., etc. | `Dr.` |\n| `<STATE_CODE>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Two-letter state code. | `CA` |\n| `<STREET_NUMBER_AND_NAME>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Street address of the contact. | `1 Lucky Shrub Way` |\n| `<SUFFIX>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Suffix for the contact's name, if applicable. | `Esq.` |\n| `<WEBSITE_TYPE>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Type of website. For example, company, work, personal, Facebook Page, Instagram, etc. | `Company` |\n| `<WEBSITE_URL>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Website URL associated with the contact or their company. | `https://www.luckyshrub.com` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_USER_ID>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>WhatsApp user ID. If omitted, the message will display an Invite to WhatsApp button instead of the standard buttons.<br>See [Button Behavior](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/contacts-messages#button-behavior) below. | `19175559999` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>WhatsApp user phone number. | `+16505551234` |\n| `<ZIP_CODE>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Postal or ZIP code. | `94025` |\n\n## Button Behavior\n\nIf you include the contact's WhatsApp ID in the message (via the `wa_id` property), the message will include a **Message** and a **Save contact** button:\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/441399296_815661620463689_7258599973025915055_n.png?_nc_cat=102&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=HC-WBNu-uwQQ7kNvwFBaOLC&_nc_oc=Adn1PsI4es5sJ5z9JdouSuKnUNJaMqfbAqjHpls8tPQ6r0jvNOvxZsh-2l962lQfhC0&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=Y9PRmPNYnhd7vqx82eU56w&oh=00_AYHJ2ny7Kft7M-_6Toze4tsrunNwC7Ml3gNo1VNiFjzvrA&oe=680AF66A)\n\nIf the WhatsApp user taps the **Message** button, it will open a new message with the contact. If the user taps the **Save contact** button, they will be given the option to save the contact as a new contact, or to update an existing contact.\n\nIf you omit the `wa_id` property, both buttons will be replaced with an **Invite to WhatsApp** button:\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/441366594_855962089669296_5557083162637364924_n.png?_nc_cat=111&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=K8gTpfxRFLgQ7kNvwGg24jY&_nc_oc=Adn-p0qDjEP6Lh8acxC_Ylqdk36_VjJ0jVSX0bc9i7VYno2kOR9UwxO9P5k2f1iCu1Q&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=Y9PRmPNYnhd7vqx82eU56w&oh=00_AYHdRvUnuWW4x2ENC0Qp3jnVAHLNLKoNSAYEA5lfyl-sYw&oe=680ADC57)\n\n## Example Request\n\nExample request to send a contacts message with two physical addresses, two email addresses, two phone numbers, and two website URLs.\n\n```\ncurl 'https://graph.facebook.com/v22.0/106540352242922/messages' \\\n-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...' \\\n--data-raw '\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"to\": \"+16505551234\",\n  \"type\": \"contacts\",\n  \"contacts\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"addresses\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"street\": \"1 Lucky Shrub Way\",\\\n          \"city\": \"Menlo Park\",\\\n          \"state\": \"CA\",\\\n          \"zip\": \"94025\",\\\n          \"country\": \"United States\",\\\n          \"country_code\": \"US\",\\\n          \"type\": \"Office\"\\\n        },\\\n        {\\\n          \"street\": \"1 Hacker Way\",\\\n          \"city\": \"Menlo Park\",\\\n          \"state\": \"CA\",\\\n          \"zip\": \"94025\",\\\n          \"country\": \"United States\",\\\n          \"country_code\": \"US\",\\\n          \"type\": \"Pop-Up\"\\\n        }\\\n      ],\\\n      \"birthday\": \"1999-01-23\",\\\n      \"emails\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"email\": \"bjohnson@luckyshrub.com\",\\\n          \"type\": \"Work\"\\\n        },\\\n        {\\\n          \"email\": \"bjohnson@luckyshrubplants.com\",\\\n          \"type\": \"Work (old)\"\\\n        }\\\n      ],\\\n      \"name\": {\\\n        \"formatted_name\": \"Barbara J. Johnson\",\\\n        \"first_name\": \"Barbara\",\\\n        \"last_name\": \"Johnson\",\\\n        \"middle_name\": \"Joana\",\\\n        \"suffix\": \"Esq.\",\\\n        \"prefix\": \"Dr.\"\\\n      },\\\n      \"org\": {\\\n        \"company\": \"Lucky Shrub\",\\\n        \"department\": \"Legal\",\\\n        \"title\": \"Lead Counsel\"\\\n      },\\\n      \"phones\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"phone\": \"+16505559999\",\\\n          \"type\": \"Landline\"\\\n        },\\\n        {\\\n          \"phone\": \"+19175559999\",\\\n          \"type\": \"Mobile\",\\\n          \"wa_id\": \"19175559999\"\\\n        }\\\n      ],\\\n      \"urls\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"url\": \"https://www.luckyshrub.com\",\\\n          \"type\": \"Company\"\\\n        },\\\n        {\\\n          \"url\": \"https://www.facebook.com/luckyshrubplants\",\\\n          \"type\": \"Company (FB)\"\\\n        }\\\n      ]\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}'\n```\n\n## Example Response\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"contacts\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"input\": \"+16505551234\",\\\n      \"wa_id\": \"16505551234\"\\\n    }\\\n  ],\n  \"messages\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"wamid.HBgLMTY0NjcwNDM1OTUVAgARGBI1RjQyNUE3NEYxMzAzMzQ5MkEA\"\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Contacts Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/contacts-messages#contacts-messages)\n\n[Sending Contacts Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/contacts-messages#post-body-parameters)\n\n[Button Behavior](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/contacts-messages#button-behavior)\n\n[Example Request](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/contacts-messages#example-request)\n\n[Example Response](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/contacts-messages#example-response)\n\n* *
