Order](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#step-5--consumer-pays-for-the-order)\n\n[Step 6: Get Notified About Transaction Status Updates from payment gateway](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#step-6--get-notified-about-transaction-status-updates-from-payment-gateway)\n\n[Step 7: Update order status](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#step-7--update-order-status)\n\n[Step 8: Reconcile Payments](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#step-8--reconcile-payments)\n\n[Checklist for Integrated Merchants](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#checklist-for-integrated-merchants)\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=595945097590761&version=1743728118)[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\>\nCloud API\n\n\n# Accept Payments via Payment Links\n\nYour businesses can enable customers to pay for their orders by bringing in all the payment methods supported on your platform to WhatsApp. Businesses can send customers invoice( `order_details`) messages, then get notified about payment status updates via webhook notifications from Payment Gateway.\n\nThis feature is not publicly available yet. Please reach out to whatsappindia-bizpayments-support@meta.com to know more.\n\n## Overview\n\nCurrently, customers browse business catalogs, add products to cart, and send orders in with our set of commerce messaging solutions, which includes [Single Product Message, Multi Product Message, and Product Detail Page](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/guides/commerce-guides/share-products-with-customers).\n\nWith the WhatsApp Messaging API, businesses can send customers a bill to complete the order with one of the supported payment instrument.\n\n## How It Works\n\nThe business must send an `order_details` message for the consumer to initiate payment. This type of message is a new type of interactive message, which always contains the same 4 main components: **header**, **body**, **footer**, and **action**. Inside the **action** component, the business includes all the information needed for the customer to complete their payment.\n\nEach `order_details` message contains a unique `reference_id` provided by the business, and that unique number is used throughout the flow to track the order. This `reference_id` is used to generate the payment link from Payment Gateway.\n\nOnce the message is sent, the business waits for a payment or transaction status updates directly from Payment Gateway. Upon receiving payment signal for an order, business should relay this payment signal to consumer client through interactive order status( `order_status`) message.\n\nUpdating user about the payment signal is important as this message updates the order details message and order details view for the consumer reflecting the order confirmation from merchant. This is shown with an example in subsequent sections.\n\n## Purchase Flow in App\n\nIn the WhatsApp customer app, the purchase flow has the following steps:\n\n1. Customer sends an order with selected products to the business or business identifies the products that the customer has shown interest to purchase.\n\n2. After receiving the order or identifying the product, if a business accepts payment methods other than UPI, such as credit cards and payment wallets, etc. then business will send a message to the user to get their preferred payment method for the order.\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=1078308010267750&version=1734499717)\n\n3.\n    When consumers want to pay using other payment method option, the business should generate the payment link by calling Payment Gateway by providing the unique \"reference-id\" and other information like amount, validity etc, then business can use the generated payment link to construct the order details message and send to the consumer.\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=1058468545282068&version=1734499717)![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=294802256669573&version=1734499717)\n\n4. When the consumer taps the Pay now/continue button, consumer will be redirected to the payment link within specially designed In-App browser to present with the list of supported payment options such as credit card, debit card, wallet or UPI apps. Consumers can choose any one of the payment option to pay for the order.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThe following is a sample payment link redirect within In-App Browser accepting various payment methods like credit, debit, wallet and UPI apps.\n\n\n\n\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=277400535146984&version=1734499717)![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=663652875865242&version=1734499717)\n\n5. Once the payment is complete, the business will receive a notification from Payment Gateway and the business needs to send order status updates to the consumer client notifying consumers about the progress on their order, this will update the order details message CTAs, Order details screen and Order status. The order status should contain the matching \"reference-id\" of order details.\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=1775753602861852&version=1734499717)![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=151744618016127&version=1734499717)\n\n\n## Integration Steps\n\nThe steps outlined below assume that the business is about to send order details message to consumer client.\n\nThe following sequence diagram demonstrates the typical integration flow for WA Payments API:\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=302103699199219&version=1734499717)\n\n### Step 1: Get Payment Link from Payment Gateway\n\nOnce the consumer has expressed their interest to purchase an item using payment link. Business needs to call payment gateway with necessary information like reference-id, amount and validity to generate the payment link. Following is a sample payment link:\n\n```\nhttps://rzp.io/i/rNiAagU8y\n```\n\nBusiness needs to use the same reference-id, amount and expiration in invoice( `order_details`) interactive message.\n\n### Step 2: Assemble the Interactive Object\n\nTo send an `order_details` message, businesses must assemble an [interactive object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages#interactive-object) of type `order_details` with the following components:\n\n| Object | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `type`<br>object | **Required.**<br>Must be \"order\\_details\". |\n| `header`<br>object | **Optional.**<br>Header content displayed on top of a message. If a header is not provided, the API uses an image of the first available product as the header |\n| `body`<br>object | **Required.**<br>An object with the body of the message. The object contains the following field:<br>`text` string<br>- **Required** if `body` is present. The content of the message. Emojis and markdown are supported. Maximum length is 1024 characters |\n| `footer`<br>object | **Optional.**<br>An object with the footer of the message. The object contains the following fields:<br>`text` string<br>- **Required** if `footer` is present. The footer content. Emojis, markdown, and links are supported. Maximum length is 60 characters |\n| `action`<br>object | **Required.**<br>An action object you want the user to perform after reading the message. This action object contains the following fields:<br>`name` string<br>- **Required**. Must be \"review\\_and\\_pay\"<br>`parameters` object<br>- See [Parameters Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#paramobject) for information |\n\n#### Parameters Object\n\n| Object | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `reference_id`<br>string | **Required.**<br>Unique identifier for the order or invoice provided by the business. It is case sensitive and cannot be an empty string and can only contain English letters, numbers, underscores, dashes, or dots, and should not exceed 35 characters.<br>The `reference_id` must be unique for each `order_details` message for the same business. If the partner would like to send multiple order\\_details messages for the same order, invoice, etc. it is recommended to include a sequence number in the `reference_id` (for example, -) to ensure `reference_id` uniqueness. |\n| `type`<br>object | **Required.**<br>The type of goods being paid for in this order. Current supported options are `digital-goods` and `physical-goods` |\n| `beneficiaries`<br>array | **Required for shipped physical-goods.**<br>An array of beneficiaries for this order. A beneficiary is an intended recipient for shipping the physical goods in the order. It contains the following fields:<br>Beneficiary information isn't shown to users but is needed for legal and compliance reasons.<br>`name` string<br>- **Required.** Name of the individual or business receiving the physical goods. Cannot exceed 200 characters<br>`address_line1` string<br>- **Required.** Shipping address (Door/Tower Number, Street Name etc.). Cannot exceed 100 characters<br>`address_line2` string<br>- **Optional.** Shipping address (Landmark, Area, etc.). Cannot exceed 100 characters<br>`city` string<br>- **Required.** Name of the city. <br>`state` string<br>- **Required.** Name of the state.<br>`country` string<br>- **Required.** Must be \"India\".<br>`postal_code` string<br>- **Required.** 6-digit zipcode of shipping address. |\n| `payment_type` | **Required.**<br>Must be \"upi\". |\n| `payment_settings` | **Required.**<br>See [Payment Settings Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#payment_settings) for more details. |\n| `currency` | **Required.**<br>The currency for this order. Currently the only supported value is `INR`. |\n| `total_amount`<br>object | **Required.**<br>The `total_amount` object contains the following fields:<br>`offset` integer<br>- **Required.** Must be `100` for `INR`.<br>`value` integer<br>- **Required.** Positive integer representing the amount value multiplied by offset. For example, ₹12.34 has value 1234.<br>`total_amount.value` must be equal to `order.subtotal.value` \\+ `order.tax.value` \\+ `order.shipping.value` \\- `order.discount.value`. |\n| `order`<br>object | **Required.**<br>See [order object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#ordobject) for more information. |\n\n#### Payment Setting Object\n\n| Object | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `type`<br>string | **Required.**<br>Must be `payment_link`. |\n| `payment_link`<br>object | **Required.**<br>Refer [Payment Link Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#payment_link) for more information. |\n\n#### Payment Link Object\n\n| Object | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `uri`<br>string | **Required.**<br>A valid payment link generated through payment gateway.<br>Generated payment links domains needs to be enabled to accept payments. Please reach out to whatsappindia-bizpayments-support@meta.com to know more. |\n| `success_url`<br>string | **Optional.**<br>The flow terminated with success status, when success\\_url is hit. |\n| `cancel_url`<br>string | **Optional.**<br>The flow ends with failure, when the cancel\\_url is triggered. |\n\n#### Order Object\n\n| Object | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `status`<br>string | **Required.**<br>Only supported value in the `order_details` message is `pending`.<br>In an `order_status` message, `status` can be: `pending`, `captured`, or `failed`. |\n| `type`<br>string | **Optional.**<br>Only supported value is `quick_pay`. When this field is passed in we hide the \"Review and Pay\" button and only show the \"Pay Now\" button in the order details bubble. |\n| `items`<br>object | **Required.**<br>An object with the list of items for this order, containing the following fields:<br>`retailer_id` string<br>- **Optional.** Content ID for an item in the order from your catalog.<br>`name` string<br>- **Required.** The item’s name to be displayed to the user. Cannot exceed 60 characters<br>`image` object<br>- **Optional.** Custom image for the item to be displayed to the user. See [item image object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#item_image_object) for information<br>Using this image field will limit the items array to a maximum of 10 items and this cannot be used with `retailer_id` or `catalog_id`.<br>`amount` amount object with value and offset -- refer total amount field above<br>- **Required.** The price per item<br>`sale_amount` amount object<br>- **Optional.** The discounted price per item. This should be less than the original amount. If included, this field is used to calculate the subtotal amount<br>`quantity` integer<br>- **Required.** The number of items in this order, this field cannot be decimal has to be integer. <br>`country_of_origin` string<br>- **Required** if `catalog_id` is not present. The country of origin of the product<br>`importer_name` string<br>- **Required** if `catalog_id` is not present. Name of the importer company<br>`importer_adress` string<br>- **Required** if `catalog_id` is not present. Address of importer company |\n| `subtotal`<br>object | **Required.**<br>The value **must be equal** to sum of `order.amount.value` \\\\* `order.amount.quantity`. Refer to `total_amount` description for explanation of `offset` and `value` fields<br>The following fields are part of the `subtotal` object:<br>`offset` integer<br>- **Required.** Must be `100` for `INR`<br>`value` integer<br>- **Required.** Positive integer representing the amount value multiplied by offset. For example, ₹12.34 has value 1234 |\n| `tax`<br>object | **Required.**<br>The tax information for this order which contains the following fields:<br>`offset` integer<br>- **Required.** Must be `100` for `INR`<br>`value` integer<br>- **Required.** Positive integer representing the amount value multiplied by offset. For example, ₹12.34 has value 1234<br>`description` string<br>- **Optional.** Max character limit is 60 characters |\n| `shipping`<br>object | **Optional.**<br>The shipping cost of the order. The object contains the following fields:<br>`offset` integer<br>- **Required.** Must be `100` for `INR`<br>`value` integer<br>- **Required.** Positive integer representing the amount value multiplied by offset. For example, ₹12.34 has value 1234<br>`description` string<br>- **Optional.** Max character limit is 60 characters |\n| `discount`<br>object | **Optional.**<br>The discount for the order. The object contains the following fields:<br>`offset` integer<br>- **Required.** Must be `100` for `INR`<br>`value` integer<br>- **Required.** Positive integer representing the amount value multiplied by offset. For example, ₹12.34 has value 1234<br>`description` string<br>- **Optional.** Max character limit is 60 characters<br>`discount_program_name` string<br>- **Optional.** Text used for defining incentivised orders. If order is incentivised, the merchant needs to define this information. Max character limit is 60 characters |\n| `catalog_id`<br>object | **Optional.**<br>Unique identifier of the Facebook catalog being used by the business.<br>If you do not provide this field, you must provide the following fields inside the items object: `country_of_origin`, `importer_name`, and `importer_address` |\n| `expiration`<br>object | **Optional.**<br>Expiration for that order. Business must define the following fields inside this object:<br>`timestamp` string – UTC timestamp in seconds of time when order should expire. Minimum threshold is 300 seconds<br>`description` string – Text explanation for expiration. Max character limit is 120 characters |\n\n#### Item Image Object\n\n| Object | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `link`<br>string | **Required.**<br>A link to the image that will be shown to the user. Must be an `image/jpeg` or `image/png` and 8-bit, RGB or RGBA. Follows same requirements as image in [media](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/media#supported-media-types) |\n\nThe `parameters` value is a stringified JSON object.\n\nBy the end, the interactive object should look something like this for a catalog-based integration:\n\n```\n{\n  \"interactive\": {\n    \"type\": \"order_details\",\n    \"header\": {\n      \"type\": \"image\",\n      \"image\": {\n        \"link\": \"http(s)://the-url\",\n        \"provider\": {\n          \"name\": \"provider-name\"\n        }\n      }\n    },\n    \"body\": {\n      \"text\": \"your-text-body-content\"\n    },\n    \"footer\": {\n      \"text\": \"your-text-footer-content\"\n    },\n    \"action\": {\n      \"name\": \"review_and_pay\",\n      \"parameters\": {\n        \"reference_id\": \"reference-id-value\",\n        \"type\": \"digital-goods\",\n        \"payment_type\": \"upi\",\n        \"payment_settings\": [\\\n          {\\\n            \"type\": \"payment_link\",\\\n            \"payment_link\": {\\\n              \"uri\": \"https://the-payment-link\"\\\n            }\\\n          }\\\n        ],\n        \"currency\": \"INR\",\n        \"total_amount\": {\n          \"value\": 21000,\n          \"offset\": 100\n        },\n        \"order\": {\n          \"status\": \"pending\",\n          \"catalog_id\": \"the-catalog_id\",\n          \"expiration\": {\n            \"timestamp\": \"utc_timestamp_in_seconds\",\n            \"description\": \"cancellation-explanation\"\n          },\n          \"items\": [\\\n            {\\\n              \"retailer_id\": \"1234567\",\\\n              \"name\": \"Product name, for example bread\",\\\n              \"amount\": {\\\n                \"value\": 10000,\\\n                \"offset\": 100\\\n              },\\\n              \"quantity\": 1,\\\n              \"sale_amount\": {\\\n                \"value\": 100,\\\n                \"offset\": 100\\\n              }\\\n            }\\\n          ],\n          \"subtotal\": {\n            \"value\": 20000,\n            \"offset\": 100\n          },\n          \"tax\": {\n            \"value\": 1000,\n            \"offset\": 100,\n            \"description\": \"optional_text\"\n          },\n          \"shipping\": {\n            \"value\": 1000,\n            \"offset\": 100,\n            \"description\": \"optional_text\"\n          },\n          \"discount\": {\n            \"value\": 1000,\n            \"offset\": 100,\n            \"description\": \"optional_text\",\n            \"discount_program_name\": \"optional_text\"\n          }\n        }\n      }\n    }\n  }\n}\n```\n\nThe `parameters` value is a stringified JSON object.\n\nFor a non-catalog based integration i.e. when catalog-id is not present, an example payload looks as follows:\n\n```\n{\n  \"interactive\": {\n    \"type\": \"order_details\",\n    \"header\": {\n      \"type\": \"image\",\n      \"image\": {\n        \"id\": \"your-media-id\"\n      }\n    },\n    \"body\": {\n      \"text\": \"your-text-body-content\"\n    },\n    \"footer\": {\n      \"text\": \"your-text-footer-content\"\n    },\n    \"action\": {\n      \"name\": \"review_and_pay\",\n      \"parameters\": {\n        \"reference_id\": \"reference-id-value\",\n        \"type\": \"digital-goods\",\n        \"payment_type\": \"upi\",\n        \"payment_settings\": [\\\n          {\\\n            \"type\": \"payment_link\",\\\n            \"payment_link\": {\\\n              \"uri\": \"https://the-payment-link\"\\\n            }\\\n          }\\\n        ],\n        \"currency\": \"INR\",\n        \"total_amount\": {\n          \"value\": 21000,\n          \"offset\": 100\n        },\n        \"order\": {\n          \"status\": \"pending\",\n          \"expiration\": {\n            \"timestamp\": \"utc_timestamp_in_seconds\",\n            \"description\": \"cancellation-explanation\"\n          },\n          \"items\": [\\\n            {\\\n              \"name\": \"Product name, for example bread\",\\\n              \"amount\": {\\\n                \"value\": 10000,\\\n                \"offset\": 100\\\n              },\\\n              \"quantity\": 1,\\\n              \"sale_amount\": {\\\n                \"value\": 100,\\\n                \"offset\": 100\\\n              },\\\n              \"country_of_origin\": \"country-of-origin\",\\\n              \"importer_name\": \"name-of-importer-business\",\\\n              \"importer_address\": {\\\n                \"address_line1\": \"B8/733 nand nagri\",\\\n                \"address_line2\": \"police station\",\\\n                \"city\": \"East Delhi\",\\\n                \"zone_code\": \"DL\",\\\n                \"postal_code\": \"110093\",\\\n                \"country_code\": \"IN\"\\\n              }\\\n            },\\\n            {\\\n              \"name\": \"Product name, for example bread\",\\\n              \"amount\": {\\\n                \"value\": 10000,\\\n                \"offset\": 100\\\n              },\\\n              \"quantity\": 1,\\\n              \"sale_amount\": {\\\n                \"value\": 100,\\\n                \"offset\": 100\\\n              },\\\n              \"country_of_origin\": \"country-of-origin\",\\\n              \"importer_name\": \"name-of-importer-business\",\\\n              \"importer_address\": {\\\n                \"address_line1\": \"B8/733 nand nagri\",\\\n                \"address_line2\": \"police station\",\\\n                \"city\": \"East Delhi\",\\\n                \"zone_code\": \"DL\",\\\n                \"postal_code\": \"110093\",\\\n                \"country_code\": \"IN\"\\\n              }\\\n            }\\\n          ],\n          \"subtotal\": {\n            \"value\": 20000,\n            \"offset\": 100\n          },\n          \"tax\": {\n            \"value\": 1000,\n            \"offset\": 100,\n            \"description\": \"optional_text\"\n          },\n          \"shipping\": {\n            \"value\": 1000,\n            \"offset\": 100,\n            \"description\": \"optional_text\"\n          },\n          \"discount\": {\n            \"value\": 1000,\n            \"offset\": 100,\n            \"description\": \"optional_text\",\n            \"discount_program_name\": \"optional_text\"\n          }\n        }\n      }\n    }\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### Step 3: Add Common Message Parameters\n\nOnce the interactive object is complete, append the other parameters that make a message: `recipient_type`, `to`, and `type`. Remember to set the `type` to `interactive`.\n\n```\n{\n   \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n   \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n   \"to\": \"PHONE_NUMBER\",\n   \"type\": \"interactive\",\n   \"interactive\": {\n     // interactive object here\n   }\n }\n\n```\n\nThese are [parameters common to all message types](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/api/messages#sending-messages).\n\n### Step 4:Make a POST Call to Messages Endpoint\n\nMake a POST call to the [`/[PHONE_NUMBER_ID]/messages`](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages) endpoint with the `JSON` object you have assembled. If your message is sent successfully, you get the following response:\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"contacts\": [ {\\\n      \"input\": \"[PHONE_NUMBER_ID]\",\\\n      \"wa_id\": \"[PHONE-NUMBER_ID]\"\\\n  } ],\n  \"messages\": [ {\\\n      \"id\": \"wamid.HBgLMTY1MDUwNzY1MjAVAgARGBI5QTNDQTVCM0Q0Q0Q2RTY3RTcA\"\\\n  } ]\n}\n\n```\n\nFor all errors that can be returned and guidance on how to handle them, see [WhatsApp Cloud API, Error Codes](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes).\n\n### Step 5: Consumer Pays for the Order\n\nConsumers can pay using WhatsApp payment method or using any UPI supported app that is installed on the device.\n\n### Step 6: Get Notified About Transaction Status Updates from payment gateway\n\nBusinesses receive updates to the invoice via payment gateway webhooks, when the status of the user-initiated transaction changes. The unique identifier reference-id passed in `order_details` message can be used to map the transaction to the consumer invoice or interactive order details message.\n\n### Step 7: Update order status\n\nUpon receiving transaction signals from payment gateway through webhook, the business must update the order status to keep the user up to date. Currently we support the following order status values:\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=634034961253028&version=1742854961)\n\n| Value | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `pending` | User has not successfully paid yet |\n| `processing` | User payment authorized, merchant/partner is fulfilling the order, performing service, etc. |\n| `partially-shipped` | A portion of the products in the order have been shipped by the merchant |\n| `shipped` | All the products in the order have been shipped by the merchant |\n| `completed` | The order is completed and no further action is expected from the user or the partner/merchant |\n| `canceled` | The partner/merchant would like to cancel the `order_details` message for the order/invoice. The status update will fail if there is already a `successful` or `pending` payment for this `order_details` message |\n\nTypically businesses update the `order_status` using either the WhatsApp payment status change notifications or their own internal processes. To update `order_status`, the partner sends an `order_status` message to the user.\n\n```\n{\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"whatsapp-id\",\n  \"type\": \"interactive\",\n  \"interactive\": {\n    \"type\": \"order_status\",\n    \"body\": {\n      \"text\": \"your-text-body-content\"\n    },\n    \"action\": {\n      \"name\": \"review_order\",\n      \"parameters\": {\n        \"reference_id\": \"reference-id-value\",\n        \"order\": {\n          \"status\": \"processing | partially_shipped | shipped | completed | canceled\",\n          \"description\": \"optional-text\"\n        }\n      }\n    }\n  }\n}\n```\n\nThe following table describes the returned values:\n\n| Value | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `reference_id` | The ID provided by the partner in the `order_details` message |\n| `status` | The new order `status` |\n| `description` | Optional text for sharing status related information in `order_details`. Could be useful while sending cancellation. Max character limit is 120 characters |\n\nFor all errors that can be returned and guidance on how to handle them, see [WhatsApp On-Premises API, Errors](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/on-premises/errors).\n\nMerchant should always post this order-status message to consumer after reciving transaction updates for an order. As the order\\_details message and order details screen experience is tied to to the order status updates.\n\n### Step 8: Reconcile Payments\n\nBusinesses should use their bank statements to reconcile the payments using the `reference_id` provided in the `order_details` messages.\n\n## Checklist for Integrated Merchants\n\n- Ensure that `order_status` message is send to consumer informing them about updates to an order after receiving transaction updates for an order.\n\n- Ensure the merchant is verified and WABA contact is marked with a verified check.\n\n- Verify the WABA is mapped to appropriate merchant initiated messaging tier(1k, 10k and 100k per day)\n\n- Merchant should list the customer support informatoin in the profile screen incase consumer wants to report any issues.\n\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Accept Payments via Payment Links](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#accept-payments-via-payment-links)\n\n[Overview](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#overview)\n\n[How It Works](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#how-it-works)\n\n[Purchase Flow in App](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#purchase-flow-in-app)\n\n[Integration Steps](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#integration-steps)\n\n[Step 1: Get Payment Link from Payment Gateway](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#step-1)\n\n[Step 2: Assemble the Interactive Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#step-2--assemble-the-interactive-object)\n\n[Step 3: Add Common Message Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#step-3--add-common-message-parameters)\n\n[Step 4:Make a POST Call to Messages Endpoint](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#step-4-make-a-post-call-to-messages-endpoint)\n\n[Step 5: Consumer Pays for the Order](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#step-5--consumer-pays-for-the-order)\n\n[Step 6: Get Notified About Transaction Status Updates from payment gateway](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#step-6--get-notified-about-transaction-status-updates-from-payment-gateway)\n\n[Step 7: Update order status](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#step-7--update-order-status)\n\n[Step 8: Reconcile Payments](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#step-8--reconcile-payments)\n\n[Checklist for Integrated Merchants](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/payment-links#checklist-for-integrated-merchants)\n\n* * *\n\n![](https://scontent-lax3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/459257729_1010347667767763_3581566724399163588_n.svg?_nc_cat=111&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=SQN4xkEmOWYQ7kNvwF27Geg&_nc_oc=AdklzEHAjFuUadLGo2X0EolF4Dk3dMoiH83bAkIIY80o9H0XFhI5iyFB3ogFUcYKexI&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-2.xx&_nc_gid=nkbmHnfeJT7jh0uwGP0rsQ&oh=00_AYEvuQb_dN7EmIjuzrM0HJlz9006CUfUyBi1wGTV1IgU8w&oe=680B032C)\n\n- number](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/local-storage/#step-2--register-the-number)\n\n[Getting Local Storage code](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/local-storage/#step-2--request-a-verification-code)\n\n[Step 3: Verify the business phone number](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/local-storage/#step-3--verify-the-business-phone-number)\n\n[Step 4: Reregister the business phone number](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/local-storage/#step-4--reregister-the-business-phone-number)\n\n[Disabling Local Storage (v20 and older)](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/local-storage/#disabling-local-storage--v20-and-older-)\n\n[FAQs](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/local-storage/#faqs)\n\n# Cloud API Local Storage\n\nCloud API Local Storage gives you the option to control where your message data is stored at rest. If your company is in a regulated industry such as finance, government, or healthcare, you may prefer to have your message data stored in a specific country when at rest because of regulatory or company policies.\n\nCloud API Local Storage provides such an extra layer of data protection by implementing additional data management controls. Local Storage feature comprises of two additional constraints in Cloud API runtime environment:\n\n- **Data-in-use TTL (Time-to-Live)**: A new data retention constraint is implemented, enforcing how long message content is accessible to Cloud API on Meta data centers outside the target jurisdiction while being processed. When using Local Storage, Cloud API will automatically delete message content from Meta data centers after a TTL of 60 minutes. There will be no message content on Meta servers outside the target jurisdiction after the TTL when using local storage.\n- **Data-at-rest location**: A new data placement constraint is implemented, enforcing which physical location Cloud API is allowed to use as a persistent storage for message content. Text and media payload of both incoming and outgoing messages will be stored in the Cloud API in-country (non-US) data stores.\n\nOnce Local Storage is enabled for a business phone number, Cloud API Local Storage uses a localized storage in the specified country for persisting message content, instead of using its default storage based in the US.\n\nLocal Storage feature supplements other [Cloud API privacy and security controls](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fbusiness.whatsapp.com%2Ftrust-and-safety&h=AT1CpByDSCgeypRyGsm8S8UnjaKzA8esc9GF-MIcyGLJKbb7eI45217lgFfrUggA1AdBd8090f1FDz0BEq6F6t-NWxE8wjOy6KNlgaZhwW8kEA54bEMKn3PRt-mtJ5E8J7koaSu2OpfhmQ), and allows customers to ensure a higher level of compliance with local data protection regulations.\n\n## Localized Data\n\nCloud API implements localization for message content. The following message flows are covered by Local Storage feature:\n\n- **Outgoing messages**: messages you are sending to recipients via Cloud API\n- **Incoming messages**: messages you are receiving back via Cloud API\n\nThe following message types are covered by Local Storage feature:\n\n- **Text messages**: textual payload (message body) is localized\n- **Media messages**: media (audio, document image or video) payload is localized\n- **Template messages**: components with text / media payload are localized\n\nAlso, a limited set of metadata attributes is included in the localized data set, in order to correctly associate the encrypted localized message payload with the originally processed message and to audit the fact of localization. The stored metadata is protected with tokenization and encryption.\n\nThe goal of Cloud API Local Storage feature is to allow your business to directly control where your sensitive data-at-rest is stored via Cloud API settings - at the same time giving you flexibility to choose data placement locations globally.\n\n## Available Regions\n\nThe regions permitted by Cloud API Local Storage are reflected in the [Meta Hosting Terms for Cloud API](https://www.facebook.com/legal/Meta-Hosting-Terms-Cloud-API). The regions currently available for Local Storage can be found under the `data_localization_region` parameter [set during phone number registration](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration/#register).\n\n## Requirements\n\nLocal Storage can only be enabled or disabled on business phone numbers when they are in an unregistered state.\n\n## Limitations\n\nMedia files uploaded by a phone number with Local Storage enabled are only accessible to that specific phone number and cannot be shared with other phone numbers associated with the business.\n\n## Enabling Local Storage\n\nFollow the steps below to enable local storage for an unregistered business phone number using API\nversion 21.0 or newer. If you are using an older API version, see [Enabling Local Storage (v20 and older)](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/local-storage/#enabling-local-storage--v20-and-older-).\n\n### Step 1: Enable local storage on the number\n\nUse the [**POST /<WHATSAPP\\_BUSINESS\\_PHONE\\_NUMBER\\_ID>/settings**](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/whats-app-business-account-to-number-current-status/settings/#Updating) endpoint to enable local storage on the unregistered business phone number:\n\n#### Request Syntax\n\n```\nPOST /<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>/settings\n\n{\n  \"storage_configuration\": {\n    \"status\": \"IN_COUNTRY_STORAGE_ENABLED\",\n    \"data_localization_region\": \"<COUNTRY_CODE>\"\n  }\n}\n```\n\nSet `<COUNTRY_CODE>` to the [country code](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/local-storage/#available-regions) of the country where data-at-rest should be stored.\n\n#### Response Syntax\n\n```\n{\n  \"success\": <SUCCESS>\n}\n```\n\nUpon success, `<SUCCESS>` will be set to `true`.\n\n#### Example Request\n\n```\ncurl 'https://graph.facebook.com/v22.0/106540352242922/settings' \\\n-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...' \\\n-d '\n{\n  \"storage_configuration\": {\n    \"status\": \"IN_COUNTRY_STORAGE_ENABLED\",\n    \"data_localization_region\": \"BR\"\n  }\n}'\n```\n\n#### Example Response\n\n```\n{\n  \"success\": true\n}\n```\n\n### Step 2: Register the number\n\nUse the [**POST /<WHATSAPP\\_BUSINESS\\_PHONE\\_NUMBER\\_ID>/register**](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/whats-app-business-account-to-number-current-status/register/#Creating) endpoint to register the business phone number.\n\n#### Request Syntax\n\n```\nPOST /<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>/register\n\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"pin\": \"<TWO_STEP_PIN>\"\n}\n```\n\nSet `<TWO_STEP_PIN>` to the desired two-step verification PIN for the business phone number.\n\n#### Response Syntax\n\n```\n{\n  \"success\": <SUCCESS>\n}\n```\n\nUpon success, `<SUCCESS>` will be set to `true`.\n\n#### Example Request\n\n```\ncurl 'https://graph.facebook.com/v21.0/v22.0/register' \\\n-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...' \\\n-d '\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"pin\": \"123456\"\n}'\n```\n\n#### Example Response\n\n```\n{\n  \"success\": true\n}\n```\n\n## Getting Local Storage Settings\n\nUse the [**GET /<WHATSAPP\\_BUSINESS\\_PHONE\\_NUMBER\\_ID>/settings**](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/whats-app-business-account-to-number-current-status/settings#Reading) endpoint to get local storage settings on a WhatsApp Business Phone Number. For example:\n\n```\ncurl 'https://graph.facebook.com/v22.0/179776755229976/settings' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...'\n```\n\nThis returns a [node that represents the local storage settings](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/whats-app-business-account-to-number-current-status-settings/) on the business phone number. For example:\n\n```\n{\n  \"storage_configuration\": {\n    \"status\": \"IN_COUNTRY_STORAGE_ENABLED\",\n    \"data_localization_region\": \"BR\"\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## Disabling Local Storage\n\nUse the [**POST /<WHATSAPP\\_BUSINESS\\_PHONE\\_NUMBER\\_ID>/settings**](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/whats-app-business-account-to-number-current-status/settings/#Updating) endpoint to disable local storage on an unregistered business phone number using API version 21.0 or newer. If you are using an older API version, see [Disabling Local Storage (v20 and older)](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/local-storage/#disabling-local-storage--v20-and-older-).\n\n#### Request Syntax\n\n```\nPOST /<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID/>settings\n\n{\n  \"storage_configuration\": {\n    \"status\": \"IN_COUNTRY_STORAGE_DISABLED\"\n  }\n}\n```\n\nSet `<COUNTRY_CODE>` to the [country code](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/local-storage/#available-regions) of the country where data-at-rest should be stored.\n\n#### Response Syntax\n\n```\n{\n  \"success\": <SUCCESS>\n}\n```\n\nUpon success, `<SUCCESS>` will be set to `true`.\n\n#### Example Request\n\n```\ncurl 'https://graph.facebook.com/v22.0/106540352242922/settings' \\\n-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...' \\\n-d '\n{\n  \"storage_configuration\": {\n    \"status\": \"IN_COUNTRY_STORAGE_DISABLED\"\n  }\n}'\n```\n\n#### Example Response\n\n```\n{\n  \"success\": true\n}\n```\n\n## Enabling Local Storage (v20 and older)\n\nTo enable local storage for an unregistered business phone number using API version 20.0 or older:\n\n### Step 1: Check verification status\n\nUse the [**GET /<WHATSAPP\\_BUSINESS\\_PHONE\\_NUMBER>**](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/whats-app-business-account-to-number-current-status/#Reading) endpoint and request the `code_verification_status` field. If the code verification status is `VERIFIED`, skip to step 4. Otherwise, proceed to step 2.\n\n### Step 2: Request a verification code\n\nUse the [**POST /<WHATSAPP\\_BUSINESS\\_PHONE\\_NUMBER\\_ID>/request\\_code**](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/whats-app-business-account-to-number-current-status/request_code/#Creating) endpoint to request a verification code. Upon success, the API will respond with `true` and a verification code will be sent to the business phone number via the method specified in the `code_method` parameter.\n\nFor example, this query requests a verification code to be sent via SMS in the English language (US locale).\n\n```\ncurl -X POST 'https://graph.facebook.com/v20.0/110200345501442/request_code?code_method=SMS&language=en_US' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...'\n```\n\nUse the code in the delivered message in the next step.\n\n### Step 3: Verify the business phone number\n\nUse the [**POST /<WHATSAPP\\_BUSINESS\\_PHONE\\_NUMBER\\_ID>/verify\\_code**](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/whats-app-business-account-to-number-current-status/verify_code/#Creating) endpoint to verify the business phone number using the verification code included in the message you received from the previous step.\n\nFor example:\n\n```\ncurl -X POST 'https://graph.facebook.com/v20.0/110200345501442/verify_code?code=123830' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...'\n```\n\n### Step 4: Reregister the business phone number\n\nUse the [**POST /<WHATSAPP\\_BUSINESS\\_PHONE\\_NUMBER\\_ID>/register**](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/whats-app-business-account-to-number-current-status/register/#Creating) endpoint to register the business phone number. Indicate the country where data-at-rest should be stored using the `data_localization_region` parameter.\n\nFor example, this request enables local storage on a business phone number, and sets the country where data should be stored to India:\n\n```\ncurl 'https://graph.facebook.com/v20.0/110200345501442/register' \\\n-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...' \\\n-d '\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"pin\": \"123456\",\n  \"data_localization_region\": \"IN\"\n}'\n```\n\n## Disabling Local Storage (v20 and older)\n\nUse the [**POST /<WHATSAPP\\_BUSINESS\\_PHONE\\_NUMBER\\_ID>/deregister**](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/reference/whats-app-business-account-to-number-current-status/deregister/#Creating) endpoint to disable local storage on a business phone number using API version 20.0 or older.\n\nFor example:\n\n```\ncurl -X POST 'https://graph.facebook.com/v22.0/110200345501442/deregister' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...'\n```\n\nNote that this deregisters the business phone number so it cannot be used with WhatsApp Cloud API. If you want to continue using it with Cloud API but without local storage enabled, you must reregister it without including the `data_localization_region` parameter.\n\n## FAQs\n\n**Q. What are the migration paths for moving a phone number to the Cloud API version with Local Storage?**\n\nWe support all migration paths to Cloud API version with Local Storage, this includes:\n\n- Existing On-Premise API number migrating to Cloud API version with Local Storage\n- Existing Cloud API number migrating to Cloud API version with Local Storage\n- New Cloud API number enabling Local Storage\n\nIn all these scenarios you would need to send a POST request to the [/register](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#register) endpoint for the selected phone number, specifying the target country for which data to be localized in a new parameter `data_localization_region`.\n\n**Q. Are there any migration risks? Any downtime associated with this?**\n\nNo migration risks, this is a similar process as migrating from On-Premise API to Cloud API. See our [developer documentation here](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/migrating-from-onprem-to-cloud). Downtime is typically less than 5 minutes and no re-verification of the business phone number is required.\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Cloud API Local Storage](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/local-storage/#cloud-api-local-storage)\n\n[Localized API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\n- [Overview](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview)\n- [Get Started](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started)\n- [Get Started for Solution Partners](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started-for-solution-partners)\n- [Get Started for Tech Providers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started-for-tech-providers)\n- [Multi-Partner Bot](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/set-up-whatsapp-echo-bot)\n- [Payload [user\\_preferences](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/user_preferences)\n\n- [Sell Products & Services](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services)\n- [Payments API - India](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in)\n- [Payments API - Brazil](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br)\n- [Reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference)\n- [Support](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[User preferences webhoooks](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/user_preferences#user-preferences-webhoooks)\n\n[Trigger events](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/user_preferences#trigger-events)\n\n[Cloud API Syntax](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/user_preferences#cloud-api-syntax)\n\n[Cloud API Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/user_preferences#cloud-api-parameters)\n\n[On-Premises API Syntax](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/user_preferences#on-premises-api-syntax)\n\n[On-Premises API Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/user_preferences#on-premises-api-parameters)\n\nThis webhook field is gradually being rolled out along with [user preferences for marketing messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates#user-preferences-for-marketing-messages), and may not be available to you initially.\n\n# User preferences webhoooks\n\nWhatsApp users can use the **Offers and announcements** setting to stop or resume marketing template messages from individual businesses. See the following documents to learn more about this setting:\n\n- Cloud API: [User preferences for marketing messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates#user-preferences-for-marketing-messages)\n- On-Premises API: [User preferences for marketing messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/message-templates/creation#user-preferences-for-marketing-messages)\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/467533489_1278013276799319_5179783758286717076_n.png?_nc_cat=101&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=aoM3qRSouXEQ7kNvwHHn6vC&_nc_oc=Adm_bXcxB_Zr3WlCkSXqmqxDQwAy6CBoiMMaoUDp9QQRqTp78q-Z3EJa0XTEajOtxrc&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=p2LXgOMghFEMbQiRjKxNjQ&oh=00_AYHZscpfvGCDBfgjqoJ-_qJ5g9NBgyBctvimp-QDV86AYQ&oe=680AE8EE)\n\n## Trigger events\n\n- A WhatsApp user stops marketing messages.\n- A WhatsApp user resumes marketing messages.\n\n## Cloud API Syntax\n\n```\n{\n  \"object\": \"whatsapp_business_account\",\n  \"entry\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_ACCOUNT_ID>\",\\\n      \"changes\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"value\": {\\\n            \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\\\n            \"metadata\": {\\\n              \"display_phone_number\": \"<BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\\\n              \"phone_number_id\": \"<BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>\"\\\n            },\\\n            \"contacts\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"profile\": {\\\n                  \"name\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_NAME>\"\\\n                },\\\n                \"wa_id\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_ID>\"\\\n              }\\\n            ],\\\n            \"user_preferences\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"wa_id\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\\\n                \"detail\": \"<PREFERENCE_DESCRIPTION>\",\\\n                \"category\": \"marketing_messages\",\\\n                \"value\": \"<PREFERENCE>\",\\\n                \"timestamp\": <WEBHOOK_SENT_TIMESTAMP>\\\n              }\\\n            ]\\\n          },\\\n          \"field\": \"user_preferences\"\\\n        }\\\n      ]\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\n## Cloud API Parameters\n\n| Placeholder | Description | Example value |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| `<BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>` | Business phone number ID. | `106540352242922` |\n| `<BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER>` | Business display phone number. | `+15550783881` |\n| `<PREFERENCE_DESCRIPTION>` | Description of marketing message preference. Values can be:<br>- `User requested to stop marketing messages`<br>- `User requested to resume marketing messages` | `User requested to stop marketing messages` |\n| `<PREFERENCE>` | Marketing message preference. Values can be:<br>- `stop`<br>- `resume` | `stop` |\n| `<WEBHOOK_SENT_TIMESTAMP>` | Unix timestamp indicating when the webhook was sent. | `1731705721` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_ACCOUNT_ID>` | WhatsApp Business Account ID. | `102290129340398` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_USER_ID>` | WhatsApp user's ID. | `16505551234` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_USER_NAME>` | WhatsApp user's name. | `Pablo Morales` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>` | WhatsApp user phone number. | `+16505551234` |\n\n## On-Premises API Syntax\n\n```\n{\n  \"contacts\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"profile\": {\\\n        \"name\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_NAME>\"\\\n      },\\\n      \"wa_id\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_ID>\"\\\n    }\\\n  ],\n  \"messages\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"from\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\\\n      \"id\": \"<WHATSAPP_MESSAGE_ID>\",\\\n      \"system\": {\\\n        \"body\": \"<PREFERENCE_DESCRIPTION>\",\\\n        \"marketing\": \"<PREFERENCE>\",\\\n        \"type\": \"user_preference_changed\"\\\n      },\\\n      \"timestamp\": <WEBHOOK_SENT_TIMESTAMP>,\\\n      \"type\": \"system\"\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\n## On-Premises API Parameters\n\n| Placeholder | Description | Example value |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| `<PREFERENCE_DESCRIPTION>` | Description of marketing message preference. Values can be:<br>- `<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER> chose to stop receiving marketing messages on WhatsApp from your business`<br>- `<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER> chose to resume receiving marketing messages on WhatsApp from your business` | `User requested to stop marketing messages` |\n| `<PREFERENCE>` | Marketing message preference. Values can be:<br>- `stop`<br>- `resume` | `stop` |\n| `<WEBHOOK_SENT_TIMESTAMP>` | Unix timestamp indicating when the webhook was sent. | `1731705721` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_MESSAGE_ID>` | WhatsApp message ID. | `16505551234` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_USER_ID>` | WhatsApp user's ID. | `16505551234` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_USER_NAME>` | WhatsApp user's name. | `Pablo Morales` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>` | WhatsApp user phone number. | `+16505551234` |\n\nOn This Page\n\n[User preferences webhoooks](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/user_preferences#user-preferences-webhoooks)\n\n[Trigger events](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/user_preferences#trigger-events)\n\n[Cloud API Syntax](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/user_preferences#cloud-api-syntax)\n\n[Cloud API Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/user_preferences#cloud-api-parameters)\n\n[On-Premises API Syntax](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/user_preferences#on-premises-api-syntax)\n\n[On-Premises API Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/user_preferences#on-premises-api-parameters)\n\n* * Webhook](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-ccavenue#status-webhook)\n\n[Payment Status](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-ccavenue#payment-status)\n\n[Billdesk's Whatsapp Integration Process](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-ccavenue#billdesk-s-whatsapp-integration-process)\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=595945097590761&version=1743728118)[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\>\nCloud API\n\n\n# CCAvenue Payment Gateway Integration Guide\n\n## Purpose\n\nThe purpose of this document is to lay down the payment integration with CCAvenue that is required for a merchant (or BSP) that has implemented a chatbot using WhatsApp Business APIs and needs to accept payments from WhatsApp users.\n\nThis document outlines the necessary APIs that must be integrated and how the integration works in conjunction with the WhatsApp Business API integration. While not a comprehensive guide, it serves as a general overview to assist in understanding the payment gateway integration process. Any specific or unique details related to the payment gateway must be determined by the merchant (or BSP).\n\nIn terms of integrating with the WA P2M product, this document covers the requests and responses highlighted in red within the flow diagram.\n\n![](https://scontent-lax3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.8562-6/448869440_2428077867389175_3301703345264807843_n.png?_nc_cat=104&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=f537c7&_nc_ohc=cJ-Tt9NOIVoQ7kNvwGYZHFI&_nc_oc=AdkKqqO4RodZ1pwqcUuheIPy3BrtNNs5j1F2vD5Foo58GYji7YZ4zGa4ZbsMNx4m52g&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-1.xx&_nc_gid=qKx-FG6WxacBtiXedBnt4g&oh=00_AYHAcPyYivk6ggH8Qk8z4PJEp2CAp-OkBkDHH3YMzleGWQ&oe=67F675CC)\n\n## CCAvenue Integration with Whatsapp Payments\n\n### Setup\n\nPlease use documentation from CCAVenue for steps to authenticate with their server.\n\nTo simplify the explanation, the following examples will only address the body of the final payload that will ultimately be included in the final object required for successful authentication with their API. It is important to consult CCAvenue's documentation for guidance on how this final object must be structured.\n\nYou must have the following details before you can proceed:\n\n1. Successfully authenticate\n2. Details from the payment configuration you already configured on the Whatsapp Business Account.\n\n   - Merchant category code\n   - Merchant’s VPA\n\n### Initiate Payment API\n\n#### Request\n\nSample payload to POST to “https://secure.ccavenue.com/transaction.do”\n\n#### Request\n\n```\ncurl -XPOST -d 'card_name=UPI&order_id=67314339998877&currency=INR&payment_option=OPTUPI&card_type=UPI&merchant_id=2&amount=100.00&re direct_url=https://merchantredirecturl.com'\n```\n\n| Name | Description | Type |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| merchant\\_id | Merchant Id is a unique identifier generated by CCAvenue for each activated merchant. | Numeric |\n| order\\_id | This ID is used by merchants to identify the order. Ensure that you send a unique id with each request. | Alphanumeric (30) <br>Characters allowed: Alphabet (A-Z), (a-z), Numbers, - (hyphen),<br>/ (slash) ,\\_ (underscore) |\n| currency | The currency in which you want to process the transaction.<br>INR – Indian Rupee | \"INR\" |\n| amount | Order Amount | Numeric (12, 2) |\n| redirect\\_url | CCAvenue will post the status of the order along with the parameters to this URL. If you do not send this value, order status will be sent back to the URL configured in dynamic event notifications module in your MARS account. If there is no URL configured in the MARS account, PG will display thestatus of the order on the CCAvenue confirmation page. | Alphanumeric (100)<br>Characters allowed: Alphabet (A-Z), (a-z), Numbers, / (slash),\\_ (underscore) |\n| card\\_type | Type of card used by the customer.<br>UPI | \"UPI\" |\n| card\\_name | Name of the card used by the customer. This list will be provided by CCAvenue.<br>UPI | \"UPI\" |\n\n#### Response\n\nSample response from CCAvenue\n\n```\n{\n     \"status\":\"0\",\n     \"enc_respone\":\"\"\n}\n\n```\n\nDecrypted Sample Response\n\n```\n {\n     \"errorCode\":\"\",\n     \"errorMessage\":\"\",\n     \"intentUrl\":\"upi://pay?pa=vpa@samplebank&pn=Infibeam Avenues Limited&tr=123123123123&am=100.0&cu=INR&mc=8299\"\n }\n```\n\n#### Parse the response\n\n- Use the value of “tr” in the response value marked by the key “intentUrl” and pass it as the “reference\\_id” while setting up the “parameters” object to send for the order details message using the Whastapp API\n- Make sure to verify the values in the “intentUrl” key that you receive in the response with the payment configuration you created on the Whatsapp Manager:\n\n  - The value of “pa” is the merchant VPA. This value must match the UPI ID on the “payment\\_configuration” you send us on the “parameters” object.\n  - The value of “mc” must match the MCC code you put into payment configuration.\n\n### Status Webhook\n\nWhen an event occurs, such as the successful processing of a payment in your CCAvenue account, CCAvenue generates an event object. This event object contains essential details, including the event type and associated data. CCAvenue forwards this event object to a designated URL in your account's webhook settings through an HTTP POST request.\n\n### Payment Status\n\nUse the webhook notification above to find the payment status using the “Payment status API”\n\n#### Request\n\nSample payload to POST to “https://api.ccavenue.com/apis/servlet/DoWebTrans”\n\n```\n{\n  \"orderNo\": \"11111111\",\n  \"referenceNo\": \"111111111111\"\n}\n```\n\n#### Parse the response\n\nUtilize the \"order\\_status\" retrieved from the response above and transmit the corresponding [status message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/upi#step-7--update-order-status) via Whatsap's API.\n\n## Billdesk's Whatsapp Integration Process\n\n#### UAT Environment Setup\n\n1. Once partner initiates request to Billdesk, a request form is sent from Billdesk to collect values like: Partner IPs to allowlist, partner callback URLs, and merchant account to trigger setting up a UAT environment.\n2. Once the request form is shared, Billdesk shares the UAT credentials and API docs so partners can build their solution in UAT. This takes about 4-5 days.\n3. Partners can test integrations by using a [web tool](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fpguatweb.billdesk.io%2Fpgtxnsimulator%2Fbanksimulator%2Fupi%2F%5Btr-value%3E%5D&h=AT29BJWVnosmH8EKnY8Gd8vobL-K3hCRrVoKUIEwEMTV5XLAk3xDpKhu2K2ohDes6GlN7lng3d8lmime5x29Xa64kZr0DQV2xSFVLa9mxySoQrBHdSYBEXBX-R8J8Q6LQrv6wnVV9_Kq7Q) (replace \"\\[tr-value\\]\" in the URL with the “tr” value from the \"createTransactions\" response, and you can simulate a success / response.\n4. Partners must apply for a UAT sign off post this which typically takes 1-2 days where Billdesk E2E tests the solution or ask for screenshots if E2E test is not possible. For Whatsapp, Billdesk checks to see if the app tray opens up and redirects to the right apps successfully.\n5. Once sign off is received, a production environment is created that takes about a week, post which credentials for production are shared.\n\nOn This Page\n\n[CCAvenue Payment Gateway Integration Guide](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-ccavenue#ccavenue-payment-gateway-integration-guide)\n\n[Purpose](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-ccavenue#purpose)\n\n[CCAvenue Integration with Whatsapp Payments](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-ccavenue#ccavenue-integration-with-whatsapp-payments)\n\n[Setup](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-ccavenue#setup)\n\n[Initiate Payment API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-ccavenue#initiate-payment-api)\n\n[Status Webhook](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-ccavenue#status-webhook)\n\n[Payment Status](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-ccavenue#payment-status)\n\n[Billdesk's Whatsapp Integration Process](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/upi-intent/pg-guide-ccavenue#billdesk-s-whatsapp-integration-process)\n\n* * [![Follow us on Facebook](https://scontent-lax3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/459306853_1501629487899251_7449019458089488547_n.png?_nc_cat=107&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=fos-AFiHuvAQ7kNvwHUolak&_nc_oc=AdkVHwbSWUfyb5LOtbgXwu2X8QXoODqrjO3hqTOSUTu6S5gzRwIjYZyzMjYrSbKbUj0&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-2.xx&_nc_gid=qKx-FG6WxacBtiXedBnt4g&oh=00_AYHb9rGoJza1No-ovT0_JreWxHtedDEUSh-jgUzKLtk9VQ&oe=680AE6E2)](https://www.facebook.com/MetaforDevelopers)[![Follow us on [Reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference)\n- [Support](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Upload Inventory to Meta](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services/upload-inventory#upload-inventory-to-meta)\n\n[Solution Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\>\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\\>\n[Guides](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides)\n\n# Upload Inventory to Meta\n\nA business’s inventory needs to be uploaded to Meta in a catalog format — see [About Catalogs](https://www.facebook.com/business/help/890714097648074) for more information.\n\nIf a business already has a Meta catalog set up, we suggest that you leverage that catalog for WhatsApp commerce use cases. Just [connect the catalog to a WhatsApp Business Account](https://www.facebook.com/business/help/158662536425974) (WABA) and the business will be able to [share products with customers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services/share-products).\n\nIf a business needs to create a catalog, there are two possibilities:\n\n- Create a catalog using the [Commerce API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/commerce-platform/catalog/get-started)\n- Create a catalog using the [Meta Commerce Manager](https://business.facebook.com/commerce/).\n\nYou can only upload one catalog per WABA, but the same catalog can belong to multiple phone numbers.\n\n## Solution Partners\n\nSolution Partners onboarding client businesses into commerce messages have the following options:\n\n- If a client business already has and manages their own Meta catalog, they can give permission to the Solution Partner to manage their catalog —these permissions are controlled via the [Meta Business Manager](https://business.facebook.com/) and [Meta Commerce Manager](https://business.facebook.com/commerce/). After that, the Solution Partner can [connect the WhatsApp Business Account to the catalog](https://www.facebook.com/business/help/158662536425974) via WhatsApp Manager.\n- If a client business doesn't have a Meta catalog, they can create and upload a new catalog under the Solution Partner's business ID.\n\n[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\|\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\\|\n\n[Business Management API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Upload Inventory to Meta](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services/upload-inventory#upload-inventory-to-meta)\n\n[Solution Partners](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services/upload-inventory#solution-partners)\n\n* *
