    "markdown": "[iframe](/common/referer_frame.php?cb=1)\n\n[iframe](/common/referer_frame.php?cb=1)\n\n[iframe](/common/referer_frame.php?cb=1)\n\n[iframe](/common/referer_frame.php?cb=1)\n\n![](https://facebook.com/security/hsts-pixel.gif)\n\n[![](https://developers.facebook.com/images/developer/m4d_logo_july_2024.svg)](https://developers.facebook.com/?no_redirect=1)\n\n[Docs](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/) [Tools](https://developers.facebook.com/tools/) [Support](https://developers.facebook.com/support/)\n\n[Log In](https://business.facebook.com/business/loginpage/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fdevelopers.facebook.com%2Fdocs%2Fwhatsapp%2Fcloud-api%2Fpayments-api%2Fpayments-br%2Forders%3Fnav_ref%3Dbiz_unified_f3_login_page_to_dfc&app=436761779744620&login_options%5B0%5D=FB&login_options%5B1%5D=SSO&is_work_accounts=1&config_ref=biz_login_tool_flavor_dfc)\n\n[Orders](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Orders](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#orders)\n\n[Sending order messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#sending-order-messages)\n\n[Order details example](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#order-details-example)\n\n[Order status example](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#order-status-example)\n\n[Message response](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#message-response)\n\n[Full API Reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#full-api-reference)\n\n[Order Details](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#order-details)\n\n[Order Status](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#order-status)\n\n[Errors and Statuses](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#errors-and-statuses)\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=595945097590761&version=1743728118)[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\>\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\\>\n[Payments API - Brazil](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br)\n\n# Orders\n\nThis feature is not publicly available yet and is only available for businesses based in Brazil and their Brazillian customers. To enable payments for your businesses, please contact your Solution Partner.\n\nPayments API introduces two new types of [interactive messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages#interactive-messages): `order_details` and `order_status`. They are the entrypoint to collect payment in WhatsApp.\n\n1. `order_details` messages are sent to create an order in the buyer's WhatsApp client app. This message includes a list of the items being purchased, any fees being charged, and the payment settings used to collect payment. The payment settings will vary depending on the integration type ( [Pix](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/offsite-pix), [payment links](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/payment-links), [Boleto](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/boleto)).\n2. `order_status` messages are sent when businesses update the order status either based on the WhatsApp payment status change notification or based on their internal processes.\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=634034961253028&version=1742854961)\n\nOrders start in `pending` status. When the merchant has fully fulfilled the order and the buyer should not expect any further updates, it must be marked as `completed`.\n\n## Sending order messages\n\nBoth message types contain the same 4 main components of an interactive message: _header_, _body_, _footer_, and _action_. The parameters in the _action_ component will vary based on the message type.\n\nOnce the interactive message object is assembled, make a POST call to the [messages endpoint](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages#messages). Remember to set the type to `interactive`.\n\n### Order details example\n\n```\n{\n \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n \"to\": \"[recipient-wa-id]\",\n \"type\": \"interactive\",\n \"interactive\": {\n   \"type\": \"order_details\",\n   \"body\": {\n     \"text\": \"Your message content\"\n   },\n   \"action\": {\n     \"name\": \"review_and_pay\",\n     \"parameters\": {\n       \"reference_id\": \"unique-reference-id\",\n       \"type\": \"digital-goods\",\n       \"payment_type\": \"br\",\n       \"payment_settings\": [\\\n         {\\\n           \"type\": \"payment_link\",\\\n           \"payment_link\": {\\\n             \"uri\": \"https://my-payment-link-url\"\\\n           }\\\n         }\\\n       ],\n       \"currency\": \"BRL\",\n       \"total_amount\": {\n         \"value\": 50000,\n         \"offset\": 100\n       },\n       \"order\": {\n         \"status\": \"pending\",\n         \"tax\": {\n           \"value\": 0,\n           \"offset\": 100,\n           \"description\": \"optional text\"\n           },\n         \"items\": [\\\n           {\\\n             \"retailer_id\": \"1234567\",\\\n             \"name\": \"Cake\",\\\n             \"amount\": {\\\n               \"value\": 50000,\\\n               \"offset\": 100\\\n             },\\\n             \"quantity\": 1\\\n           }\\\n         ],\n         \"subtotal\": {\n           \"value\": 50000,\n           \"offset\": 100\n         }\n       }\n     }\n   }\n }\n}\n```\n\n### Order status example\n\n```\n{\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"whatsapp-id\",\n  \"type\": \"interactive\",\n  \"interactive\": {\n    \"type\": \"order_status\",\n    \"body\": {\n      \"text\": \"your-mandatory-text-body-content\"\n    },\n    \"footer\": {\n      \"text\": \"your-optional-text-footer-content\"\n    },\n    \"action\": {\n      \"name\": \"review_order\",\n      \"parameters\": {\n        \"reference_id\": \"unique-reference-id\",\n        \"order\": {\n          \"status\": \"processing\"\n        }\n        \"payment\": {\n          \"status\": \"captured\",\n          \"timestamp\": 1722445231\n        }\n      }\n    }\n  }\n}\n\n```\n\n### Message response\n\nFor either type, if your message is sent successfully, you will get the following response:\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"contacts\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"input\": \"[PHONE_NUMBER_ID]\",\\\n      \"wa_id\": \"[PHONE-NUMBER_ID]\"\\\n    }\\\n  ],\n  \"messages\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"wamid.HBgLMTY1MDUwNzY1MjAVAgARGBI5QTNDQTVCM0Q0Q0Q2RTY3RTcA\"\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n\n```\n\nFor all errors that can be returned and guidance on how to handle them, see [Cloud API Errors Codes](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes/).\n\n## Full API Reference\n\n### Order Details\n\nTo send an order\\_details message, businesses must assemble an interactive object of type order\\_details with the following components:\n\n#### Interactive Object\n\n| **Field Name** | **Optional?** | **Type** | **Description** |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| type | Required | String | Must be `order_details`. |\n| header | Optional | Object | Thumbnail image for order details message. It has the following fields:<br>- `type`: Must be `image`.<br>- `image`: See [Image Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#imageobject).<br>If the header is not present, Biz-API finds the first product with an image and uses that for the thumbnail image. |\n| body | Required | Object | An object with the body of the message. The object contains the following field:<br>- `text` string: The content of the message. Emojis and markdown are supported. Maximum length is 1024 characters. |\n| footer | Optional | Object | An object with the footer of the message. The object contains the following field:<br>- `text` string: **Required** if footer is present. The footer content. Emojis, markdown, and links are supported. Maximum length is 60 characters. |\n| action | Required | Action Object | See [Action Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#actionobject) below. |\n\n#### Image Object\n\n| Field Name | Optional? | Type | Description |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| link | Required | String | Url of the image. |\n| provider | Optional | String | Name of the url provider. |\n\n#### Action Object\n\n| Field Name | Optional? | Type | Description |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| name | Required | String | Must be `review_and_pay`. |\n| parameters | Required | Parameters Object | See [Parameters Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#paramsobject). |\n\n#### Parameters Object\n\n| **Field Name** | **Optional?** | **Type** | **Description** |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| reference\\_id | Required | String | Unique identifier for the order or invoice provided by the business. This cannot be an empty string and can only contain English letters, numbers, underscores, dashes, or dots, and should not exceed 35 characters.<br>The reference\\_id must be unique for each order\\_details message for the same business. If the partner would like to send multiple order\\_details messages for the same order, invoice, etc. it is recommended to include a sequence number in the reference\\_id to ensure reference\\_id uniqueness. |\n| type | Required | String | Must be one of `digital-goods` or `physical-goods`. |\n| payment\\_type | Required | String | Must be `br`. |\n| payment\\_settings | Optional | [Payment Settings Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#paymentsettingsobject) | List of payment related configuration objects. |\n| installment | Optional | Installment Object | Installment configuration for this order when buyer is paying in WhatsApp. See [Installment Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#installmentobject). |\n| currency | Required | String | ISO 4217 currency code for the order. Must be `BRL` (Brazilian Real). |\n| total\\_amount | Required | Amount Object | See [Amount Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#amountobject).<br>`total_amount.value` must be equal to `order.subtotal.value` \\+ `order.tax.value` \\+ `order.shipping.value` \\- `order.discount.value` |\n| order | Required | Order Object | See [Order Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#orderobject). |\n\n#### Payment Settings\n\n| Field Name | Optional? | Type | Description |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| `type` | Required | String | One of `pix_dynamic_code`, `payment_link`, `boleto`. |\n| One of the following objects: `pix_dynamic_code`, `payment_link`, `boleto`. | Required | Object | Payment instructions which will be displayed to buyers during the checkout process. |\n\n#### Installment Object\n\n| Field Name | Optional? | Type | Description |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| max\\_installment\\_count | Required | Integer | Maximum number of monthly payments allowed for this order.<br>Final installment count is dependent on the card network selected by the buyer. |\n\n#### Installment Selection Object\n\n| Field Name | Optional? | Type | Description |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| selected\\_count | Required | Integer | Number of installments selected by the buyer |\n| amount | Required | Integer | Amount of each installment. See [Amount Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#amountobject). |\n| interest | Required | Integer | Total interest to be charged for selected installment count. See [Amount Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#amountobject). |\n\n#### Order Object\n\n| **Field Name** | **Optional?** | **Type** | **Description** |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| status | Required | String | Status of the order. Only supported value here is `pending`. |\n| catalog\\_id | Optional | String | Unique identifier of the Facebook catalog being used by the business. |\n| expiration | Optional | Expiration Object | Expiration for that order. The CTA for payment will be disabled after expiry on the user end. See [Expiration Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#expirationobject). |\n| items | Required | List of Item Objects | List must have at least one item. See [Item Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#itemobject). |\n| subtotal | Required | Amount Object | See [Amount Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#amountobject).<br>The value **must be equal** to sum of ( `item.amount.value` or `item.sale_amount.value`) \\\\* `item.quantity`.<br>The following fields are part of the `subtotal` object:<br>`offset` string<br>- **Required.** Must be `100` for `BRL`.<br>`value` string<br>- **Required.** Positive integer representing the amount value multiplied by offset. For example, S$12.34. has value 1234 |\n| tax | Required | Amount With Description Object | The tax information for this order. Even though the object is required, the amount can be zero. When zero is used, the tax line is not rendered in the client. See [Amount With Description Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#amountdescriptionobject). |\n| shipping | Optional | Amount With Description Object | See [Amount Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#amountdescriptionobject). |\n| discount | Optional | Discount Object | The discount for the order. See [Discount object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#discountobject). |\n\n#### Expiration Object\n\n| **Field Name** | **Optional?** | **Type** | **Description** |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| timestamp | Required | String | UTC time in seconds. Minimum threshold is 300 seconds. |\n| description | Required | String | Text explanation for when the order will expire. Max character limit is 120 characters. |\n\n#### Item Object\n\n| **Field Name** | **Optional?** | **Type** | **Description** |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| retailer\\_id | Required | String | Content ID for an item in the order from your catalog. |\n| name | Required | String | The item’s name to be displayed to the user. Cannot exceed 60 characters. |\n| amount | Required | Amount Object | The price per item. See [Amount Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#amountobject). |\n| quantity | Required | Integer | Number of items in this order. |\n| sale\\_amount | Optional | Amount Object | The discounted price per item. This should be less than the original amount. If included, this field is used to calculate the subtotal amount. See [Amount Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#amountobject). |\n\n#### Discount Object\n\n| **Field Name** | **Optional?** | **Type** | **Description** |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| value | Required | Integer | Positive integer representing the amount value multiplied by offset. For example, 12.34 BRL has value 1234. |\n| offset | Required | Integer | Must be `100` for `BRL`. |\n| description | Optional | String | Max character limit is 60 characters. |\n| discount\\_program\\_name | Optional | String | Text used for defining incentivised orders. If order is incentivised, the merchant needs to define this information. Max character limit is 60 characters. |\n\n#### Amount Object\n\n| **Field Name** | **Optional?** | **Type** | **Description** |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| value | Required | Integer | Positive integer representing the amount value multiplied by offset. For example, 12.34 BRL has value 1234. |\n| offset | Required | Integer | Must be `100` for `BRL`. |\n\n#### Amount Object (With Description)\n\n| **Field Name** | **Optional?** | **Type** | **Description** |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| value | Required | Integer | Positive integer representing the amount value multiplied by offset. For example, 12.34 BRL has value 1234. |\n| offset | Required | Integer | Must be `100` for `BRL`. |\n| description | Optional | String | Max character limit is 60 characters. |\n\n### Order Status\n\nTo send an order\\_status message, businesses must assemble an interactive object of type order\\_details with the following components:\n\n#### Interactive Object\n\n| **Field Name** | **Optional?** | **Type** | **Description** |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| type | Required | String | Must be `order_status`. |\n| header | Optional | Object | Optional object for the message's header for the message. |\n| body | Required | Object | An object with the body of the message. The object contains the following field:<br>- `text` string: The content of the message. Emojis and markdown are supported. Maximum length is 1024 characters. |\n| footer | Optional | Object | An object with the footer of the message. The object contains the following field:<br>- `text` string: **Required** if footer is present. The footer content. Emojis, markdown, and links are supported. Maximum length is 60 characters. |\n| action | Required | Action Object | See [Action Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#statusactionobject) below. |\n\n#### Action Object\n\n| Field Name | Optional? | Type | Description |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| name | Required | String | Must be `review_order`. |\n| parameters | Required | Parameters Object | See [Parameters Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#statusparamsobject). |\n\n#### Parameters Object\n\n| Field Name | Optional? | Type | Description |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| reference\\_id | Required | String | The unique ID provided in the `order_details` message. |\n| order | Required | Order Object | See [Order Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#statusorderobject). |\n| payment | Optional | Payment Object | See [Payment Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#statuspaymentobject). |\n\n#### Order Object\n\n| Field Name | Optional? | Type | Description |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| status | Required | String | The new order status. [See supported order status](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#orderstatussupported). |\n| description | Optional | String | Optional text for sharing status related information in order-details page. Could be useful while sending cancellation. Length should not exceed 120 characters. |\n\n#### Payment Object\n\n| Field Name | Optional? | Type | Description |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| status | Required | String | The new payment status. [See supported payment status](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#paymentstatussupported). |\n| timestamp | Optional | Integer | Optional epoch timestamp in seconds |\n\n#### Supported Order Status\n\nCurrently we support the following order status values:\n\n| Value | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `pending` | Order is pending / not processed yet. |\n| `processing` | Merchant/partner is fulfilling the order, performing service, etc. |\n| `partially-shipped` | Part of the products in order have been shipped by the merchant. |\n| `shipped` | All the products in order have been shipped by the merchant. |\n| `completed` | The order is completed and no further action is expected from the user or the partner/merchant. |\n| `canceled` | The parner/merchant would like to cancel the order\\_details message for the order/invoice. The status update will fail if there is already a successful or pending payment for this order\\_details message. |\n\n#### Supported Payment Status\n\nCurrently we support the following payment status values:\n\n| Value | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `pending` | Payment is pending. |\n| `captured` | Payment was successfully captured. Receiving this payment status will update the order bubble to include the \"paid\" label (with green checkmark). |\n| `failed` | Payment failed. |\n\n## Errors and Statuses\n\nThese are the relevant errors for the WhatsApp Payments API:\n\n| Error Code | Description |\n| --- | --- |\n| `2040 - Message is not supported` | The message you are trying to send cannot be received by this user |\n| `2046 - Order status invalid transition` | The order status cannot be updated from the existing value to the new one |\n| `2047 - Order cancellation failure` | The order could not be cancelled |\n\nFor a comprehensive list with detailed descriptions of error codes and HTTP status codes, please refer to these pages:\n\n[Cloud API Error Codes](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes/)\n\n[HTTP Status Codes](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/errors#http)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Orders](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#orders)\n\n[Sending order example](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#order-details-example)\n\n[Order status example](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#order-status-example)\n\n[Message response](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#message-response)\n\n[Full API Reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#full-api-reference)\n\n[Order Details](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#order-details)\n\n[Order Statuses](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br/orders#errors-and-statuses)\n\n* * It](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services/share-products#why-you-should-use-it)\n\n[Sending Product Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services/share-products#sending-product-messages)\n\n[Step 1: Assemble the Interactive Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services/share-products#step-1--assemble-the-interactive-object)\n\n[Step 2: Add Common Message Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services/share-products#step-2--add-common-message-parameters)\n\n[Step 3: Send a Request to the Messages Endpoint](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services/share-products#step-3--send-a-request-to-the-messages-endpoint)\n\n[Single-Product Message Template Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services/share-products#single-product-message-template-messages)\n\n![](https://scontent-lax3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/467179990_582893330879738_1534232517322631641_n.png?_nc_cat=102&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=UiIZ9_pPw1AQ7kNvwGjE7Ud&_nc_oc=AdmNGvHeESXX8fqum8u3zpzuioxb656lk1sKRGUS5wgtFjspqXSPeRaCQNIQONxWcvA&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-1.xx&_nc_gid=KzHhQmdLl-e886DM-O_UpQ&oh=00_AYHNWlTlG8ccm58jKoaupcqaUO72cU2WkQkurCB2Umu0bg&oe=680AE45A)\n[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/)\n\nWe are making changes to the WhatsApp Business Platform pricing model.\n\n**Effective July 1, 2025 for all businesses on our platform:**\n\n- The conversation-based pricing model will be deprecated\n- We will charge [per-message for template messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing/updates-to-pricing#per-message-pricing) instead of per-conversation\n- Utility templates sent within an open customer service window [will be free](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing/updates-to-pricing#free-utility-templates-in-the-customer-service-window)\n\nSee [Pricing Updates on the WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing/updates-to-pricing) for additional details.\n\n# Share Products With Customers\n\nYou have multiple ways to share products with your customers.\n\n## Catalog Messages\n\nCatalog messages are messages that allow you to showcase your product catalog entirely within WhatsApp.\n\nCatalog messages display a product thumbnail header image of your choice, custom body text, a fixed text header, a fixed text sub-header, and a **View catalog** button.\n\n![](https://scontent-lax3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/353831413_931793014769642_1489938023342123500_n.png?_nc_cat=109&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=10M4xO6HUDMQ7kNvwHES9qZ&_nc_oc=AdnH2rTKPVyIJzXdo8pM-A_edjy5KryhU7u--Um_Sd_3kSGZnJy5H2-C0FF6fz2fBKs&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-1.xx&_nc_gid=KzHhQmdLl-e886DM-O_UpQ&oh=00_AYEctca6y8mebItWbSpqHZVCPOFtLh3Nok4knkYDYUZdZw&oe=680B0AD5)\n\nWhen a customer taps the **View catalog** button, your product catalog appears within WhatsApp.\n\n![](https://scontent-lax3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/353808079_9331603410246288_3629219693038191737_n.png?_nc_cat=109&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=6Fh4g_KtrwUQ7kNvwFq4nPD&_nc_oc=AdlgzT-dWHwFWFg-0GH9n0PFavuMaSDeOIrbiT2MvOyqHJp1Q8Xg_4QFNc7XXL3suYg&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-1.xx&_nc_gid=KzHhQmdLl-e886DM-O_UpQ&oh=00_AYFR4sKJg_tR8u7A6S0NpNWeV9HLZUieASLrwS2oPMgrfA&oe=680AFFE8)\n\n### Requirements\n\nYou must have [inventory uploaded to Meta](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services/upload-inventory) in an ecommerce catalog [connected to your WhatsApp Business Account](https://www.facebook.com/business/help/158662536425974).\n\n### Request Syntax\n\nUse the **WhatsApp Business Phone Number > Messages** endpoint to send a catalog message.\n\n```\nPOST /<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>/messages\n```\n\n### Post Body\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"<TO>\",\n  \"type\": \"interactive\",\n  \"interactive\" : {\n    \"type\" : \"catalog_message\",\n    \"body\" : {\n      \"text\": \"<BODY_TEXT>\"\n    },\n    \"action\": {\n      \"name\": \"catalog_message\",\n\n      /* Parameters object is optional */\n      \"parameters\": {\n        \"thumbnail_product_retailer_id\": \"<THUMBNAIL_PRODUCT_RETAILER_ID>\"\n      }\n    },\n\n    /* Footer object is optional */\n    \"footer\": {\n      \"text\": \"<FOOTER_TEXT>\"\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### Properties\n\n| Placeholder | Description | Sample Value |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| `<BODY_TEXT>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>Text to appear in the message body.<br>Maximum 1024 characters. | `Hello! Thanks for your interest. Ordering is easy. Just visit our catalog and add items to purchase.` |\n| `<FOOTER_TEXT>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Text to appear in the message footer.<br>Maximum 60 characters. | `Best grocery deals on WhatsApp!` |\n| `<THUMBNAIL_PRODUCT_RETAILER_ID>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Item SKU number. Labeled as **Content ID** in the Commerce Manager.<br>The thumbnail of this item will be used as the message's header image.<br>If the `parameters` object is omitted, the product image of the first item in your catalog will be used. | `2lc20305pt` |\n| `<TO>`<br>_String_ | Customer phone number. | `+16505551234` |\n\n### Sample Request\n\n```\ncurl 'https://graph.facebook.com/v17.0/106540352242922/messages' \\\n-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...' \\\n-d '\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"+16505551234\",\n  \"type\": \"interactive\",\n  \"interactive\": {\n    \"type\": \"catalog_message\",\n    \"body\": {\n      \"text\": \"Hello! Thanks for your interest. Ordering is easy. Just visit our catalog and add items to purchase.\"\n    },\n    \"action\": {\n      \"name\": \"catalog_message\",\n      \"parameters\": {\n        \"thumbnail_product_retailer_id\": \"2lc20305pt\"\n      }\n    },\n    \"footer\": {\n      \"text\": \"Best grocery deals on WhatsApp!\"\n    }\n  }\n}'\n```\n\n### Sample Response\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"contacts\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"input\": \"+16505551234\",\\\n      \"wa_id\": \"16505551234\"\\\n    }\\\n  ],\n  \"messages\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"wamid.HBgLMTY1MDM4Nzk0MzkVAgARGBI0ODVEREUwQzEzQkVBRjQ1RUUA\"\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n```\n\n## Catalog Template Messages\n\nCatalog template messages are template messages containing a button that, when tapped, displays your product catalog within WhatsApp.\n\n![](https://scontent-lax3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/354047426_125269187252102_7173148343631613735_n.png?_nc_cat=105&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=m7JeXQeob_wQ7kNvwFdMpWX&_nc_oc=AdlLf6qpjHQNkQGmldccaxJnLBz_UPyymmU_GbpXpDMtQZEpr8rlEy5uKpLNE5LfaPw&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-1.xx&_nc_gid=KzHhQmdLl-e886DM-O_UpQ&oh=00_AYGv9wr5tF-bw9AtuHyxeEUWboYaIVeltSUaPzuhh_N-Aw&oe=680AFA26)\n\nSee [Catalog Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/message-templates/catalog-templates) to learn how to create and send these templates.\n\n## Catalog Link Messages\n\nYou can send a link to your entire product catalog by assembling a wa.me link and including it in a standard [text message](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages#text-messages). When sending a text message, you can use the optional `preview_url` set to `true` to have the message render a set of product catalog thumbnails of any URL in the message `body` string.\n\nNote that if you [disable the catalog](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services/set-commerce-settings#enable-disable-catalog), wa.me links and the **View Catalog** button in catalog link messages will display a **Invalid catalog link** message when tapped.\n\nTo assemble wa.me link, append your business phone number, including country code, to the end of the following string:\n\n```\nhttps://wa.me/c/\n```\n\nFor example:\n\n```\nhttps://wa.me/c/15555455657\n```\n\n## Checkout Button Templates\n\nCheckout button templates allow India-based businesses to showcase one or more products that WhatsApp users in India (with India country calling codes) can purchase, without having to leave the WhatsApp client.\n\n![](https://scontent-lax3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/461864193_1053025166222560_1984323495828319066_n.png?_nc_cat=108&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=woPFYWBfe7kQ7kNvwFZvAO7&_nc_oc=Adl8u68b8PIIEUoYIGy9KdLbR9-UpieWhIuA8Ze70AWEq6eohFnA2vEZyq-c4TrZoXY&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-1.xx&_nc_gid=KzHhQmdLl-e886DM-O_UpQ&oh=00_AYGMkGszkDMu7WuB2NOaJqeQar4psEAf0VuzVskRz9omFQ&oe=680B027C)\n\nSee [Checkout Button Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in/checkout-button-templates) to learn how to create and send these templates.\n\n## Media Card Carousel Template Messages\n\nMedia card carousel template messages allow you to send a single text message accompanied by a set of up to 10 cards in a horizontally scrollable view:\n\n![](https://scontent-lax3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/461961248_1048610163180196_3907313698557856900_n.png?_nc_cat=107&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=YUhVpNmvatcQ7kNvwHzrVU2&_nc_oc=AdlFMpmEn5dmbstOo5_UCyybE5pnlo3KwjAV8fcsNxBF70pFA-rKWi036V6_vNLoSv0&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-2.xx&_nc_gid=KzHhQmdLl-e886DM-O_UpQ&oh=00_AYFiQg_6vB8C1DAYOjuj36M2gDeCdQ98aRWiysDDAjOxaQ&oe=680AE2FC)\n\nSee [Media Card Carousel Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/message-templates/media-card-carousel-templates) to learn how to create and send these templates.\n\n## Multi-Product Message Template Messages\n\nMulti-Product Message (MPM) template messages present product information for up to 30 products from your ecommerce catalog, organized customizable by sections.\n\n![](https://scontent-lax3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/345336924_1476472873159435_9050004394387774321_n.png?_nc_cat=105&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=ArRkGj5O4lsQ7kNvwGgL8sR&_nc_oc=AdkHX1Yw5Gd5NTR0Fu3tmmv3wUq2na4otUiekfHGql7PNHSUR_pW2xU8BekM78VYm14&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-1.xx&_nc_gid=KzHhQmdLl-e886DM-O_UpQ&oh=00_AYHm8U-6Qz5wQ7f7bEEEYVNhSQSv2BGFGEYFkNh2AXraaQ&oe=680AE59C)\n\nSee [Multi-Product Message Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/message-templates/mpm-templates) to learn how to create and send MPM templates.\n\n## Product Card Carousel Template Messages\n\nProduct card carousel template messages allow you to send a single text message accompanied by a set of up to 10 product cards in a horizontally scrollable view.\n\n![](https://scontent-lax3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/456451243_832660229062364_6760679807399209749_n.png?_nc_cat=108&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=n510z72qxY8Q7kNvwE-URrC&_nc_oc=AdnjWRNvruuyKTLJXehDulwz-NtvjBfCMmB7HvrA2RG-oe5TCvlXEkUWaL19mdZ7s1A&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-1.xx&_nc_gid=KzHhQmdLl-e886DM-O_UpQ&oh=00_AYElIM8ZgG74NykqFEL2zm2LALcYSnxeuBWaEYezehKAoA&oe=680B0223)\n\nSee [Product Card Carousel Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/message-templates/product-card-carousel-templates) to learn how to create and send these templates.\n\n## Product Messages\n\nBoth Multi-Product Messages and Single-Product Messages are types of interactive messages.\n\n|     |     |\n| --- | --- |\n| _Multi-Product message example:_ | _Single-Product message example:_ |\n| ![](https://scontent-lax3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.8562-6/292108221_1395416057607341_8626862943168807306_n.png?_nc_cat=104&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=f537c7&_nc_ohc=zEIRyBgEQbYQ7kNvwFIIFtJ&_nc_oc=AdklHFa1wqsA2CIbi7WdKnQNX3EKS-0v5LCbDvu4FXGTZVUNuADN2GaJGRPn_CVRKT4&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-1.xx&_nc_gid=KzHhQmdLl-e886DM-O_UpQ&oh=00_AYH6R5z8h1HzTjim3VVH0bN8UL4BcFWU6UX-dhFsN6Ll6Q&oe=67F68541) | ![](https://scontent-lax3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.8562-6/312656331_827995635053809_8142366016380114877_n.png?_nc_cat=105&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=f537c7&_nc_ohc=7vdl0x7T8VEQ7kNvwEGKL94&_nc_oc=AdnukMyD6dM24FptZUSNvslAqgsSXM9M0HDAcMX9i49387lDaillIN5TlwlB7bYyXaM&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-1.xx&_nc_gid=KzHhQmdLl-e886DM-O_UpQ&oh=00_AYGxxd_LSL_hIxNloHAp_zHedU0QRS7R37cIzlKP99cdgw&oe=67F69EDE) |\n| _Menu triggered when user clicks on Start Shopping:_ | _Product Detail Page example:_ |\n| ![](https://scontent-lax3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.8562-6/289528853_2914485008850727_2814545241726052772_n.png?_nc_cat=100&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=f537c7&_nc_ohc=O99mzcZnqkEQ7kNvwG2nAff&_nc_oc=AdkfVfFnacslCwZiul8MUKdH5l0bBOA6zJpluAv0CxsUfoQ_Z1goXCWw37xePLMWhtY&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-2.xx&_nc_gid=KzHhQmdLl-e886DM-O_UpQ&oh=00_AYEJOuUa1l41S29gD0C3Ns-9BegkvkEegw6GQzDmGsudvQ&oe=67F67A25) | ![](https://scontent-lax3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.8562-6/288650990_707961303771386_2387792743578105956_n.png?_nc_cat=107&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=f537c7&_nc_ohc=DLvlfXki0lAQ7kNvwETlCsr&_nc_oc=AdlmZASTpytHk6XUcom7fR_2QdZh3fTAaqgKXkKzrtzulY52pmQ43MKL0ztuQTrAcwg&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-2.xx&_nc_gid=KzHhQmdLl-e886DM-O_UpQ&oh=00_AYGWZM-t9pfTc_ZPL-A-CxE2wpTyyPgKVdeGbZPV8QTdsQ&oe=67F66E7F) |\n\n### Overview\n\nCustomers that receive Multi- and Single-Product Messages can perform 3 main actions:\n\n1. View products: Customers can see a list of products or just one product. Whenever a customer clicks on a specific item, we fetch the product's latest info and display the product in a Product Detail Page (PDP) format. Currently, PDPs only support product images — any videos and/or GIFs added to the product won’t be displayed in the PDP.\n2. Add products to a cart: Whenever a user adds a product to the shopping cart, we fetch the item’s latest info. If there has been a state change on any of the items, we display a dialog saying \"One or more items in your cart have been updated\" — See [Product Updates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services/share-products#product-updates) for more information. A cart persists in a chat thread between you and your customer until the cart is sent to you — See [Shopping Cart Experience](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services/share-products#shopping-cart-experience) for details.\n3. Send a shopping cart to you: After adding all needed items, customers can send their cart to you. After that, you can define the next steps, such as requesting delivery info or giving payment options.\n\nIf your customer has multiple devices linked to their account, the Multi-Product and Single-Product Messages will be synced between devices. However, the shopping cart is local to each specific device. See [Shopping Cart Experience](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services/share-products#shopping-cart-experience) for details.\n\nCurrently, these types of messages can be received in the following platforms:\n\n- iOS: 2.21.100 (Multi-Product Messages) and 2.21.210 (Single-Product Messages).\n- Android: 2.21.9.15 (Multi-Product Messages) and 2.21.19 (Single-Product Messages).\n- Web: The web client that supports these features has been launched.\n\nIf the customer's app version does not support Multi- or Single-Product Messages, they will instead receive a message explaining that they were unable to receive a message because they are using an outdated version of WhatsApp. We will also send you a webhook notification indicating the message was unable to be delivered due to the customer using an outdated version of WhatsApp.\n\n### Expected Behavior for Messages\n\nMulti-Product Messages and Single-Product Messages can be:\n\n- Forwarded by one user to another.\n- Reopened by a user within the same conversation.\n\nMulti-Product Messages and Single-Product Messages cannot be:\n\n- Sent as notifications. They can only be sent as part of existing conversations.\n\n### Limitations\n\nUnlike product messages sent via the WhatsApp Business app, messages sent via the Cloud API currently do not display a shopping cart icon in the chat thread header.\n\n### Product Updates\n\nYou may need to update properties of items in your catalog. Depending on the updated property, this is how we handle any messages mentioning that product:\n\n| Updated Property | Update Process |\n| --- | --- |\n| Product's price, title, description, and image. | 1. You send a Multi or Single-Product Message containing product A.<br>2. You update product A's properties on their catalog.<br>3. The screens that display that product are updated as soon as the customer client learns about the change from the server. |\n| Availability change | 1. You send a customer a Multi- or Single-Product Message containing product B.<br>2. You sell all units of product B available. Then, you update your catalog saying that product B is no longer available<br>3. If a customer has already added product B to a cart, the item will be removed from the cart. The shopping cart displays a dialog saying \"One or more items in your cart have been updated\".<br>4. If a customer has not added product B to the cart, the Multi- or Single-Product Message now shows the item as unavailable. |\n\n### Shopping Cart Experience\n\nAfter viewing products, a customer can add them to their shopping cart and send that cart to you. For the purposes of commerce on WhatsApp, a shopping cart:\n\n- Is unique to a customer/business chat thread in a specific device: Only one cart is created per chat thread between you and a customer, and carts do not persist across multiple devices. Once a cart is sent, the customer can open another cart with you and start the process again.\n- Has no expiration date: The cart persists in the chat thread until it is sent to you. Once sent, the cart is cleared.\n\nCustomers can add up to 99 units of each single catalog item to a shopping cart, but there is no limit on the number of distinct items that can be added to a cart.\n\nOnce a cart has been sent, no edits can be made. Customers can send a new cart if they need new items, or would like to change their order. You cannot send carts to customers.\n\n|     |     |\n| --- | --- |\n| ![](https://scontent-lax3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.8562-6/289576410_357660536502359_7357229773376420895_n.png?_nc_cat=104&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=f537c7&_nc_ohc=ebAEXEoEdswQ7kNvwG3BkTd&_nc_oc=Adk8qZXtgbI2-jbjFv8UvIrm6LXg2xOLABcyYD_WfM8R9pI4GFy9EPLKRSRa1ZmTiDc&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-1.xx&_nc_gid=KzHhQmdLl-e886DM-O_UpQ&oh=00_AYHTo6NDVJ8ND3maV7N6HtBcAPGlZ4T8VFCASUbO5HCmOw&oe=67F678D7) | ![](https://scontent-lax3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.8562-6/289414889_571456754569942_5382094597567091524_n.png?_nc_cat=100&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=f537c7&_nc_ohc=SIBSWNnVcQwQ7kNvwHVg3Jx&_nc_oc=AdlQ1ib4vXWp1wFxhP-0p01ZH3HftqJF6tRwG2Yux5YTpZ8WfOkQ1xGlqaaoXQLOKrY&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-2.xx&_nc_gid=KzHhQmdLl-e886DM-O_UpQ&oh=00_AYFyyGTeH5KyCV_jpPgf0v0Z0w0FRsn-ND0sz7HisoUBHg&oe=67F6A538) |\n\n_Shopping cart experience example and expected behavior for item state change._\n\n### Why You Should Use Them\n\nBoth Multi- and Single-Product Messages lend themselves best to user experiences that are simple and personalized, where it's a better experience to guide the customer to a subset of items most relevant to them, rather than browsing your full inventory.\n\n#### Simple and Efficient\n\nCombining the features with navigation tools like NLP, text search or List Messages and Reply Buttons to get to what the customer is looking for fast.\n\n#### Personal\n\nPopulated dynamically so can be personalized to the customer or situation. For example, you can show a Multi-Product Message of a customer’s most frequently ordered items.\n\n#### Business Outcomes\n\nA performant channel for driving orders, during testing businesses had an average 7% conversion of Multi-Product Messages sent to carts received.\n\n#### No Templates\n\nInteractive messages do not require templates or pre-approvals. They are generated in real-time and will always reflect the latest item details, pricing and stock levels from your inventory.\n\n### Why You Should Use It\n\nMulti-Product Messages are best for guiding customers to a specific subset of your inventory, such as:\n\n- Shopping in a conversational way. For example, using search functionality to allow customers to type a shopping list and send back a Multi-Product Message in response.\n- Navigating to a specific category. For example, fitness apparel.\n- Personalized offers or recommendations.\n- Re-ordering previously ordered items. For example, a user can re-order their regular take-out order of less than 30 items.\n\nSingle-Product Messages are best for guiding customers to one specific item from your inventory, offering quick responses from a limited set of options, such as:\n\n- Responding to a customer’s specific request.\n- Providing a recommendation.\n- Reordering a previous item.\n\nBoth features can also be used as part of a human agent flow, however you need to build the tooling to allow the human agent to generate a Multi-Product Message or Single-Product Message in thread.\n\n### Sending Product Messages\n\nBefore sending product messages, follow the get started best suited for your needs:\n\n- [Get Started for people developing for themselves or their organization](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started)\n- [Get Started for Solution Partners](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started-for-solution-partners)\n\nAll API calls mentioned in this guide must be authenticated with an access token. Developers can authenticate their API calls with the access token generated in the **App Dashboard** \\> **WhatsApp** \\> **API Setup** panel. Solution Partners must authenticate themselves with an access token with the [whatsapp\\_business\\_messaging](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/permissions/reference/whatsapp_business_messaging) permission.\n\n### Step 1: Assemble the Interactive Object\n\n#### Single-Product Messages\n\nTo send a Single-Product Message, assemble an `interactive` object of type `product` with the following components:\n\n| Required Components | Optional Components |\n| --- | --- |\n| - Action Object — Must include both catalog\\_id and product\\_retailer\\_id. | - Body Object<br>- Footer Object |\n\nSee [Messages, Interactive Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages#interactive-object) for full information. By the end of the process, the interactive object should look something like this:\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"PHONE_NUMBER\",\n  \"type\": \"interactive\",\n  \"interactive\": {\n    \"type\": \"product\",\n    \"body\": {\n      \"text\": \"BODY_TEXT\"\n    },\n    \"footer\": {\n      \"text\": \"FOOTER_TEXT\"\n    },\n    \"action\": {\n      \"catalog_id\": \"CATALOG_ID\",\n      \"product_retailer_id\": \"ID_TEST_ITEM_1\"\n    }\n  }\n}\n```\n\n#### Multi-Product Messages\n\nTo send a Multi-Product Message, assemble an `interactive` object of type `product_list` with the following components:\n\n| Required Components | Optional Components |\n| --- | --- |\n| - Header Object — Header’s type must be set to text. Remember to add a text object with the desired content.<br>- Body Object<br>- Action Object - Must include catalog\\_id and sections.<br>  <br>  <br>  - Sections must be an array of objects describing each section using title and product\\_items.<br>    <br>    <br>    - Each section's product\\_items value must be an array describing each product in the section using product\\_retailer\\_id and the product's SKU number. | - Footer Object |\n\nSee [Messages, Interactive Object](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages#interactive-object) for full information. By the end of the process, the interactive object should look something like this:\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"PHONE_NUMBER\",\n  \"type\": \"interactive\",\n  \"interactive\": {\n    \"type\": \"product_list\",\n    \"header\":{\n      \"type\": \"text\",\n      \"text\": \"HEADER_CONTENT\"\n    },\n    \"body\": {\n      \"text\": \"BODY_CONTENT\"\n    },\n    \"footer\": {\n      \"text\": \"FOOTER_CONTENT\"\n    },\n    \"action\": {\n      \"catalog_id\": \"CATALOG_ID\",\n      \"sections\": [\\\n        {\\\n          \"title\": \"SECTION_TITLE\",\\\n          \"product_items\": [\\\n            { \"product_retailer_id\": \"PRODUCT-SKU\" },\\\n            { \"product_retailer_id\": \"PRODUCT-SKU\" },\\\n            ...\\\n          ]\\\n\\\n        },\\\n        {\\\n          \"title\": \"SECTION_TITLE\",\\\n          \"product_items\": [\\\n            { \"product_retailer_id\": \"PRODUCT-SKU\" },\\\n            { \"product_retailer_id\": \"PRODUCT-SKU\" },\\\n            ...\\\n          ]\\\n        }\\\n      ]\n    }\n  }\n}\n```\n\n#### Missing Items\n\nIf none of the items provided in the API calls above matches a product from your product catalog, an error message is sent and the Multi- or Single-Product Message is not sent to the user.\n\nFor Multi-Product Message, at least one item from the products list must match an item from your product catalog. In this case:\n\n- Messages are sent successfully\n- Items without a match are dropped\n- You receive an error message asking for a catalog update\n\n### Step 2: Add Common Message Parameters\n\nOnce the interactive object is complete, append the other parameters that make a message: `recipient_type`, `to`, `messaging_product`, and `type`. Remember to set the `type` to `interactive`.\n\n```\ncurl -X  POST https://graph.facebook.com/v22.0/FROM_PHONE_NUMBER/messages \\\n -H 'Authorization: Bearer ACCESS_TOKEN' \\\n - d '{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"PHONE_NUMBER\",\n  \"type\": \"interactive\",\n  \"interactive\": {\n  // INTERACTIVE OBJECT GOES HERE\n}'\n```\n\nFor all available parameters, see [Reference, Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages#message-object).\n\n### Step 3: Send a Request to the Messages Endpoint\n\nSend a POST request to the [`/PHONE_NUMBER_ID/messages`](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages) endpoint with the JSON object you have assembled in steps 1 and 2. If your message is sent successfully, you get the following response:\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"contacts\": [{\\\n      \"input\": \"PHONE_NUMBER\",\\\n      \"wa_id\": \"WHATSAPP_ID\",\\\n    }]\n  \"messages\": [{\\\n      \"id\": \"wamid.ID\",\\\n    }]\n}\n```\n\n## Single-Product Message Template Messages\n\nSingle-Product Message (SPM) template messages present a single product from your ecommerce catalog, accompanied by a product image, product title, and product price (all pulled from your product within your catalog), along with customizable body text, optional footer text, and an interactive **View** button.\n\n![](https://scontent-lax3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/456334558_1165670014537761_4619872146080155046_n.png?_nc_cat=107&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=TEpVDueue6YQ7kNvwHOR5Zm&_nc_oc=Adk6hPsQxYYRYpnJ4OUxR7EVKberLXNvXN5v4D6c7GhdZUWXnRO96oFDhZZKqX4SNeU&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-2.xx&_nc_gid=KzHhQmdLl-e886DM-O_UpQ&oh=00_AYFOu46HDmy6pYlZbb68eJvu0-gsu5gGiRO_Op4iAwnb3Q&oe=680AF00E)\n\nSee [Single-Product Message Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/message-templates/spm-templates) to learn how to create and send SPM templates.\n\n[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\|\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\\|\n\n[Business Management Providers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started-for-tech-providers)\n- [Multi-Partner Solutions](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/multi-partner-solutions)\n- [Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages)\n\n\n- [Flow](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/interactive-flow-messages)\n- [Interactive List](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/interactive-list-messages)\n- [Interactive Reply Buttons](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/interactive-reply-buttons-messages)\n- [Location](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/location-messages)\n- [Location Request](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages/location-request-messages)\n- [Reaction](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/reaction-messages)\n- [Sticker](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/sticker-messages)\n- [Template](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates)\n\n\n- [Auth Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/auth-otp-template-messages)\n- [Template Library](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/template-library)\n- [Catalog Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/catalog-template-messages)\n- [Coupon Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/coupon-templates)\n- [LTO Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/limited-time-offer-template-messages)\n- [Media card carousel templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/media-card-carousel-templates)\n- [MPM Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/mpm-template-messages)\n- [Product Card Carousel Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/product-card-carousel-templates)\n- [SPM template messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/spm-template-messages)\n- [Flows Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/flows-templates)\n\n- [Text](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/text-messages)\n- [Video](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/video-messages)\n- [Read Receipts](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/mark-message-as-read)\n\n- [Block Users](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/block-users)\n- [Phone Numbers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/phone-numbers)\n- [Webhooks](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/set-up-webhooks)\n- [Sell Products & Services](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/sell-products-and-services)\n- [Payments API - India](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-in)\n- [Payments API - Brazil](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/payments-api/payments-br)\n- [Reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference)\n- [Support](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support)\n\n# Sending Limited-Time Offer Templates\n\nThis document describes how to send an approved [limited-time offer template](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/message-templates/limited-time-offer-templates) in a template message.\n\nUse the [WhatsApp Business Phone Number > Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages) endpoint to send an approved limited-time offer template in a template message.\n\n## Request Syntax\n\n```\nPOST /<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>/messages\n```\n\n### Post Body\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"<CUSTOMER_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\n  \"type\": \"template\",\n  \"template\": {\n    \"name\": \"<TEMPLATE_NAME>\",\n    \"language\": {\n      \"code\": \"<TEMPLATE_LANGUAGE_CODE>\"\n    },\n    \"components\": [\\\n\\\n      /* Required if template uses header, otherwise omit */\\\n      {\\\n        \"type\": \"header\",\\\n        \"parameters\": [\\\n          {\\\n            \"type\": \"<HEADER_TYPE>\",\\\n            \"<HEADER_TYPE>\": {\\\n              \"id\": \"<HEADER_ASSET_ID>\"\\\n            }\\\n          }\\\n        ]\\\n      },\\\n\\\n      /* Body and params required if templates uses body params, otherwise omit */\\\n      {\\\n        \"type\": \"body\",\\\n        \"parameters\": [\\\n          <BODY_VARIABLES>\\\n        ]\\\n      },\\\n\\\n      /* Required if template uses offer expiration details, otherwise omit */\\\n      {\\\n        \"type\": \"limited_time_offer\",\\\n        \"parameters\": [\\\n          {\\\n            \"type\": \"limited_time_offer\",\\\n            \"limited_time_offer\": {\\\n              \"expiration_time_ms\": <EXPIRATION_TIME>\\\n            }\\\n          }\\\n        ]\\\n      },\\\n\\\n      /* Copy code button optional */\\\n      {\\\n        \"type\": \"button\",\\\n        \"sub_type\": \"copy_code\",\\\n        \"index\": 0,\\\n        \"parameters\": [\\\n          {\\\n            \"type\": \"coupon_code\",\\\n            \"coupon_code\": \"<OFFER_CODE>\"\\\n          }\\\n        ]\\\n      },\\\n\\\n      /* Required */\\\n      {\\\n        \"type\": \"button\",\\\n        \"sub_type\": \"url\",\\\n        \"index\": <URL_BUTTON_INDEX>,\\\n        \"parameters\": [\\\n          {\\\n            \"type\": \"text\",\\\n            \"text\": \"<URL_VARIABLE>\"\\\n          }\\\n        ]\\\n      }\\\n    ]\n  }\n}'\n```\n\n## Body Properties\n\n| Placeholder | Description | Example Value |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| `<BODY_VARIABLES>`<br>_Array of objects_ | **Required if template body text uses variables.**<br>Body text variable values. Define each variable as an individual object. | `{\"type\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Pablo\"},{\"type\":\"text\",\"text\":\"CARIBE25\"}` |\n| `<CUSTOMER_PHONE_NUMBER>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>Phone number of customer who the template message should be sent to. | `+16505555555` |\n| `<EXPIRATION_TIME>`<br>_Unix timestamp_ | **Required.**<br>Offer code expiration time as a UNIX timestamp in milliseconds. | `1698562800000` |\n| `<HEADER_ASSET_ID>`<br>_Media asset ID_ | **Required.**<br>Uploaded media asset ID. Use the [/PHONE\\_NUMBER\\_ID/media](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/media#upload-media) endpoint to generate an ID. | `1602186516975000` |\n| `<HEADER_TYPE>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>Header type used by the template. Values can be `image` or `video`. | `image` |\n| `<OFFER_CODE>`<br>_String_ | **Required if template uses a copy code button.**<br>Offer code.<br>Maximum 15 characters. | `CARIBE25` |\n| `<TEMPLATE_LANGUAGE_CODE>`<br>_Enum_ | **Required.**<br>The template's [language and locale code](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/message-templates/supported-languages). | `en_US` |\n| `<TEMPLATE_NAME>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>The template's name. | `limited_time_offer_caribbean_pkg_2023` |\n| `<URL_BUTTON_INDEX>`<br>_Integer_ | **Required.**<br>URL button index. If the template uses a copy code button, value must be `1`.<br>If the template does not use a copy code button, the value must be `0`. | `1` |\n| `<URL_VARIABLE>`<br>_String_ | **Required if URL uses a variable.**<br>URL variable value.<br>No maximum but value counts against URL string maximum of 2000 characters. | `n3mtql` |\n\n## Example Request\n\nExample request to send a limited-time offer template that uses:\n\n- an image header\n- body text variables\n- the offer expiration details\n- a copy code button\n- a URL button with a variable\n\n```\ncurl 'https://graph.facebook.com/v17.0/106540352242922/messages' \\\n-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...' \\\n-d '\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"16505555555\",\n  \"type\": \"template\",\n  \"template\": {\n    \"name\": \"limited_time_offer_caribbean_pkg_2023\",\n    \"language\": {\n      \"code\": \"en_US\"\n    },\n    \"components\": [\\\n      {\\\n        \"type\": \"header\",\\\n        \"parameters\": [\\\n          {\\\n            \"type\": \"image\",\\\n            \"image\": {\\\n              \"id\": \"1602186516975000\"\\\n            }\\\n          }\\\n        ]\\\n      },\\\n      {\\\n        \"type\": \"body\",\\\n        \"parameters\": [\\\n          {\\\n            \"type\": \"text\",\\\n            \"text\": \"Pablo\"\\\n          },\\\n          {\\\n            \"type\": \"text\",\\\n            \"text\": \"CARIBE25\"\\\n          }\\\n        ]\\\n      },\\\n      {\\\n        \"type\": \"limited_time_offer\",\\\n        \"parameters\": [\\\n          {\\\n            \"type\": \"limited_time_offer\",\\\n            \"limited_time_offer\": {\\\n              \"expiration_time_ms\": 1209600000\\\n            }\\\n          }\\\n        ]\\\n      },\\\n      {\\\n        \"type\": \"button\",\\\n        \"sub_type\": \"copy_code\",\\\n        \"index\": 0,\\\n        \"parameters\": [\\\n          {\\\n            \"type\": \"coupon_code\",\\\n            \"coupon_code\": \"CARIBE25\"\\\n          }\\\n        ]\\\n      },\\\n      {\\\n        \"type\": \"button\",\\\n        \"sub_type\": \"url\",\\\n        \"index\": 1,\\\n        \"parameters\": [\\\n          {\\\n            \"type\": \"text\",\\\n            \"text\": \"n3mtql\"\\\n          }\\\n        ]\\\n      }\\\n    ]\n  }\n}'\n\n```\n\n## Example Response\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"contacts\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"input\": \"16505555555\",\\\n      \"wa_id\": \"16505555555\"\\\n    }\\\n  ],\n  \"messages\": [\\\n    {\\\n      \"id\": \"wamid.HBgLMTY1MDUwNzY1MjAVAgARGBI5QTNDQTVCM0Q0Q0Q2RTY3RTcA\"\\\n    }\\\n  ]\n}\n\n```\n\n[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\|\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\\|\n\n[Business Management API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api)\n\n* * API](https://www.facebook.com/legal/Meta-Hosting-Terms-Cloud-API)\n- [WhatsApp Business Messaging Policy](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fbusiness.whatsapp.com%2Fpolicy&h=AT2Z9XR22Z-k7Va1ELi4SJ6rP2itXvMtwZnvjP49nRVLuQZNLLQPEC_m4mmVlh8GnYhIfzJYXnLk2W-fdjoE0XwZelHG39zfQJTqXItamIoHlRgMBUF_aJ3ceo47hjf-nUxf8QFJWwPI5A)\n- [WhatsApp Business Terms of Service](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.whatsapp.com%2Flegal%2Fbusiness-terms&h=AT3t_v8Qw23NZoJbxCDeAymHShnmPgS4S9T0LpRUvR-vdYqoQdod6cQGLEjWsrzcz4sYx4IhjupamBk-sNNWkzci6bok-kYkG6Pp1tfZbzgZ0xGTtYl2HzDhFXQzkYQMOVUoUo0TB3cPaw)\n- Troubleshooting\n\n### Message Not Delivered\n\nThe following scenarios can cause a message to appear as sent but not delivered. For many of these reasons, **we will not disclose the underlying cause of the error**, due to privacy and policy reasons.\n\n- The customer did not come online during the 30 day window where we hold messages for offline customers.\n- The customer has blocked the business phone number, or another business phone number owned by the business.\n- The customer is in a [restricted or sanctioned country](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#country-restrictions).\n\nIn some scenarios, the API returns an [error code](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes) with an error message describing the nature of the error. Example scenarios:\n\n- Invalid request parameters\n- Integrity errors\n- The customer has not accepted our new Terms of Service and Privacy Policy. Please send your end user this link [https://wa.me/tos/20210210](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwa.me%2Ftos%2F20210210&h=AT3S4yWrl_oW4fPnCuZnqIzw4cI0Q0CGV3QsWQ1-6XbnZyUTaBRReJoctq1TASEiPUI0GzeJdcuuYwTKZe-ly7etKGNPkxpsDEYEXixEOwc0Uxjzctwye6Ht3BRc8SbM00rnnS-wNeRJSA) to accept the latest Terms of Service.\n- The customer is using an old version of WhatsApp. Customers should use the following version or greater:\n\n  - Android: 2.21.15.15\n  - SMBA: 2.21.15.15\n  - iOS: 2.21.170.4\n  - SMBI: 2.21.170.4\n  - KaiOS: 2.2130.10\n  - Web: 2.2132.6\n- The customer is part of an [experiment](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/experiments) group.\n- The message was not delivered to create a high quality user experience. See [Per-User Marketing Template Message Limits](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates#per-user-marketing-template-message-limits).\n\n#### Possible Solutions\n\nUsing a non-WhatsApp communication method, ask the WhatsApp user to:\n\n- confirm that they can actually send a message to your WhatsApp business phone number(s)\n- confirm that none of your WhatsApp business phone numbers are in their list of blocked numbers ( **Settings** \\> **Privacy** \\> **Blocked** or **Blocked contacts**)\n- confirm that they have accepted our latest Terms of Service ( **Settings** \\> **Help**, or **Settings** \\> **Application information** will prompt them to accept the latest terms/policies if they haven't done so already)\n- update to the latest version of the WhatsApp client\n\n### Country Restrictions\n\nBusinesses in Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Syria, and three sanctioned regions in Ukraine (Crimea, Donetsk, Luhansk) are not eligible to use the WhatsApp Business Platform.\n\nWhatsApp Messenger (WhatsApp) and WhatsApp Business app users in Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Syria, and three sanctioned regions in Ukraine (Crimea, Donetsk, Luhansk) are not eligible to receive messages sent via the WhatsApp Business Platform.\n\nAs of May 15, 2024, Türkiye is no longer restricted for Cloud API business messaging. Cloud API businesses can now initiate conversations and receive messages from WhatsApp users with Turkish numbers.\n\n### Webhooks\n\n#### Conflicting Message Delivery Status\n\nIn rare cases, the same message may trigger both success and failure [message status update webhooks](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/webhooks/payload-examples#message-status-updates). For example, a message may trigger message webhooks with `\"status\":\"delivered\"` and another webhook with `\"status\":\"failed\"`. This can happen when a customer is logged in to WhatsApp on multiple devices and the message is successfully delivered to one device but not the other. Any message that triggers a `\"delivered\"` message status webhook has been delivered to at least one of the user's devices.\n\n### Error Code `2` \\- API Service\n\nWhen we update the API, you may experience up to 5 minutes of downtime. During this period of time, the service is unavailable. We try to make these updates with minimal disruption to businesses, but you may end up being affected\n\n#### How To Debug\n\nWe suggest that you wait 5 minutes and try to make the API call again.\n\n### Authentication and Authorization Errors\n\nThese errors are returned when there was a problem with the access token you are using for the API call.\n\n#### How To Debug\n\nYou can directly paste the access token you are using into the [Access Token Debugger](https://developers.facebook.com/tools/debug/accesstoken). Then, check if you have selected the `whatsapp_business_management` and `whatsapp_business_messaging` permissions.\n\nIf your token doesn’t have access to the permissions, you need to generate a new one. While generating the token, make sure to select:\n\n- The Meta app you are using for the API calls\n- The following permissions: `whatsapp_business_management` and `whatsapp_business_messaging`\n\n## FAQs\n\n### General FAQs\n\n[Which company will be providing the Cloud API?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_873905230230961)\n\nWhatsApp develops and operates the WhatsApp Business API, which enables businesses to communicate with WhatsApp consumer users on the WhatsApp network. When using the Cloud API, Meta will host the WhatsApp Business API for you and provide an endpoint for the WhatsApp service for your incoming and outgoing WhatsApp communications.\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_873905230230961)\n\n[Does the introduction of Cloud API mean WhatsApp is deprecating the existing On-Premises API?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_861067461188258)\n\nPlease view information about the [sunset of the On-Premises API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/on-premises/sunset).\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_861067461188258)\n\n[Are there any additional costs for the Cloud API?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_4391871607539216)\n\nAccess to Cloud API is free, and we expect it to generate additional cost savings for developers, as Meta hosts and maintains the Cloud API.\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_4391871607539216)\n\n[Will consumers know whether a business is using the Cloud API or the On-Premises API?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_1337008646695629)\n\nWe want to make it clear what it means to message with a business on WhatsApp. Some businesses may choose to use Meta or another company to help them manage and store their messages. When a business chooses to manage their messages with another company, we will let consumers know by showing a different system message. [Learn more](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Ffaq.whatsapp.com%2Fgeneral%2Fsecurity-and-privacy%2Fwhy-am-i-seeing-a-new-system-message-in-my-whatsapp-chats&h=AT3B4v6c3gzZjCHFwoMwFWbVl7RsNsE-b3KC4CmzTX9ANYQf6_uFHMJkavaqU-_-6zKKzrWgjBz9XzyDYWCtpfLr-kFwuygeNz49eefYKpqCOEjbtKa4RyoJW4ynZaL0Fw68Q9-vv9Ssdw).\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_1337008646695629)\n\n### Technical Implementation FAQs\n\n[What is the architecture of the Cloud API?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_1133198140536519)\n\nThe Cloud API architecture significantly simplifies the Solution Partner's operational and infrastructure requirements to integrate with WhatsApp Business Platform. First, it removes the infrastructure requirements to run Business API docker containers (CAPEX savings). Second, it obviates the need of operational responsibilities to manage the deployment (OPEX savings). For details, refer to the architecture diagram comparing the On-Premises and Cloud API deployments.\n\n![](https://scontent-lax3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.8562-6/240462671_714107706653430_5683717668189775578_n.png?_nc_cat=102&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=f537c7&_nc_ohc=24p2qNfn5k4Q7kNvwHd4I5D&_nc_oc=Admp3eohm_GuIcyfT3CDj8BP2luXyi-jyz1-EjMFAJkVFmvNrI-hS_wk85VK7O2M90Y&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent-lax3-1.xx&_nc_gid=f7OAZwfwie6iA5d-HkmJDg&oh=00_AYGEYJXh6MoZceYyxfuOpH4EIi2O5SO6I53ywkj3ilDBxg&oe=67F69FDE)\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_1133198140536519)\n\n[Will the Solution Partner or direct client need containers and what data will be in those containers?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_384148039983633)\n\nSolution Partners and direct clients do not need the WebApp and CoreApp containers that are used in the On-Premises API. Meta will manage all database data and media data on behalf of the Solution Partner or direct client.\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_384148039983633)\n\n[How does WhatsApp recommend I conduct load tests for the Cloud API?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_549644352922793)\n\nAs your on-premises performance depends heavily on your hardware, software, and connectivity to WhatsApp servers, if you wish to understand these differences, you can perform your own load tests on Cloud API as you might have done for your own on-premises installation. You can also refer to our [performance comparison](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/on-premises-cloud-api-comparison) to understand more details around how the on-premise and Cloud APIs compare.\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_549644352922793)\n\n[How can we migrate from On-Premises to the Cloud API?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_1132481834256692)\n\nMigrating between the on-premises and Cloud APIs is seamless, and can be done bidirectionally. See [migration details](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/migrate-between-on-premises-and-cloud-api) for more information.\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_1132481834256692)\n\n### Reliability FAQs\n\n[How can I track latency and availability metrics for Cloud API in more detail?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_3110824062544682)\n\nPlease view our [WhatsApp Business API Status Page](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fmetastatus.com%2Fwhatsapp-business-api&h=AT3DraQaXpvLAwAE5Iq9hTjqYahLQSlHtZQlKhP5A4TYaYvDgiDxMcYgl_R1hhHYOCFSljhGkpvVSz_zgQhDIODV1iIMl3QfbF2ND3ABxpKgwORrWtoz09dnLo9FuKH1D5hN5koiSoU2nA) for Cloud API specific observability metrics.\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_3110824062544682)\n\n[How is availability downtime calculated?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_762291718863960)\n\nPlease view the [API Status Page](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/support-api-status-page#availability) document for more details.\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_762291718863960)\n\n[How often are availability numbers updated?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_2126292087572045)\n\nAvailability is updated once a day.\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_2126292087572045)\n\n[Are there instances where downtime in availability is overridden?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_140473225618592)\n\nThere could be situations where certain user errors can be automatically counted incorrectly toward downtime. In these situations, we will override the downtime to uptime after detailed analysis within a week.\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_140473225618592)\n\n[Meta Status Page reflects no issues for Cloud API, yet I am still facing issues.](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_1410453006519066)\n\nThere may be issues that do not impact our global availability. In these cases, the [WhatsApp Business API Status Page](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fmetastatus.com%2Fwhatsapp-business-api&h=AT1oDn9DMPP2DSJ9yOU_G3FYBxkkXYldQn3ieB84As6UJz0e1JAZu7GAuaF7U0IBZmvrPofCqWtxD1chFL5bsFQ08NFM22xbin-fe1S5bVPfpDB9lz9EQa2ojJGoECzd9JkaRaw3JhG8sw) will have a status to reflect that there may be some disruptions that are not affecting global availability. Please submit a [Direct Support](https://business.facebook.com/direct-support) ticket to investigate further.\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_1410453006519066)\n\n[Are there instances where downtime in availability is not automatically tracked?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_1401826784001266)\n\nThere are the cases where downtimes in availability are not automatically tracked:\n\n- Network issues causing requests to fail before they reach the Graph API layer (first layer).\n- Network issues causing outbound webhooks not to reach business's webhook endpoint.\n\nAny issues that surface before admission into our system after this point will appear as either error or missed success. Also issues encountered after the first attempt to emit the webhook will continue to be retried, until it is successfully delivered to the webhook endpoint.\n\nThe other cases that are reflected in the availability dashboard after manual detection are (not system error):\n\n- Meta authentication issues like auth token (security libraries) are determined whether they are legitimate requests failing authentication or authorization.\n- Validation that rejects legitimate requests.\n\nIn both cases WhatsApp will detect and account for those issues after the fact, near real time, but not real time.\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_1401826784001266)\n\n[Are there product service level agreements available for uptime and/or latency?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_775539867197306)\n\nWe do not currently offer commercially available product service level agreements for uptime and/or latency.\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_775539867197306)\n\n[What will disaster recovery look like: if a region is unavailable, how much time does it take to move messages to another region?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_543667520173009)\n\nWe will have disaster recovery and data replication across multiple regions. The expected downtime would be within our SLA and usually in the order of less than a minute to less than five minutes.\n\n[Permalink](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support#faq_543667520173009)\n\n[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\|\n[Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api)\n\\|\n\n[Business Management API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api)\n\nOn This
