errors](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes#throttling-errors)\n\n![](https://lookaside.fbsbx.com/elementpath/media/?media_id=595945097590761&version=1743728118)[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp)\n\\>\nCloud API\n\n\n# Cloud API error codes\n\nThe Cloud API is built on the Graph API, so if you are unfamiliar with handling Graph API error responses, see the [Graph API error handling](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/guides/error-handling) documentation.\n\nIn general, we recommend that you build your app's error handling logic around `code` values and `details` payload properties. These properties and their values are more indicative of the underlying error.\n\nCode titles, which do not have a dedicated property in API error response payloads, are included as part of the `message` value. However, we recommend that you do not rely on titles for your error handling logic as titles will eventually be deprecated.\n\n**Receiving Errors: Synchronous and Asynchronous**\n\nCloud API errors are returned either synchronously as a Graph API response, asynchronously via Webhook, or sometimes through both methods.\n\nIt is a good practice when working with Cloud API that you monitor both the Graph API response and the `messages` webhook for error handling. If you are subscribed to the `messages` webhook field, you will receive notification of errors as they occur for supported asynchronous error types.\n\n## Error response webhooks and syntax\n\nCloud API errors can be surfaced in the following webhook objects:\n\n**Cloud API**\n\n- `entry.changes.value.errors`\n- `entry.changes.value.messages.errors`\n\n**On-Premises API**\n\n- `errors`\n\n**Error response syntax**\n\n```\n{\n  \"error\": {\n    \"message\": \"<MESSAGE>\",\n    \"type\": \"<TYPE>\",\n    \"code\": <CODE>,\n    \"error_data\": {\n        \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n        \"details\": \"<DETAILS>\"\n    },\n    \"error_subcode\": <ERROR_SUBCODE>\n    \"fbtrace_id\": \"<FBTRACE_ID>\"\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## Error response contents\n\n| Property | Value Type | Description |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| `code` | Integer | [Error code](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes#error-codes). We recommend that you build your app's error handling around error codes instead of subcodes or HTTP response status codes. |\n| `details` | String | Error description and a description of the most likely reason for the error. May also contain information on how to address the error, such as which parameter is invalid or what values are acceptable. |\n| `error_subcode` | Integer | **Deprecated. Will not be returned in v16.0+ responses.**<br>Graph API subcode. Not all responses will include a subcode, so we recommend that you build your error handling logic around `code` and `details` properties instead. |\n| `fbtrace_id` | String | Trace ID you can include when contacting [Direct Support](https://business.facebook.com/direct-support). The ID may help us debug the error. |\n| `message` | String | Combination of the error code and its title. For example: `(#130429) Rate limit hit`. |\n| `messaging_product` | String | Messaging product. This will always be the string `whatsapp` for Cloud API responses. |\n| `type` | String | Error type. |\n\n## Sample response\n\n```\n{\n  \"error\": {\n    \"message\": \"(#130429) Rate limit hit\",\n    \"type\": \"OAuthException\",\n    \"code\": 130429,\n    \"error_data\": {\n        \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n        \"details\": \"Message failed to send because there were too many messages sent from this phone number in a short period of time\"\n    },\n    \"error_subcode\": 2494055,\n    \"fbtrace_id\": \"Az8or2yhqkZfEZ-_4Qn_Bam\"\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## Error codes\n\n### Authorization errors\n\n| Code | Description | Possible Solutions | HTTP Status Code |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| `0`<br>AuthException | We were unable to authenticate the app user. | Typically this means the included access token has expired, been invalidated, or the app user has changed a setting to prevent all apps from accessing their data. We recommend that you [get a new access token](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/get-started#system-user-access-tokens). | `401`<br>Unauthorized |\n| `3`<br>API Method | Capability or permissions issue. | Use the [access token debugger](https://developers.facebook.com/tools/debug/accesstoken) to verify that your app has been granted the permissions required by the endpoint. See [Troubleshooting](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/troubleshooting#authentication-authorization). | `500`<br>Internal Server Error |\n| `10`<br>Permission Denied | Permission is either not granted or has been removed. | Use the [access token debugger](https://developers.facebook.com/tools/debug/accesstoken) to verify that your app has been granted the permissions required by the endpoint. See [Troubleshooting](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/troubleshooting#authentication-authorization).<br>Ensure that the phone number used to [set the business public key](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/whatsapp-business-encryption#set-business-public-key) is allowlisted. | `403`<br>Forbidden |\n| `190`<br>Access token has expired | Your access token has expired. | [Get a new access token](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/get-started#get-access-token). | `401`<br>Unauthorized |\n| `200-299`<br>API Permission | Permission is either not granted or has been removed. | Use the [access token debugger](https://developers.facebook.com/tools/debug/accesstoken) to verify that your app has been granted the permissions required by the endpoint. See [Troubleshooting](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/troubleshooting#authentication-authorization). | `403`<br>Forbidden |\n\n### Integrity errors\n\n| Code | Description | Possible Solutions | HTTP Status Code |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| `368`<br>Temporarily blocked for policies violations | The WhatsApp Business Account associated with the app has been restricted or disabled for violating a platform policy. | See the [Policy Enforcement](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/overview/policy-enforcement/) document to learn about policy violations and how to resolve them. | `403`<br>Forbidden |\n| `130497`<br>Business account is restricted from messaging users in this country. | The WhatsApp Business Account is restricted from messaging to users in certain countries. | See [WhatsApp Business Messaging Policy](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fbusiness.whatsapp.com%2Fpolicy&h=AT3cN6mSbgY1FulgF6QhhePMGW1sSSx7XDiwwLM9ZEs5xRGkThN7xMVdNHi-9bohyqTWbIv1_AxP9kqQljx3y9jk69gPpv5HWfc1HE2j-Xv0OddA3E6VN4a7BpRV5A65XuQ0FvPJ7cEReA) for details on allowed countries for messaging in your business category. | `403`<br>Forbidden |\n| `131031`<br>Account has been locked | The WhatsApp Business Account associated with the app has been restricted or disabled for violating a platform policy, or we were unable to verify data included in the request against data set on the WhatsApp Business Account (e.g, the two-step pin included in the request is incorrect). | See the [Policy Enforcement](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/overview/policy-enforcement/) document to learn about policy violations and how to resolve them.<br>You can also use the [Health Status API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/health-status), which may provide additional insight into the reason or reasons for the account lock. | `403`<br>Forbidden |\n\n### Other errors\n\n| Code | Description | Possible Solutions | HTTP Status Code |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| `1`<br>API Unknown | Invalid request or possible server error. | Check the [WhatsApp Business Platform Status](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fmetastatus.com%2Fwhatsapp-business-api&h=AT2E4cA38-39yZ9ycfZD3sXkBUACeo89bLuInfcFaKqU_c9pm67fITF549PgT2cEpZ-zQD9-VJx2le80mo3BA2NFAO98foJr__S_dtycKVoJvRCKpVH7_0uADBE7Z-7vkMQKN9qzfWcf4w) page to see API status information. If there are no server outages, check the endpoint [reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference) and verify that your request is formatted correctly and meets all endpoint requirements. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `2`<br>API Service | Temporary due to downtime or due to being overloaded. | Check the [WhatsApp Business Platform Status](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fmetastatus.com%2Fwhatsapp-business-api&h=AT3uVqed2zCVmirbIKXHq4hL9otcnJH9-XTdYMV59TJ5Rh8I1N1JcRb6o-LLDSrKTR8l4M4k89CW0CmOn3eVBXi0PDbVaDTbf9GFfsdx0Ya8empywJ8rV1WR4_0v-fy7HZOHcXHXRmuI_w) page to see API status information before trying again. | `503`<br>Service Unavailable |\n| `33`<br>Parameter value is not valid | The business phone number has been deleted. | Verify that the business phone number is correct. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `100`<br>Invalid parameter | The request included one or more unsupported or misspelled parameters. | See the endpoint's [reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference) to determine which parameters are supported and how they are spelled.<br>Ensure when setting the business public key, it is a [valid 2048-bit RSA public key in PEM format](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/whatsapp-business-encryption#gen).<br>Ensure there is no mismatch between the phone number id you are [registering](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#register-phone) and a previously stored phone number id.<br>Ensure your parameter is under any length restriction for the type. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `130472`<br>User's number is part of an experiment | Message was not sent as part of an [experiment](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/experiments). | See [Marketing Message Experiment](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/experiments#marketing-message-experiment). | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `131000`<br>Something went wrong | Message failed to send due to an unknown error.<br>When [setting a business public key](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/whatsapp-business-encryption#set-business-public-key), it either failed to calculate the signature, call the GraphQL endpoint, or the GraphQL endpoint returned an error. | Try again. If the error persists, open a [Direct Support](https://business.facebook.com/direct-support) ticket. | `500`<br>Internal Server Error |\n| `131005`<br>Access denied | Permission is either not granted or has been removed. | Use the [access token debugger](https://developers.facebook.com/tools/debug/accesstoken) to verify that your app has been granted the permissions required by the endpoint. See [Troubleshooting](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/troubleshooting#authentication-authorization). | `403`<br>Forbidden |\n| `131008`<br>Required parameter is missing | The request is missing a required parameter. | See the endpoint's [reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference) to determine which parameters are required. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `131009`<br>Parameter value is not valid | One or more parameter values are invalid. | See the endpoint's [reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference) to determine which values are supported for each parameter, and see [Phone Numbers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/phone-numbers) to learn how to add a phone number to a WhatsApp Business Account. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `131016`<br>Service unavailable | A service is temporarily unavailable. | Check the [WhatsApp Business Platform Status](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fmetastatus.com%2Fwhatsapp-business-api&h=AT177BYEoPk-iH1vpjf1EjAUoyHtWq9_iwRxZeC1WJDQRTHxkZXDlEGY7gd_2hvyxoZe8hMi4iL1NT7xMS4o6xvdAZl_TqQQ-LtzFt_CRlHSrbBuc17R6CUbEkpDEOSnYJTFbAS6uogrDA) page to see API status information before trying again. | `500`<br>Internal Server Error |\n| `131021`<br>Recipient cannot be sender | Sender and recipient phone number is the same. | Send a message to a phone number different from the sender. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `131026`<br>Message Undeliverable | Unable to deliver message. Reasons can include:<br>- The recipient phone number is not a WhatsApp phone number.<br>- Recipient has not accepted our new Terms of Service and Privacy Policy.<br>- Recipient using an old WhatsApp version; must use the following WhatsApp version or greater:<br>  <br>  - Android: 2.21.15.15<br>  - SMBA: 2.21.15.15<br>  - iOS: 2.21.170.4<br>  - SMBI: 2.21.170.4<br>  - KaiOS: 2.2130.10<br>  - Web: 2.2132.6 | Using a non-WhatsApp communication method, ask the WhatsApp user to:<br>- Confirm that they can actually send a message to your WhatsApp business phone number.<br>- Confirm that they have accepted our latest Terms of Service ( **Settings** \\> **Help**, or **Settings** \\> **Application information** will prompt them to accept the latest terms/policies if they haven't done so already)<br>- Update to the latest version of the WhatsApp client. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `131037`<br>WhatsApp provided number needs display name approval before message can be sent. | The [555 business phone number](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/embedded-signup#555-business-phone-numbers) used to send the request does not have an approved [display name](https://www.facebook.com/business/help/338047025165344). | Change the 555 business phone number's display name. See our [How to change your WhatsApp Business display name](https://www.facebook.com/business/help/378834799515077) Help Center article to learn how. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `131042`<br>Business eligibility payment issue | There was an error related to your payment method. | See [About Billing For Your WhatsApp Business Account](https://www.facebook.com/business/help/2225184664363779) and verify that you have set up billing correctly.<br>Common problems:<br>- Payment account is not attached to a WhatsApp Business Account<br>- Credit line is over the limit<br>- Credit line (Payment Account) not set or active<br>- WhatsApp Business Account is deleted<br>- WhatsApp Business Account is suspended<br>- Timezone not set<br>- Currency not set<br>- MessagingFor request (On Behalf Of) is pending or declined<br>- Exceeded conversation free tier threshold without a valid payment method | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `131045`<br>Incorrect certificate | Message failed to send due to a phone number registration error. | [Register the phone number](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration) before trying again. | `500`<br>Internal Server Error |\n| `131047`<br>Re-engagement message | More than 24 hours have passed since the recipient last replied to the sender number. | Send the recipient a business-initiated message using a [message template](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates) instead. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `131049`<br>Meta chose not to deliver. | This message was not delivered to maintain healthy ecosystem engagement. | Do not retry immediately if you do receive this error code and suspect it is due to the limit. Instead, retry in increasing larger time increments until the message is delivered, since the limit may be in effect for differing periods of time.<br>See [Per-User Marketing Template Message Limits](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates#per-user-marketing-template-message-limits) for additional information. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `131051`<br>Unsupported message type | Unsupported message type. | See [Messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages) for supported message types before trying again with a supported message type. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `131052`<br>Media download error | Unable to download the media sent by the user. | We were unable to download media included in the WhatsApp user's message. For more information, refer to the `error.error_data.details` value in any **messages** webhooks triggered when this message was received.<br>Ask the WhatsApp user to send you the media file using a non-WhatsApp method. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `131053`<br>Media upload error | Unable to upload the media used in the message. | We were unable to upload the media for one or more reasons, such as an unsupported media type.<br>For more information, refer to the `error.error_data.details` value in any **messages** webhooks triggered when this message fails to send.<br>We recommend that you inspect any media files that are causing errors and confirm that they are in fact supported. For example, in UNIX you can use file inspection via the command line to determine its MIME type:<br>`file -I rejected-file.mov`<br>You can then confirm if its MIME type is supported. See [Supported Media Types](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/media#supported-media-types). | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `131057`<br>Account in maintenance mode | Buiness Account is in maintenance mode | The WhatsApp Business Account is in maintenance mode. One reason for this could be that the account is undergoing a [throughput](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview#throughput) upgrade. | `500`<br>Bad Request |\n| `132000`<br>Template Param Count Mismatch | The number of variable parameter values included in the request did not match the number of variable parameters defined in the template. | See [Message Template Guidelines](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/message-templates/guidelines/) and make sure the request includes all of the variable parameter values that have been defined in the template. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `132001`<br>Template does not exist | The template does not exist in the specified language or the template has not been approved. | Make sure your template has been approved and the template name and language locale are correct. Please ensure you follow [message template guidelines](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/message-templates/guidelines/). | `404`<br>Not Found |\n| `132005`<br>Template Hydrated Text Too Long | Translated text is too long. | Check the WhatsApp Manager to verify that your template has been translated. See [Quality Rating and Template Status](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/message-templates/guidelines/#quality-rating-and-template-status). | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `132007`<br>Template Format Character Policy Violated | Template content violates a WhatsApp policy. | See [Rejection Reasons](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/message-templates/guidelines/#rejection-reasons) to determine possible reasons for violation. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `132012`<br>Template Parameter Format Mismatch | Variable parameter values formatted incorrectly. | The variable parameter values included in the request are not using the format specified in the template. See [Message Template Guidelines](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/message-templates/guidelines/). | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `132015`<br>Template is Paused | Template is paused due to [low quality](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/message-templates/guidelines#quality-rating) so it cannot be sent in a template message. | [Edit the template](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/message-templates#edit-a-message-template) to improve its quality and try again once it is approved. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `132016`<br>Template is Disabled | Template has been paused too many times due to [low quality](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/message-templates/guidelines#quality-rating) and is now permanently disabled. | Create a new template with different content. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `132068`<br>Flow is blocked | Flow is in blocked state. | Correct the Flow | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `132069`<br>Flow is throttled | Flow is in throttled state and 10 messages using this flow were already sent in the last hour. | Correct the Flow | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `133000`<br>Incomplete Deregistration | A previous deregistration attempt failed. | [Deregister](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration#deregister-phone) the number again before [registering](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration). | `500`<br>Internal Server Error |\n| `133004`<br>Server Temporarily Unavailable | Server is temporarily unavailable. | Check the [WhatsApp Business Platform Status](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fmetastatus.com%2Fwhatsapp-business-api&h=AT0zOdelWk11r2LNsvwZ9dbCjXqk87ssyZ8TYMvF3MnkRrH5etVh7WPpQYj4agNFge2-y33pGUMVeG7l7AqI6Z2UbMhKFVtF_VUuT0w0sNQHgNTm7-05Ca8sVspJCAIYrr8ypAr8qrMWVQ) page to see API status information and check the response `details` value before trying again. | `503`<br>Service Unavailable |\n| `133005`<br>Two step verification PIN Mismatch | Two-step verification PIN incorrect. | Verify that the two-step verification PIN included in the request is correct.<br>To reset the two-step verification PIN:<br>1. [Disable two-step verification](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/phone-numbers#resetting-two-step-verification-pin-in-whatsapp-manager).<br>2. Send a POST request that includes the new PIN to the [Phone Number](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/two-step-verification) endpoint. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `133006`<br>Phone number re-verification needed | Phone number needs to be verified before registering. | [Verify the phone number](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/phone-numbers#verify) before registering it. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `133008`<br>Too Many two step verification PIN Guesses | Too many two-step verification PIN guesses for this phone number. | Try again after the amount of time specified in the `details` response value. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `133009`<br>Two step verification PIN Guessed Too Fast | Two-step verification PIN was entered too quickly. | Check the `details` response value before trying again. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `133010`<br>Phone number Not Registered | Phone number not registered on the WhatsApp Business Platform. | [Register the phone number](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration) before trying again. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `133015`<br>Please wait a few minutes before attempting to register this phone number | The phone number you are attempting to register was recently deleted, and deletion has not yet completed. | Wait 5 minutes before re-trying the request. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `135000`<br>Generic user error | Message failed to send because of an unknown error with your request parameters. | See the endpoint's [reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/) to determine if you are querying the endpoint using the correct syntax. Contact [customer support](https://developers.facebook.com/support/) if you continue receiving this error code in response. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n\n### Synchronization errors\n\n| Code | Description | Possible Solutions | HTTP Status Code |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| `2593107`<br>Synchronization Request limit exceeded | You have exceeded the maximum number of times to call the synchronization api for this phone number. | You can only call this endpoint once to synchronize the business phone number contacts and once to synchronize its messaging history. See [Onboarding business app users](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/embedded-signup/custom-flows/onboarding-business-app-users#phases-and-chunks).<br>Offboard the business customer and re-onboard them. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `2593108`<br>Synchronization Request made outside of allowed time window | Synchronization request can only be made within 24 hours of onboarding | You can only initiate contacts and messaging history synchronization of an onboarded WhatsApp Business app user within 24 hours of onboarding the user. See [Onboarding business app users](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/embedded-signup/custom-flows/onboarding-business-app-users#phases-and-chunks).<br>Offboard the user and re-onboard them. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n\n### Throttling errors\n\n| Code | Description | Possible Solutions | HTTP Status Code |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- |\n| `4`<br>API Too Many Calls | The app has reached its API call rate limit. | Load the app in the [App Dashboard](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/apps) and view the **Application Rate Limit** section to verify that the app has reached its [rate limit](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/overview/rate-limiting#wa-biz-api). If it has, try again later or reduce the frequency or amount of API queries the app is making. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `80007`<br>Rate limit issues | The WhatsApp Business Account has reached its rate limit. | See WhatsApp Business Account [Rate Limits](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/#rate-limits). Try again later or reduce the frequency or amount of API queries the app is making. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `130429`<br>Rate limit hit | Cloud API message throughput has been reached. | The app has reached the API's throughput limit. See [Throughput](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/overview/#throughput). Try again later or reduce the frequency with which the app sends messages. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `131048`<br>Spam rate limit hit | Message failed to send because there are restrictions on how many messages can be sent from this phone number. This may be because too many previous messages were blocked or flagged as spam. | Check your quality status in the WhatsApp Manager and see the [Quality-Based Rate Limits](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/messaging-limits#quality-rating-and-messaging-limits) documentation for more information. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `131056`<br>(Business Account, Consumer Account) pair rate limit hit | Too many messages sent from the sender phone number to the same recipient phone number in a short period of time. | Wait and retry the operation, if you intend to send messages to the same phone number. You can still send messages to a different phone number without waiting | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n| `133016`<br>Account register deregister rate limit exceeded | Registration or Deregistration failed because there were too many attempts for this phone number in a short period of time | The business phone number is being blocked because it has reached its registration/deregistration attempt limit. Try again once the number is unblocked. See \"Limitations\" in the [Registration](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/registration/) document. | `400`<br>Bad Request |\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Cloud API error codes](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes#cloud-api-error-codes)\n\n[Error response webhooks and syntax](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes#error-response-webhooks-and-syntax)\n\n[Error response contents](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes#error-response-contents)\n\n[Sample response](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes#sample-response)\n\n[Error codes](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes#error-codes)\n\n[Authorization errors](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes#authorization-errors)\n\n[Integrity errors](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes#integrity-errors)\n\n[Other errors](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes#other-errors)\n\n[Synchronization errors](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes#synchronization-errors)\n\n[Throttling errors](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support/error-codes#throttling-errors)\n\n* * Request](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-messages/location-request-messages)\n- [Reaction](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/reaction-messages)\n- [Sticker](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/messages/sticker-messages)\n- [Template](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates)\n\n\n- [Auth Library](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/template-library)\n- [Catalog Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/catalog-template-messages)\n- [Coupon Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/coupon-templates)\n- [LTO Numbers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/phone-numbers)\n- [Webhooks](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/set-up-webhooks)\n- [Sell Products & [Reference](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference)\n- [Support](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/support)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Sending Media Card Carousel Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/media-card-carousel-templates#sending-media-card-carousel-templates)\n\n[Request Syntax](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/media-card-carousel-templates#request-syntax)\n\n[Post Body](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/media-card-carousel-templates#post-body)\n\n[Post Body Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/media-card-carousel-templates#post-body-parameters)\n\n[Example Request](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/media-card-carousel-templates#example-request)\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/467179990_582893330879738_1534232517322631641_n.png?_nc_cat=102&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=UiIZ9_pPw1AQ7kNvwGvUmlZ&_nc_oc=Admy0rSWSsPXo3CPiNndZQ0YhGWcu1BXbV-bPPgrxkISUh1cL9Lse6tgBOamqgdOqsI&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=8ojV_Q7kCn-mD3Lzytw3pQ&oh=00_AYEsZYwdwvuUaU9nOs-4mCagLKlOotx6tbJCafctzD-_-g&oe=680AE45A)\n[WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/)\n\nWe are making changes to the WhatsApp Business Platform pricing model.\n\n**Effective July 1, 2025 for all businesses on our platform:**\n\n- The conversation-based pricing model will be deprecated\n- We will charge [per-message for template messages](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing/updates-to-pricing#per-message-pricing) instead of per-conversation\n- Utility templates sent within an open customer service window [will be free](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing/updates-to-pricing#free-utility-templates-in-the-customer-service-window)\n\nSee [Pricing Updates on the WhatsApp Business Platform](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/pricing/updates-to-pricing) for additional details.\n\n# Sending Media Card Carousel Templates\n\nThis document describes how to send approved [media card carousel templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/message-templates/media-card-carousel-templates) to WhatsApp users.\n\n## Request Syntax\n\nUse the [**POST /<WHATSAPP\\_BUSINESS\\_PHONE\\_NUMBER\\_ID>/messages**](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages) endpoint to send an approved media card carousel template to a WhatsApp user.\n\n```\nPOST /<WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>/messages\n```\n\n## Post Body\n\n```\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>\",\n  \"type\": \"template\",\n  \"template\": {\n    \"name\": \"<TEMPLATE_NAME>\",\n    \"language\": {\n      \"code\": \"<TEMPLATE_LANGUAGE>\"\n    },\n    \"components\": [\\\n\\\n      /* Omit if template body text does not use variables */\\\n      {\\\n        \"type\": \"body\",\\\n        \"parameters\": [\\\n          <MESSAGE_BODY_TEXT_VARIABLE>,\\\n          <MESSAGE_BODY_TEXT_VARIABLE>\\\n        ]\\\n      },\\\n      {\\\n        \"type\": \"carousel\",\\\n        \"cards\": [\\\n          {\\\n            \"card_index\": <CARD_INDEX>,\\\n            \"components\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"type\": \"header\",\\\n                \"parameters\": [\\\n                  {\\\n                    \"type\": \"<MESSAGE_HEADER_FORMAT>\",\\\n                    \"<MESSAGE_HEADER_FORMAT>\": {\\\n                      \"id\": \"<MESSAGE_HEADER_ASSET_ID>\"\\\n                    }\\\n                  }\\\n                ]\\\n              },\\\n\\\n              /* Omit if template card body text does not use variables */\\\n              {\\\n                \"type\": \"body\",\\\n                \"parameters\": [\\\n                  <CARD_BODY_VARIABLE>,\\\n                  <CARD_BODY_VARIABLE>\\\n                ]\\\n              },\\\n\\\n              /* Omit if template does not use a quick-reply button */\\\n              {\\\n                \"type\": \"button\",\\\n                \"sub_type\": \"quick_reply\",\\\n                \"index\": <BUTTON_INDEX>,\\\n                \"parameters\": [\\\n                  {\\\n                    \"type\": \"payload\",\\\n                    \"payload\": \"<QUICK_REPLY_BUTTON_PAYLOAD>\"\\\n                  }\\\n                ]\\\n              },\\\n\\\n              /* Omit if template does not use a URL button */\\\n              {\\\n                \"type\": \"button\",\\\n                \"sub_type\": \"url\",\\\n                \"index\": <BUTTON_INDEX>,\\\n                \"parameters\": [\\\n                  {\\\n                    \"type\": \"text\",\\\n                    \"text\": \"<URL_BUTTON_URL_VARIABLE>\"\\\n                  }\\\n                ]\\\n              }\\\n            ]\\\n          }\\\n        ]\\\n      }\\\n\\\n      /* Addt'l cards would follow. All cards must have same components. Must\\\n         include a card for every card defined on the template. */\\\n\\\n    ]\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## Post Body Parameters\n\n| Placeholder | Description | Example Value |\n| --- | --- | --- |\n| `<BUTTON_INDEX>`<br>_Integer_ | **Required.**<br>Zero-indexed order in which button appears at the bottom of the template message. `0` indicates the first button, `1` indicates second button, etc.<br>Note that if any buttons use variables, the type and order of buttons must match the type and order defined on the template, so you can't use the index values to arrange the order of the buttons in the sent template.<br>For example, if the template defines a phone number button first (which equates to index `0`) and a URL button that supports a single variable second (which equates to index `1`), if you attempt to send the template with the URL button index set to `0` , the API would return an error (\"Parameter value for URL was expected but was not found\") because it's expecting a button object with an index of `1` to be present in the post body payload. | `0` |\n| `<CARD_BODY_VARIABLE>`<br>_Object_ | **Required if the template card body text uses variables, otherwise omit.**<br>Object describing a card body variable. If the template uses multiple variables, you must define an object for each variable.<br>Supports `text`, `currency`, and `date_time` types. See [Messages Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages#parameter-object).<br>There is no maximum character limit on this value, but does count against the card body text limit of 160 characters. | ```<br>{<br>  \"type\":\"text\",<br>  \"text\": \"Pablo\"<br>}<br>``` |\n| `<CARD_INDEX>`<br>_Integer_ | **Required.**<br>Zero-indexed order in which card should appear within the card carousel. `0` indicates first card, `1` indicates second card, etc. | `0` |\n| `<MESSAGE_BODY_TEXT_VARIABLE>`<br>_Object_ | **Required if template message body text uses variables, otherwise omit.**<br>Object describing a message variable. If the template uses multiple variables, you must define an object for each variable.<br>Supports `text`, `currency`, and `date_time` types. See [Messages Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/messages#parameter-object).<br>There is no maximum character limit on this value, but it does count against the message body text limit of 1024 characters. | ```<br>{<br>  \"type\":\"text\",<br>  \"text\": \"Pablo\"<br>}<br>``` |\n| `<MESSAGE_HEADER_ASSET_ID>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>Header asset's uploaded media asset ID. Use the [**POST /<BUSINESS\\_PHONE\\_NUMBER\\_ID>/media**](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/media#upload-media) endpoint to generate an asset ID. | `1558081531584829` |\n| `<MESSAGE_HEADER_FORMAT>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>Indicates header type and a matching property name.<br>Note that the `<MESSAGE_HEADER_FORMAT>` placeholder appears twice in the post body example above, as it serves as a placeholder for the type property's value and its matching property name.<br>Value can be `image` or `video`. | `image` |\n| `<QUICK_REPLY_BUTTON_PAYLOAD>`<br>_String_ | **Optional.**<br>Value to be included in messages webhooks ( `messages.button.payload`) when the button is tapped. | `more-aloes` |\n| `<TEMPLATE_LANGUAGE>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>Template [language and locale code](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/message-templates/supported-languages). | `en_US` |\n| `<TEMPLATE_NAME>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>Template name.<br>Maximum 512 characters. | `carousel_template_media_cards_v1` |\n| `<URL_BUTTON_URL_VARIABLE>`<br>_String_ | **Required if the URL button URL uses a variable.**<br>URL button variable value. | `blue-elf` |\n| `<WHATSAPP_USER_PHONE_NUMBER>`<br>_String_ | **Required.**<br>WhatsApp user phone number. | `+16505551234` |\n\n## Example Request\n\nThis example request sends a media card carousel template named \"carousel\\_template\\_media\\_cards\\_v1\". It supplies three body text variables (which the template requires) and contents for three cards (which the template also requires). For each card, the request supplies an image asset ID, a quick-reply button payload (to be included in webhooks when the button is tapped), and a text string to be injected into the URL mapped to the card's URL button (which is defined on the template).\n\n```\ncurl 'https://graph.facebook.com/v22.0/106540352242922/messages' \\\n-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n-H 'Authorization: Bearer EAAJB...' \\\n-d '\n{\n  \"messaging_product\": \"whatsapp\",\n  \"recipient_type\": \"individual\",\n  \"to\": \"+16505551234\",\n  \"type\": \"template\",\n  \"template\": {\n    \"name\": \"carousel_template_media_cards_v1\",\n    \"language\": {\n      \"code\": \"en_US\"\n    },\n    \"components\": [\\\n      {\\\n        \"type\": \"body\",\\\n        \"parameters\": [\\\n          {\\\n            \"type\": \"text\",\\\n            \"text\": \"Pablo\"\\\n          },\\\n          {\\\n            \"type\": \"text\",\\\n            \"text\": \"20%\"\\\n          },\\\n          {\\\n            \"type\": \"text\",\\\n            \"text\": \"20OFF\"\\\n          }\\\n        ]\\\n      },\\\n      {\\\n        \"type\": \"carousel\",\\\n        \"cards\": [\\\n          {\\\n            \"card_index\": 0,\\\n            \"components\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"type\": \"header\",\\\n                \"parameters\": [\\\n                  {\\\n                    \"type\": \"image\",\\\n                    \"image\": {\\\n                      \"id\": \"1558081531584829\"\\\n                    }\\\n                  }\\\n                ]\\\n              },\\\n              {\\\n                \"type\": \"button\",\\\n                \"sub_type\": \"quick_reply\",\\\n                \"index\": \"0\",\\\n                \"parameters\": [\\\n                  {\\\n                    \"type\": \"payload\",\\\n                    \"payload\": \"more-aloes\"\\\n                  }\\\n                ]\\\n              },\\\n              {\\\n                \"type\": \"button\",\\\n                \"sub_type\": \"url\",\\\n                \"index\": \"1\",\\\n                \"parameters\": [\\\n                  {\\\n                    \"type\": \"text\",\\\n                    \"text\": \"blue-elf\"\\\n                  }\\\n                ]\\\n              }\\\n            ]\\\n          },\\\n          {\\\n            \"card_index\": 1,\\\n            \"components\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"type\": \"header\",\\\n                \"parameters\": [\\\n                  {\\\n                    \"type\": \"image\",\\\n                    \"image\": {\\\n                      \"id\": \"861236878885705\"\\\n                    }\\\n                  }\\\n                ]\\\n              },\\\n              {\\\n                \"type\": \"button\",\\\n                \"sub_type\": \"quick_reply\",\\\n                \"index\": \"0\",\\\n                \"parameters\": [\\\n                  {\\\n                    \"type\": \"payload\",\\\n                    \"payload\": \"more-crassulas\"\\\n                  }\\\n                ]\\\n              },\\\n              {\\\n                \"type\": \"button\",\\\n                \"sub_type\": \"url\",\\\n                \"index\": \"1\",\\\n                \"parameters\": [\\\n                  {\\\n                    \"type\": \"text\",\\\n                    \"text\": \"buddhas-temple\"\\\n                  }\\\n                ]\\\n              }\\\n            ]\\\n          },\\\n          {\\\n            \"card_index\": 2,\\\n            \"components\": [\\\n              {\\\n                \"type\": \"header\",\\\n                \"parameters\": [\\\n                  {\\\n                    \"type\": \"image\",\\\n                    \"image\": {\\\n                      \"id\": \"1587064918516321\"\\\n                    }\\\n                  }\\\n                ]\\\n              },\\\n              {\\\n                \"type\": \"button\",\\\n                \"sub_type\": \"quick_reply\",\\\n                \"index\": \"0\",\\\n                \"parameters\": [\\\n                  {\\\n                    \"type\": \"payload\",\\\n                    \"payload\": \"more-echeverias\"\\\n                  }\\\n                ]\\\n              },\\\n              {\\\n                \"type\": \"button\",\\\n                \"sub_type\": \"url\",\\\n                \"index\": \"1\",\\\n                \"parameters\": [\\\n                  {\\\n                    \"type\": \"text\",\\\n                    \"text\": \"black-prince\"\\\n                  }\\\n                ]\\\n              }\\\n            ]\\\n          }\\\n        ]\\\n      }\\\n    ]\n  }\n}'\n```\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Sending Media Card Carousel Templates](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/media-card-carousel-templates#sending-media-card-carousel-templates)\n\n[Request Syntax](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/media-card-carousel-templates#request-syntax)\n\n[Post Body](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/media-card-carousel-templates#post-body)\n\n[Post Body Parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/media-card-carousel-templates#post-body-parameters)\n\n[Example Request](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/send-message-templates/media-card-carousel-templates#example-request)\n\n* * incident](https://developers.facebook.com/incident/report/)\n\n#### Terms and policies\n\n- [Responsible platform initiatives](https://developers.facebook.com/products/responsible-platform-initiatives/)\n- [Platform terms](https://developers.facebook.com/terms/)\n- [Developer policies](https://developers.facebook.com/devpolicy/)\n\nFollow Us\n\n- [![Follow us on Facebook](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.2365-6/89126182_222315695571651_4936319991919149056_n.svg?_nc_cat=1&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e280be&_nc_ohc=OcG-3KgtZEgQ7kNvwFSYDg0&_nc_oc=Adm5hQ7B-B10c8AQ4_wYpSsRoXwlsKXNVJgQ9Yh7cfR0BX7OC_EkesCUfObdDYwlj6A&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=8ojV_Q7kCn-mD3Lzytw3pQ&oh=00_AYEkLKAbyLje_1lfH3B0UzJryIFY7sn06l4s8iQwQYsDwA&oe=680AE2EF)](https://www.facebook.com/MetaforDevelopers)[![Follow [Load Testing](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/load-testing)\n- [Experiments](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/experiments)\n\nOn This Page\n\n[Load Testing on Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/load-testing#load-testing-on-cloud-api)\n\n[Introduction to Load Test on Cloud API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/load-testing#intro)\n\n[What is an API Load Test?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/load-testing#what)\n\n[What types of Load Tests are available?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/load-testing#types-of-load-tests)\n\n[Why should you perform Outbound Load Testing using Cloud API?](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/load-testing#why)\n\n[Preparing for the Load Test](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/load-testing#preparing)\n\n[Load Testing Tools and Setup Guidelines](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/load-testing#testing-tools)\n\n[Load Testing using JMeter with InfluxDB and Grafana](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/load-testing#using-jmeter)\n\n[Running the Test in JMeter](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/load-testing#running-jmeter)\n\n[Load Testing using Locust with InfluxDB and Grafana](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/load-testing#using-locust)\n\n[Running the Test in Locust](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/load-testing#running-locust)\n\n# Load Testing on Cloud API\n\n## Introduction to Load Test on Cloud API\n\n### What is an API Load Test?\n\nAPI Load Testing is a crucial process for assessing how well your application servers handle the expected production traffic. It allows you to systematically apply the anticipated load to your servers and observe how your application behaves. By conducting API Load Testing, you can identify any weaknesses or bottlenecks before your users encounter them, ensuring that your application is robust enough to handle the desired workload.\n\nAt Meta, we recognize the importance of API Load Testing and provide a comprehensive feature within our WhatsApp Cloud API that enables you to simulate traffic on the messaging API endpoint and evaluate their performance under various conditions. This feature empowers you to examine the overall performance of your API integration and assess its ability to handle concurrent requests from a large number of virtual users.\n\nWe understand the dynamic and demanding landscape of digital communication, and our commitment is firmly rooted in enabling businesses to thrive within it. By offering this feature, we empower our clients to stay ahead of the curve, delivering exceptional messaging services that can withstand the challenges posed by ever-increasing user demands and market fluctuations.\n\n### What types of Load Tests are available?\n\nAt present, our Cloud API offers \"Outbound Load Test.\" This feature serves as a powerful tool for businesses to evaluate and enhance the resiliency of their WhatsApp Cloud API integration. By conducting Outbound Load Testing, clients can gain insightful measurements regarding their system's performance and identify areas for improvement.\n\nThe ability to proactively assess and optimize their systems is paramount for businesses aiming to provide seamless messaging experiences for their customers, even during periods of peak usage. By leveraging the Outbound Load Test feature, clients can gain confidence in the robustness and scalability of their WhatsApp Cloud API integration, ensuring that it can handle high message volumes without sacrificing performance or user experience.\n\n### Why should you perform Outbound Load Testing using Cloud API?\n\nPerforming Outbound Load Testing using our Cloud API offers significant benefits in two distinct scenarios:\n\n1. **Solution Partners Tracking**: Solution Partners can leverage load testing to track the time series of API requests made and the corresponding responses received. This enables Solution Partners to gain valuable insights into the performance of their systems over time. By monitoring these metrics, Solution Partners can identify patterns, analyze response times, and ensure optimal service delivery to their clients.\n\n2. **Message Status Webhook Monitoring**: For businesses, load testing provides a means to monitor the number of message status webhooks received on their designated endpoint during the testing period. By analyzing webhook data, businesses can gauge the responsiveness and reliability of their systems in real-time. This allows them to proactively detect any issues, optimize their webhook handling processes, and ensure seamless message status updates for their users.\n\n\nIn both scenarios, load testing serves as a powerful tool for assessing and improving webhook performance. Whether it is tracking API request-response dynamics or monitoring message status webhooks, load testing empowers businesses and Solution Partners to enhance their services, optimize workflows, and deliver exceptional user experiences.\n\n## Preparing for the Load Test\n\nTo ensure a smooth and effective load test experience, appropriate preparation is crucial. In the case of an outbound load test with Meta, we provide essential components to facilitate the process. Specifically, we will furnish you with a designated test number that will serve as the sender of the load test messages. Additionally, a range of dummy numbers will be provided to act as end user numbers for the test.\n\nThe test number we provide has been purposefully designed to process all the requests similar to a regular number would, but it will not deliver the messages to actual recipients. This thoughtful design prevents any inadvertent spamming of real numbers during the load test, maintaining the integrity of the process.\n\nTo initiate the load test, clients are required to create load test requests via our Direct Support channel. This ensures streamlined communication and enables our team to provide prompt assistance and guidance throughout the testing phase.\n\nTo set up the load test successfully, we kindly request the following information from our clients:\n\n1. **Existing Message Template Example**: We require a sample of the message template you intend to use for the load test. This includes the associated name and WhatsApp Business Account (WABA) linked to it. Providing us with this information allows us to accurately replicate your messaging setup during the load test, ensuring realistic testing conditions.\n\n2. **Webhook URL**: Please provide us with the URL of the webhook endpoint that will receive notifications and data from the load test. This enables us to capture and analyze the responses and behavior of your system during the test, allowing for thorough evaluation and optimization.\n\n3. **Webhook URL verify token**: Please provide us the webhook verify token so that we can override your Webhook URL to receive notifications.\n\n\nOnce the load test session is confirmed, our dedicated support team will provide you with the necessary resources on the day of the load test, including:\n\n- **Test Number**: We will furnish you with a dedicated test number that will serve as the sender for the load test messages. This number is specifically designed to process all the requests like a regular number would, without delivering the messages to actual recipients. This ensures the load test is conducted accurately while safeguarding the privacy of real numbers.\n\n- **Access Token**: You will receive an access token that grants you the necessary authorization to initiate and monitor the load test.\n\n- **Message Template**: We will provide the specific message template and its corresponding details to be used during the testing. This includes the content, structure, and any variables or placeholders that need to be included within the messages.\n\n\nOur support team will be available throughout the load test to provide guidance, address any queries, and ensure a smooth testing experience.\n\n**Note**: It is crucial to ensure that no incoming messages are sent to the test number when registering or obtaining the ID of the outbound number. Sending a message to the test number during the load test can trigger a circuit breaker mechanism, resulting in the disconnection of the load test number. To maintain a stable and uninterrupted load test session, please refrain from sending any messages to the designated test number during the setup and execution of the load test.\n\n## Load Testing Tools and Setup Guidelines\n\nThere are certain tools that pair best depending on what development platform you use for load testing. The following are common platforms and their common load testing tools:\n\n| Development Platform | Tool |\n| --- | --- |\n| Java | [JMeter](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/load-testing#jmeter) |\n| Python | [Locust](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/load-testing#locust) |\n\nTo conduct effective load testing, you will need the following tools: InfluxDB, Grafana and JMeter/Locust. Below are the steps to set up each component:\n\n#### InfluxDB:\n\nInfluxDB is a time-series database that works seamlessly with JMeter and Grafana. To install InfluxDB, visit [InfluxDB download](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fportal.influxdata.com%2Fdownloads%2F&h=AT0rlHZvm6VQhjtAHlVuzXxNLKZJNHV7ZP3SQZKObxTvTF-zlUaqQ6T-p5Eb6tkNwIw6Oa9_vAU6VV_h2zd8fPg8acrMuzoutKU5DUFm-QU22WcLb9-DKoLiTH8btY5mm6CIFCUnTMayqA).\n\nDue to known issues with the 2.x version of InfluxDB, you need to download the 1.x version of InfluxDB. You can find the 1.x version if you follow the download link above and then scroll down to the bottom of the webpage and select **Are you interested in InfluxDB 1.x Open Source?**.\n\n#### Grafana:\n\nGrafana is an open-source analytics and monitoring solution that supports various databases. The most commonly used approaches involve building Grafana dashboards using InfluxDB and Prometheus. In this section, we will focus on the integration with JMeter and InfluxDB. To install Grafana, please visit the [Grafana download](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fgrafana.com%2Fgrafana%2Fdownload%3Fpg%3Dget%26plcmt%3Dselfmanaged-box1-cta1%26platform%3Dmac&h=AT2lYAp5zv2LeiB-dcUKyi8335Iunzd4_64eKjyFH_RjiByC93oMBYHCSsQAh6tBYFxQZc2nA_E18EsRxJ9q0nDGB93E9porLIC1YxTrafy9D_E_IE6XbIuGXHV1PtSG6_QOdikMHoo_5A) page.\n\n#### JMeter:\n\nJMeter is a powerful open-source load testing tool. To install JMeter, follow the installation guide available at the [JMeter website](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fjmeter.apache.org%2Fdownload_jmeter.cgi&h=AT16Qdjh5G0hKi9fdG7veIqN3KzrhX4wkbfR-Z2W2XpeV-Uet9gpH516mopZUc-8l70Vf1wcag-XluhRZL0n3kJbdvUgqWZugontYEC-bGYTkU2WjBRlL77XNHjb_nbiMIk46Z0IH-NnWg).\n\n#### Locust:\n\nLocust provides a flexible and efficient way to simulate user behavior and generate load on your system. Download the [load test zip file](https://developers.facebook.com/micro_site/url/?click_from_context_menu=true&country=IE&destination=https%3A%2F%2Fdevelopers.facebook.com%2Fresources%2FLoadTest-py.zip&event_type=click&last_nav_impression_id=1KLU92oUeSpUvNoBF&max_percent_page_viewed=55&max_viewport_height_px=1009&max_viewport_width_px=1792&orig_http_referrer=https%3A%2F%2Fdevelopers.facebook.com%2Fdocs%2Fwhatsapp%2Fcloud-api%2Fguides%2Fload-testing&orig_request_uri=https%3A%2F%2Fdevelopers.facebook.com%2Fajax%2Fdocs%2Fnav%2F%3Fpath1%3Dwhatsapp%26path2%3Dcloud-api%26path3%3Dguides%26path4%3Dload-testing&region=emea&scrolled=true&session_id=1A5EfT0NY2fOb0sOj&site=developers) provided by Meta and extract it.\n\n## Load Testing using JMeter with InfluxDB and Grafana\n\nOnce you have installed the necessary components, follow these steps below to configure your setup using JMeter:\n\nTo start **JMeter**, follow these steps:\n\n1. Download JMeter using the provided download link.\n2. Open the terminal and navigate to the JMeter folder.\n3. Browse to the \"bin\" folder within the JMeter directory.\n4. Run the following command to start the JMeter application:\n\n\n```\n./jmeter\n```\n\n\nBy executing this command, JMeter will launch, and you will have access to the JMeter application interface, allowing you to create and configure your performance tests.\n\nNext step is to **import the test plan**. To import a sample test plan into JMeter, follow these steps:\n\n1. Download the [zipped test plan file](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.8562-6/383083590_849533576487865_448384137962027554_n.zip?_nc_cat=111&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=b8d81d&_nc_ohc=wsOXWrW3RTAQ7kNvwGWSOTK&_nc_oc=AdmLGnk-S6BX0o4uMnKVlbgZYDaFEZmIaHfhbP13cOqxUyIEVS80Qv1wUrIJUyLQITU&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ThpjOXogmFf7veMpawnq3w&oh=00_AYHcNR-mP3oTvgJtoYZlvFj7Dw0jjL_nlFdjuVvnZcNQlQ&oe=67F67926) provided and extract its contents into the JMeter folder. This file contains the necessary configurations, and you only need to modify the variables.\n2. Open JMeter and navigate to the `LoadTest.en_US.jmx` test file. You can do this by selecting **File** \\> **Open** and locating the file within the JMeter interface.\n3. Once the test file is opened, JMeter will display the test plan structure. This imported test plan serves as a starting point, and you can modify it according to your specific requirements.\n4. Locate the \"HTTP Request\" element within the test plan. Here, you need to provide the necessary details in the POST body data, including the template object.\n\n    ![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.8562-6/382087025_622676800018583_9031772173292230986_n.png?_nc_cat=109&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=f537c7&_nc_ohc=YeD4Ggl2Y48Q7kNvwEQM0We&_nc_oc=AdlUmourUNOQ1a_laPy3IIWwamCD7FL6oI0AjFanHP340Zlw6ARmDf7mDl9ah6ONa7E&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ThpjOXogmFf7veMpawnq3w&oh=00_AYEgzoBKaxa-TcrZsR1Yk4YcAbHSytodSUqXkHzT7ISrGg&oe=67F6901E)\n5. Find the \"User Parameters\" element and add values for the following variables:\n\n\n   - **phoneNumberID**: this will be the test phone number ID provided by Meta\n\n   - **systemUserAccessToken**: this will be the access token also provided by Meta\n\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.8562-6/382088982_1727169851057216_2825910604870048502_n.png?_nc_cat=106&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=f537c7&_nc_ohc=upiSZ038FCoQ7kNvwGo1Egs&_nc_oc=AdntiyX-pKlj99sMtEevo98o3s_XYahxtjt4DaHN9IOVi-NssfcnS478ci8WDJ1PTuc&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ThpjOXogmFf7veMpawnq3w&oh=00_AYE0paxzQOCm7LLnK6-qdckSjWqjZDaaK0YQEft2v1lWdQ&oe=67F6A372)\n6. To configure InfluxDB for result collection, go to the \"Backend Listener\" element. Configure it to match the settings shown in the provided screenshot or documentation.\n    ![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.8562-6/380100804_872050040533440_7674047855572581953_n.png?_nc_cat=105&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=f537c7&_nc_ohc=EsfnEZiycVIQ7kNvwEJPPP7&_nc_oc=AdmaAbIF4zclLcePOwO81ZpTKpyXmqxyKQRXeHXjv9xgUPSx164O9zY5dtaFg1AV_9I&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ThpjOXogmFf7veMpawnq3w&oh=00_AYEHYWtSnvD5XGebrGG-2Pr_Lq1agV9PTaB0ucfxHQCEvA&oe=67F69CC1)\n\nBy following these steps, you will successfully import the sample test plan into JMeter and make the necessary modifications to tailor it to your specific testing requirements. This test plan provides a starting point for load testing your system and collecting performance metrics using JMeter and InfluxDB.\n\nNext start the InfluxDB server and create a new database for storing JMeter readings:\n\n1. Start the InfluxDB Server:\n1. Open a terminal and navigate to the InfluxDB installation directory. In most cases, it can be found at **InfluxDB\\_folder/usr/bin**.\n2. Run the following command to start the InfluxDB server on port 8086:\n\n```\n./influxd\n```\n2. Create a New Database:\n1. Open a new terminal tab or window.\n2. Set the directory to the InfluxDB installation directory, typically located at **InfluxDB\\_folder/usr/bin**.\n3. Launch the InfluxDB console by executing the following command:\n\n```\n./influx\n```\n3. Create the Required Database:\n1. Within the InfluxDB console, create the necessary database for the JMeter configuration. In this example, let's name the database \"demo\".\n2. Run the following command to create the database:\n\n```\ncreate database demo\n```\n\nWith these steps completed, the InfluxDB server will be up and running, and you will have a designated \"demo\" database ready to store the JMeter readings.\n\nTo set up Grafana for JMeter, follow these steps:\n\n1. Grafana Server:\n1. Open a new tab in the terminal and navigate to the Grafana installation directory. Typically, it can be found at **grafana\\_folder/bin**.\n2. Run the following command to start the Grafana server:\n\n```\n./grafana-server\n```\n\n4. This will start the Grafana server on the default port 3000. Ensure that other servers using port 3000 (such as Docker or NodeJS) are turned off to prevent conflicts.\n2. Grafana Client:\n1. Open a web browser and visit [http://localhost:3000](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A3000%2F&h=AT2ck2DwkP0mWdchTyAH6CjpnnllU68bTu63VIRygdh7iBANumFuNdUhXbRsmnhvrPYllt9TW4MnMUsWCuJOTqVTH9skxJKIrM1RQRKHuEr5HWATcD36Z5VzBOhHE8N_UgcI28g24FTpqQ). You will be prompted to log in to Grafana.\n2. Use the following login credentials:\n\n```\nUsername: admin\nPassword: admin\n```\n3. Once logged in, hover over the gear icon (configuration) located at the bottom-left corner and select **Data Sources** to access the list of data sources. Select **InfluxDB** from the available options to open the InfluxDB interface.\n4. Configure the InfluxDB settings:\n   - Set the Query Language to **InfluxQL**.\n\n   - Enter the InfluxDB URL as [http://localhost:8086](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A8086%2F&h=AT17uSWqvvfbQx7pboQZ3J8t1MH6sshJJLU0FJGwyxFutQhai6YGLmWFnKsJq6iWmgC7NWA3QYsmGXXRstEvtoPIkKL-Mv0E50hnDBe-Y7-gxAvjhSb9c3DfXU01ck7LfEWMnVD0kSSfuw) (the URL used to access InfluxDB).\n\n   - Choose the previously created **demo** database as the target database for JMeter readings.\n5. Click on **Save & Test** to save the InfluxDB configuration and verify the connection.\n6. To set up the Grafana dashboard, hover over the square icon on the left side of the Grafana app and select **+Import**.\n7. Load the Grafana dashboard with ID **5496** by clicking on **Load**.\n    ![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.8562-6/382065510_253005791062988_9024232412279053830_n.png?_nc_cat=104&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=f537c7&_nc_ohc=mqZBCQD7s6kQ7kNvwF0I0fY&_nc_oc=Adm4nap0NIpNQ1ZThyC_te8UqMHY0odqHl9xR7BlSceMEzZEeqRRNSkjsTLqlfnKlTI&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ThpjOXogmFf7veMpawnq3w&oh=00_AYFeF-AdFtyYyU4FahD7xEZ5t2YARUiWWnkfxyDD3P8-Mg&oe=67F691C6)\n\nWith these steps completed, the Grafana configuration is now finished, and you are ready to run your JMeter test. Ensure that both JMeter and InfluxDB are running, and then execute the JMeter test to populate the Grafana dashboard you have just set up.\n\n### Running the Test in JMeter\n\nOnce you have completed the setup steps outlined in the previous section, follow these instructions to run the test using JMeter:\n\n1. Navigate to the **Thread Group** element in your JMeter test plan. This is where you configure the test settings.\n2. Specify the desired number of threads or users that will simulate concurrent access to your application. Each thread represents a virtual user. The number of threads directly impacts the load on your system.\n3. Set the ramp-up period to define how JMeter gradually increases the number of users from zero to the desired total. The ramp-up period is measured in seconds and determines the time it takes for JMeter to start all the specified users and reach the maximum number of users. For example, if you have 1000 users and a ramp-up period of 100 seconds, JMeter will start a new user every 0.1 seconds (1000 users / 100 seconds) until all 1000 users are active.\n4. Once you have configured the test with the appropriate number of threads and the ramp-up period, you can proceed to start the test. Click on the start button, represented by a green play button, to initiate the load test.\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.8562-6/382076859_320313457252888_1469402455630165569_n.png?_nc_cat=108&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=f537c7&_nc_ohc=Kne5xuFZgRcQ7kNvwEO6eJe&_nc_oc=AdnTVegxqrZAGA6LKwEhgTaBQ4vEd4vjgAdQ4Z3UD14pSSszvWhCfGe3LE92_rfZR5s&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ThpjOXogmFf7veMpawnq3w&oh=00_AYE2S7lGwTBiGQoSAYoH1GVwTuqsBJWCHI8XUjv11z8kNQ&oe=67F66EE1)\n\n## Load Testing using Locust with InfluxDB and Grafana\n\nOnce you have installed the necessary components, follow these steps below to configure your setup using Locust.\n\nTo start Locust, follow these steps:\n\n1. Download the [load test zip file](https://developers.facebook.com/resources/LoadTest-py.zip) provided by Meta and extract its contents.\n2. Open the `config.json` file included in the extracted files. In this file, you need to specify the template, auth\\_token, and phone\\_number\\_id values to be used for the load test.\n\n   - Modify the JSON structure as follows:\n\n     ```\n     {\n         \"template\": {\n             \"name\": \"welcome_user\",\n             \"language\": {\n                 \"policy\": \"deterministic\",\n                 \"code\": \"en\"\n             }\n         },\n         \"auth_token\": \"<YOUR_TOKEN>\",\n         \"phone_number_id\": \"<YOUR_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>\"\n     }\n     ```\n\n   - Replace `<YOUR_TOKEN>` with the appropriate authentication token and `<YOUR_PHONE_NUMBER_ID>` with the corresponding phone number ID.\n3. Ensure that Locust is installed on your system. If not, install it by running the following command:\n\n\n```\npip3 install locust\n```\n\n4. Verification:\n   - Verify that Locust has been successfully installed by running the following command:\n\n     ```\n     locust -V\n     ```\n\n   - This will display the installed Locust version.\n5. Install the InfluxDB listener/connector to enable loading Locust test results directly into InfluxDB:\n   - Use the following command to install the listener:\n\n     ```\n     pip3 install locust-influxdb-listener\n     ```\n\n   - Installing the listener allows you to seamlessly integrate Locust with InfluxDB for storing and analyzing load test results.\n\nNext start the InfluxDB server and create a new database for storing Locust readings:\n\n1. Start the InfluxDB server:\n   - Open a terminal and navigate to the InfluxDB installation directory. In most cases, it can be found at **InfluxDB\\_folder/usr/bin**.\n\n   - Run the following command to start the InfluxDB server on port 8086:\n\n     ```\n     ./influxd\n     ```\n2. Create a new database:\n   - Open a new terminal tab or window.\n\n   - Set the directory to the InfluxDB installation directory, typically located at **InfluxDB\\_folder/usr/bin**.\n\n   - Launch the InfluxDB console by executing the following command:\n\n     ```\n     ./influx\n     ```\n3. Create the required database:\n   - Within the InfluxDB console, create the necessary database for the JMeter configuration. In this example, let's name the database `pyt`.\n\n   - Run the following command to create the database:\n\n     ```\n     create database pyt\n     ```\n\nTo set up Grafana for Locust, follow these steps:\n\n1. Grafana Server:\n1. Open a new terminal tab and navigate to the directory where Grafana is installed ( **grafana\\_folder/bin**). Run the following command to start the Grafana server:\n\n      ```\n      ./grafana-server\n      ```\n\n2. This will initiate the Grafana server on the default port 3000. Ensure that any other services utilizing port 3000 are stopped or turned off.\n2. Open a web browser and go to http://localhost:3000. Use the following login credentials to access Grafana:\n\n```\nUsername: admin\nPassword: admin\n```\n\n3. On the Grafana web interface, hover over the gear icon (configuration) located on the bottom left corner. Then select **Data Sources** to view a list of data sources.\n4. Select **InfluxDB** to open the InfluxDB interface. In the InfluxDB interface, configure the following settings:\n\n   - Query Language: Select **InfluxQL**\n\n   - URL: Set the URL as [http://localhost:8086](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A8086%2F&h=AT0tABUcvVfWozVuic1iVKe43Ou-WkvGR_zw3Qjxb1A68KcZ06NsnJAPWU6szfS5G3JZUl3XL66zAIM1nyUKJ1nJ8z8yH6fF6v3QSlA1nuIclnCixn3RQvEchDUvZ_5ORzkTO29GvLLlDg)\n\n   - Database: Set the database as `pyt`\n5. Click on \"Save & Test\" to save the configuration and verify the connection to InfluxDB.\n6. To set up the Grafana dashboard:\n1. Hover over the four-square icon on the left side of the Grafana interface and select **+Import**.\n2. Click on **Upload JSON file** and upload the `locust-grafana-dashboard.json` [file](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/guides/load-testing#using-locust) provided by Meta in the zip archive.\n7. Click **Load** to import and load the Locust Dashboard with its pre-configured settings and visualizations.\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.8562-6/382041498_332389595942840_7084820122700628941_n.png?_nc_cat=109&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=f537c7&_nc_ohc=eC7QfwtFZYYQ7kNvwH13qTk&_nc_oc=AdloQIbPjn7H1S9ItzzWcbQC5cciv5IOkEuBHPCObUPv9QYyMACkiWcFplse9_rq7Tg&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ThpjOXogmFf7veMpawnq3w&oh=00_AYEaJwfiK7yA7D696WeJ8QAeLo8jw_5-8wg1d0zuzzKphQ&oe=67F67A18)\n\nBy following these steps, you will have successfully set up Locust for load testing and ensured the necessary dependencies and configurations are in place.\n\n### Running the Test in Locust\n\nOnce you have completed the setup steps outlined in the previous section, follow these instructions to run the test using Locust:\n\n1. Navigate to the folder where you installed the load test zip file.\n2. Open your terminal or command prompt and run the following command to start the Locust server on port 8089:\n\n```\nlocust -f locustFile.py\n```\n\n3. After running the command, open your web browser and go to [http://localhost:8089/](https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A8089%2F&h=AT164l0ORPbcLEOGE72FFiBlzpoRvIRqCUH15yJtmSPf8CcAi3nhumMfbOb84RX_jxDzoBDr1HoPZOhyz6Kjq8_Is__Fhb6tAIIJpyAsCaUOcAI2zDqk-Oh1EWP0kUrBfE1Oo9tMai5LRg). This will open the Locust web interface.\n4. In the Locust web interface, click on **New Test** to configure your test.\n5. Specify the desired number of users for your load test. These users represent the simulated virtual users or clients that generate traffic to your application during the test. The number of users determines the amount of concurrent traffic generated.\n6. Set the spawn rate, which determines the rate at which new virtual users are created during the load test. It controls how quickly the number of concurrent users ramps up. For example, if you set a spawn rate of 10 users per second, Locust will start with a few users and gradually increase the number of active users by 10 each second until the desired number of users is reached.\n7. Take into consideration the optimal user-to-throughput ratio for your test. As a general guideline, you can add approximately 100 users for every 300 messages per second (MPS) throughput. Keep in mind that each user takes approximately 350ms to compute.\n8. Ensure that the host field is set to the appropriate value, such as [https://graph.facebook.com](https://graph.facebook.com/), depending on the system you are testing.\n9. Click on **Start Swarming** to initiate the load test.\n\n\n![](https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.8562-6/382098314_1354424608786276_1483583943047005287_n.png?_nc_cat=110&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=f537c7&_nc_ohc=tzzJ08aek2MQ7kNvwFKqxmq&_nc_oc=AdlRt7cbmF5l0Caee3apnUCDvYiHFIlSP6wtXp_H82HzFMhgX7t024yd1TAR1hiwQR4&_nc_zt=14&_nc_ht=scontent.xx&_nc_gid=ThpjOXogmFf7veMpawnq3w&oh=00_AYE4XpfFQwU8WOr9bl955csUOWm60dNVMOcC_aTwEZeZCg&oe=67F67FC9)\n\nIn the Locust terminal console, you should see verbose output indicating that the load test is running. Monitor the console for any reported failures. If there are no failures reported, it indicates that your initial test is successful, and you can proceed to configure the Grafana Dashboard.\n\n[WhatsApp Business
